Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Coleen S
Reviews.Content: If location is your number one priority, than Empire Hotel is a great hotel. It is located across the street from Lincoln Center and a subway terminal. There is a Starbucks next door along with a pharmacy and is a couple of blocks from Central Park. I found the hotel staff to be nice, however somewhat aloof. Checking in went smoothly and I was able to stow our luggage until we could officially get into our room. The room was fine - bigger than I anticipated since the reviews stated how small the room was. Our view was horrible - air conditioning vents outside the window. But the room was so quiet, I did not want to ask for a change. The shower needed a manual to work and the shower door was stationary and only went halfway - water hit the floor due to the open space. The only complaint I had was that whoever cleaned our room kept forgetting to replace the towels, bath mat, etc. I would understand this if it was a one time event. However, four out of five nights, I had to call the front desk and ask for wash clothes and a bath mat, then wait between twenty and thirty minutes for someone to bring it. For a four star hotel, I thought this was a major oversight that was a big pain. By the way, if you plan on using the internet, the business center is available to use. Bring dollars or a credit card as it is 25 cents a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tara B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at the Empire on two separate occasions. On both stays we have had good experiences. The rooms are fairly small (what rooms aren't in NYC) but nicely decorated. The bathroom is also very small and the open shower is a little incovenient. On our second stay with Empire we got stuck in a bad room, but they were very accommodating and moved us to a higher and larger room overlooking Lincoln Center. The rooftop bar is excellent and the lobby bar is great as well! The location of the Empire can't be beat. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ar91
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The decor is very good, the roof top bar is good at night pritty expensive but its new york city and your in a roof top bar so you dont expect it to be cheap. Very clean hotel, beds changed every day, the cleaner even folding up all my clothes i left out.. All the staff are very friendly. The bed is possible the best hotel bed i've slept in. Its in a very good location, metro stop 5 minutes walk away. If you Going to new york i'd stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our trip to NYC :-)”
Reviews.Author: Jayne084
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire on 16th December for 6 nights and couldn’t have been happier. I would say the best thing about the hotel is the location. I often get a tad nervous in areas on the evening but felt very safe here! The hotel lobby is gorgeous and the drinks were lovely. We never made i up to the roof top bar as it was Christmas party season and was used for parties. I was pleasantly surprised by the room size after reading reviews, it isn’t huge at all but big enough for what you need, Bed comfortable too! The only criticism we would make was that our room was on the floor below the night club and it seemed like this was used as the exit route, one night a fight broke out in the hall and i was very scared! I would ask to be away from the lift also as it was noisy! Hotel staff lovely, try the Atlantic Grille near hotel, it was recommended and was one of our favs. Thank you The Empire for making our trip to NYC perfect. We will be back! xxx

Reviews.Title: “They know customer service!”
Reviews.Author: noreen k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights last summer,and although there were some plumbing problems and our room wasn't ready they made the best arrangements to help us and went out of their way to compensate. Could not have asked for better or more friendly staff :) Front desk manager was amazing !

Reviews.Title: “Yet another fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: margaret b
Reviews.Content: Look no further than the empire for your llandudno hotel,yet another super weekend,fab food,beautiful bedroom,excellent staff,lovely pool and great beauty treatments.Family run hotel-you can tell the difference.Have been visiting here for 12 years.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Evening”
Reviews.Author: Cris M
Reviews.Content: Went to the lobby bar at the Empire Hotel and I can truly say that it was one of the best experiences I've ever had. I travel constantly and have been to many places all over the world and my time spent at the Empire is for sure one of my top favorites. The drinks, the food, the staff (Aaron and Gabe are beyond accommodating), the ambiance all made a great recipe for an unforgettable evening. I will definitely be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF, GREAT LOCATION, HOTEL NEEDS SOME WORK”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five nights at the hotel. The first night was given a room (no. 1109) that should be turned into a storage area. Moved to a very nice room for the following nights with the street view (as we had requested when we booked six months in advance). The room attendants are not very efficient. Had to call down twice for towels, etc. As to the room, even some of the staff agree that the bathrooms, although clean, are badly designed as to shower, the flat bowl sinks and inadequate shelf space. Location is just across Lincoln Center. Great location, close to the subway, restaurants and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Missbotess
Reviews.Content: I know the Empire continues to get mixed reviews but we have just returned from a three night stay and I wanted to update my previous review. My husband, 15 year old daughter and I stayed in a corner suite and in addition to the amazing views of Lincoln Center and up Broadway and 7th Avenue, the suite was roomy and comfortable. Yes, the shower with one door is still strange, yes the standard rooms are very small, and yes you have to pay for WiFi but the convenient and lovely city location, fun over-the-top retro art-deco(?) design, Starbucks just steps one way and PJ Clarks the other way, this is a great choice for families, couples, and business. And, oh yes, if you have a teenager who loves "Gossip Girl," you may be lucky enough to be there when they are filming something in the opulent lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Empire is Convenient”
Reviews.Author: localhassle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights with my wife and two teenage daughters.Location is perfect,right next to the Lincoln Center.We prefer this location over Times Square.Hotel is above average.Try to win it on Priceline, like we did and it becomes an excellent property.Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “The cougar of NYC hotels”
Reviews.Author: BinGeneva
Reviews.Content: First a few positives: The location is excellent -- minutes from two subway stops and directly across from Lincoln Center. Also, we had a great room overlooking the front entrance on the second floor -- it was quiet (as long as the window was closed), but with a lovely view. But, really, this is the cougar of NYC hotels. The decor is a bit garish with extensive use of gilt and leopard prints -- I knew this going in and was fine with it. But when you look a bit closer you notice that it's got some wrinkles beneath the surface. Our bathroom was clean -- but kind of gross in that paint was chipping, there were some permanent stains on the door frame and the caulking was tearing apart. It could use a little TLC, not a smothering of fabrics and bright colors. Overall, a fine place to stay if you get a good price and don't look too closely once you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jillmurf
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in NYC with 3 teenagers to celebrate my daughter's 16th birthday and stayed at the Empire. The lobby is beautiful and the location is great. We had been upgraded to a deluxe double and were told it had a beautiful view of Lincoln Center. When we got to our room we had no view and the set up of the room was very strange with a column in the middle of the room. I called down and was told that we could switch rooms tomorrow but nothing was available that night. I was fine with that until I saw how small the bathroom was. I think it is quite possibly the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel. This was a little bit of a problem with three teens. Also the showers do not have a door so the water tends to spray out of the shower and all over the floor of the bathroom. Our heater's nob was broken so the air in the room was pretty bad, luckily I was able to crack a window. The icing on the cake for this room was that one of the girls found a yamika in the bed. I tried to not make too big of a deal about it to the girls but did mention it the next day and was able to get a much nicer room as a result. The staff was friendly. The conceirge was great the first night and led us to a great restaurant down by Time Square. The following night we were going to a play and wanted to go to little Italy for dinner. The conceirge told us to take the #1 train down and get off at Canal St. The only thing he forgot to tell us was that we would have to walk all the way through Canal St. and the stop was about a mile from little Italy. Needless to say there was a closer stop if he had directed us correctly and had us switch trains at Time Square. Also it was quite scary to walk through Canal St with 3 teenagers who were dressed to go to the theater. And we ended up only having an hour for dinner because he did not tell us that it would take us an hour to get there. Overall it was a great weekend and my daughter and friends had a great time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Skidrowe3
Reviews.Content: There's a huge clustering of hotels in NYC in Times Square. While that's inarguably an exciting place to be, it's also maddeningly mobbed, noisy all night, and overwhelmingly touristy. The Empire is only about 10 minutes' walk north of Times Square, but its Upper West Side location is worlds away. One (long crosstown) block to Central Park; across the street from Lincoln Center. A few blocks from the Whole Foods on Columbus Circle, the Apple Store at 66th & Broadway. The subway cluster at Columbus Circle (59th Street) isn't as extensive as the Times Square cluster, but it will get you most places you want to go. Best of all, though, this is a neighborhood: there are plenty of visitors in the streets, of course, but most of the skyscrapers are full of residents, people who walk their dogs, get a bagel at the deli, and so forth. The hotel itself has been recently refurbished in a stylishly comfy boutique hotel manner. In my room, the showerhead was positioned so that it wasn't possible not to get the bathroom floor wet, but that was the only example of a stylish element not quite completely coordinated. Cushy towels and bathrobe. The usual overabundance of pretty pillows and throws on the bed, but at least the room was large enough to stash them in a corner. The building is in an E-shape, such that a lot of the rooms look into courtyards (the rest look at the street). These courtyards are classic New York: not much sunlight or air, not especially clean, with white-noise-creating mechanical equipment at the bottom. But quiet, I found. The fitness center is pretty standard-issue, with some treadmills, stairmasters, and other machines. The standout feature is the view: it looks north to a small triangular park & Broadway (which at that point has a lovely landscaped median), with Lincoln Center to the left (west) and a slot view of Central Park to the right (east). Compared to the more standard windowless fitness center, this was outstanding, especially for a guest staying in a room that looks into the grey twilight of the courtyards. The hotel has a spectacular-looking roof deck and pool. I say "looking" because it was still closed for the winter when I stayed. Service seemed good. We weren't disturbed when we had the Do Not Disturb sign up; an error in the bill was quickly corrected; a problem with the Business Center was quickly attended to.

Reviews.Title: “Lincoln Center NY Trip”
Reviews.Author: BFW10
Reviews.Content: We wanted to see the show "War Horse" and stay overnight in New York City. There were six of us and we were driving up. We were meeting relatives for dinner. Once we parked, we wanted everthing to be convenient. The Empire Hotel was perfect! The vallet parked our car (our package included parking) and we were able to check in at noon (one room was ready even though check-in is 3:00PM). The corner suite was newly decorated and lovely. We had a king sized bed and our grandson had a sofa bed in the living room. We had two bathrooms. We ate a wonderful lunch at Cafe Fiorello just across the street from the hotel, went to the 2:00 PM show. We came back and the others checked into their rooms which were lovely also. One junior suite with two double beds and one regular queen room which was upgraded to a king delux made for comfortable accomodations. The area was upscale and we found a very nice mall within walking distance. That night we had dinner at PJ Clark's next to the hotel. My husband and I went to sleep early but the others enjoyed being together in the lovely loby or lounge. We had an American breakfast buttet in the hotel restaurant (juices, coffee,eggs, potatoes, breads, pastery, cereal, yougert etc.) which was also included in our package. The hotel was clean, newly redecorated, had fine linens and toiletries and was in an excellent location. Chris at the front desk gave us excellent information during our visit and when I had originally called for reservations. The pricing for NY City was fair and we were pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: housekeeping30
Reviews.Content: Spent nights here in March-busy hotel but great stay. As many have mentioned rooms are cramped-things like side table only on one side of the bed, bathroom very tight with no place to put your things, however nice shower and great L'occitaine soaps and shampoos. Free wi-fi in the lobbey and mezzanine area only, would be great to have throughout hotel as many people sitting around public areas on their phones and computers. Impossible to park outside hotel-we had a hire car and did lots of shopping and hoped to drop off our bags at the door-no chance. Was on the 11th floor and heard traffic and sirens through the night-but not a real issue. Location is excellent easy walk to Times Square, Central Park and subways. Overall would stay again for sure, did Price Line to get a lower rate as regular rates are the normal NYC pricey. Overall great stay in fabulous NYC!

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure In The Heart Of NYC”
Reviews.Author: GJDiMaggio
Reviews.Content: The Empire is a unique boutique hotel in NYC, situated at Lincoln Center; with a welcoming lobby and front desk staff, a wonderful lounge area (with free WIFI and outlets) and small European-type rooms. This is not your typical hotel, you will not find dressers or much furniture besides the bed in your room, you will find a small lovely bathroom with a glass enclosed walk-in shower, a shelve on the wall for your toiletries, and a large TV mounted on the wall over a narrow desk and chair, clothing nook and beautiful finishes of textured paper, high ceilings, a window with floor to ceiling curtains, and a wonderful bed with high end linens that made for a great nights sleep. The ambiance of the hotel is a throw back to art deco New York, albeit with a modern flare, and although worn and tired along the fringes and in need of some updating, management seems to go to great lengths to maintain a dimly light, sexy and cool ambiance that resonates throughout the hotel. I was there during Fashion Week and found the crowd an energetic mix of professional 20 something’s to older business types. Also, Ed’s Chowder House is located in the hotel, expensive and good seafood in a gorgeous open, Italian modern setting. I found the Empire a welcoming, friendly and affordable fun place to stay in NYC, and I will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a 7 night stay; highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sarahsuperdork
Reviews.Content: We originally chose the Empire Hotel based on its proximity to Central Park; since we were on our honeymoon for a week, we didn't want to be in the busy centre of Manhattan the whole time. On our arrival, we were helped with our bags by the bellman straight away and Miriam made our check-in quick and easy at the front desk. She was a credit to the hotel, giving us plenty of friendly advice on local sights. Throughout our stay, we found all of the staff to be nothing short of friendly, professional and courteous. Our room, a deluxe king, was exceptionally clean and well-maintained with a great view. On the 8th floor, it was away from the noise of the lobby and the rooftop bar, and the sound of the street. We had 7 nights of great sleep, even with the window open. We didn't know what to expect of the room before we came, having read many reviews that the rooms were small, but ours was a great size for the two of us. If you want a bigger room, you can't expect to pay for a standard queen and get a large suite. The Empire Hotel is in the perfect location for exploring Central Park, visiting the Lincoln Center and getting into downtown Manhattan (it's only a twenty minute walk from Times Square, in fact). When there's a Whole Foods at Columbus Circle, a five-minute walk, you can't beat the location for convenience. Wi-fi in the lobby area is complementary and If your flight isn't until later in the day on your day of checking out, there's a free luggage storage room. This was great for us, as our flight wasn't until 7pm that evening. We'd definitely come back if we chose to visit New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home”
Reviews.Author: Chrisanng
Reviews.Content: Have started to use this as home base when I come to NYC -- there is always a "NYC" cookie waiting for me in my room except for today -- I had a red velvet cupcake! Location is great and do is roof deck!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Thequacker
Reviews.Content: We have just recently had three nights here and found the location to be fabulous, just a short block walk to Central Park, right on Lincoln Square. A very easy walk down into Manhattens famous Time Square, the Carnegie Deli etcetera. The rooms are small but very clean and have everything you need (except the ability to make yourself a cup of tea or coffe n your room but lots of American hotels do not offer this anyway). I had read many reviews saying that the rooms were very noisy, we had an maternal room, that looked into an internal open well and we found our room to be very quiet and dark at night which ensured a great nights sleep every night. The Internet is free if u are n the lobby area, which is an open two storey space so that you can sit on very comfy lounges upstairs overlooking the central lobby and quite privately access the Internet . Unfortunately the pool was closed for renovations so we weren't able to look at the view from there. Front desk staff were always very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: bargain_hunting
Reviews.Content: Another trip to New York, and this time we chose the Empire based on a recommendation and a reasonable rate. The Empire is located in a pretty good spot, within walking distance of many shops, restaurants and entertainment places. Being on Broadway and Columbus is great for navigation as a pedestrian, and getting a cab. As a weekend getaway, we unfortunately couldn't spend very much time at the hotel and I can't comment on the nightclub. Of course the rooms are tiny, as are any other Manhattan hotel rooms in our price range, but our room on the 5th floor overlooking Broadway had little street noise and we slept very well. Others have mentioned the peculiarity of the shower without the door, and it did seem odd to us, but the ceiling shower was very nice and strong. The Chowder House in the hotel was fun and had great food, and conveniences such as a coffee shop or a drug store are just around the corner. The doormen were great at helping us with luggage, navigating the city, arranging transportation, and were discreet about possible celebrity sightings (we didn't see any). It was disappointing that the reception staff wouldn't go out of their way to accommodate our early arrival. Normally I would understand, but with a young child, the extra luggage, and the need for space to feed and change clothing, it would have been appreciated. Although it was February, the room was much too warm on our arrival, and while I ran the air conditioning unit full out for the whole weeekend, it struggled to keep the room at a tolerable temperature. Such was a similar complaint of others in our block of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Empire Hotel March 2012”
Reviews.Author: HRCoord
Reviews.Content: I had read many, many negative reviews of this hotel on various sites and was very nervous about what lay ahead for us. We arrived late on March 12th and Miriam greeted us quickly and courteously. She was amazed that I had drove for 9 hours to get there and so upgraded us to double queen room. Even though our room was one of those above the HVAC equipment outside, we had our AC running in the room and couldn't hear anything outside. Yes, there was no view but then we were only in the room to sleep so it didn't matter to us. The room was very clean and quiet (at the end of the hall). We loved it. The shower is odd but that would be our only negative. The entire staff were friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurant was good. We would definitely go back. Also, the hotel is located in a very quiet area of Manhattan (Lincoln Center) - upper west side. Very, very nice area. Loved every minute of our trip. Miriam was the best hotel desk clerk we've ever had and we travel quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: travel1946
Reviews.Content: The location next to the Met is excellent but there are many negatives to the hotel. This sounds minor but with no coffeemaker in the room one has to get dressed, etc just to get the first cup of coffee. At that price point WiFi should be included but it is $13/day. With the Lincoln Center location was hoping this would be a high class experience with maybe operatic or classical music in the background but found instead a poor mix of music in the lobby and too loud. The breakfast buffet, which we skipped, at $26 was the poorest we have seen in a major hotel and doesn't remotely approach some that have many hot entrees, instead of just 3, and include items such as lox, assortment of cheeses, house made pastries, etc. Apparently many people feel the same as the dining room was very sparsely populated for breakfast when I checked it out. The room size was OK for a NY hotel but one of the floor lamps had a broken switch and the bathroom sink drain was so slow that I removed the stopper to drain it quicker. Also, many times the front door was left open for extended periods and smoke from the sidewalk area was very noticeable and disagreeable in the lobby area. Maid service was poor.

Reviews.Title: “A Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo6154
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Hotel March 14, 2012. This is a truly different and better hotel since their renovation. Rooms are small but nicely decorated. Front desk personnel friendly and helpful. Excellent location for Lincoln Center. The only negative is that in addition to the minibar, there is a pile of snack food and wines on the desk (for sale at minibar prices). This is tacky. If you don't want this stuff in your room, they will charge you to remove it.

Reviews.Title: “empire is really a dungeon”
Reviews.Author: blau124
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that by staying at this hotel, my sisters and I felt that they (the management) had ruined our whole nyc experience. From the beginning they gave us a smoking room (without us asking for it) and they interrogated us, yes I said interrogated when we requested a change. the staff is rude, hostile and uppity. Our requests took over an hour, ruined our dinner and made us late for our show. Upon returning not only werent we upgraded, but our luggage could not be found, and was left in the smoking room that we had requested to leave. The night manager was rude and certainly wasnt trained in being hospitable to guests. It took more time out of our evening to get this settled as well. My advice, even if you have to walk or take a subway to Lincoln Center do not give this hotel any business until they learn the meaning of SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elyssa J
Reviews.Content: I went here for spring break with my mom this year. The customer service was spectacular and the rooms were fierce! I loved meeting my friends at the Rooftop bar. I will definitely stay here again. :) The beds felt like clouds!

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars, Priceline? Really?”
Reviews.Author: QueenParrottfish
Reviews.Content: I did get a good deal for a hotel a stones throw from Lincoln Center and Daniel Boulud's culinary corner, but I would not give it the same rating as say the Essex House. If you like animal prints and loud techno music, if you are impressed by dark lighting and heavy handed decorating, this is your place. Smoke and mirrors was my takeaway. The front desk does not seem to know how to accommodate travelers the way any other 4 star hotel does effortlessly. When we returned for a third try to get into our room at 3pm, we had to wait in a long line for half an hour. By the time we got to the counter the bigger better rooms with a real view were gone. Imagine a queen size bed with a one foot clearance on three sides - that was our room. Imagine sitting sideways on the toilet so your knees don't hit the opposite wall - that was our bathroom. Imagine looking out your window into the window of another room just a few feet away - that was our view. Not luxurious or sophisticated as they advertise, not even charming or cozy. Just really really tiny. We got a call in the middle of the night from housekeeping - 2AM or so - because they wanted to deliver ice and we didn't answer the door. What? Still wondering what that was about. At about 4AM, the party of what sounded like a dozen loud young hipsters arrived across the hall with doors slamming and shouting for the next 45 minutes. I wonder if Megan ever found her phone. On the other hand, the location was ideal and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: Dingwoman
Reviews.Content: Booked via mystery site at a decent rate for Manhattan. Was granted early check-in without a comment and received great service throughout. Room was small (to be expected. It's NYC, people!) but well-kept. Enjoyed a great view of Lincoln Center! And fabulous, convenient location for business and walking about... I normally don't go for trendy but enjoyed the lounge-like atmosphere. Ordered room service late one night. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, but why do I have to pay for everything??”
Reviews.Author: Mik2tuf4u
Reviews.Content: The pros: great service (we originially had an interior room next to the elevator, but after asking, we were upgraded to an exterior room more isolated), great decor, upstairs bar (warning, very expensive!), great concierge service, lobby is beautiful, great location Cons: shower with no door, pay $12 for Internet in the room (free in the lobby), small room This was my first time staying at a four Star hotel. I was unimpressed, as the accomodatns at some marriotts are better. I found it on Priceline, so the price was good, but I wouldn't pay the asking price for it. Got about 50% discount with Priceline. Also, we were going to Newark, and there is a bus that comes directly to the door every hour, for $25 per person, which is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Eh, okay”
Reviews.Author: Chelexi
Reviews.Content: Pros -lobby area is nice -located directly across the street from The Met and within walking distance to Central Park and restaurants Cons -upon check-in, front desk didnt seem welcoming or friendly at all. Nor did they acknowledge that I was standing there for about 10 minutes until I had to get their attention and there were no other customers around me -junior suite is small -when taking a shower, water still manages to get all over the floor and is soaking wet - no ice vending machine?! you literally have to call downstairs and have someone from the bar bring up ice AND they supposedly have a limit of how many times you can do that.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: SalzburgTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the most well put together hotels I've stayed at. From the rooms, to the rooftop bar, to the lobby everything was classy and elegant. The price was great for a Hotel in Manhattan and the location is close to the park and the subway. Staff was friendly and quick, we had no trouble checking in or out. The room was decently sized and super clean. We had no problems at all with this hotel and are looking forward to staying there again when we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joeybella
Reviews.Content: We arrived at around 9am and were able to check in early. The front desk staff, bell men, door men and concierge were awesome. Reading some of the other bad reviews I was kind of scared to see what I would find, instead we found a great hotel, good staff and even better location. There are plenty of restaurants and shops around. The subway station is less then a block away. I'm just sorry I missed the taping of Gossip Girl =( which of course isnt the hotel's fault. We had a room with 2 beds, it wasnt bad for the 3 of us. The bathroom is super small, but clean and nice. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Kudos to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LaTrivs
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate for the Empire at a mystery website. As others have noted, the rooms are very small. For one person, it was ample. The room was very clean. The bathroom was tiny, and water did get all over the floor every time I showered as there was not a shower door. But, the location is fabulous for enjoying the city. Convenient to the subway, the Whole Foods at Columbus Circle and many restaurants and attractions. The Chowder House in the hotel was delicious. With a good deal, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best birthday ever”
Reviews.Author: Jen H
Reviews.Content: Could not have felt more welcomed. Staff went way above and beyond the call of duty. Treated like royalty. Website doesn't do justice

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: jazzy81
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at about a dozen hotels all over Manhattan and never really had a bad experience until we came here. The check-in was long, tedious and unpleasant. The woman that checked us in was just plain rude and seemed to absolutely hate her job. The first room they put us in was an absolute horrible neightmare. The decor was run down, the room was so small, you couldn't even turn around in it, you had to back onto the toilet because the bathroom was so small. Nowhere to put a suitcase or a bag or a cosmetics case. But the worst thing was the horrendous noise from the airconditioning units outside our window. NOT that our aircon even worked!! it was SO hot! We were sweating all night and hardly had any sleep, between the loud noise and heat. The noise was like a big truck running outside the window the entire time. And our view was a big wall with windows and aircon units. You coulnd't even open your window to let some fresh air in, because the other windows were 10cm from ours and people could see inside our room!! no wonder they've had thefts in this hotel, it'd be so easy to climb from one room to another. In the morning, I went and complained as we had been in NYC for almost three weeks and we were about to fly back overseas and we wanted our last night in NYC to be pleasant. So after much trouble, they moved us to a room that was much better and a bit bigger - it faced the outside and we could see lincoln centre. And there was no aircon noise and the room temperature was manageable. There were many other irks with this hotel, like when we had to call and ask for things, it would take between 45min-1hr for someone to bother to come around and bring it to us. For example, we asked for ice, 45min later someone showed up. We asked for an iron and ironing board.. after half an hour we rang to ask for it as we really needed it to iron our clothes before going out to a restaurant that we had a booking for. But it STILL took them another half an hour to bring the iron up. How disappointing. The only good thing about this hotel for us was the location, right across from central park and also a great spot if you want to catch the train to the airport. this was a breeze, we rolled our suitcases to 59th street (i think - at the SW corner of central park) and it has elevators here, so you can go down with ease and catch the train to the airport. Pity our last few nights in NYC were ruined by our experience in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Going to the Met? Look no further for a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Seeitalltogether
Reviews.Content: If you are going to the Opera at Lincoln Center, you will probably notice the hotel right in front of it and think it would be very nice to stay there instead of taking a cab at midnight in NY after 4 hours of Wagner. We have been in the Empire Hotel several times. The single rooms are really small and pricey in high season, but location trumps anything. Attention is professional and considerate (thank you Margie and Helena!). Really, you cannot beat this place for convenience, folded under a great deal of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Drucey2
Reviews.Content: This hotel in a great location for exploring the city. Literally 2 min walk to the metro and 2 min walk to Central Park. The hotel is very contemporary. The rooms were spacious, huge beds, and very clean and modern bathroom. Some parts of the room needed a lick of paint but nothing urgent. We did not have a good view from our room apart from the air conditioning units. If you want a decent view, ask for the front of the building. Very friendly staff, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A big fan of the Empire”
Reviews.Author: Nutytart
Reviews.Content: I first heard of the Empire hotel as a Gossip Girl fan, and then it was in SATC so when I saw the deal on Travel Republic for only £600 for 5 nights in August I jumped at it! The hotel is located really well, 5 mins away from Columbus circle, 15 from Times Square and near a well connected Subway line. You can see Central Park from the roof as that's just 2 mins away. There is a starbucks literally underneath it and a few other shops located on the main road from the Subway/Columbus Circle. The Lincoln Centre is on the door step! We found the service to be efficient and very helpful, when we arrived the air con in our room wasnt working properly and this was in the summer, so we were moved to an alternative room immediately. We managed to be in New York the same week as both the earthquake and hurricane (unlucky!!) and the hotel were excellent with advice and guidance etc. There were only 2 negatives, one is the size of the room...I know NYC rooms are small..ive stayed in a few different hotels but for a 4 star i was expecting a little more space, there was barely room for 2 of us to walk either side of the ned, never mind put our suitacases out! Also the same problem with the water in the shower...think this is a serious design flaw. The other reason is the rooftop terrace/pool/bar...I was very confused as guests have direct access to the pool deck (which is fab but as others have said this is a plunge pool NOT a proper pool..its tiny!!), i went up there and could see the hotel Empire sign...however this is not the same place as the evening bar/club and to get to this even guests have to go down to the lobby and then queue and go up in a separate lift to the bar area...I really think they should offer guests some kind of priority/direct access and its one of the major selling points!! Going back to NYC in Sept this year but cant get the Empire for less than £180 a night so i must have got an excellent deal last year. Overall i would recommend it, its a fab hotel in a great location...but just be aware of exactly what you are getting for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: Logistar
Reviews.Content: Finding a great hotel, with descent prices in a good location in New York, is no small feat. For the perfect ' girlfriend' weekend or a quick get a way while catching a show- the Empire Hotel fits pretty darn well! Having stayed there years ago, I recall smallish rooms, some with views that look towards the river and bathrooms that didn't allow exactly spell modern. But they've remodeled(not sure of the year) and the rooms now are soothing and comfortable- albeit a bit small- with modern bathrooms and some luxury touches. Frette towels and sheets, a good comforter and a mattress that allows rest for weary shoppers at days end ... add to the benefits this hotel provides. For Lincoln Center activities, you cannot touch this location and if you wish to shop... whether at Barney's or Bergdorf, the shops at Time Warner Center , this location is tops. It's an easy walk to the Subway- giving you great freedom to zoom around the City ( I made it to Meatpacking and the Lower East Side in about 20 each) but also allows you to stroll through Central Park to enjoy the Met or take a short cab ride to most of the City's most popular attractions. If you are a jogger.. your option other than Central Park, is the fantastic West Side park.. and the smaller boutique style shops of the Upper West Side are just a few blocks away. The lobby is windy with doors that seem to be constantly opening , but the check in and check out process was smooth and friendly. A great Bell Captain ( sorry, cannot recall his name) managed to control of 15 some odd bags of ' shopping treasures' along with our regular totes with a smile! Drinks in the lobby bar and mezzanine area were not as good as we had hoped. The mixologist could use a bit of training , given there are two insanely good bars just a few blocks away were drinks are not only conjured up from incredible imagination, but are truly memorable ( Bar Bolud/ Bolud Sud and Lincoln) . I do however, plan to make The Empire- my NYC home away from home, as it allows me to visit with my UWS friends and connect quickly to the LES where I enjoy the fresh , less corporate feeling shops and restaurants. There is a Starbucks immediately attached to the lobby for those who cannot talk until they have their first cup ( hmmmm) and while there are restaurants who are attached to this hotel, I did not try either. It was snowing the weekend we were there, so the rooftop and it's view- which we heard was pretty fantastic- was not the place to head. There is a ' wait on line' to get in bar scene up there.. but to be honest, I did not have the energy to check that out scene ..after long hours walking the streets of Manhattan trying to help restore the US economy! All in all.. the Empire feels comfortable and the rooms good. I'd love a few more plugs for all the electronic stuff we need to charge and maybe a better place to get a good look at the outfit or makeup.. all things they can add if they'd like. So for an easy location and good space that is a nice blend of luxury, location and amenity.. try the Empire Hotel. I'm headed back this weekend, and will update my review based on that say.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Lenetra
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at The Empire. Each time I have a good experience. The staff is always nice and helpful. It's a great location. You can either walk to a ton of places or grab the train (either at Lincoln Center or Columbus Circle) to places further away. THE ROOMS ARE SMALL, if you need a large room, you should book a suite or choose another place, however if you are like me and are only using a room for sleeping, showering and changing clothes, then its perfect (I had a standard queen. The king rooms are a little bigger, but not by much, so I just opted for the queen). The club is nice or if you want something quieter, you can hang around in the in the lobby or on the mezzanine, they have great seating in those places if you want to have a drink and relax. Also, because I had stayed at the hotel a few times prior, they did send me an email with special offers (I got one night for free) and if you are a returning guest they have a nice card and cookie waiting for you in your room :)

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: pinapopper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on Valentine's Day because of it's close proximity to Lincoln Center. We arrived about 1:30 pm and knew our room probably wouldn't be ready until the 3pm check-in time. The man at the front desk asked for our cell # and said they'd call us when the room was ready. We went out for a stroll through Central Park and around 3pm started to head back to the hotel. We never received a call but assumed the staff didn't call because we knew check-in was at 3. We planned to go back to the room, relax for 30+ minutes and then shower for our 5pm dinner reservation. When we went to get our key from the front desk it was approximately 3:10. We were told our room had a problem and we would have to wait 15 minutes more. I was highly annoyed because the man didn't offer us an apology or even a drink at the lobby bar. We waited in the lobby for EXACTLY 20 minutes. I then sent my husband back up to the desk to get our key. The same gentleman said it was going to be another 20+ minutes. My husband then heard another man at the desk offering a different room to a woman who was evidently not pleased w/ her current room. We demanded another room because it was already 3:40 at this point and the man said "there is nothing else available" and we'd just have to sit tight. No apology...NOTHING. My husband said he wanted to speak w/ the manager because after overhearing the other woman getting a choice of room, there was clearly another room available. If I pay for a hotel room from 3pm until noon the next day, I expect it to be ready. If it is not, another room should be offered. We basically argued w/ the man until finally around 3:50 they gave us another room. The room was very nice, but we had NO TIME to relax and just barely made my 5pm dinner reservation. My husband had to skip his shower altogether. The hotel was very pretty, but the large amount of dust on the floor in the lobby was overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel near Lincoln Center”
Reviews.Author: Joefrombrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Great place. The valet, bellhop, front desk, housekeeper, bartender, restaurant madre d, all made for a really great experience. Our junior suite was really beautiful, most comfortable bedding, convenient tv that angled in all directions off of the wall, the snacks and drinks weren't overly expensive and the system didnt charge you for just picking up an item like some modern amenity trays and refrigerators. The only down side in the room was that the shower was not that much pressure and the half-shower door lets water out. Lobby could use some new fabric on the furniture, glass doors into the lobby are very heavy, rooftop bar smells, has sticky floors, way too crowded, waitress was very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: SassySandi049
Reviews.Content: Cool hotel, incredible location across the street from Lincoln Center. Do not get an inside room-it overlooks an airshaft. We were upgraded to a suite by the manager.

Reviews.Title: “You will absolutely regret and furious because there are no quilts, no coffee, no slipper..”
Reviews.Author: Boston521
Reviews.Content: I come because I used to watch gossip girl. And I now just going to stop watching this soap drama. I don't have any happy memory here. The only positive thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good west side hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmityL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in February for business. Nice lobby with lots of seating so it was easy for business meetings. Plus there is a bar that definitely gets a happy hour crowd. Ate 2 lunches and a breakfast at the restaurant on the 2nd floor which is really nice and bright and sunny. The breakfast buffet was $26 so not cheap but typical for a nice NYC hotel breakfast buffet I guess. Room was small (not the smallest ever in NYC) but totally fine for a couple nights and was nice and modern. Bathroom was nice too. No complaints whatsoever. Free wifi in the lobby but you have to pay to use Internet in your room.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: Gedaliah G
Reviews.Content: Although I had been in this hotel years ago and it was old and funky, the location couldn't have been nicer. When I went back for four nights - it was super modern and super cool. Great staff, right down to the people handling the front doors - and still wonderful location. It is now my hotel of first choice for the Big Apple (subway connections, ease of taxi, airy, top part of town and great for after work walks in any direction!)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in New York”
Reviews.Author: SPGomes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Hotel for 8 nights during New York Fashion Week and had the best stay I've ever had in a long time. I had stayed at the Hudson Hotel before and had a horrible experience, so I was little apprehensive at first staying at a hotel I had never stayed before, but I was greeted by a very friendly and professional employee named Mariana as I checked-in who immediately put me at ease and made sure I was happy with my room. Everything was perfect (and I don't use that word often); Friendly and helpful staff, great continental breakfast (more food and variety than I was expecting), my room was always clean and fast check-in and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2.13 - 2.14. The lobby was very nice and almost had a 'speak-easy' feel to it, which is a very different theme compared to most hotels. It was too cold for the Rooftop bar so unfortunately I didn't get the chance to check it out. The room was nice, but very, very small. Great TV and plenty of channels, and the liquor/beer wasn't too expensive compared to most mini-bar prices in NYC. Awesome location, walking distance to Central Park and trump towers, and there's an awesome burger joint right next door. They actually have beer that isn't locally brewed which honestly was a relief as I had nothing but local NYC beer that whole week. Food was delicious. We were in room 304, and it was a great view if you like a brick wall and windows to look at, but it wasn't that big of a deal. The only bad thing I could really find was the noise of the A/C unit and the fact that the shower didn't have a closing door. Other than that, I will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Facility”
Reviews.Author: anijean
Reviews.Content: I work in New York, do a lot of travel in and out, and usually stay at the Four Seasons. Checking my calendar I saw that I'd forgotten to book a hotel for a month long stay and my hotel of choice was booked up for the first two nights. Happily, I found that the Empire had an amazing deal on a suite from Expedia for the two nights in question and I booked about three days ahead. The location is great--right next to Lincoln Center, close to the park, etc. The hotel is beautiful, my room was enormous and since I had a corner suite, I had amazing views of Columbus Circle. The lobby is chic and stylish and inviting. The facility itself is great. My issue was with the staff of the hotel. Granted, it was the middle of Fashion Week. Granted, I'm just a lowly guest who paid for a room for two nights through a third party service. However, being reminded of these things by the staff of the front desk is really bizarre (including a really awkward moment when the man behind the counter said, "Well, you're obviously not a Fashion Week-er so...." before drifting off, and abruptly turning to a different customer who had also been waiting at the counter). Apparently appearing as if I was a country bumpkin I was condescendingly told, "It must be so fun for you to see what models and fashion people look like up close!" (Word for word.) I was kept waiting for my room for two hours after check-in time with the excuse of, "It's Fashion Week." The hotel was incredibly noisy because, "It's Fashion Week." Room service was slow because "There are VIP guests because it's Fashion Week." I get it--it's Fashion Week. However, if you're so busy because of Fashion Week, maybe don't have rooms still available on a moments notice (after Fashion Week had started, no less) or, perhaps, don't allow bookings from those who (you think) aren't attending Fashion Week? I knew it was Fashion Week before I arrived since (shock) I actually work for a fashion magazine and (double shock) wasn't just there to shop at the suggested Gap and Banana Republic. (Thanks, guy at the front desk, for the super duper awesome suggestions!) Other random things: housekeeping doesn't care if the "do not disturb" sign is on the door and will enter anyways; housekeeping also closes the doors when they clean which seems like an enormous security issue to me; my neighbor's room service trays were left in the hallway over 24 hours; there was a chip bag in the toilet when I arrived; the french fries from room service were AMAZING even though the caesar salad was wilted; there's an "Intimacy Kit" available for $38 so don't let your kids rifle through the stuff available for purchase sitting on the desk; the windows actually open which might be really pleasant if the weather is nice; free copies of WWD out in the lounge was a really nice touch, though I'm going to assume it was just for Fashion Week; the TV (at least in my room) was whatever the equivelant of terrible definition is; the men working the door are quick, competant and friendly; if you have to wait two hours after check-in for your room, you'll be offered a drink in the lounge....which you will end up paying for yourself; possibly the attitude of the staff is kind of an ambiance thing for people who want that true nobody-cares-about-you city service--perhaps they're supposed to be acting that way! The best part of the Empire is the hotel itself--beautiful and comfortable. I would absolutely suggest getting a suite if one is available and mine was far enough away from everything that it was incredibly quiet despite lots of noise down the hall. Judging from other reviews, I think this is one hotel where it really pays to upgrade if you can. I wouldn't suggest bringing children and I wouldn't suggest coming here if it's your first time to the city or if you're just planning to tourist it up during your stay. If you're uncomfortable with a condescending staff or if you need city guidance, this hotel is also probably not for you. Stay here if you love the area, are comfortable with New York already, need a romantic get away where you won't be leaving the room, or you know, if you're in town for Fashion Week.

Reviews.Title: “First rate experience”
Reviews.Author: Alex H
Reviews.Content: from the people to the room to the food and location was excellent. I would recommend to anyone visiting the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Holly P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Miriam was so wonderful, she really took care of us and made sure that we were well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: RFJ
Reviews.Content: Older hotel in a good location right by Lincoln Center and a subway stop (Route 1 train). There are some nice restaurants within a block, as well as a movie theatre across the street. I booked via Priceline for 1 night and was alone, so the tiny room was adequate for me but certainly not for a couple. The room was clean with updated decor and a good heating system, but I did have to get the low water pressure fixed, and lighting is not good if you need to work at a desk. Lobby looked great but there was a bad odor around the elevator bank on the Sunday I checked in. It was gone Monday when I checked out but I've not run into that issue before at a big hotel. NET: I would not seek out this hotel but it's certainly adequate with a good price deal.

Reviews.Title: “OMG where do I start.”
Reviews.Author: picozoz
Reviews.Content: First, a week before we stayed at the Empire I had done a web search to research the cool things about the area around the hotel and the hotel itself. As I was reading I came upon a great deal that was 130.00 less than I paid through the hotel website. I called the hotel to discuss this and suggested I cancel my reservation with them and rebook through this other internet site. The lady I spoke to on the phone was very nice and said no need, she would adjust it. Very nice and I thanked her. Weeeellllll, when I arrived they charged me the original price and when I explained, the lady at the front desk looked me straight in the eye and said, "prove it". I had no proof on me because the lady on the phone had assured me it was no problem at all. She said I could be lying and unless I had proof the price was as is. I didn't want to get in an argument so left but it really bothered me. I was dumbfounded. I have never been talked to like that before in NYC. People are usually so nice.I finally did go back and when the same lady saw me she didn't even say anything and just pointed for me to talk to another guy. I did and explained again and he changed the price within 2 minutes. The whole thing was embarrassing and time consuming. I have stayed in NYC 6-8 times a year for the last 6 years and every other hotel has been really nice. The way the front desk talked to me really took me off guard. Then we get to our tiny drab room. I am use to NY boutique hotels and don't expect a big room so was OK, but the heater was broken(I was relieved to see others mention this) and I know our room was 90 degrees. This was in January 2012. It snowed that night and it felt like it was a sweltering hot summer night. I couldn't find a thermostat so decided to deal with it when we got back from dinner. At 11:00 my husband and daughter went to Sleep No More and I went to relax in the room. It was soooo hot. I called the front desk and they told me to open the heater and turn it down from the inside and if that didn't work to find the extension cord under the unit and unplug it. Well the knob on the inside of the heater didn't work at all so I had to unplug it which sparked and believe it or not it still was putting out a tiny bit of heat. I called to see if I could get a fan and after 1/2 hour a maintenance man showed up looking embarrassed with a tiny plastic fan that was duct taped together. So I put the fan on the bedside table and slept on top of the bed(no top sheet on the bed...yuck). When my husband got in at 3am his first words were, "whoa it is hot in here!". Also, if you plan on going to the rooftop bar check ahead of time. There was a private party the night we were there and we couldn't go up. The lobby bar was nice, though. I asked to go up the next morning to take a picture of the sign and was told it didn't open until 5pm no exceptions. The lobby is nice and the location is beautiful but the rooms and service make me never want to go back. It is a hotel I am glad to forget. There are many other better hotels. For the price I like the Ace. No wonder Tablet Hotels doesn't feature them. I was sent a survey on my stay and explained this whole thing and never even heard back. Management probably doesn't really care unless there are good comments. The reason we went to this hotel in the first place is a young film producer we know had worked on a film there and thought it was nice. Obviously he didn't spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge are credit to hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrew i
Reviews.Content: What more could you want with a NYC hotel? This hotel is clean,comfortable and charming! The location is great-right opposite the Lincoln centre and subway with a starbucks on the corner (well there is a starbucks on every corner). Room was cleaned every day and didn't have a problem with the noise at all. The bathroom was adequate and spotless and big enough for the both of us. Staff were all pleasant but the CONCIERGE were outstanding and are a credit to this hotel. Yuri and Chris you were awesome and made our stay not only more enjoyable but helped us make the most of our time in New York with valuable information and a knowledge only true new yorkers have!!! These guys know their stuff people and i suggest one you've used them you leave them a "thank you" tip, as like everyone else in new york they provide a service and are more than worth it. The management should think about giving them bonuses for the effort they put in. We will definitely be staying here again when we come back in Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - uncomfortable amenities”
Reviews.Author: RGB1016
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. It is directly located across the street from Lincoln Center. We got to see all the goings on for Fashion Week. Thank goodness for a great location. There is so much to do on the west side of the city. The room was less than desirable. It was very small with a terrible view. The heating unit was very loud and made the room sweltering hot. The room was supposed to have a queen bed. This was not a queen bed but a full. My husband's feet fell over the edge of the bed. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. It felt as though I was sleeping on a concrete slab. The pillows were quite flat and hard as well. The bathroom was tiny. Our sink did not drain properly when the drain plug was in place - we had to take it out for the water to go down. The sink was so shallow that water splashed out of it every time I ran the water. The individuals at the front desk did not assist us at all when we asked for a place to have breakfast or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mrdcs1
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal at Empire Hotel through hotwire.com and it didn't disappoint. After a last minute idea to go to NYC to see a few shows, we ended up at this hotel modern hotel right across from Lincoln Center and around the corner from Columbus Circle. It is also a block from Central Park. Plus, we were able to walk everywhere - not one cab ride, or even a subway fare. It was an easy walk down to the theatre district as well as all the local restaurants on 9th Avenue in Hell's Kitchen/Clinton.

Reviews.Title: “We will return.... BUT”
Reviews.Author: GranBeba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Emprie Hotel in NYC. We were going to three operas at Lincoln Center and the location cannot be beat. There are plenty of excellent restaurants in the area so we were within walking distance most of the time. Our room was very large. We were not expecting that after reading all the reviews to the contrary. And the maid service was prompt and thorough. We had windows overlooking Lincoln Center. So what do we have to complain about.... Reception. We arrived about 11:00 and were told that our room was not ready. There WAS a room on a smoking floor if we would like that. We said that we would wait. We went to eat lunch at the restaurant next door. When we came back we were told that the room was not ready yet. We waited in the lobby until about 2:45. Someone came and told us that our room was finally ready and we were thrilled to be able to get in and unpack right away. It was only AFTER we had unpacked our bags that my husband noticed that there was an ashtray and Empire Hotel matches on the desk. And we began to realize that the room was actually on the smoking floor! Thankfully the room had been cleaned very well and did not have that "smoking floor" odor. The hallway had been a bit "musty" but we had been so anxious to get to our room that we hadn't paid much attention. We had been kept waiting in the lobby for almost 4 hours and then were given the room we had turned down when we first arrived! The manager offered little when I called to complain. We stayed in the room... but feel that the hotel treated us shamefully. If only they could get their act together I would give them more points....

Reviews.Title: “Aweful - the noisiest hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: tripadvizor2012
Reviews.Content: The rooftop bar has REALLY loud music, that I was told lasts until 4am. There is simply no way you will sleep the night if you're on one of the upper floors. Amazingly, I even asked for a quiet room, and they placed me on the top floor!! Don't fall for the lower end prices unless you don't want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off our VISA card after departure”
Reviews.Author: Lynnworks
Reviews.Content: After we received our "final" bill and left the Empire, they assessed another $60 charge on our credit card. Called accounting and sent email to ask for justification; no response. Have asked our credit card company to withhold payment.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FineMind
Reviews.Content: We scored a room at this wonderfully-located hotel through Hotwire and were expecting the worst when the very sweet receptionist told us the hotel was fully booked on Saturday night. Room #1. We were not surprised to find ourselves in a broom closet-sized room shaped much like a triangle. The room was so small I used the fridge INSIDE the closet as a night stand. To get inside the bathroom you had to step inside the shower. We are not large people but . . . We found much to laugh about but the real kicker was the fact that our queen-sized mattress had been placed atop a much smaller frame making sleeping along the edges precipitous. The lobby of this hotel is pretty and interesting and almost impossible to see because someone kept the lighting at 1 candle power. Silly. Because the receptionist had assured us we could move to a larger room for our second night, we packed our belongings the next morning and headed to Ed's Chowder House for breakfast. DELIGHTFUL! We LOVED it and all our fortunes changed from that moment on. Room #2 King-sized bed on the tenth floor overlooking Lincoln Centre Plaza. Lovely room and we were as happy as happy can be. LOVED this room: spacious, clean, well-lighted. After another splendid breakfast at Ed's Chowder House, we had to bid the Empire "Adieu" and we were delighted to be able to see the lobby fully lighted in all its glory. Why they keep it looking dingy as a cave is beyond me. Liked this hotel a lot, and I could see us returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best in NYC”
Reviews.Author: omgitsjacobtyler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a birthday weekend at the hotel in NYC. Hands down, this is the ONLY place in NYC I'd stay. Having stayed there, no other hotel is comparable. From the roof top bar with it's dimmed lights to the very friendly, very accommodating staff. (Not to mention, the sales manager is super attractive!!) Honestly, I loved everything about this place and I actually have nothing bad to say about it. The location alone is worth the stay. :)

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: woosie123
Reviews.Content: Travelled to NYC in January as part of a conference trip and had the pleasure of staying in the Empire Hotel. the first room i received was lovely but as i was staying for a week the view of the back wall of the other side of the hotel was not something i wished to be seeing for the full duration of my stay. However there was absolutely no difficulty changing the room even though the hotel was quite busy and the hotel staff were more than helpful with the switch. The rooms are airy, bright and comfortable although they are in need of some renovation. the shower tap came off in my hand and the window was in danger of falling off due to wear and tear. It is in need of repair but which hotel isn't with the passage of time. The reception area is comfortable and bright and the bar caters to guests need in a friendly and relaxed manner. the concierge is helpfulness personified. With its excellent location within 5 minutes of Central Park and 15 minutes walk of Times Square, the Empire Hotel is an excellent choice in a fabulous city. Enjoy.........

Reviews.Title: “Room With a View”
Reviews.Author: Iandet
Reviews.Content: The Empire Hotel's great location served as a terrific base for a weekend in NYC for my wife's 30th birthday. We were upgraded to a King Deluxe room overlooking the Lincoln Center, which made our stay that much more pleasant. The room was quite spacious and well appointed, and the bed was fresh and comfortable. We found all the staff, from reception to housekeeping, to be very attentive and friendly. Thanks Ms. Baldwin!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: Laurie S
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times here and never disappointed. Perfect location for all that the west side of Manhattan has to offer, from Lincoln and Time Warner Centers to Central Park and the Columbus Circle heart of NYC transit system. Clean room with upscale amenities. Very quiet which was surprising given that we were on a low floor facing Broadway. Excellent window covers (perfect for late-rising guests!). Attentive staff. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE EMPIRE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: JohnMac131
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at The Empire dozens of times (all for business) over the past few years. Favorite hotel in New York. Just spent weekend at Empire with wife and young daughter. Great location (running in Central Park). Great staff (valet remembers my name every time). Great value. Have convinced friends to cancel Plaza reservations and stay at Empire they have had no regrets. Always happy when I am at the Empire.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre....”
Reviews.Author: fj74582
Reviews.Content: I visited the Empire hotel and enjoyed the lobby lounge that they had, service was good and the drinks although pricey were good. On one night we decided to head up to the roof top bar and see what everyone was waiting in line for...as a guest you don't have to do a line.... Well the experience of being on a roof top bar was good, great view. but thats about it. Drinks were watered down and very expensive even compared to what was charged in the lobby. Ok place I guess but nothing special, and no way worth standing in line for.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't ever Consider staying here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYClovers22
Reviews.Content: Nightmare staff non existent room service the worlds noisiest air conditioning had no sleep in the four days stay there due to roof top nightclub worst hotel in new York would have slept better in central park!!! Refused to serve us a coffee at the bar saying they didn't serve coffee there then later witnessed a local patron being given a cappuccino on the house!!!! Please stay anywhere else but here.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Hotel, Standard 4-star”
Reviews.Author: Lane H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Christmas, and was as expected. The rooms are on-par with this level of hotel, but seems like its trying to be something its not. It was the first time I've stayed in the Upper West Side, but I prefer its counterpart, The Upper East side as there is much more to do. It is in a great location, however, if you are going to Lincoln Center.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location + Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WineDarkC
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal for the Empire on TravelZoo, and stayed here with three other girlfriends for our annual trip. The location is impeccable! Right across from Lincoln Center, surrounded by great restaurants (Bar Boloud, Bolud Sud, Epicerie, Lincoln at Lincoln Center, Alice’s Tea Cup, GastroArte), and good shopping (also a few blocks away from the Time Warner Center). The hotel is well appointed and has a good bit of energy. The rooms were fine – it is New York so they’re not huge but the double, double was just as big as one in any other city. The beds were very, very comfy, and the operable windows let you vent a lot of the standard New York room heat. Something I’ve never noticed in any other hotel – the hallways smell good. The lounge is busy every night, and the upstairs club is a nice amenity to take advantage of without having to taxi around town to find a bumping club. Be aware, the line goes out the front door on the weekends. The service from the front door staff was great – every day the doorman, and bellhop greeted us with a hello, and a friendly smile, as if they recognized us as guests. They were very helpful in holding our luggage after we checked out of the hotel. I would highly recommend and I will definitely look here again for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: fooderella
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at The Empire which is right opposite the Lincoln Centre in Manhattan. Was upgraded to a deluxe King size room - which was fine. It just worries me what a standard room is like. the deluxed King size had everything you could need apart from a wardrobe where you could hang coats/dresses .. but ok if you had suits (the mini bar took up the lower half of the wardrobe). the bed/sheets were wonderful. the shower was great. the service a bit casual prefer a bit more in the of being made to feel welcome. the bar looked cosy and the location good. Not sure if i'd stay again ... worried about room size so ask for suqare footage when you book in case you bring a cat that needs swinging!

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: Homeownermartin
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a fantastic hotel. All hotel rooms in NYC are small, this was no different but big enough for our needs. If going to NYC in summer this hotel is perfect - the Private roof terrace/pool/bar are first class. Great part of town, not overly noisy, and 2-3 minute walk from Central Park. The oysters and burgers in the bar on the ground floor are also excellent. I will definately look up this place again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “service was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Dana M
Reviews.Content: I meet a friend of mine in NY every year for a couple of days and we are usually on a bit of a budget. It was our last night and we decided to ask Chris at the concierge desk for some help planning our evening. He suggested a jazz club that had a show and dinner that was well within our budget and made the reservation for us. When we arrived the waiter brought us drinks that he had ordered for us. Made us feel amazing. The next day we were getting ready to leave and went to check our bags so we could spend a few more precious hours in the city and my friend's duffle bag ripped. Daniel the bellman not only helped with our bags, he gave us a tip that duffles were on sale at a local bed bath and beyond and saved the day. These little touches go a long way in making a trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - but rooms are slightly 'tired'”
Reviews.Author: njchristiansen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and had no complaints! However, we were slightly disappointed this trip. We were here right before Xmas, so the rooms were obviously extremely expensive. We were put in a room that was SO small we could barely walk around the bed. Though the rooms are modern and funky, they are now looking VERY tired. We also had a major problem with the AC in our room. We would wake up in the middle of the night in a sauna.... there was no way, however, to control the temperature in the room. We made a complaint the next day, but the second night was no better. If we were going to stay a third night I would have demanded to change rooms....

Reviews.Title: “Great but not so Great”
Reviews.Author: TR218
Reviews.Content: Great but not so great On short notice my wife and I decided to travel from LA to NY to attend my brothers birthday and 60 wedding Anniversary after checking out several hotels in the Time’s Square Area we decided on the Empire Hotel adjacent to the Lincoln Center located on Broadway and 63 Street. When we arrived at the hotel around 6:00 PM Saturday evening I was taken by the exotic furniture style (simulated tiger skin chairs and odd shaped couches.) At check in I stated when I booked the room I requested a very quiet room as I was a light sleeper; actually I prefer quiet to view. The clerk informed me that the hotel was fully booked and he would see what he could do. The bellhop escorted us to the 11th floor room 1120 the room and bathroom were small. After placing our bags in the room I could hear the sound of loud rap music, people yelling and sharp banging noises. I said to the bellhop could you tell the room over head to quite it down. He stated there no room above you it’s the disco. I immediately called down to the front desk and requested a differnt said I am attending a Broadway play within the hour and when I return I would like to change my room. I was told that the hotel was fully booked and there were no other rooms. My wife and I freshen up and went to the play, when we returned at 11:00Pm that evening I called the front desk and said if the hotel could not provide me with a quite room I plan to checkout. Within minutes I received a call from the night manager and was told there was a seating room with a pull out bed they could give us at a reduced rate. I said that’s unacceptable send up the bellhop it was then that he offered me an up grade at the same rate down the hall to 1115 a large suite with nice size bathroom he insured me the room was very quite and he provided us with a complementary breakfast for our trouble The next morning an hour before we were to leave for the party, I called the front desk requesting they bring up my car I was told it usually takes around 30 to 40 minutes for valley and it will be parked at the front of the hotel the bell Capitan will have your keys. When I went to get my keys an hour later I was told the car had not come up, as it was a very busy day. At the front desk I was told it would be another 15 to 20 minutes actually it took another 30 minutes to get my car and once more the hotel was very accommodating and comp the $60 valet parking fee. It should be noted the $60 charge is for every time you take the car. There is no in- out. Bellhops are friendly but do not rush to open the double set of front doors. You would expect as these doors are very hard to open epically if your carrying luggage. So after all is said and done the hotel was very accommodating but for all the trouble we had it was a great but not so great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Closest hotel to Lincoln Center”
Reviews.Author: mizlori
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Empire due to its close proximity (across the street!) to Lincoln Center as we had opera tickets. Took #1 train from NY Penn to 66th street station and walked to the hotel. We arrived at 3:30 on Saturday to a check-in line, and upon reaching the reception desk, we learned our room would not be ready for another hour unless we wanted a smoking room. No thanks. Other people also waiting in the lobby who must have had the same circumstances. Note to hotel: maybe reduce the # of smoking rooms and convert to non-smoking rooms? While waiting I enjoyed an $18 (with tax/tip) cocktail; would have been nice for Empire to pick up the tab on that one since check in time is supposed to be 3pm. Room was finally ready and we had a room with 2 doubles though we reserved one queen. I was told this was an upgraded room. I like the soap in the bathroom and the rain shower is cool too. The 1/2 shower door is bizarre and must cost the hotel a lot in water repairs due to the damage it causes on the floor, which is clearly visible. Nice very white fluffy towels. Bathroom very small. The room's heater made odd clanking sounds all through the night, and there was a plentiful cold air supply from the draft coming from under the heater unit. We had a tripadvisor rate which included continental breakfast for two. Breads, yogurt, oj, coffee, fruit which was sufficient for us. This is an $18 per person value. The do offer omelets and eggs, bacon, etc. in the restaurant as well. I hope the hotel's management reads the reviews on here and sees a theme, and does something about the things that are repeatedly mentioned as issues. This place has potential to be rated as Excellent consistently.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: ICAPlane
Reviews.Content: Very hip & funky modern updates to this modern hotel. We absolutely could not have asked for a better location, and the employees very pleasant and unobtrusive. The bathrooms are tiny, but workable, and our room had a great view of Lincoln center, which is right across the street. We went to NY to see a play, and I almost booked a hotel closer to the theater, but I am glad we didn't - we were so close to Central Park, and had a great time exploring it while we were there. The theater was less than a mile, and it was an easy walk, with plenty to look at along the way. Our room was quiet and comfortable, but as other reviewers stated, the rooftop bar is very loud on the weekends. The rooftop is a real draw for 20 somethings - we went up to get a drink, and came right back down. My only complaint is that we thought we were getting a free breakfast (turned out I did not book that option), and it was very expensive and just okay, nothing special. My husband could not believe they used lunchmeat ham in his ham & cheese omelette. Plenty of cheaper options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointed and nicest thing was the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was super annoyed that they don't have a front door that automatically opens or even a door man! It was very annoying trying to prop open the door with luggage. Also, to the hotel employee who was cleaning the glass doors and who I thought was going to open the door for us, you suck for walking away! Check-in was smooth but I was a little annoyed that we had to wait 5 minutes for the other check-in clerk to call us over even though he wasn't helping anyone. The lobby is really nice and a great place to hang-out. The elevators were also very fast. We ended up getting drinks at the bar and taken back by the automatic 20% gratuity! Our 5 drinks for two people ended up costing $160. The pouring of my $25/glass scotch doesn't warrant a $5 tip! Didn't get to check-out the roof top bar but heard dress code was pretty strict even for hotel guests. Our room (#702) was tiny! Booked the room for $160 (including tax) through a promo so I wasn't much but the size disappointed. Also, TV reception was poor (there was static). Our room was nicely decorated and the "rain fall" open shower was nice. On TV check-out didn't work so we called the front desk and check-out was smooth.
