The hotel is right next to central park and there's a Shake Shack about 5 blocks away. Also, wifi is like $13. Before staying here we stayed at the Hampton Inn near the Empire State building which offered free breakfast, free wifi, and larger room for less money. I don't mind paying more for better service and amenities but this hotel is lacking in both categories.

Reviews.Title: “Great room if you request it ahead of time”
Reviews.Author: FreeSpiritAdventurer
Reviews.Content: After reading other's reviews I learned a great deal. First, it is wise to try and get this room for around $115 on Priceline.com (I stayed from 1/2- 1/6/2012). The top floor is very warm, but the windows do open. The bottom floor is cooler, but the "quiet" side away from the street is very noisy due to the HVAC units (ac/heat). The showers do flood, the design is awful! The prices on food/drinks/other accoutrements are a bit pricey, even for NYC standards. I requested a king size bed each day and received it; which made me really happy. The staff was very friendly. The roof top bar was a lot of fun. The location is very close to great shopping and Central Park. My only major complaint was when the roof top bar closed, I had just bought an expensive liquor drink and was wanting to take it to my hotel room (bar is in the hotel, well on top of it) and the "guard" at the elevator in the lobby told me I could not take my drink. He refused to let me even finish it. I still have no clue why I could not take a drink I paid for in the hotel bar to my hotel room, this really annoyed me!! I chose not to stay there another night b/c of this and will look elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Conflicted, but overall average”
Reviews.Author: jtashley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights in mid-January at the Empire Hotel. The check-in process took a while (as echoed by other reviews) and the staff was not particularly friendly, but not rude either. The room was small, but what I expected in NY. The bathroom, however, was impractical, especially the shower, with only half the enclosure. The heater was very noisy at night, prompting us to turn it off (in 19 degree weather) so we could get some sleep. Tried to call the concierge one evening probably a dozen times, and no one ever answered. On the plus side, awesome location and very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Empire Hotel at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: cheppesntall
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean but the rooms were small. I think you expect that for NYC. We had a drink in the bar which was very nice. Good location for the theater if you don't mind walking - which we don't. Very close to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: Sky5432
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I ever stayed in. Honestly, the rooms were small and dirty. The staff was rude. Our tv did not work and we slept with no heater when it was 16 degrees outside. I got a full refund for our stay because it was that bad. Do not stay here. There are much better hotels in new York !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawnyj47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from 27 Dec 11. We had only booked a basic room but were upgraded by the hotel on arrival. Check in was very smooth and staff were friendly. I expected the rooms to be small but it was better than expected. The bathroom is very small though! The room was cleaned daily The air con isn't very modern and although it was cold outside we just couldn't seen to cool our room. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in a good location just near Central Park. Overall, a nice hotel and would deifinitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Poor in Contrast to it's appearance and reviews”
Reviews.Author: ariekis
Reviews.Content: On paper this is a wonderful hotel, looks great (photos and physically) Reasonable price, great location and large rooms. The problem lies with horrific service due to major understaffing and unpleasant tiny bath / and impractical shower. The problem starts with a busy checking in area which means one always seems to have a 20 minute wait to check in or out and with other problems, Whenever you don't need anything, magically there is no queue, We changed rooms as the shower has no door so water splashes in the bathroom, not ideal, and when we moved to a room with a bath the bath was so small with no ledge and enclosed by a wall, it was incredibly uncomfortable and impractical. Being in Manhattan and not a modern building noise was a problem. Beds were very comfortable, Hotel appears to be 5 star in many ways, but let down by the bath/shower area and the reception delays which somehow destroys a potentially great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not great!”
Reviews.Author: mellyallen
Reviews.Content: Arriving after 36 hrs flying to find out our booking was for one night (previous night only) instead of the 5 it was supposed to be we were so tired and just wanted a shower but instead we had to sit on a couch in the freezing cold lobby for 20+ minutes as the front door was open and a very cold breeze came in. Lady who served us was quite nice, she eventually (after me going over to the desk to find out what was going on!!) offered us a 'much bigger room' and free breakfast for our troubles. Breakfast was lovely and definitely brightened our spirits, the room had a huge bed but in the case of a much bigger room, I would hate to have seen the shoebox we were originally booked into! Housekeeping attended our room on more than one occasion, one morning even while we were still in bed even though we had the do not disturb sign up for our entire trip. Overall an ok experience, decent location but staff lacked interest in customers and weren't overly friendly. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: cathy m
Reviews.Content: The room was so small we felt claustrophobic and the bathroom was also so small and not even a place to set your cosmetic case. We have stayed 4 other places in Manhattan and found this to be the least favorite place we have stayed. We definitely would not recommend it and had not checked trip adviser and wish we would have. It was such a disappointment and we were staying over Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely cute, but the quality of your stay depends on your room.”
Reviews.Author: Fattycrab
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this former SRO building is its location. You simply cannot get closer to Lincoln Center as it across the street. In addition, with a few decent restaurants around- one could argue that this is a serious hotel to consider if you have business on the Upper Westside. I have stayed here more than twice but I must confess that I wanted to wait until I had a better experience. I cannot forget room 139 which okay was so small it was silly but there was no air or heat unit, although it faced one outside. That is the view. If you are suffocating and cannot open anything, you get a feeling that you are in a coffin, albeit a pretty and designed one. The use of space is so smart because if you really think about it, these rooms are very , very small. The front desk was so poorly trained when I was in " the coffin" that they told me they would send an engineer that never came and the following morning, Helena? glossed over the whole incidence and offered to rebook me for another night with a little discount !? Another visit was much improved which was great as I had a family member with me. Except, I know I left my Mac power cord there and they never found it which I know I left it by the door. The desk on two occasions was dicey but once I did get great service. There is a party vibe in the entrance but not necessarily in the rooms unless you are around the bigger rooms where there may be a small group or family get-together. The bar area is fine and I believe you can get some wifi in there. If not, there is a Starbucks on the ground floor along with a restaurant that is really not bad. It is Ed's Chowder House. One big design complaint is the shower. Wow. It is really difficult to shower and not turn your coffin into a small waterpark and get your hair soaked. The Empire isn't bad, it just is a bit of luck that is needed with your room assignment and the staff you encounter. The beds are very comfy and perhaps the most important thing- the rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding for a Quick Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Snefru7
Reviews.Content: We just went up for a quick night's stay in order to take in a play at the Lincoln Center (5 minutes walk across the street). Empire Hotel was perfect for this purpose. The check-in process was without incident. The room was clean, and while small, perfectly adequate. We had a room right next to one of the elevators--I am a very light sleeper--but fortunately I had ear plugs with me which I recommend and had a great night's sleep. We had gotten a Trip Advisor Special which included a Continental Breakfast but did not get any coupons at check-in, so recommend you clarify this on check-in. The manager quickly provided us the necessary vouchers after our inquiry. The lobby is well appointed, the doormen pleasant and the overall experience was positive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Bryna T
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated, easy check-in and very boutique feel. The room was immaculate and I really loved the thoughtful subtleties (fresh rose on the nightstand, loaner umbrella, refrigerator and separate well stocked mini bar). The room is small (as expected from a boutique hotel) but cozy and bed/bedding were clean and comfortable. Only 3 not so great things: 1) Room doors slam pretty loudly. Some kind of hinge to slow them down would be nice. 2) Our room was on the 5th floor and we heard mechanical sounds that were pretty loud outside (I think they were the furnaces) 3) The toilet is a pretty tight squeeze and there was no hot water at 10:30am. All 3 things weren't enough to deter me from returning if I paid the same Hotwire rate of under $200 per night for a standard Queen. I would gladly visit the Empire Hotel again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice and comfortable stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ken G
Reviews.Content: We all know what NYC hotels can be like -- small cramped rooms. Hotels sometimes have to deal with the limited space regardless of the management. The rooms at Empire, however, make the most oft the space -- stylish/modern, comfortable and calming. Rooms are compact, but affordable. They get genuinely dark for a good night's rest, bed is comfortable (and I have a bad back), and it's *clean.* Hotel has a rooftop bar, as well as a nice one in the lobby. It is a stone's throw to Central Park, some great Italian food nearby (don't miss Francesco's fast food pizza joint up the road, too), and the staff were gracious and friendly. I understand that they're under new management. The only reason I didn't put 5 stars is because I reserve that for the top of the line hotels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: samSG81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Hotel of Gossip Girl fame for 4 nights in Dec 2011. The room was small and not too fancy. The hotel was located in the upper west side, so it was quite far away from the more tourist areas in mid town Manhattan. There were plenty of amenities and shops around; Starbucks, Duane Reade, ATMS all within 2 mins walk from the lobby and the Columbus Circle metro station was about 5 mins walk away. We had Christmas Eve dinner at the hotel's restaurant, Ed's Chowder House and it was quite good. Overall the hotel is a bit pricey for what you get and totally not what I expected for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: dmy84
Reviews.Content: I visit NYC plenty of times and Iove it there!! I will recommend anyone to visit NYC if already haven't. Everytime I go I hate to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Swank hotel but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: JA-From-Sydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in August, before I signed up to tripadvisor, hence the late review. Guest rooms are well furnished but small. The bathroom was stocked with high end toiletries but it was really small. Forget 'showering with a friend', there was barely enough room for me (6' 180 lbs) to get in and out of the shower on my own! In fact a friend of mine left her suitcases in the room after she checked out of her room and travelled upstate to Rochester. I agreed to store her 2 suitcases but had to perform some olympic grade gymnastic maneuvers that would make Mary Lou Retton proud just to get to the bed from the door as there's simply is no dedicated space for suitcases. Y'all remember Mary Lou, the West Virginian who won Olympic gold in LA in 1984. I quizzed the front office staff - all uniformly polite and well groomed - about the shoebox sized room and was whispered that the ultra small rooms are given to folk who book through third party sites. Never do those who book with the hotel get such shoeboxes. I thanked the pretty Englishwoman at the front desk for her candour. For all I know she was just regular front office staff or perhaps the Duty Manager or even several rungs higher up the corporate ladder. I have no idea, but she is certainly what I want in a hotel I sleep at. Very professional manner and very polished presentation. Would I stay here again given the small room? Yes. Is the location good? Pretty good. There is a lovely open air rooftop bar accessible through a separate elevator in the lobby, and being here is a nice (but not gruelling) 17 block walk to Zabar's on Broadway and West 80th, where I had b/fast. The coffee at Zabar's is also very good. Oh and there are plenty of grocers, cafes and diners nearby. While wifi is pricey in the room, next door to the hotel is a Starbucks with free wifi (and they are open late). And of course, if you love music, the joint is right opposite Lincoln Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but excellent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mymanren
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my fiance just before New Year's because of an accepted bid on Priceline and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The rooms are a little small, particularly the bathroom. However, the staff fulfilled all of our requests. The furnishings in the rooms are very nice and are at least 4 star quality. The bed is comfortable and the room had a nice TV as well as a fully stocked mini fridge. The shower was one of the best hotel showers I've experienced and I loved the towels. The air conditioner wasn't so great, but we could open the windows all the way. The hotel is in one of my favorite neighborhoods in Manhattan and is convenient to so many things. The lobby turns into a lounge at night, which isn't so pleasant to return to, but it did not disturb our stay. I like the design of the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: CarolynandBurton
Reviews.Content: We so love this area, if we could live here we would move to NYC. The next best thing to moving is the Empire Hotel. It used to be a dump and has been transformed into a trendy boutique hotel. Being an old hotel, the rooms are small. We take a Jr. suite for the extra space. Standouts, for me, are the clever way they transformed long narrow hallways into a walk in the forrest. Biggest joke-the shower. Design-wise the hotel is gorgeous, including the rooms. But the shower is a challenge. I want to strangle the designer every time I take a shower. You see, it's all about style w/o substance although there is nice storage in this bathroom. Teak floors in the shower, nice. Rain shower head on the ceiling that drips on my hair, not nice. Men love it. It has a hand held shower wand, dangerous. You have to think in this shower. Positioning yourself is key. My husband the klutz, was taking a shower. I opened the bathroom door and got a blast of water that went all the way into the room. You guessed it, wet hair. They've since installed glass panels which keeps the bathroom somewhat drier. Once you get the hang of the showers, you can enjoy the best neighborhood in NYC. don't eat in the hotel. The food is mediocre and expensive. Walk out the door and you are surrounded with restaurants and food shops anywhere from $-$$$. But best of all, You Are Right Next Door To Lincoln Center, across the street from Central Park, down the street from a wonderful art cinema. Around the corner to Bergdorf Goodman on Fifth Ave and the Plaza Hotel. Any direction you choose to walk is right. Only one downside; this hotel is a destination place for clubbing. They have a wonderful roof top lounge. The young and badly dressed line up, for hours, waiting their turn to get up to the roof. It really isn't difficult to get into the hotel if you're staying there but the lobby and bar sees a lot of action. Fun thing is, performers that are playing Lincoln Center stay at the hotel. I met Sting in the lobby. We actually got tickets on the Lincoln Plaza at the last minute for the Sting concert with the London Philharmonics Orchestra. Same for NYC Ballet. We were walking in the park and I decided at the last minute to see if I could get a seat. Got the best one! My husband walked to our favorite Grey's Papaya Hot Dog Shop for a hotdog. He was happy not to go to the ballet. It was a win-win.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a quick city break!”
Reviews.Author: Reading_Traveller06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in November 2011. We arrived at the hotel and were pleased to be greeted by a friendly and helpful Receptionist who checked us in quickly & smoothly. Our room was clean and small but spacious - you couldn't swing a cat in there, but there was enough storage for two people. The only problem we had was that the room was absolutely boiling, like a sauna. As we found out later on, the top two floors are the hottest in the hotel and if we had known at checkin, would have moved rooms. We complained about the temperature and an engineer came to open the window which reduced the temperature, but it was still too hot to sleep in and spend more than five minutes in. Make sure you visit the hotel bar, the sofas are amazing! Make sure you have a taste of the cocktails, they are worth exploring. We ate in the bar a couple of times and were pleased with the standard of food and price which was reasonable. As a tip, don't go to the bar on a Friday or Saturday night as it is very noisy and full of teenagers. The location is perfect for all sightseeing and shopping trips - within a 5 minute walk is Central Park and a large shopping mall. I'd definitely recommend a visit to this hotel as it's in a perfect location and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: malaLondra
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Empire end of October for 5 nights. We were immediately upgraded to a larger room, which was fairly large for NY standards. Restaurant was excellent and so were drinks in the lobby bar - rooftop terrace was already closed though... Overall very pleasant stay, would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Empire Chic”
Reviews.Author: marturey
Reviews.Content: Location is very convenient. The hotel is across from Lincoln Center and near some great shopping (less than a 10 minute walk to Century 21 department Store which is amazing). I really loved the look of the hotel both inside and out. Inside, it is nice, the décor is dark but sexy. Check-in was efficient and the rep was pleasant. The room itself was very nice, especially the view of Lincoln Centre and the city. The hotel supplies l'Occitane toiletries which are my favourite. The bathroom is awkward though. The shower stall has an exposed wall which caused water to get on the floor. The bathroom sink is very small and was awkward for someone who wears contacts and needs a ledge to set my case and there wasn't one. Overall the room was lovely, very clean and the bed was comfy. The room was a decent size. The only gripe I had was with housekeeping. They forgot to leave us any bath towels, they forgot a flat sheet and so there was just a fitted sheet and cover which was odd, and cold, and the bathrobe that was previously there was taken and not replaced. The staff were nice and the concierge was very popular with guests. The gym was fine. Mostly cardio equipment and some free weights. The gym is on a lower level so it was kind of nice to run and overlook the city. The room service menu was limited and there was nothing for vegans. We came home late one night and so there was nothing for us to order from room service. Plus, there were no ice machines which was inconvenient. This is a nice hotel though and if you have a reservation here you'll be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Slinky69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June this year....was quite a busy time of year as all rates seemed very high, it is a nice hotel but not sure is worthy of the money we paid. Would stay at this hotel again only if we got a better deal. The location however is briliant, and is a gorgeous hotel, lobby is quite grand and the rooms, while they are small are very nicely decorated (although get impression this is same throughout NY) and the bed is big and very comfy! Plus rooms were really quiet on a night too. There were some issues at check in but not sure if the girl was new and so wouldnt really make a big deal of it - we all had bad first days!! They also arranged a transfer back to airport for about the same as a taxi would have been, which was a great as was nice and air conditioned on a scorching hot day!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: DoyleMom4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline for $170/night. Then we read the reviews on Trip Advisor and were a bit leary. However, from the moment we arrived, we had nothing but a positive experience! The valet was extremely efficient and helpful. Our room was ready for early check-in. We were on the 11th floor and I had read the rooms were warm and our room was, but it we cracked the window and turned the thermostat to cool (no trouble finding it). I LOVED listening to the city at night, so we kept our window open. The beds were extremely comfortable. The room was an average size room for in the city. Remember you are in the city. Unless you want to pay $800/night, your room will probably not be extremely spacious. I cannot say enough about the location. The neighborhood is excellent, the subway close by, the Lincoln Center right there, restaurants close by, Starbucks on the corner, a mall right down the street. We walked everywhere and when we got tired, rode the subway back. Check in and check out was amazingly seemless. The front desk was friendly and efficient. We asked Concierge to help us with our in room safe as we locked ourselves out of it. He arrived promptly and took care of opening it. Our shower was great, a minimal amount of water outside of the door controlled easily with the bath mat. We had absolutely no complaints and would stay again in a moment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fand
Reviews.Content: We had a really great stay at The Empire Hotel. When you walk in, the lobby is, as others have mentioned, gorgeous. We had to wait in line to check in, for quite a while, but I travel a bit so I’m used to that. I was told we were eligible for an upgrade in room, which was great (not sure why we got that). They put us in a deluxe room on the eighth floor with a view of Lincoln Center. It was spacious and nicely decorated. We had enough room for my boyfriend to sit over in the little seating area and read while I went to bed without too much light keeping me awake. The bed was comfortable. The room was nice and quiet. The real thing you want to know about this hotel is how great the location is if you are planning on attending anything at Lincoln Center. You could throw a rock from the front of the hotel and hit it. We walked from the hotel to the Met in under five minutes. So easy. Also, there is a Starbucks right on the corner—I got our breakfast there and took it back to the room instead of paying room service prices (which, for the record, are about average at the Empire). The southwest end of Central Park is only a couple of blocks away. We walked to MoMA along the edge of the park, which was nice, and then we walked back through the park, which was even nicer (it’s a longish walk to MoMA in case you were wondering). I had a drink in the lobby bar while waiting for my boyfriend to change and get ready for the opera. The wine was good, the atmosphere pleasant, and the bartenders nice. One of them was generous with the wine, and the other brought me some snack mix. The day we checked out we had tea and coffee in the lobby bar for 90 mins or so before going back to Penn Station—it was a very pleasant place to spend some time after checking out but before we needed to leave. Finally, I feel like I have to talk about the bathroom, because everyone else has. Yep, it’s weird. It is like someone who never needed to use one designed it. The shower isn’t fully covered—meaning no curtain, so yes we got water on the floor. The sink is what I thought was really strange—but it’s too hard to explain why. Let’s just say weird design that doesn’t function well. But the bathroom was fine, really, if a little odd. It didn’t cause us to not enjoy our stay or anything. I will definitely stay here again when I go to NY. No question.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: WheatenDarby
Reviews.Content: I have relatively low expectations for a hotel: a clean room; a reasonably comfortable bed; and a place to get clean. A helpful, courteous staff is a plus. The Empire staff was a plus. They were unfailingly courteous and very willing to help; however, the room did not quite meet my low expectations. The room was clean and the bed comfortable, but the bathroom was an interesting experience. The number of clean towels varied daily. The number of wash cloths varied from none to four. Hot water was sometimes available. Toiletries were replaced at random. The hotel is in a great location but needs to improve a bit to make it worth the money. This was our first stay at the Empire and will be our last. There are other hotels in the area that do a better job.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in New York”
Reviews.Author: Kal0Taxidi
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Empire. My husband and I went for a theater-going four days and we had a terrific stay here. The staff was so helpful - Maggie at the front desk helped us change our room without a hitch and Chris, the bell-man we had at check in and check out, cheerfully lugged boxes of Christmas presents and suitcases to our great room. Our windows overlooked Lincoln Center and it was fun to watch audiences going and coming to the opera, ballet, etc. Our room on the 7th floor was spacious, a wonderful mattress on the bed. We walked everywhere, ate great food in the neighborhood. We don't recommend rooms in the 02-06 line since the air handler for the hotel is outside those windows and it is quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Latamtravel
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my wife with a NYC Christmas holiday weekend, Looked at different locations and read trip advisor reviews. Some of the reviews go on and on about the noise from the club if you are on a high floor, the street noise if you are at a low floor, small rooms etc. People love to complain, this is a very nice boutique hotel very close to central park, Columbus Circle, Lincoln Ctr. Very friendly and helpful Staff at the front desk. I upgraded my room to a 10th floor overlooking Lincoln ctr, and yes you will hear some noise but people have blown this out of proportion, this is NYC! It is a very active city and at the Empire the location is the best; great lobby, best burger in town at PJ Clarkes...I will be back, I recommend the Empire

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: nicolecammz
Reviews.Content: I recently booked this room through Expedia - it was one of those hidden hotel deals. After booking the room and getting thename of the hotel I cam to trip advisor to read the reviews. I was so nervous! Everyone was complaining about how small the rooms were, that there were robberies, the air conditioner unit was loud, and that the shower flooded. I also noticed that the General Manager had reached out to everyone who wrote reviews on here. To me that's great service. I actually took the liberty of calling to let them know I was skeptical, and she assured me that we had nothing to worry about and was offered an upgraded room. I would like to break this down for you as simple as possible: 1. It is a 4-5 Star hotel...which means the rooms are going to be smaller! The decor is going to be more modern, and it's going to cost a fortune because of the location. You aren't going to get a huge room! 2. The bed was amazing to sleep on! I had slept so cozy that night! 3. The shower is really nice! As far as the flooding, It has a rain shower head, it's better to shower closer to the shower head rather than stand in front of it...this will avoid the flooding, we didn't have any problems. 4. The air conditioner unit wasn't loud, well we didn't turn it on, but it had a loud dripping noise from time to time. 5. The staff and service was excellent - we do not have any complaints! 6. The only complaint I have, pretty much the only reason i only gave it a 4 was the house keeping - we went back to our rooms around 8:00 take a break from the long day of walking, and House keeping was going around cleaning the rooms, our room got knocked on twice after we said we were fine. We just put the do not disturb sign up. All in all, it was great stay! No complaints and we will definitly recommend this hotel and stay there again for our next visit. I hope this eases anyone's minds who is thinking about staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Katze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a weekend getaway Dec 17-18 and we stayed in room 606. Location: It's great. I usually prefer to stay in midtown, but this is a great option too! It's right across from the Lincoln Center, which looked especially gorgeous decorated for Christmas. The subway is also just across the street and Central Park is just a short walk. Lobby and hotel itself: It's swanky. The lobby is very impressive and fits the boutique label. The bar was hopping and looked fun, but since I'm pregnant, we didn't partake. Check-in was fine. I asked for a quiet room since I'm a light sleeper and preferably a king or queen bed. Room: We ended up on the 6th floor in a small room with a queen-sized bed. There really was not a view - just saw another building since we were in the back of the property. I understand why the guy who checked us in put us there though - it was quiet. We didn't hear cars honking or traffic sounds, and we were at the very end of the hall. Yes, it was small, but it was perfectly fine for us for 1 night. The bed was awesome, so comfortable! Be aware, if you are allergic to feathers/down, let them know. There was a feather bed, feather pillows, and a down comforter. Fortunately, we're not allergic and I love the softness of down bedding. Linens were high quality. The bathroom is tiny. The sink is poorly designed and placed. It was very challenging to wash my face and even washing my hands was difficult due to the strange design. It looks nice but the functionality is lacking. The bathroom amenities are very nice quality. We had plenty of hot water but the shower pressure was just ok due to the rain-style shower head. Again, it looks good, but not the most functional. Other thoughts: This is an old building. It gives it plenty of charm, but there are also quirks. When the people in the room next to us took a shower, dang, it was loud. It sounded like a loud sink was running right next to my head. Fortunately I was able to fall back alseep, but it was annoying. Overall, my husband and I really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely visit again (if the price is right).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: liss314
Reviews.Content: I loved the lobby--dark, mysterious, and with gorgeous chandeliers. We were upgraded from the typical NYC shoebox room to a regular-sized queen room, but the bathrooms must all be the same size because this one was tiny. And the shower didn't have a door or curtain, so the floor got wet. But besides that, everything was wonderful, even being woken up by sirens multiple times during the night. What's more New York than that?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: MANYFLCA
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms here for family to see The War Horse at Lincoln Center. Location at Columbus Circle right next to Lincoln Center is awesome spot for scouting NYC during the holidays. Attention to detail in room appointments is extremely good - beautiful rooms, extremely good quality and comfortable bedding, very nicely designed baths. Rooftop lounge a big plus. Staff excellent - checked us in (very) early with no problem, very solicitous of our well-being - from door staff to front desk staff to housekeeping staff. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Two Nights at The Empire the Weekend Before Christmas”
Reviews.Author: GoSupai
Reviews.Content: I liked The Empire a lot. Great room (small, but it's NYC after all, they're ALL small unless you're paying 5 times the price), great sheets and bed, completely clean (barefoot clean, in fact) beautiful lobby, great location, loved the decor. I would definitely stay here again. I got my room on Priceline -- and I don't think I've ever had better value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “At the price, I was satisfied (Faint praise, I know, but...)”
Reviews.Author: Cohen_Jack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Empire for a single night stay after a late evening in the Lincoln Center area on December 14th. I reserved the room for $150.00 on Priceline, and, for the amount I paid, it was a nice choice. The hotel has undergone extensive renovation, and, although the rooms are European-level small, they are clean and serviceable. We didn't use or check out the pool or the gym, but the idea that a hotel in this area had such amenities was impressive. You'll find yourself 1/2 block from Lincoln Center, which is a nice touch. Ed's Chowder House, the restaurant downstairs, has a nice buffet breakfast for the usual hotel overcharging price. Service at the front desk was friendly, and the lobby was inviting. The elevator I traveled in had a door that didn't open properly at first. But the doorman service was friendly, and the front desk efficient. Overall, I'd feel comfortable staying there again, although I wouldn't be panting to do so at the full-charge rate you'd find on Expedia or Hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: MrMac510
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Located right by central park and a short walk to times square. Pleaseant staff, lOvely roof top bar. Highly reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique Hotel - Very, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mj W
Reviews.Content: The Empire Hotel is a GORGEOUS hotel. The Valet and front desk staff were super helpful and friendly. The first floor bar area and Mezzanine level were dark and sexy yet inviting. The rooms are clean and updated but as small as a closet. I stayed with a girlfriend in a double and let's just say that if my husband had been with me, I still would have felt crowded! The bathrooms are also small and have an open shower door that gets water all over the floor. We couldn't figure out that design snafu. Other than that, the area is great (Upper West Side, right next to Lincoln Center) and the Columbus Circle subway station is about four blocks away. There is a Starbucks on the corner as well as several stores where you can get sandwiches, coffee, drinks, etc. Since the rooms were small, and there was free Wifi in the lobby, I spent quite a few nights working on the Mezzanine level, and enjoyed it immensely. The bar area downstairs gets more crowded as the week goes on but it was never overcrowded. It was easy and relaxing to get work done any day of the week. The "look" of this hotel is so beautiful and the furnishings are so modern that I ended up doing a photo shoot for a friend while I was there (until Management stopped me!) They have a bar on their roof, which is a very popular place to hang out. I've seen episodes of The New York City Housewives where they filmed at that bar and apparently Kim Kardashian has also stayed at this hotel. If you want a gorgeous, boutique hotel experience, and don't mind a super small room, then The Empire Hotel is the place for you!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Loud, broken A/C, poor plumbing... a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a one-night trip to NYC, 12/15/2011-12/16/2011. Basically this place has terrible climate and plumbing control, amounting to a huge hassle and disappointment. 1) Our first room was on the 11th (top) floor, and it didn't take long for us to realize it was SWELTERING in there! Despite pawing around for thermostat and other temperature controls, we could not find the control for the heating unit. Upon calling the front desk, we spoke with an engineer who came up to the room and explained that since we were on the top floor, we were getting all the radiant heat from "all the steam pipes" above us on the roof. He said there was nothing that could be done, except move us to another floor. Our only other options were the 4th floor (designated "SMOKING" - really? in the 21st century?) and the 1st floor. At this point it was midnight and we said the 1st floor would be fine. Schlepping down to Room 107, we unloaded all of our bags and settled in a few hours later for the night... 2) Except, it was awfully hard to settle in with the CONSTANT CLANGING OF THE A/C (yes, A/C) unit throughout the night. It was a distinct metal sound that could be heard loudly throughout the room. It woke us up every hour on the hour throughout the night. Only after getting up and fiddling with the A/C and eventually unplugging the unit were we able to get some rest. (Later, when we mentioned this to the hotel staff, they curiously asked us if we were sure we hadn't been hearing the sound of the "elevator" down the hall... um, yes, we know what an elevator sounds like... and it's definitely not he sound of metal clanging inside an A/C unit located approximately 10 inches from your head, thanks to the small size of the rooms!) SO MUCH FOR A GOOD NIGHT'S REST. 3) The next morning, I woke up and hopped into the shower, hoping to stay on schedule to catch our departure at 9:30AM. Strangely, the hot water didn't seem to be coming on in the shower. Fiddled with the dial, changing it at 15-20 degree (out of 360 degree) intervals, but the water only seemed to be cold and colder. After **12** minutes, warm water and eventually hot came out of the spigot... by this time, I was ready to resort to a sponge bath in order to make it out of there on time. Bottom line, if you're looking for a hassle-free accommodation, Empire's not going to make the cut. Having lived in New York for a number of years, I can attest that this place does not live up to the competitive pace and standards expected of a four-star hotel in a world-class city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: munchkins7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early November. The location is across from Lincoln Center, a subway stop and a bus line. Couldn't be better for getting around town. Liked the fact that we weren't in the mix/near Times Square and could escape to a real neighborhood. Lots of really good restaurants. Cafe Ronda on Columbus Ave ROCKS! Didn't have much interaction with the staff except check in and check out, but they were competent and friendly enough. The shower is CRAZY! Be sure to check to see which way the hand held is facing before turning it on. Our last day nearly flooded the bathroom. One thing that I found annoying, was that ice could only be gotten through room service. Silly if you ask me! The hotel stay was a gift from a friend and they Pricelined it so I don't know the final bid. If I could get a decent rate, would probably stay again, just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: TrickyTree14
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Was allocated a room on first floor. Air con units right outside window. Romeo gave us complimentary breakfasts so it felt churlish to complain. Superb location. One little tip. We required tranport to the Cruise port at Bayonne, New Jersey. The concierge quoted $124. We asked the bell boys and they got us a limo for $80 including tolls and tip.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: Harris14
Reviews.Content: Dark,dank, not kept up, tiny rooms, needs overhaul, 2 star at best, never return

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Stepha10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire hotel for 2 nights in November 2011. The location is great. However we had to change room twice as it was noisy and the air-conditioning did not work. Also the decor is a little dated. It was expensive for the service we received - overall disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, postage-stamp room”
Reviews.Author: Ob3ron
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights in December 2011. The location is great (best attraction: 2 short blocks from Central Park for great morning runs). The room ("Deluxe king" -- I think that this means a standard room) was postage-stamp sized -- not enough room to actually stand in front of the sink (you sort of have to straddle the commode to wash your face), and predictable toe-stubs on the bed if you try to walk from one side of the room to the other. I was on the second floor, and predictably there was street noise through the night. (Hint: run the air conditioner to add some white noise and drown out the street.) I'll also never understand why hotels have shower stall with no doors, so that they can count on flooded bathroom floors every morning in every room. But the desk staff were helpful enough. Bottom line: it's mid-town NYC. Nothing special, nothing bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you don't want to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: travelleteacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July for 10 days as part of a booking made via the internet which meant I couldn't cancel my stay once it started. The location is great, the atmoshphere is cool, rooms very modern. However, the entire focus of the hotel is the bar on the roof. I stayed on the 9th floor, and the music was so loud the water in my glass was shaking. I complained each night as well as in the morning. The staff were very nice to talk with and explained how they can't control the volume of the music as the bar is not owned by the hotel. There is a a huge line which goes around the hotel to get into the plush bar. This crowd is very young and loud. You will almost have to push your way through the line to get into the hotel at night. Spoke with the daytime manager who simply offered to have me stay a night for free the next time I'm in NYC. Really great offer for a traveller from another country who will probably never be back. Having an oral offer really amounts to nothing. It demonstrated how little the management at the hotel cared about the opinion of a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location let down by size of rooms”
Reviews.Author: Romac41
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in the Empire Hotel over my birthday early December 2011. Fairly well serviced and superb Location - we walked everywhere. Check in was easy, but room very small (on 4th floor at the back) and we were disturbed by the noisy air conditioning/heating units - but the noise soon blended into the background. What a fantastic shower! Could have done with tea/coffee making facilities in the room (but I seriously doubt there would be room for them!). Dont have a drink in the Lobby Bar - very expensive!! Overall, a good stay which would be improved by a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie k
Reviews.Content: Me, my daughter and a friend stayed at the Empire for a long weekend of sightseeing and girlie shopping at the beginning of December. We stayed in a room on the fourth floor. After reading other reviews we expected the rooms to be very small but were pleasantly surprised. Our room had two very large comfortable beds and was quite spacious. The bed linens and towels were excellent quality. The room was spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The hotel was in an excellent location and just a short walk to most of the major tourist attractions. The only thing I would have liked to see in the room was tea and coffee mmaking facilities. Overall I would reccomend this hotel to others and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Trentmeister
Reviews.Content: OK it was the height of summer when we stayed, but the pokey little room was like an oven. A little more familiarity with New York would have meant that I would have spotted that as the place is built right where Broadway narrows into Columbus Ave and that this was unlikely to be the most tranquil spot. But it was noisy noisy noisy!!! We had the option of being deafened by the air con (1950s style window mounted tractor engine powered contraption) and gently roasting, or turning off the A/C and boiling to death and being deafened anyway by the equally loud incessant traffic just below the window. The first, awful night we also had parties of what sounded like dozens of loud, Spanish speaking (shouting, rather) people careering up and down the corridor, pausing periodically only to beat on our bedroom door. Our best purchases in NYC were the earplugs bought on the second day. We were also ripped off by the Concierge recommended airport shuttle (an incredibly rude bandit) and had an item "go mysteriously missing" when in the left luggage room (hard to prove anything, but we know that that was the only possible place it could have gone).

Reviews.Title: “Try the Empire”
Reviews.Author: pj t
Reviews.Content: I'm staying on the third floor of the Empire facing the street. The noise -- garbage trucks -- loudly announce the dawn and never stop. Ask for a room up high and away from traffic. The room is clean, large for a standard Queen in New York and nicely appointed. Great bed, super fresh sheets, good sized bath. At night, this is an amazing place to be -- close to two of NYC's best restos (Picholine and Telapan) with the yummy Chowder Bar right in the hotel. But it is the nightclubish lobby that seems to draw the cool. Velvet drapes and comfy benches, romantic lights and designer drinks. For those who complained about the smallness of the room, I believe you but mine is excellent. Try this place with the caveat at check-in that you will ask to move if you don't like the room. But don't let those posts make you skip this fabulous location (Broadway and 63rd in the shiny heart of the Apple's entertainment district). I also got a great rate using Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Engagement!!”
Reviews.Author: Bakul M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here end of September for about a week. It was a surprise holiday for my girlfiend and I - I proposed to here in New York! Overall, we were both extemely impressed with the hotel and finisings. The staff are great and the guy on concierge a legend. The location if fantastic, close to Lincoln Centre subway or Columbus Circle - a boon of a location. A couple of points to make. When I made the reservation I wrote a note saying I will be proposing and it would be nice if the hotel guys could do something nice for us which didn't seem to happen. Perhaps some roses or chocolates would be great. I'm sure they would have if I asked in person but just keep an eye on the reservation footnotes please. Secondly, the room we had seemed to have one of he first air conditioners ever made! It was seriously loud. Again, not an issue for us as it was cold when we were there so we didn't use it, apart from once or twice. My advice would be investment in some up to date quiet ceiling mounted air con units. The rooms we finished to a very high standard and the shower great. Just one personal note - I would prefer a full door on my shower. The room we had only had half a door so we had to be careful not to allow the shower to spray out. Our room view was the innerds of the hotel, again not an issue for us as we there only to sleep! I gave value a 4* as we had 2 nights free through a promotion. If we didn't I would still award 4*. My sleep quality would potentially be 2* IF THE AIR CON WAS ON, seeing as it was off 5*. Overall vey impressive, but please upgrade your air-con machines! P.S. she said yes!

Reviews.Title: “Marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: rosemary r
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights and would definitely return when next in NYC. Staff were friendly and helpful, including a courtesy call to our room to see if we were satisfied with it after check-in. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. Although it was a busy weekend and the hotel's bars popular, we were not disturbed. Ask for a front room with views of the Lincoln Centre. This was an ideal city base from which to explore: close to Central Park, shops,etc and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Room #1014”
Reviews.Author: Danni S
Reviews.Content: We stay in NYC for a kid-free weekend several times per year. We stay at a diffrent hotel every time and have had great experiences with nearly every property (Affinia, Kitano, Bryant Park, W, etc....all great). This was the first major exception. We don't spend much time hanging-out in the room and we are used to typically-small NYC hotel rooms. This "room" was so small one of us had to be sitting on the bed or in the bathroom so there was room for the other person to walk around the bed. You also had to be standing in one very specific spot in the bathroom in order for there to be enough room to close the bathroom door. It was almost comical is was so small. Like something from I Love Lucy. They should be ashamed of themselves for classifying this as a room (the difference b/t it and the rest of the rooms on the floor is clear once you look at the emergency escape floor plan that's posted). The bed was, I guess, a double because there is no way in hades anything bigger than that would fit in this room. The AC was super-loud but not especially cold. If that had been the only issue it would have been NBD. Our room rate probably would have been decent for an actual room but not for the sleeping closet. Probably not coincidentally, for the first time ever upon check-out, we were not asked if we enjoyed our stay. After all, they could see that we were booked into the sleeping closet. All in all, a wonderful weekend in NYC for the NY Comedy Festival and shopping but we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: Alison3238
Reviews.Content: I have done extensive traveling. Rarely have I paid 500 bucks a night for a hotel room except at Farimount properties. I know that NYC is not priced to most standards but 500 bucks should still carry with it an expectation of well-above-average standards. The only good thing about it was the location. As soon as I walked in I got a bad vibe. The decor was dark, heavily draped and dingy. The deluxe premium room was small, had one chair and again the decor was brown/black. There was a full shower with half of a shower door so water went everywhere. There was a sink but it was 2 inches deep so water went everywhere. there was no counter space and the whole thing annoyed me.The street noise was typical but the hotel patrons were beyond noisy! For 500 bucks a night I expected a refined clientele and it was anything but...sorry I have stayed in better Marriotts, Hampton for under 100 bucks a night. I would NEVER go back, in fact I could not wait to get home! The front desk was oblivious and contacting them at all was a hassle. Next time I am in NYC I will stay at a Marriott even if is more than 500 bucks. Shame on you EMPIRE HOTEL!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jennifer m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, a family of three with a two year old included in the party. Firstly do not be put off from booking this hotel as I had some concerns following recent reviews on this site. We took a superior double room there was lots of space for storing our 5 cases and buggy. Room was well cleaned every day, beds are really comfy. All rooms have air con so you can adjust your own room temp. One incident occurred due to the poor behaviour of another guest, hotel staff dealt with this within minutes, offered another room and complimentary meals. Please note this was a one off incident and totally beyond the hotels control however they resolved it swiftly. With regards to security we had no concerns at all room safe, dead bolts fitted to doors and no concerns at all. Decor was lovely, staff very friendly and professional and they loved kids. Kid friendly restaurants in neighbour hood along with general stores for food supplies etc. a few minutes from central park and all the upper west side. We will definitely use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, decent NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnx16
Reviews.Content: The Empire hotel is a decent, conveniently located NY hotel. It was renovated a few years ago and the price of the rooms is usually reasonable. As with most NY hotels, don't expect a breakfast buffet and the price, 99% of the time, does not include breakfast. It has a basic gym with 2 treadmills, 2 elliptical machines and 1 bench. The rooms are of decent size (especially the Superior King and up) and well equipped albeit I find the lightning inside the rooms on the dim side, but then again that may be my personal quirk and the hotel may claim that it adds to the "ambience" of the room. Inside, the rooms offer Frette linens and L' Occitane bathroom amenities. On the ground floor, there is a popular Starbucks (due to the nearby NYIT) and PJ Clarke's, a good American hamburger place worth visiting. As a conclusion, I'd say that the Empire hotel is decent, without many drawbacks, but also without any memorable characteristics

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: turkeyOgel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire's JR.Suit between the dates of nov.10-26 th. The hotel's location is a great plus.The room was clean and well maintained,the bed was very comfortable.The bathroom was good size and in good condition. We were happy about the big screen TV in our room with decent number of channels ,sometimes we just wanted to stay in our room and rest although the reception quality of the channels was not always good,maybe an adjustment would have helped. Our primary concern with this hotel was the house keeping service. Almost every day something in our room was not replaced,we needed to keep on calling the house keeping service on the phone almost every day for missing fresh towels,toilet paper,soap,pillows,etc...which was very annoying.Somebody needs to contol this department. We had no other major complaints. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly,so were the bell boys and the waiters at the breakfast lounge. Maybe the decor of the hotel needs to be updated.I did not like the colors and the designs of the rooms but this is rather subjective. If they can keep their room prices on a reasonable level I would not mind staying in this hotel on my next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “So good they named it twice”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: We returned to the UK yesterday morning after staying 4 nights at this superb hotel . The staff were really very helpful . Our room was stylish, modern yet retro in style , clean and very comfortable. Even though it was a good 10 minutes walk into the theatre district and a short taxi ride to main shopping areas it was convenient for our needs . We both have knee replacements but it did not deter us from walking almost everywhere . When we got back to the hotel from sightseeing it was a comforting to see the" Empire Hotel" in lights on the roof from each direction . We would definitely recommend this hotel . Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “Won a nights stay here!”
Reviews.Author: gamcd27
Reviews.Content: I won a 26 hour trip to NYC for a Foo Fighters Concert. The Hotel was only used for about 5-6 hours by us but in that time it seemed pretty nice. We were impressed by the atmosphere inside. It looked nice from the inside and not bad from the outside. For you starbucks people there is one next door. Very convienant for Lincoln Center and City Park. We went from Florida and were able to see the leaves changing, Awesome. There is a sub station very near so nice too. Beds were comfortable, nice flat screen, very dark unless you turned on a light, my view sucked and looked into an alley/ Just like everyone says very small bathrooms. No fans in them, and small rooms. Shower head was updated and it even had and extra cleaning feature for the women... if you needed that. Shampoo and conditer they gave smelled good according to my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Misses on almost every mark.”
Reviews.Author: OhioTGN
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only three things going for it…location (right next to Lincoln Center and close to Central Park), good beds, and it appears to be fairly clean. We just returned from a four night stay in late November 2011. We stayed in a ‘Deluxe Room’ paying approx. $540 a night…hardly a cheap room, even for NYC. There was just too much wrong with the room to be satisfied with the Hotel. There are hotels that disappoint and hotels that simply leave a foul taste in one's mouth...this one is the latter. The bathrooms are small, about 7’x7’ with the walk-in shower only half glassed so that when taking a shower it was virtually impossible to not flood the floor with a significant amount of water. The bathrooms had virtually no counter space due to a foo-foo stand-alone sink where you could barely get your hands under the faucet to wash them. Other than that, there were 3 very small shelves, maybe 4-5” deep to store items. The room, as stated in other reviews, was extremely small which creates a variety of problems. There are actually NO DRAWERS TO STORE UNPACKED CLOTHES IN so we basically lived out of our suitcases. There is also an extraordinary small amount of space to hang clothes in…maybe 3 feet wide and I could not actually hang a men’s sport coat without it bunching on the bottom shelf as the space is shared with a refrigerator and a small safe. We were on the third floor which had an extraordinary amount of road noise…and yes, NYC never does sleep. Even worse was the lack of soundproofing in the hallway and the room doors. As people returned to their rooms in the wee hours of the morning, you could very clearly hear conversations and doors banging shut throughout the night - total misery from a sound level perspective. While we made our reservations two months in advance, we were told that room floors were not guaranteed, but also that we did not want to be too close to the roof as there is a nightclub on the top floor with music and frivolity going on until 2-3 in the morning. Honestly, the three times I was at the front desk doing business – oh yeah, and they charge for internet access! – there were several people who appeared to be very upset over room issues ranging from quality to the cost of supplemental charges. I heard all three directly state to the front desk that that they would never be returning to the hotel - I don't know what their specific complaints were, but the desk staff did not seem to bat an eye. Run far and fast from this overpriced - and based on most of the reviews – extraordinarily overrated hotel. Given the choice of going to NYC and staying at the Empire or staying home, home would win every time…and I live in Cleveland Ohio! As my wife stated...."I've stayed in a Hampton Inn for $125 that was nicer than this."

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dismal, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: Dionne C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights 25th-30th October 2011. Upon checking in, we were given the card to our room. When we got to our non-smoking room, it smelt like somebody had just put out a cigar in there, the air-con units were outside the window and really noisey and the room was tiny. You had to walk into the bathroom, half close the door, struggle through the gap and then fully close the door (this is from a size 8 woman!). I immediately called the front desk with my complaints, was told the hotel was fully booked that night but to leave our bags packed and we would be moved tomorrow, and that we had only paid for this type of room! Upon returning to the hotel the following evening, we checked with the front desk where we had been moved to, to be told we had not been moved and the person that had taken my call did not leave any notes as to why we requested a move! When we eventually got to our new room it was bigger and slightly quieter. During our stay a parcel had been delivered for us without our knowledge. At no point during our stay were we made aware of this, infact the first we heard was when we arrived back in England! At this stage we contacted the hotel, who arranged shipping using the credit card details we had to leave with the hotel when we checked in. When the credit card bill arrived, we had been charged £56 for the shipping, for a t-shirt!! I contacted the hotel asking for themn to reimburse the costs, but was told that they did put a note under our door (they did not, or we would have collected it!) so they would not pay the costs. All of this aside, the hotel is a great location for the price, and has been 'tarted up' but not to a great standard. Would I stay here again? No!

Reviews.Title: “overall good impression and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Teodoraliliandiana
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a fantastic trip with my daughter and my niece. A big of the fantastic part is definitly the hotel. The only negative thing that I agree with other guests is that the rooms are quite small, but how much time do you spend in the room when you are in manhattan?!? The sleeping quality is excellent and that's more important! When we needed something from the housekeeper or the concierge we got it right away. The bathroom is ok, could be much better if you could close when taking a shower, instead of having water splashing out. If I go back to N Y, I will definitly choose this hotel again. The location is perfect, close to shopping, starbucks, central park........and many other things. I want to thank Zuli for a friendly and superservice, for all the information and suggestions we needed during our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: AthlasF
Reviews.Content: I'm now on my last night staying at the Empire hotel - and I have to say - it's great! There are a few bits and pieces that you'd want fixed (e.g. the doors don't close properly on their own, so it's happened a few times that the employees have knocked and asked if it was left open by mistake - awesome service though!), but it's overall a great place to stay in New York! Location is amazing - and for the price - awesome! Kudos to Zuli for help with great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Empire Hotel, late October while visiting family”
Reviews.Author: countydufus
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of negative reviews, we were apprehensive about staying here, booked as a result of our Priceline bid. Much to our delight, this is a wonderful hotel. The staff is helpful and friendly. The room had great beds and was as big as we needed. The only negative was the shower, which is an open design and somewhat unusual. It took a while to figure out how to get hot water, but their engineer staff explained it and it works fine. Other than that we would definitely recommend the Empire. The food at Ed's Chowder House was excellent, and the location across from Lincoln Center can't be beat. Don'[t believe everything you read in these reviews. People love to complain, but we had nothing but a wonderful stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Lizcurrier
Reviews.Content: What impressed me the most was the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff. The Concierge was a treasure, so helpful, also the receptionists we met and Rose in the Chowder House was delightful. Ok our room was small especially the en-suite( you couldn't have got in it if you had been a large person) but the cleanliness was good, and the bed very comfortable. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but could be improved”
Reviews.Author: FantasticMsLou
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by Trailfinders. We wanted a Mid-Town New York hotel and this fitted the bill, although it was on the northern end of Mid-Town. Excellent location for Central Park, Bloomingdales and the museum/ galleries on the Upper East Side, but some way north of downtown - a fair walk. The biggest complaint I would have is the room size. We actually paid to have a superior room and although admittedly there were two double beds, the room was tiny with barely any space on one side of each bed and not much in between. The bathroom was even smaller and the frosted glass doors didn't feel as private as they should have - ok for couples but not so good for friends. There was also not very much storage space. The room was very hot - the air con unit was rather old fashioned with no proper temperature control and only seemed to cool the air immediately above it. The bar had also been hyped, but on 3 out of our 4 nights stay, it was hired out privately and therefore inaccessable until much later on. On the plus side, Chris the concierge was excellent. He secured us reservations for a restaurant we should have booked much earlier and also booked us on the Sex and the City tour which was great fun. He was also endlessly enthusiastic about our trip. The beds and pillows were also very comfortable. Overall, we had a good stay, but I wouldn't rave about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pick-pocketing Maids”
Reviews.Author: Nicole P
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Empire Hotel, and during my stay, my friend's laptop was stolen, as well as her purse. I also had a small side bag stolen from me, as well as having one of the maid's throw away one of my keepsake travel blankets. The service at this hotel was horrible and I do not believe that they did their best to find my friend's lap top. They don't just vaporize into this air, and the card tester for the door is a complete joke, as well as the "door checks" that they do in the middle of the night. The police said that this is a common offense at the Empire Hotel, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A wolf in sheep's clothing in heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Mariamanthattan
Reviews.Content: This hotel although maybe centrally located and artistically designed is never the less a faired and disgrace to the great city of Manhattan. I recently was a guest at this establishment and had the disturbing and frightening experience of having my labtop amongst other items robbed as I lay asleep.. Somehow predators entered my room and stole my belongings as I lay lifeless to the world .. I could of been raped and killed If god forbid I awoke during this robbery.. The authorizes and the hotel employees have not taken this disgusting reality seriously .. I am left with disgrace for the justice system of the city of New York ... For this matter is far beyond a missing laptop it is the severity of the security of an establishment that represents the great city of new York which is Rome of the 21st century. For that I shame you Empire hotel and the city of new York .....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, could be better”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the EH for four nights, mid Nov 20011. The beds were very comfortable, it was clean and tidy. I quite liked the decor, very designer, possibly a little over done. The bathroom was tiny and had no bath, for the price I would have expected one of those lavish American bathrooms! My friend and I had a room service breakfast one morning, it was mediocre and cost about $60. I guess I'm used to English hotels where you would get breakfast included. I found the room very over heated, had to get a maintenance man to sort the air con. I found the reception staff very friendly and helpful, they recommended some fantastic restaurants which we would never have found. We came back one day to find that our room keys didn't work, eventually the whole door handle was drilled out as the batteries were dead, this took an hour during which time we were told that it was not our room and had to prove our identities with passports etc. Not much fun after a hard day pounding the streets of NY. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay, a few little tweeks and it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it was 4 stars in its heyday”
Reviews.Author: wandernotlost1
Reviews.Content: The Empire is flashy upon entry into the lobby, but the rooms are in serious need of some TLC. I don't think the Empire should hire the same contractors to do the building work, though...some pretty shoddy workmanship. No fan in the bathroom means some major humidity problems, the rooms are quite small and the carpet is hurting. The booking we made through Priceline stated "standard room with king, queen or two double beds upon request" and we were hassled when we checked in and asked for two double beds. The hotel wanted to charge us an upgrade of $50 per night but we dug in our heels and got it without paying extra. Only catch was that it was on a stinky smoking floor, but the room itself didn't smell of smoke, thankfully. Good location - just a couple blocks from two subway stops. The concierge was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain, overall very good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Okaydokay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the empire hotel for 1 week over the time of the marathon. We stayed in a superior double double room on the first floor and were more than pleased with the size. Bathroom was fine, and yes the floor did get wet but we were given plenty of clean towels every day. We didn't have to get in contact with reception for any reason so can't comment on this. Location is amazing! So close to everything..Eds chowder house is a must!! Food was amazing! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Flawed at best”
Reviews.Author: Luanne506
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, couldn't control the room temperature, staff ssssslllllllooooowwww to respond to request for heat, breakfast was overpriced. Felt like I should have my wallet surgically attached to my hand to get any member of the staff's attention...wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel--not spectacular, not awful”
Reviews.Author: javl
Reviews.Content: I became worried after reading some of the very negative reviews of EH, but I had no bad experiences. Every staff member I had contact with--receptionist, engineer, doormen--was very pleasant and helpful. My room was clean; it was not tiny (as it sounds like other rooms are), but it was long and narrow. I couldn't work there because there was no desk or work space--only a narrow table covered with everything except a lamp. I was there for business for one night, and it served my needs well enough. If you need a clean and safe place to stay after long days and night out, the EH would be a good option. A lot of Europeans were staying there. The main reason why I wasn't crazy about it has to do with Aesthetics. It is all done in dark, heavy colors (bronze, black) and drapes and animal-print patterns--and I found it oppressive. The lobby could be spectacularly beautiful--but the decor makes it closed and dark. I don't think of this as 'contemporary' but as some throw-back to a brooding interpretation of victorian times with dark velvet and drapes and no lights. I found myself just wanting to get out in the fresh air and openness. I had breakfast there, which was a mistake. The restaurant opened 10 minutes late; the eggs were greasy; they didn't have wheat toast and burnt the white toast. I should have gone to Starbucks around the corner. I should qualify this by saying my experience of NYC hotels is limited, so if the EH is the best deal you can find, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly flawed, but good overall”
Reviews.Author: Tef5
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive after being booked here for a business trip and seeing people either loving or hating the Empire. Fortunately, while there were a handful of small things that were annoying, my overall experience was quite positive. The good things: The hotel is stylish and contemporary in the areas that count: the lobby and the rooms. Muted tones and surfaces create an atmosphere that is contemporary without being annoyingly trendy. My bed was very comfortable, although the pillows are like almost every other hotel's: excessively floppy and lacking support for side sleepers. The location is outstanding, with Central Park, Lincoln Center, shopping, subways and excellent restaurants no more than a 5-minute walk away (and usually less). The flawed things: There were some layout decisions in my room that made me think someone really didn't think things through. The only electrical outlet by the desk was wedged behind the wall-mounted flat-screen TV, making it incredibly difficult to plug in the adapter for my laptop. With people carrying laptops, phones, cameras, etc. on every trip, it's frankly inexcusable for a hotel not to offer ample electrical outlets by the desk. The shower featured only a half-width glass panel, which would probably be ok if the overhead shower head wasn't located in the exact center of the shower. I encountered a small lake on the bathroom floor after every shower. And there's the previously mentioned pillows. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay here. I slept well, I was conveniently located and I was able to get some work done, even considering the lack of conveniently placed electrical outlets. The flaws took a little shine off the experience, but nothing was approaching deal-breaker level. For a business trip, there's really nothing more I need out of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MULTIPLE ROBBERIES”
Reviews.Author: Miranda B
Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE HOTEL! I recently stayed here in November 2011. My laptop was stolen right from my room. The worst part was that my roommate was sleeping in the room when the robbery happened at about 11:30 at night. It significantly compromised our safety! The security staff was not helpful and the hotel did not reimburse me for my loss nor accommodate us in any other way. They did an "investigation" but the result was "inconclusive." After reporting the theft to the NYPD and speaking to a detective, my robbery was the 5th robbery this month so far from that specific hotel! It was advised to inform others to NOT stay at the EMPIRE HOTEL. Police are under investigation of the hotel staff as well as a lot of suspicious activity has been reported ever since the Hotel went under new management. Stay safe and DO NOT stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amenities can't be beat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: Its amazing dry cleaning service in 2 hours. Othe hotels I have to turn in at 12 pm to have it back in 6 hours and thats a 'rush.' People here get things doen no ifs or buts. If your business this would come in handy when you have an emergency meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that great”
Reviews.Author: Amy K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient for the NYC marathon, since it's close to Central Park. Aside from that, I can't say that it is a good hotel at all. The rooms are tiny, there is no place to put your suitcases, there is no coffee maker or any way to obtain coffee (especially before the marathon!) and they have so much stuff for sale on the dresser and in the frig that there is actually no place for any snacks or breakfast stuff you may have purchased for your own use-- not even one bottle of water. We were there for 4 nights, and on the evening of the 3rd we realized that again, the shampoo hadn't been replaced. Not once. After we drank out of the glasses, they were also never replaced during the entire visit. There is no shower door in the tiny bathroom, although it's clear that there used to be. So water gets all over the bathroom floor, and the door is rotting in the corner. The air conditioner made awful sounds the first night and quit working on the 2nd day. So we opened the window (which had no screen-- isn't that illegal? 10th floor-- a child could fall out!) If you want to go to the rooftop bar, expect that you will need to stand in a long line behind a bunch of young people (because guests are not given priority). The entire place is more show (such as the lobby) than actually being nice, clean and convenient. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Service”
Reviews.Author: Bill H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Empire for 4 days. Rooms tend to be small but the service is big. Door staff phenomenally helpful getting you a cab or SUV in mere seconds. Roof top bar a must. Location sensational with restaurants, drugstore etc close at hand. The foyer and decor is just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyIre
Reviews.Content: Wen we arrived the room we were given was an express queen which is what the travel agent booked for us, it was extremely small if staying here I'd stay away from them rooms. We upgraded to the junior suit for an additional $100 a night but it was worth it!!! The room was amazing with great views and you couldn't ask for a better location. Nearly everything in walking distance and subway just down the road, central park is right across the street! Staff really polite and friendly. We will be back again sometime in the future! We had a great honeymoon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smart & stylish hotel, fairly well located, staff not rude but could be more welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Cfox1404
Reviews.Content: stayed here last NYE for 7 nights. The hotel in general was pretty stunning, our room was nice and had a amasing view however we paid for an upgrade for a delux and I didnt see what I paid extra for. House cleaning were fantastic with the room cleaned twice daily. It was great for a strole to central park with the south entrance just 30 mtrs away but its a little further from most other attractions, not a problem if you dont mind a walk. Everytime I encountered the staff I was left feeling they didn't care much for conversation or small talk and didn't come across as welcoming, possibly the reason for a 4/5 & not a 5/5! They ask for $100 a night deposit which I guess wouldn't be too bad if you were only staying a night or two, but considering we were staying 7 nights its a little excessive. We brought a set amount from the UK and this slightly restricted our spending.. good or bad I'm not sure!

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Yanwan
