Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2011 with my sister. Check In- Upon arrival at the hotel, the bell boy came to open the doors of the car and offered to take our bags for us. Check in was quick but a pity the room wasn't ready for us at 10am. The same bell boy offered to store our bags for us while we waited for it to become ready and it did by 1pm. Room- We got a room on the 4th floor facing the main road. The hotel needs to improve on its sound proofing. Facing the main road wasn't a joke in the middle of the night or at anytime of the day in NYC. You could hear cars, ambulances, and simply everything going out in the street! It was terrible. Room was NYC standard, small and squeezy. It had 2 double beds, flat screen TV, a lounge chair, wardrobe, safe, minibar and the bathroom. However, it was luxurious with gold fixtures and modern touches. The bathroom had a rainforest showerhead. Housekeeping was impeccable and really quick. We went down one day for breakfast and was back up in an hour and the room was done! Facilities- The hotel housed a really beautiful and luxurious lobby. It's sort of the place that you want to be seen at having a drink or having a meeting. Great sofas and lounge chairs all around. We heard great reviews of the rooftop bar but never had the chance of visiting it. Guests can access it from a seperate elevator guarded by this really tall bouncer. We had breakfast daily at Ed's Chowder House. The restaurant was grand and had lots of natural light. The buffet wasn't something to scream about though. The hotel didn't offer free wifi but there's a Starbucks right around the corner and buying a coffee there costs much than the hotel's wifi. Location- The hotel is located in the Upper West Side of Manhattan right next to the Lincoln Centre and just a 5 minutes walk to Central Park (we chose it basically for this reason). The subway is also just a 5 minutes walk away. There's also a pharmacy round the corner. If you're looking for good restaurants, the hotel is in a good spot. The Upper West Side had lots of fantastic restaurants and down at 57th Street, more excellent dining outlets. Staff- Extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helped us to book theatre tickets. The bell staff were always at the door to help with nearby recommendations and hailing of cabs. Houskeeping was swift. Restaurant staff were welcoming and attentive during meals. All in all, I would definitely return to this hotel on my next trip to NYC though I do hope the hotel can do something about its sound proofing.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and location in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: jv3940
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I have stayed at in NYC, this one has been the best. The location is amazing. The rooftop bar great. The atmosphere at the hotel puts you in a great mood. The room was spacious for NYC, view of Lincoln center was awesome. I have stayed at many hotels usually based on price, I got a good deal on my stay. I am returning to NYC in dec. And booked this hotel not based on price, but because it was such a great stay. The easy access to the rooftop bar was a great way to jumpstart the night too. Romeo at the front desk was extremely helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Xel X
Reviews.Content: It was nice except that the heater made some clicking sounds. I didn't bother to call to get it fixed, because I didn't really need it. Before this, I called for help on how to use the heater, and someone came in less than a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Chic Hotel, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: jco71
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Empire Hotel. The location was great - within moments of checking in, we were strolling in Central Park, and it wasn't too far to walk 16 blocks down Broadway to get to the theater. The decor is chic with a tiger print arm chair in the room and lovely down comforter. The room itself was teeny tiny. Just enough space for 2 double beds but really it was the bathroom that was ridiculous - the door is just shy of touching the toilet, the sink faucet is so low it practically touches the sink basin making it tough to wash your hands, and there is no counter space to put any toiletries, which makes it ridiculously tough to get ready in the morning without risking your belongings falling in the toilet. The shower lacks a door, so you are bound to get water on the floor (despite the fabulous rain shower head). Also, there is no floor length mirror, which most hotels are kind enough to provide. Despite my whining, we truly did enjoy our stay. The Concierge provided great restaurant recommendations, the Bellman went above and beyond to hail us a cab when none of the drivers wanted to pick us up during their shift change, and when we had an issue with the outlets not working, maintenance arrived within minutes to fix. NOTE: We also checked both our mattresses, which appeared clear of bedbugs. Phew!

Reviews.Title: “Panicked for nothing!”
Reviews.Author: LDG-Sheffield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire Hotel in New York, October half term - a 13th birthday treat for our grandson. I was very apprehensive before we travelled due to the numerous unfavourable reports but I had worried for nothing. We had a perfectly wonderful time. The superior double, double room, which was cleaned every day was plenty big enough as was the shower room, very comfortable beds which were changed each day as were the towels. We had a marvellous view from our 10th floor room and were never bothered by any noise at all. We did not spend much time in the hotel and therefore did not have much contact with the staff but the ones we did were very polite and helpful. My one 'gripe' was the seriously over-priced mini-bar/snack selection in the room - $75 for a bottle of white wine/$230 for a bottle of Jack Daniels/£7 a bag of nuts!! Needless to say we did not purchase anything on 'offer'. That said we would not hesitate to use this hotel again. soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “The most awful hotel I have stayed in NYC after travelling there for the last 8 years!!!”
Reviews.Author: AAAA186338
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Empire hotel in NYC and were shocked to wake to bites all over my body as well as my young Childs face. When we reported this to reception the manager asked me "what it could be" they decided to send 2 burly males to my room after I requested a female member of staff to come and witness the bites on our bodies to document it for a report but was made to feel intimidated & stupid for even suggesting that this could be bed bugs. They have the worst service & I constantly complained that the room was not being cleaned properly. The housekeeping staff seemed to come to the room and replace the towels & make the beds & then disappear. On 2 occasions the bins were not emptied and food trays were either left in the room or on the floor outside until we asked for them to be removed. This is not what you expect from a hotel in Manhattan. I would never stay there again as i found the staff apart from the concierge very unhelpful & housekeeping very lazy.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury...this is not”
Reviews.Author: bikeski
Reviews.Content: Let's begin with positives - location, location, location. Lincoln Center is literally across the street. We were going to the Met. Opera in the raging snow/rain storm and did not even get wet. Negatives:our superior king room for just under $500 (with taxes) per night was very small with tiny bathroom. The minimal furniture shows its age/use. It is adequate for two people, but luxury this is not. Now do not get me wrong: this is New York. Real luxury probably cost ten times that and if you need a place to stay while exploring the city, Empire is fine, just do not call it luxury. We have travelled the world quite a bit and stayed in different places. Empire hotel will not be on the top of my list of hotels. Bring ear plugs, pretty useful if you are a light sleeper like me. This is New York and emergency vehicles do sound loud sirens at night when in a hurry. And loading/unloading is quite noisy even for the 6th floor. Conclusion: for me this was disappointment since I expected something out of the ordinary for $500 per night. But as they say in the Orient: do not expect, you will never be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a trendy vibe!”
Reviews.Author: JulieRush
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Empire Hotel in June for our annual NY summer weekend. The hotel has a very modern feel with a busy lobby bar where we started and ended almost every evening. There is a roof top pool with great views of the city, and the concierge was very helpful with dining recommendations and theater tickets. The hotel is across the street from the NY Ballet and in walking distance to wonderful shopping and places to eat. We would stay here again. My only complaint is that the spigot on the bathroom sinks is wrong for the shallow sink, so everytime I washed my hands, I got water all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “The Empire is why everyone loves New York”
Reviews.Author: Krismac_11
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our one night "vacation" at the Empire. We live in Queens and with two kids, sneaking away for one night was all we could do. We had tickets to a show at the Beacon Theatre and decided to spend the night in the city. As soon as you walk into the hotel you know you are not in the W or one of the other chain hotels that are carbon copies of themselves in every city. The entire hotel is pure New York and has truly done a great job preserving the history of the property while updating it beautifully with every modern amenity. Our room was a junior suite and I don't know the actual dimensions but the unique shape gave us a view of Lincoln center on one side and a peak of central park on the other. It was truly beautiful, especially at night. Being a New Yorker from the outer boroughs I am never impressed with New York, but the location, attention to detail, excellent service and of course the snowstorm 2 days before Halloween made it such a romantic "trip" for my husband and I.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: LenoLegend
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our honeymoon before returning home. The hotel is ideally located in Manhattan near central park. We arrived to the hotel after a red eye flight at 6am. We hoped but were not expecting to be able to check in so early. But this hotel were able to accomodate us (with a small room upgrade charge) and got us a room which were delighted to get as we both were very tired at this stage. Getting checked in so early like this effectively gave us an extra night's stay. The room was even serviced for us that morning which I was not expecting. The hotel is clean and well maintained. It has been recently renovated I understand and is definately top quality. The room (upgraded) was spacious and we had no faults. You often hear of hotel rooms in NY where you can't swing a cat, so this room was a pleasure for us both. Tea / Coffee making facillities were in the room with free Wifi in the lobby area (charged in the room). All staff were friendly and helpful. The concierage helped with our airport transfer when leaving. The bar is trendy and modern and seemed busy every night with both guests and non guests. The prices however are in keeping with the style and a bit high. The automatic gratuity added to the bar bills didn't help the prices. All in all - a lovely stay and we will definately be keeping this hotel in mind for our future visits to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Chris the Concierge for King!”
Reviews.Author: magsprice
Reviews.Content: room typically small for NY but served it's purpose. Chris the Concierge is the bomb! He made our stay in NYC fabulous! He was more than helpful- he went that extra mile and always appeared pleased to do so. Every hotel should have a Chris! He is the the KIng of the Concierge!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Alleyns
Reviews.Content: Our visit to New York should have started in late August for three nights but as we were travelling from Boston on Amtrak we were delayed for two days by hurricane Irene. This meant we arrived at 6pm on our last day feeling very tired and jaded. Our booking at the Empire Hotel had been cancelled instead of reduced to 1 night by our UK agent, so this felt like the final straw. How wrong we were however, with a very supportive team on front desk , who simply said "dont worry we will make sure you have the rooms you need for tonight". This level of support continued the next day as we were unable to get information on our ongoing Amtrak service, and were offered a later checkout whilst the Concierge tried to get information. This level of customer service was really excellent, and made our stay a pleasure. Well done !!. (Sorry this review has not been done earlier). The public areas in the hotel are excellent, with a beautiful period style to the lounge area adjacent to the front desk, and a modern well decorated restaurant, where we enjoyed a very good breakfast. Our rooms were good with excellent en suite facilities, and although they were small were large enough for our needs. Previous reviews were correct in this respect, and for us the biggest drawback was definately the single glazing on the windows which allowed traffic noise to penitrate. We balanced this against the location of the hotel with the small Dante park in front which offers a glimpse of greenery, and keeps the main streets to each side, plus the fact that the Lincoln Centre for performing arts is alongside, and Central Park is just 1 block away. A short walk takes you down Broadway to Times Square and we felt fortunate to have been close enough to have got a glimpse of the New York we wanted to see. We feel this a good location for visitors. Would we return? Yes - a short stay (up to 3 days) would be on the cards for 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Richard A
Reviews.Content: . . . but the down-sides: 1. The horrific noise ("background music" at an unbearable volume) in the foyer/reception area. 2. We had to ask for new towels, as the room, despite having been cleaned, hadn't had the towels replaced. These took 30min to arrive (we were on the 2nd floor) - not particularly impressive when we were tired! The hotel itself was clean and tidy, and the staff were unfailingly helpful a courteous. A special mention to Romeo who helped on several occasions. We found the hotel ideally situated for many museums, the Lincoln Centre, and Ed's Chowder House just next door. Central Park, Columbus Circle and central Manhattan were a short walk. A good place to stay for our first visit to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful inside, fantastic service, good location”
Reviews.Author: mirandayork
Reviews.Content: Mostly good. The room was smaller than any we've had but beautifully decorated etc. Bathroom also small though it had a big shower! Everything modern and very clean. Apart from the size, the only downside was the noisy aircon outside the building. The second day we came back to our room to find that suddenly, winter heating was in place and our room was like a furnace! Asked if it could be changed and it was done while we went out to eat so no problem. Free wi-fi supposedly only available in public areas but I got on it in the room too. Service was excellent at all times - the concierge was so helpful, chatty and friendly and made us feel he really cared that we had a good stay in New York and at the hotel. We only ate breakfast at the hotel which was expensive (but it IS in NY and it is a big central hotel so not surprising). There wasn't a massive selection on the breakfast buffet but it was good and plenty of it. The lounge and reception areas are impressive and a great place for people watching - during the moments resting our feet after being out and about. This was our 1st visit to NY and I hope it won't be our last. We'd certainly come back to this hotel if it met our needs at the time. Just don't have anything from the minibar without checking the price. We didn't want anything but looked at the price of the wine. A bottle of white wine was $76! Such a shame we only had 2 nights here and would have loved a room with a view of course. I would have rated sleep quality higher if it hadn't been for the noisy aircon outside as the bed and pillows were great. Also would have rated the room higher if it had been a bit bigger.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to New York!”
Reviews.Author: d24smith
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel in March 2011. Having never been to New York, we were travelling with low expectations. I'm pleased to say that we were very satisfied with the Empire. Steps from the subway and walking distance to Times Square, it was perfect for our first trip to the city to take in all of the sights. I was also surprised to see that I had seen the lobby before in Sex and the City 2. What fun! The front desk staff were very nice and very helpful. We arrived in Manhattan about 6 hours before check-in and were surprised when we were told our room was ready and we could check-in. The room and bathroom were tiny, but well-decorated and well-laid out. I was impressed how well they used ever nook and cranny for a shelf, luggage stand, closet, etc. The linens were clean and comfortable. We also enjoyed the Starbucks right outside the front door. Our shower head was broken the first day we were there. The hotel staff was quick to replace it the next day. I was worried that the noise from the night club and hotel lounge would bother our sleep, but quite honestly I didn't hear a peep at night and our room was on the 3rd floor. With an excellent location, and excellent price--we have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Could Have Stayed Longer!”
Reviews.Author: katjams1
Reviews.Content: I was totally blown away by the beautiful interior of my room (three windows facing into two directions); the unique corner layout of my junior suite; and the fabulously cozy kingsize bed. There was also a sleeper sofa in the room so that easily four people could be in the room without claustrophobia setting in. All the electronics equipment (large size TV; iPod docking station; phone) were pretty new and super clean which cannot be taken for granted - especially not in New York City. Although it was closed for the winter, I checked out the site of the spectacular roof deck pool. The entire suite was immaculately clean and all of the staff I contacted for whatever reasons during my stay was exceptionally forthcoming and helpful. I honestly wish I could have stayed longer and have no hesitation to recommend the hip Empire Hotel to single travelers (important especially for us women!) and groups alike. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a chance!”
Reviews.Author: Judy_mansky
Reviews.Content: We were in the City form Oct 13-16, and most of our activities were at Lincoln Center. After reading the previous reviews, my fingers were crossed about The Empire. Our stay was great! The deluxe King room was beautiful and the Italian linens (including the top sheet!) were a treat. We had a view of Lincoln Center, which we loved. Check-in and check-out were effortless and the staff incredibly helpful and pleasant. We were on the 2nd floor and heard quite a bit of noise from the street, but it IS New York! The proximity to the subway was convenient, the concierge helpful with directions, and Ed's Chowder House amazing. Even a movie being shot in front of the hotel did not inconvenience us in any way. Thank you, Empire staff, for a delightful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in New York City”
Reviews.Author: toyshan
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small for the wife & I - but that is standard for the city. Outside of the city the rooms are much larger. The King size bed was comfortable and it was nice to have a safe. The closet for hanging your clothes were the size of a broom closet. You can hear the running water from next door. No free WiFi - there is a surcharge, but next door is Strabucks and. Luggage space is very limited. No coffee maker if you wanted to have a cup of tea, but again there is Starbucks. Not use to the half door glass shower stall and the other side is open to splash water onto the floor when u use too much water pressure. There was no lamp at the desk. The hotel is located 1 block away from Central Park - great for a walk and rental bikes are available at the beginning of the park at 59st. Columbus Circle on Broadway. The subway trains stations are nearby which is a plus. Time Square is within walking distance and so are the Broadway Shows. You pay more for this hotel, but it is better than commuting from New Jersey or areas outside of the city. Would definitely stay in New York City because of its ammenties. Took the Bus to Ground Zero so that we could get a view of the city areas. Then took subway trains to Flushing Meadows and it was easy to travel to SOHO, CHINATOWN, GREENWICH VILLAGE, ITALIAN TOWN - so much to see and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biggesthead
Reviews.Content: This is a good overall hotel. After reading some of the posts here, I must say it is neither as bad as some say it is nor as good as a 5-star. It is great in terms of location. It sits right across from Lincoln Center and 5 minutes away from Columbus Circle (subway stop). Few minutes walk to either Central Park or the Museum of Natural History. Furthermore, it got a Starbucks and Duane Reade (Drug Store + Convenient Store) - a big plus in my book. Once you step inside, it has a very chic lobby. I suspect they are aiming for the W-Hotel crowd here. The room is definitely on the small side, but on par with other hotel rooms in NYC and some European cities. The room was clean with decent amenities. As per some of the comments, I laughed when I observed the non-closing drawers. The drawers do pop out if one closes it too quickly. Just need to close slowly and they will stay shut. A non-issue but funny nevertheless. I didn't get a chance to visit the roof top bar however.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toralkeshwala
Reviews.Content: Driving up to this hotel is a treat. The location is just SO good, close to Trump Plaza, Central Park and we even managed to walk to 5thAvenue. Although we did get a cab back. The doorman allows you to enter a smallish lobby, very modern and impressive. The room iteself was on the small side, but then again it is new york. The room was a modern treat, decked out in neutral browns and creams. Egyptian cotton sheets and impossibly plump pillows. Quite pricy, but a lovely hotel for a special occassion.

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: happydaysscot
Reviews.Content: Great situation, very comfy beds, small room but as expected in NYC, very helpful concierge, plentiful towels and toiletries in the room, powerful shower in small bathroom, great hairdryer supplied, quiet room. Last stayed here after refurb when all was now and shiny - needing a bit of a freshen up now. Main areas are very attractive, cocktails are superb. No free Wi- fi but Starbucks under the hotel has

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, annoyingly loud housekeepers in the morning”
Reviews.Author: Stephishu
Reviews.Content: Given the location, the hotel price was reasonable compared to others. Walking distance to Central Park and Times Square as well as many restaurants, etc. The only frustrating part of my experience was the door banging housekeepers first thing in the morning. It was ridiculous. The banging and slamming of doors was a constant all morning long!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag, but overall ok”
Reviews.Author: SLO_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC for business, and stayed here for one night. I selected this hotel solely based on proximity to my business meeting, figuring I could manage just about anything for one night. First, the good. I was greeted upon check-in by Helena, who was very friendly and helpful. I was upgraded to a junior suite (I had a king room reserved; the jr suite adds a couch, chair, and coffee table), which I'm glad for, as I can't imagine what the size of a regular room would be given how small the junior suite was - but of course, small room size isn't a big surprise given the nature of the hotel. (The bathroom was also on the small size but very managable.) More plusses: the bed was very comfortable, and the shower had an overhead rain shower head with handheld attachment and great water pressure. Now the bad. Now, I'm a self-admitted hotel snob, but generally if a place is clean, upkept, and modern, I'm fine with it. My room - well, it was literally worn around the edges, which I found somewhat offputting. The dressers, night tables, a side table, and cabinetry in the bathroom were laminated particleboard (not a problem in and of itself) but the laminate was worn down around ALL the edges and made the furniture, etc. look pretty shabby. The caulking in the bathroom was in desperate need of replacement - no mold or the like (thank goodness) but just plain worn and ugly. One of the floor lamps was missing the knob to turn it on - it had just the small post the knob goes on, making it tricky to turn on. Also, there was no bathmat in my bathroom - I had to use a hand towel. Sure I could have called about the last two items, but I was there working and really did not wish to be disturbed. One final point - others have commented on the lack of a coffee maker in the room. This is indeed the case, but there is a Starbucks literally next door to the hotel, so no in-room coffee wasn't so bad. Overall, my experience was ok. I would stay there again if it was conveniently located to where I needed to be in NYC as it was this past trip. Otherwise, I don't think I'd go out of my way to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice double queen bedded room”
Reviews.Author: kelsbeth60
Reviews.Content: I was most surprised at the size of our rom. It was quite spacious especially by New York standards. My only real complaint was that there was not a coffeemaker in the room. Otherwise the bed was quite comfortable. The personal products were upscale and plentiful. Zackat the front desk could not have been more accommodating. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “"The way it should be"”
Reviews.Author: Loudenclr
Reviews.Content: Being fortunate enough to travel to the city for business about every seven weeks, I'm so glad that I've found The Empire Hotel. In a time when PERSONAL relationships with customer and businesses has gone away, it's just not the case at this hotel. Upon arrival I'm alway greeted with a warm smile and "Welcome Back". Zuli at the front desk ALWAYS recognizes me and shows her appreciation for my continued loyalty to the hotel and does her best to always ensure that my stay is as wonderful as possible! The location is perfection, clearly!!! Room service menu is always delicious and the staff very friendly and courteous. I'm looking forward to my next visit already DM Louden

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed - great location BUT.............”
Reviews.Author: lizzycat
Reviews.Content: I checked in Friday 9/30/2011 and was pleasantly surprised that the room was ready. When I went to take a shower at 4, no toiletries or towels and a leaking shower. Called the front desk, explained the problem, was transferred to housekeeping with a promise that engineering would be notified. Housekeeping arrived in 15 minutes. I left the room and returned at 11:00pm to a leaking shower that annoyed me all night long. When I left on Saturday around 1:00pm - still leaking. And when I returned at 5 it had been fixed BUT my window was open!!! Why? Well apparently engineering or housekeeping needed to smoke as their was a match and a cigarette on the sill outside my window(see photos). Appalling!!! No I didn't write the Empire as they totally ignored the email I sent prior to arriving. Customer service is not a priority in this hotel. Very very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “No very well run -”
Reviews.Author: jbwheat4
Reviews.Content: We were staying on business and needed a room with 2 beds, for 3 people. Reservations was very helpful and told us a few rooms had 2 queen beds, but most had two doubles. Later, in requesting a room from the front desk we found out the double bed rooms had a much better view, so we requested that. Upon arrival, we were checked into one, which was dirty. We said we would wait for it to be cleaned, but were put in another room - on the 11th floor. This had 2 doubles, but faced the interior space - an awful view. Not wanting to make a 3rd trip to the desk, we kept the room. The room ended up being REALLY LOUD - right next to the elevator. I now believe it is probably the last room they sell, as it really is almost unbearable. Also, the elevators did not work very well. They were never all operating, and often stopped on random floors. We requested a late check-out. We were told we could have 12:30pm - a half hour later than normal check-out time. Shortly after noon, we returned to the room and our key card would not work. Not wanting to take the long trip to the front desk, I called the front desk from my cell phone for help. I was told the bellmen were busy, and would have to go to the desk. On our way down, we shared the elevator with another guest who was experiencing the same situation. The desk had no record of our late check-out, and as with our other interactions, could not have cared less. As for the rooms, they did not have enough lights, but were nicely decorated and clean. The tiny bathroom had a shower stall with a partial glass wall, but the door was missing, so water got all over the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Empire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neena M
Reviews.Content: The Empire Hotel in NYC was amazing! I had a short visit to NYC and the comforts of this hotel were perfect. Romeo was especially helpful (front desk) and very friendly! I will be back again in the near future and this hotel will definitely be my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Empire Hotel 9-23-11”
Reviews.Author: Chrisbiggar
Reviews.Content: we had not stayed at this hotel before and read the reviews prior to booking. We found the front desk very helpful and we were informed that the hotel had given us a free upgrade-not sure what that meant but we did have a nice view out of our window of the met and upper Broadway. The bed was great with a down mattress cover, down comforter and down and non feather pillows. It was small but well appointed with many outlets etc. Comfortable for a weekend get away! The bathroom was tiny and a half door on the shower caused a minor flood on the floor until we figured out the hand held shower system (also a shower head in the ceiling) lovely water pressure room enough for 1 person at a time in the bathroom only. No fan so the room got very warm and steamy-uncomfortably so as it was a muggy weekend. The room was very clean and although there was no temperature control in the room we found it comfortable. The window actually opened! The lobby was a sea of chaos no matter what time of day or night, seemed like a large amount of teenagers-perhaps as the location is right next to Lincoln center and the Met. Did not have drinks at that bar as it was very noisy. The only disappointment with our stay was that the roof top was closed for the season however a private party was being held on the roof on Friday night and we could not go up to see the city at night-nor could we go up the next day. Central park is around the corner and an easy walk to Times Square make this a convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay great, mystery credit card charge, not so great!”
Reviews.Author: Juliebruijn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in April. A copple of months later I was going through my credit card statements and discovered the hotel had charged my credit card 120 dollar. I had no idea what it was for so I emailed the hotel. I got a quick response from Ryan and he informed me it was probably for the valet parking or a charger. I told him I didn't use valet parking nor a charger. Now, two weeks later I still haven't heard from him what the 120 dollar was for. As much as I enjoyed my stay there, I don't appreciate it when they charge my credit card with stuff I didn't use. So I'll think twice before booking a room at the Empire again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: MRMC513
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to NYC for Fashion Week, and stayed at the Empire Hotel. Full disclosure: we were part of an event with all expenses paid, so we did not choose the hotel or pay the bill. Overall we were delighted with the Empire Hotel: fantastic location; beautiful lobby and lounge; stylish rooms. The beds were excellent, the duvets freshly steamed each day, luxury l'Occitane amenities. Food served at the bar and at our events was creative and delicious. Staff was friendly and very helpful. We were very happy with our room, although it wasn't perfect: bulb out on one lamp, and the dresser drawer kept sliding open (we wedged a folded paper in it to keep closed.) Our room had 2 queen beds so it was tight, but I imagine a king room felt more spacious. Regarding other reviewers' comments: yes, the rooms were small, and the bathroom is very small: with an old hotel you get advantages (tall ceilings, thick walls, character) and disadvantages (small rooms and bathrooms). Yes, the shower door is a partial glass panel, but it's not missing a door -- that's the contemporary open style. We angled the shower head and no problem. Regarding checking in early, I think it is unreasonable to be upset that a room is not ready if you arrive early. We arrived early with the hotel at full occupancy, and the bell hop stored our luggage until midafternoon when the room was ready. Regarding no ice machines, expensive room service, high prices --- welcome to NYC! If you want ice machines, go find a chain motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st Visit to New York!”
Reviews.Author: AliJ1971
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about our stay having read previous reviews but overall felt the hotel was good though only used it as a base really. Positives - location is great very close to Central Park but still within walking distance to Times Square, bed comfy, and staff were helpful. Negatives - drinks in the bar expensive which was a shame as chose this hotel because of it's roof top bar, missed having tea/coffee making facilities and would rather have had that and no mini bar and air conditioning was noisy but didn't stop us from sleeping. We had a fantastic holiday in New York and would definitely visit the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: trvlgal333
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I went to NY to celebrate her 30th birthday. We chose to stay at the Empire Hotel because we thought it looked really cute online. It was an added bonus that after we booked the hotel, we heard that the Kardashians stayed there, too! We booked a standard room with 1 king sized bed because it was almost half the price as a room with 2 queen beds. We arrived before check-in so we asked if it would be possible to check in early. The woman at the front desk said we could check in early if we upgraded our room, which we weren't interested in doing at that time. She said she would call us if our room was available early. We left to walk around and eat lunch, but after a few hours, no one ever called. We came back to the hotel to ask if our room was available - it was (even though no one ever called to notify us). We went up to our room which was TINY... there was no dresser or space to store clothes, and the bathroom resembled something you'd find in a camper or airplane. For this reason, we decided to ask about upgrading to a suite. We called the front desk and the woman said we could upgrade to a suite, but we couldn't see the suite first. This made no sense so we walked down to the front desk. After explaining that this made no sense, we were told that we could in fact look at a suite before deciding whether or not we wanted to upgrade. The upgraded suite was still only equal in size to some of the other rooms we've stayed in in NY, but we decided to pay the fee to upgrade anyway because the standard room seemed unbearable. It takes a lot for us to complain or even submit a review, but ultimately the service is what has caused us to do so. Other complaints: - The hotel doesn't have an ice machine so you have to call Room Service for ice. Be prepared to wait an hour or more, even if you call more than once. - The suite didn't have a dresser or space for clothes, either, so I lived out of my suitcase the entire time. - There was no iron or ironing board but they were available upon request. It wasn't uncommon to see irons and ironing boards just sitting out in the hallway. - Our dirty drinking glasses sat for DAYS on the floor outside of the door to our room. - It's impossible to shower without getting water all over the bathroom floor. - The lamp turned on and off by itself; we couldn't even get it to stay on. - We never even ended up using the rooftop pool or hanging out up there because it really wasn't impressive at all. On our last day, our flight was cancelled so we needed to book another night at a hotel. We ended up staying at the Tribeca Grand and were instantly impressed by how much better the service and the quality of the hotel were.

Reviews.Title: “First time in New York, dissapointing stay.”
Reviews.Author: rygry86
Reviews.Content: Wasnt that impressed with the room.. Pros: -Beautiful Lounge -Great Staff -Decent location Cons: -Very small rooms -Our glass sliding door shower didn't have the door on it. -Thin walls. Heard some interesting noises. Bottom line, don't stay here unless you have to. Just visit the lounge area but bring plenty of money. Super expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad everything else”
Reviews.Author: profmom57
Reviews.Content: Got this on Priceline, but it wasn't "cheap" even for Priceline. The people working the front desk are very rude and condescending. When we checked in we asked for two double beds and were told we had to pay $50 extra per night to have that. Since we have to have 2 beds, we reluctantly agreed. By this time we were almost at full price of the room anyway. The room smelled like smoke even though it was on a non smoking floor. When we called they said they were fully booked and couldn't move us. The room is about 10 by 12, the bathroom is about 6 by 6. Decor is horrible and cheap. Beds are lumpy. The top drawer of the dresser doesn't stay closed, it mysteriously opens at will and blocks the way to the bathroom. The "closet" has room for about three shirts. Also, there is only room service until 10:30 pm. Who ever heard of that in NYC at a supposed four star hotel? Coffee and juice from room service were tasteless. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is that it is right across the street from Lincoln Center. Otherwise I would urge you to avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Sisters Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ribs97
Reviews.Content: Want Chic? Yes. The staff was AMAZING, they were attentive and helped us out with directions to the train and such. Looking for Rooftop pool and bar? Yes, the pool is super small and not really useful, but a great place to hang out and grab a drink with the girls. Workout facility? Yes. Don't expect much, but it is nice that they have one. No worries you are 2 blocks from Central Park! Easy access to the Subway? Yes. It was a treat for this Chicago girl to be able to use and find fun ways to travel around the city in the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: MVBjr
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay somewhere close to the Lincoln Center or Time Warner Building then this is a prime location. The front desk staff especially Michelene were wonderful and very helpful. Bathroom was not great but shower pressure was strong! Great lobby but expensive drinks! As a runner I enjoyed being a block off the park. I've come to this hotel 3 times now and will continue to use it as a back up given the friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Cybdiver1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was revovated and the rooms are still painfully small. BUT! loud but here, if you want a place that is almost walking distance from everything stay here. Across the street from Lincolin Center, Across the street from Central Park, surounded by great places to eat. This was a great place to say. My wife and I stayed for a week to hang in Manhattan. We were there to sleep and shower. It's a safe hotel in a nice area. Many of the rooms have no view but in most of NY your just looking at another building. After the renovation the prices jumped up quite a bit, okay alot. I would stay here again just because of the great location. Being a native New York, I knew where all the good sites are. We did all the museums, broadway the empire state building. It was my wifes first trip to NY. I think I blew her mind. But staying in Manhattan was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here Twice: Great Location and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: jetsfan001
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Lincoln Center or the vicinity, then this is the place for you! The Empire is located right across the street. There are also good restaurants all around and it's a great location in general. I stayed at the Empire Hotel twice in two months - once for business in June 2011 and the second time on vacation in August 2011. I was very satisfied with the hotel and the staff both times and would highly recommend it. Everything is very clean and the beds are so comfortable. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They provide L'occitane toiletries - shampoo, hand cream, etc. - which is a big plus...love it! The only minus was that the room - the second time - was really small. The other thing is that - both times - the price was pretty high (even for NYC). But, in fairness, the first time I booked it a few days out and, the second time, I booked it that same morning when the original hotel I had booked for two nights was terrible and I was not going to stay at that one for a second night. So I called The Empire early that morning and moved over there a few hours later - and was not disapointed. Bottom line is that if you can get a good price for this hotel - grab it! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, dark room and awful view compensated by location and good bed”
Reviews.Author: eurosweetie
Reviews.Content: The location of the Empire Hotel is fantastic - right by Lincoln Center, easy to get everywhere, and as we have friends on the UWS, even better, so that was one of the main reasons we selected it. Another reason we chose the hotel was because it had a rooftop pool, and as my husband was going to be in meetings for the three days we were there, at the end of May, I figured I'd be using it a lot. Sadly not. Even though it should have been opened by the end of May, the bad spring weather had delayed the pool opening. It opened the day we left. That was a big disappointment. The room we got was small (common in NY), dark, and with the worst view ever - we were in the 'well' directly overlooking and just above all the AC units and piping. The noise level from the ventilation equipment is so loud that you would never open the window even if you wanted to. However, we were at the end of a long hallway, and we never heard a peep from anyone. As a result of that, the darkness of the room, and the 'white noise' from the hotel's equipment, we overslept every morning! The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was big, although rather outdated. The decor was fine. The TV worked. We paid less than $200 a night through one of the online deals that popped up, and for this location it was fine. I am sure if you were paying rack rate you would get a lovely light room overlooking LIncoln Center. Another bonus to this hotel was going across the road to eat at Cafe Boulud for breakfast. One last comment about the hotel - my husband and I used to live in NY so we know about some of the long term residents that still exist in these old buildings. If you're walking down a hallway in this hotel and you see a little old lady sitting in her unfashionable room staring out at you, it's because she still lives in the hotel and has probably lived in it all her life - long before it became a hotel. She probably doesn't have AC, so leaving the door open means she gets to cool off from the AC in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: naphhof
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire for one night on a business trip. I was determined to squeeze in a night at the opera during this trip, and the Empire was the best located hotel for that purpose. I booked the cheapest room available, about $170. Generally that kind of money gets you a flea bag in Midtown. My room was certainly small, but very comfortable. Luxury amenities, wonderful towels and a robe, and a great bed were all there. I don't know if there was a view, I didn't look. the staff was very nice, and check in was not a problem. The only thing I could complain about is that when I inquired about printing my boarding pass in the morning at the front desk told me there would be a charge. When I did print out the boarding pass there was no charge. The lobby has free WiFi, but there is a charge in the rooms. Very curious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: gingerhdh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a trip from Vegas before flying back to England. We arrived about 11pm - there were bouncers on the door for the rooftop bar but didn't feel threatened or anything. Check in was problem free. I had booked a budget room - it had a double bed without a great deal of space around it but was adequate for our needs and nicely decorated. There was no view - just the back of other buildings, but again I knew this when booking. The air con was noisy - it didn't bother us too much but others may find it annoying - people we spoke to in the hotel asked to be moved. The bathroom was also pretty small. The hotel lobby is dimly lit with almost club music playing. It is also where the bar is based. We liked it although it may not be for everyone. Unfortunately hurricane Irene hit when we were there. Our flight was cancelled and we needed an extra 5 nights. We initially moved to a bigger room for an upgrade fee as we were going stir crazy! The superior king is lovely - much bigger bed, lots of space and a bigger bathroom. There was also a view of the Lincoln centre - a much better experience. One thing we were not happy with is that it would cost an extra $100 per night for our original room to stay in the hotel. We couldn't afford it so had to change hotels. Talking to other couples who had also been stranded, it seems that the hotel charged everyone different rates varying from $170 a night to the $300 we were quoted. Some had been upgraded. It was just disappointing to note the inconsistency especially in the circumstances. Overall the hotel was nice, quite trendy, and in a good location. Central park is a couple of mins away and times square is about 15 min walk. There are endless choices for places to eat no matter what direction you head in.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend to anyone - stay clear!”
Reviews.Author: bostongal19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Hotel last week for one night during a quick trip to NYC to go bridal gown shopping. Since I was hitting the big boutiques and department stores along Madison and Fifth Avenues, it was important for me to be relatively close to that area. I booked the Empire Hotel because it was available last minute (literally, booked the room the day before I arrived) and under $300/night. Now I understand why it was still available the day before. There were many issues with my stay at the Empire. I had relatively high expectations given the hotel's popularity with the media, but also because my close friend had chosen the Empire as the hotel of choice for her NYC wedding a few years ago. The room I was given was about the size of a cinder block, and had absolutely no view at all. The window looked straight into another room on the opposite end of the hallway, which was awkward. Needless to say, the drapes remained closed the entire time. The bathroom is TINY - no bathtub, just a shower stall, which oddly enough, has no door. L'Occitane toiletries were a nice touch, but I would have appreciated more if the bathroom had been clean. I found a few hairs on the sink upon arrival. Gross. My fiancé was on a work trip to Chicago at the same time I was in NYC. He tried to call me in my hotel room five times, and four of those times, the front desk of the hotel did not pick up the phone. The other time, they directed him to the wrong room. (Unfortunately, a friend misplaced my iPhone charger, so my cell was turned off to conserve battery.). Incompetence, anyone? Lastly, I requested a morning wake up call that went ignored. I received no such call at any point during the morning, and I was frustrated by the hotel staff's negligence of its guests. I would never recommend the Empire to a friend (or anyone, really). I will go out of my way to make sure my friends do not stay here - EVER. This was my worst hotel stay in recent memory.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service. Very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: Everyone in the hotel was so helpful especially the front desk, especially Zuli and Miriam, and the bell men . Kind and curtious. We were traveling with 2 handicap children which is a challenge in New York and everyone from the hotel made it easier for us to get around. The bellmen had the appropriate cabs waiting for us. Zuli and Miriam made sure at the front desk that they got us into accessible rooms. The concierge helped us with dinner reservations and show tickets. We travel a lot and have not been this fortunate to have such great and attentive service. Thank you Empire!

Reviews.Title: “our new york home away from home”
Reviews.Author: j c
Reviews.Content: Left new york 8 years ago when we had kids but return with kids (now 7, 5) once a year to see sports, friends and go to museums. Empire is in excellent location due to proximity to subway hub at columbus circle/59th street, being on family friendly upper west side, near central park. etc. Starbucks in first floor of building. Very nice hotel but not stuffy- they make everyone feel comfortable. Room was upgraded for no apparent reason other than that we had stayed there before. Special kicker in this hotel is rooftop pool (outside) with bar and lounge chairs-great view. The pool is really small but the kids love to splash around after we have tortured them doing grownup things all day. Manager? named Romeo very helpful as was all the staff. There is a "club" on one of the top floors which can be a bit noisy if your room is near it but separate elevator and overall barely noticeable inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ive ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: nathan p
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there the welcome was so brilliant. when we went up to our room it was so spacious and the bed was so comfortable. The facilites were so great. would definetely recommened it.

Reviews.Title: “1st rate”
Reviews.Author: Taylorzz
Reviews.Content: We only needed to stay for one night for a friend's rooftop party...when we arrived we were told the hotel was at 100% capacity and we were being moved up to a Junior Suite! I have never seen a NYC hotel room with so much space! Dinner across the street at the Atlantic Grill was wonderful and the late night drinks on the Empire's Rooftop bar provided a spectacular view... Would definatelt recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel flatters to decieve”
Reviews.Author: niallm6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the empire hotel on the 29th and 30 th of August for the final two nights of our honeymoon.Having stayed in New York many times before we were well aware that hotel rooms are tight but the rooms in the Empire are like a coffin with you Tripping over each other if you dare move with getting ready to go out requiring military planning,in sufficient air conditioning in the room leaving you waking from your sleep with sweat dripping off you and gasping for air.IF you think the room is small then wait till you experience the bathroom it resembles a cubicle in a pub.OUr room 1010 was located beside the elevator and the constant singing of the elevator would drive you mad, room service knocking on doors from 8.00am this hotel was a totally disappointing experience and flatters to deceive .

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! 3rd visit...1st choice!”
Reviews.Author: luvcamping1234
Reviews.Content: I love the Empire Hotel. I've stayed here 3 times so far and it will always be my first choice. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. I planned an overnight trip with my daughter because we had been without power for 5 days due to the hurricane. When I mentioned this to the receptionist, she upgraded our room from a standard to a King superior! The rooms are beautiful. Some reviews state they are small, but, hello...you are in NYC. There's a reason why real estate is built up and not out. My daughter enjoyed the rooftop pool, although it looks much bigger in the website pictures, she didn't care. She would have been happy with a plastic pool filled with water. I enjoyed hanging out by the pool sipping a martini. The pool bartender was wonderful. Food is pretty good too. The hotel is quiet overnight. We got a great night sleep. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “It was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Boymomsrock
Reviews.Content: Trip highlighted with US Open! Hurricane Irene delayed our plans, but our hotel kept us safe,comfy, informed and helpful in every way! Staff was very sweet and delightful! Especially Vana and Elvin! Didn't make it to the famous rooftop we'll catch it on our next visit! Great location and hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but sadly disappointed I'm afraid.”
Reviews.Author: NickKeo
Reviews.Content: Visited NY for 2 nights in August. Reception staff were helpful as was the Concierge who deserves special mention for his advice, assistance and provision of free maps! The hotel is impressive but once you leave the luxurious reception, the rooms leave something to be desired. I booked two Superior Double rooms but although furnished to a high standard, are small and cramped. Other reviewers have commented on the bathroom and shower; I also found it impossible to shower without flooding the floor. I thought the shower door was missing, but no, it just has a gap. A terrible design flaw in any bathroom. If it was designed as a wet-room then fine but it clearly was not. Never mind, a cup of tea or coffee always helps. Not in this hotel I'm sorry. Of all the hotels I have ever stayed in, never have I found there to be no complimentary tea and coffee making facilities being made available. Reception helpfully suggested that we used room service for a wake-up cup of tea. I don't think so at those prices plus tray charges. To the pool, I say pool but some imaginitive photography resulted in the rooftop pool depicted on the website being found to be little more than a small, lane-width trench of water that was freezing! The Cabanas on the roof top terrace are little more than a gazebo with a refrigerator. Not very impressive at all I'm afraid. The approach to the "pool" really defined the nature of the luxurious hotel to be sadly deficent on the small touches. On leaving the lift/elevator, you hunt for an innocent door that leads onto a basic concrete staircase that goes up and up, past a tastefully insulated length of pipework onto the roof terrace. The trendy rooftop bar apparently much-loved by the locals, is accessed via a separate lift. I didn't venture to that level but I did wonder if the clientele also had to climb up a similar flight of stairs. Yes, there are queues outside the hotel from patrons wishing to enter the rooftop lounge but I didn't find these to be a problem gaining access to the hotel. I'm sorry to sound so negative, but this hotel should really try to do better for it's guests. Things like the poorly designed shower, cramped rooms and no tea/coffee making facilities let it down badly. I'd rather dispense with the trendy facade for some small touches that help. I enjoyed New York but next time will seek a less pretentious hotel that focuses on guests actual needs rather than pure image. Sorry but it's a No from the judging panel based on this performance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlKelley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Empire Hotel for a girls' trip to the US Open. We had a surprise visit from Hurricane Irene which only caused about 24 hours of down time hanging out in our room. The regular rooms are very small. We upgraded to a Jr. Suite which was very nice except for the tiny bathroom. Great location close to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location & fabulous people.”
Reviews.Author: Queenniki
Reviews.Content: New York is a GREAT city and the Empire Hotel made my stay everything that I hoped it would be. New York is fabulous and so are all the staff at the Empire Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Angie C
Reviews.Content: A friend & i stayed for 6 nights, the decore is not the best but we loved it the Service was excellent & the rooftop bar is a happening place... Everyone was so helpful and nothing was a problem, thank you to all the staff you made our stay in New York Great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions”
Reviews.Author: pitteke d
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Empire from sunday 21st until friday 27th. Normally until saturday 28th, but we got a earlier flight because of the coming hurricane. General feeling about the hotel: nice hotel, nice rooms, very friendly and helpfull staff. The bathroom is indeed small, but was ok with us. The shower gave us some problems: we had to phone maintaince to get water out of it. Seemes that we had to put the handles on the right place to have a decent shower...A manual for the shower is maybe a good idea? The noise in the room ( 705 ) at night from the AC ventilators in the building next door was very loud at night, we had to sleep with earplugs! The AC in the room was also very noisy, so we didn't use it. The Roof-poolbar was very pleasant to sit, and enyoing the sun. But 33 dollars for 2 glasses of white wine in plastic glasses is way over the top.... Our conclusion: good hotel but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster from check in to check out!”
Reviews.Author: david b
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the SUITES (room 736) at Empire Hotel on August 19th & 20th for my wedding weekend. The room was visually gorgeous, but that is the only positive thing to say about the Empire Hotel. SERVICE: On Friday August 19th I asked the front desk for an iron and ironing board, it took them over an hour to deliver it to my room making us extremely late to our engagement dinner. On Saturday August 20th we asked for fresh towels, once again it took house keeping over an hour to deliver to our room making us late to our wedding brunch. When arriving at the hotel in the evening we were questioned by bouncers/doormen from the club that shares an entrance "what guest list you are on". After we explained we are guests at the hotel the door women offered no appology and simply said "ok you can go in". ROOM: Despite the room being visually gorgeous (trendy) it was extremely unpractical. 1. The faucet to the sink is so close to the washing basin that when you wash your hands under the faucet your hands touch the sink basin spraying water every where. 2. The shower comes along with a hose however the hose does not lock in so it does not function as a shower. Additionally there is NO shower door so after each shower there is a flood on the bathroom floor. 3. There is a charge for internet in the room. Checkout: Upon check out (Sunday August 21) I was informed there was a $93 charge made to the room from the lobby bar on Aug 20th. I explained to the gentleman at check out I never charged anything to the room and that that was the day of my wedding and I was not even in the hotel. I was told this would be looked into, however today Saturday August 26th the Empire Hotel charged my credit card $93.00.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....... rude staff....”
Reviews.Author: flababes25
Reviews.Content: Great location but really dated small rooms. I've never seen a bathroom sink that small even on cruise ships. The furniture was scratched.. The shower had only a half door and water sprayed all over the bathroom. The closet had a curtain, no door. The first 5 channels of the tv were fuzzy. Yes, I asked about it. Was told I am sorry that is a problem. It was also in my friends room on another floor so I know it's a problem thank you. I found the front desk to be rather rude. They didn't really show any desire to assist. Noisy rooms... The wireless internet was soooo slow. The "TRENDY" club was not trendy.. Sorry The lobby was cool. That is about all I can say. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel, Great Staff, Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Checked in late in the night as my flight was canceled at Newark. Staff was great and accommodating, I was quite impressed. I was put into a room on the first floor. Room was nicely appointed. The hand spray on the shower did not work, but that wasn't a big deal. I attempted to open the curtains but noticed I had a view of the alley/AC unit for the building. The noise of the AC unit outside the window was quite loud and a bit annoying. Location was great, staff was excellent, specifically Romeo at the front desk. I would absolutely stay here again, just get a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room was adequate”
Reviews.Author: izzyd121
Reviews.Content: I bid on Priceline for a hotel in NY, and was given the Empire. I was very hesitant with my stay here because the reviews are so mixed. I was traveling with my elder parents, and worried about the noise issue. I asked for a roll-away bed, but it is not available at this hotel. Therefore, I ended up paying an extra $50 for an upgrade to a room with 2 beds, since bidding on Priceline only gives you a standard room with just 1 bed. Like a previous reviewer mentioned, no free upgrades here! We arrived late on Friday evening, so there was a line of young adults apparently there to go to some nightclub. The lobby was playing loud music, but I asked for a quiet room, and they gave us one on the 3rd floor that faced Broadway. While the view wasn’t great, it was definitely quiet. Unless a group of rowdy people passed through the hallway, we were undisturbed from the noise level. We could hear the sound of the garbage trucks and traffic, but it wasn’t anything that was unmanageable. I am grateful I paid for the upgrade, because as small as the room is with 2 beds, I can’t imagine fitting 3 people in their standard sized rooms. Still, our room was adequate and not as bad as I expected. The bathroom is only big enough for 1 person and very tight. The shower has one of those removable, hand-held shower heads, which makes it very difficult not to splash water on the floor (with the lack of a shower door). However, on my second day, I discovered that there was a shower head on the ceiling, which greatly helps with the splashing problem. There is a lever underneath the shower knob which switches it from the handheld shower head to the ceiling showerhead. If you fail to look up, you might miss it. Knowing about that little lever was very useful. The room had a safe in the closet, and a small fridge. The bed was comfortable. The room overall was adequate. My stay was better than I thought, but this is only because I had such low expectations. I've stayed at better hotels, but I guess it is true that you can't ask for too much in New York while on a budget. My parents liked it though. It gave us what we needed, which was just a place to sleep in a safe, decent area. Don't expect a luxurious, resort-style stay at the Empire. The best convenience is that it is so close to the subway. The station is right across the street. It goes straight into Times Square, and straight down to Battery Park (for the Statue of Liberty ferry) without having to change trains. The line also stops at Grand Central station and Penn Station, so it makes public transit a little easier if you’re not familiar with the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jaeger5
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to New York and We had a great experience at the Empire Hotel. Since it was our 1st time to New York they gave us a free upgrade with a king size bed and a room with a nice view. The room was beautiful, the roof top pool and bar area was really cool. The water pressure in the shower was amazing and I loved the soap!! The water did get all over the floor. The shower really could use a glass door but not really a big issue. The staff was very freindly and wonderful, bed very comfortable and very quiet relaxing place to stay. We would come here again and recomend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Is fine”
Reviews.Author: Ben M
Reviews.Content: If you read some of the reviews on the web, you'll suspect that the place is a dump, with cascades of insects chasing you the half block and across the street, to the steps of Lincoln Center. Not so. Is clean, is comfortable, is convenient. Of course the basic rooms are small. Rooms are often small in NYC. Are you in town to watch TV? My wife and I were assigned a small room after bidding $200 on PriceLine. Our guest couple received a larger room for the same price. We were offered an upgrade for $80 a night ($100 for a suite) and refused the offer. And enjoyed the quiet. The hotel could be upgraded, and the owners could be less petty. The showers have a half door, so that you tend to spill water out on the floor. Yes, the shower mechanism is a bit odd, but the water is hot, so the only real problem is solved by placing a towel on the floor. The hotel charges for local phone calls and faxes, and unless you are there on business, you'll likely refuse the fee for wifi in favor of the crowded but efficient Starbucks on Broadway. (If you drink coffee, you'll want that Starbucks, as the hotel doesn't have coffee in the room; and I suppose--though am not sure--that the in-house restaurant charges more.) Another annoyance: the hotel doesn't provide free Internet access in the lobby. However, the folks we spoke to were polite and responsive. If you have a car, drop off your passengers at the door, turn right, turn right, and go to the Icon parking lot on 64th street, on the right, after Broadway: at this writing, $40/day including tax, compared to $60/day + tip for the hotel valet. Then, to get the car, stroll down 63rd street for a block and enter the lot from there. The upstairs bar was disco-like and (to us) useless, but you can walk to the theatre district in 25 minutes or less, and there are other choices up and down the west side. The bottom line is this: if you were sent to the Empire Hotel by one of the room vendors such as PriceLine, you've done well, especially if you can avoid the extra charges. And maybe you've done well even if you are paying full price.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location,rooms good shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: sarah c
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for all of the main sites,and is on the doorstep of Central Park. I was a bit nervous about the hotel after reading some of the reviews but i feel the reviews did not do this hotel justice.We had a back room with no view,and i asked for a room with a view as it was our Anniversary,wether or not they had one we didnt get it!I pressume this was because we had a cheap package deal? The room was fine and well cleaned,ideal for what we needed and made a great base. We had a problem with the bathroom door as it locked us out but maintenence soon sorted it.The room service was great and the room was cleaned every day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone,there are some great restaurants around for all pallets and budgets. The only negatives for me was not having a room with a view for our Anniversary and as one of the other reviews mentioned,we also have had problems with the security deposit taken and not yet refunded.They asked for a credit card as securitiy,but neglected to mention this would be $500.It was only at the end of our holiday we noticed it missing, unable to buy the extra gifts we were hoping to bring back! And over a week later and several emails advising i am accumalating charges i still have not received my refund! I dont want to let this spoil my trip but as i have said the service leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: brit_kell
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived home today after a five night stay at The Empire Hotel. I must admit after reading prior reviews I was PLEASANTLY surprised. The Hotel's location is perfect, walking distance to Times Square, but far enough away to feel peaceful. Very close to Central Park and the relaxed tree lined streets in the upper west. All public areas of the hotel were amazing, the Lobby, Bar and Pool Deck were exceptional. Our room was small, but we fitted ourselves (couple) and four suitcases (yes we shopped) comfortably. The bathroom was also small, however the shower spacious and at all times it was well stocked with lovely ammenities. The decor was great. No complaints with regard to the room at all. All Empire staff we came into contact with were extremely friendly and helpful. This was my first trip to NYC, we saw a lot of the city in our stay and it is now my favourite. There is also no question that I would return to the Empire for my next stay. I work in the travel industry in Australia and will be recommending this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & trendy rooms”
Reviews.Author: AleksandarNiko
Reviews.Content: Very kindly and friendly personnel at the reception-- Ms. Zuli

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service; satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A_Experiencer_CA
Reviews.Content: A solid four star establishment. Yes, the rooms could be small, but you have the option to get an upgrade and go for the deluxe room with a nice sitting area and a view. We were pleased with the service we received from all of the staff we came in contact with during our week long stay here. Ed's Chowder House provides a good variety of food to satisfy my family's taste buds, for dinner, breakfast, and poolside snacks. The raw oysters were sublime! As most previous reviewers stated, the location of this hotel is its primary asset. It took us less than five minutes from leaving our hotel room to being seated at a concert at the Lincoln Centre. On a critical note, I think the PLUNGE pool must be stated in all advertisements. Many of us chose this hotel because of the roof top pool, but most are disappointed with the size of the pool and the fact that it is not heated. Also be aware, the pool is closed when there is rain in the forecast, even though it is under a sheltered area. Overall, we are satisfied and will most likely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with some special needs”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 3 night stay, Sun August 14-Wednesday August 17. I found the hotel to be very beautiful on the inside. Service was outstanding from the time I checked in till I left. Room service food was outstanding. Front door staff were cordial and knowledgeable about the area. My suite was nicely decorated and comfortable. The bathrooms, while small, are adequate. The room was clean and the maid was friendly as well. I enjoyed the rooftop bar on Tuesday evening, although it was very crowded due to 2 private parties. The only had one waitress waiting on all non-private party staff. She was stressed. I had a $150 bill for my group. I asked for my check but it never came. She was overwhelmed and needed help. I had to leave and went up to her station where she was entering in orders and just lightly touched her shoulder. Without looking I was told to "back the f... up". I said I just needed my bill and she apologized profusely but probably should not address her peers in that way. Don't remember her name, but she had dark short hair and a 3 word tattoo on her right shoulder. The only other downfall of this property which is important to many travelers is the lack of decent fitness center. I was embarrassed when I took a client down to work out. The equipment looked like something from the 80's and the center was just in an empty sleeping room. It was not well signed to know where to enter. The hotel needs to invest in some updated ellipticals, etc. I had to leave the hotel and take the client to another gym a block behind the hotel to work out. There is a $15 charge to do that. Maybe the hotel could pick that up or work a deal until they update. I heard multiple comments about the fitness center while I was there. Overall, it is a customer service friendly hotel with a nice location, attentive staff, good food and clean rooms. Only downside for me was the server and the poor fitness center. I will be back in a couple of weeks and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: zoesmom2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Empire and I don't understand the bad reviews. First of all, the room was sufficient in size for a New York hotel. We've stayed in over 5 different hotels in NYC over the last few years. We had a room with two double beds and there was plenty of room to walk around in. The bathroom is small, but is typical for a NYC hotel room. The half glass wall is a trend we continue seeing in newly remodeled or built hotels. Once you figure out the shower and turn off the handheld shower head you avoid flooding the room. (hint: there is a black lever above the shower rod that, when flipped, turns off the handheld). The only negative about the bathroom was the placement of the magnifier mirror adjacent to the toilet and about the height for someone over 6 feet to use. I also wished there were robe hooks in the bathroom. The rooftop pool and deck was a welcome escape on our first night after enjoying some free outdoor events at Lincoln Center. The pool isn't huge, but hardly as small as a bathtub as some say. Wow I want to see their bathtubs! It was very cold the evening we tried to use it, but my daughter got in and swam around. It was a nice break just to rest my legs in followed by a rest on the chaise lounge while looking at the city. The location was perfect and we were able to get last minute seats for War Horse playing at the theatre at Lincoln Center. It was nice to stroll back to the hotel while the rest of the crowd were fighting over taxis. There were two subway stations for different routes about 3 blocks in either direction. There were two movie theatres and several wonderful cafes nearby. We enjoyed great meals at Josephinas, Clarkes, Chowder house and Atlantic Grill. There is a Duane Reede and a Starbucks around the corner. My husband found that by sitting in the lobby bar all the way against the back wall he could pick up a free wifi signal from the neighboring Starbucks. The staff was great. The linens superb. The amenities were perfect. We will definitely try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location great room view but...”
Reviews.Author: jwreyns
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good location but be prepared for no coffee maker in the room and if you awake before the restaurant opens you have to go down the street for coffee. Room and bathroom is small but not as small as some I've stayed in, in NY. No door on the shower and if you are heigth challenged you can't adjust the overhead (ceiling mounted) showerhead nor the switch that redirects water from the head to the hand held wand. There are no directions in the bathroom for operation, had to call the front desk and they did send up maintenance to explain operation. All of this in a superior King room. Fortunately, only there one night.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Midtown”
Reviews.Author: leaveapath
Reviews.Content: I Just love the Empire! I stay here a lot when I travel to NYC for business and love it more and more each time I stay. The funky chic decor just oozes New York and you're treated like a celebrity the moment you walk in the door. I'm obsessed with the lobby/lounge which is great for an informal meeting (I'm not in Finance however...) or a drink after a long day of meetings. The staff are super friendly. The rooms are very small but so is every hotel room in NYC. The location is great and close to some nice restraunts. The breakfast at the hotel is good, but expensive! Traveling on my company stipen makes me order very carefully. If you're traveling with a group, the roof deck is a great place to unwind. Just make sure you're room is on a lower level - tough to get up for an early Friday meeting when the base is blasting Thursday night. Can't wait to stay there again. Only thing....wish they would bring black the black & white cookies in the room...just sayin.

Reviews.Title: “The Empire strikes back?”
Reviews.Author: Poutine_saucebrune
Reviews.Content: Yes, the other reviws are right: the pool is ridiculously small (something like 9x20 feet), two people can't swim at the same time. Yes, the rooms are tiny, but that is to expect in NYC. But the staff is very nice and polite, the bed is comfy, and the view from our room was gorgeous. Having reserved a seperate deck of the rooftop bar for guests is nice, since the public rooftop bar is always full of people. Sound proofing could use a little help, especially if your neighbor is coming back down from a night of drinks at the bar... But all in all, a positive experience. And the location is awesome, central park is a short walk, subway stations also, services, restaurants, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Took a chance and was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: KSteg
Reviews.Content: Due to the location and a super deal on travel zoo, we took a chance on the Empire Hotel for the 4th of July weeked, and we were so glad we did. We were upgraded to a junior suite, corner room, which had a fabulous view of the upper west side (and a small view of central park). The room was very spacious and well appointed. And contrary to all of the reviews that almost scared us away, the service was great too! We rented a rooftop cabana for the 4th (which I definitely reccommend), and it came with a small tv, chairs, and mini fridge (that you could stock). The bed was beyond comfy and made it difficult to get out of bed in the mornings, especially on a rainy Sunday. The location for us was great as we would not have been happy staying in the times square area (too congested). It was very close to the park and other great attractions/ restaurants. This hotel would be ideal for attending an event at the lincoln center. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing positive about this place”
Reviews.Author: movingon95
