Reviews.Content: Your first introduction to this hotel is a stale smelling smoked filled foyer that you pass through to go to the lobby. Went to check in to a room we reserved as part of a wedding group. They had already charged my credit card for my room stating that I was supposed to arrive 2 days before I got there so they charged me for a "no show". Checked my credit card again and there was a pending charge for the night at the hotel. Room did not have an iron, called housekeeping but they never came. Dirty towels in bathroom. No info given at time of check-in about restaurants in the hotel. Went out for morning coffee. Location is great but not worth the hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice modern decor.”
Reviews.Author: vivalajuicy
Reviews.Content: Liked the modern feel and decor. It felt like a nice hotel for a younger crowd, as opposed to some of the hotels that have a "stuffy" feel. The room was small but did well overall with utilization of space. Bed was very clean and comfortable. Closet was big enough for me to hang/store my clothes for the 4 nights we stayed. The location was just a block away from the subway station and right across from Lincoln Center, so it was a great location (could walk to Central Park, Columbus Circle, etc.) There are some decent restaurants in the area, including Rosa Mexicano (upscale Mexican), and Landmarc and Porterhouse (both in the Time Warner Center). We heard that P.J. Clarke's (right next door to the hotel) is overpriced for average food, and so we skipped that one. Don't make the mistake of eating average food in NYC! Hell's Kitchen is not that far away- great restaurants there. And we liked heading down to the West Village for great food as well. It is well worth it to wander away from the hotel for some great restaurants (overall better priced ones as well). The only issue with the hotel was the bathroom, and it wasn't that big of a deal. It was very small, as expected, but the strange thing was that the shower stall had no real door- just a half wall of glass between the shower and the sink area. Not a problem until the floor gets all wet from the shower. So we had to use up several towels because of how wet the floor would get. The bathroom was not really big enough for more than one person anyway, and so if you close the door the bathroom stayed hot and steamy from the shower (even without a shower door). It may have been a space issue, but a small glass door wouldn't be a bad idea... The rooftop pool was a small but nice area. The pool itself is small and covered, but there are many lounge chairs if you are a sun-worshiper. The lobby bar had average priced drinks and the same nice, modern decor. Overall we enjoyed our stay there and will be back, as we have a conference in that area we will go to every other year.

Reviews.Title: “What An Amazing Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: Besides the beautifully designed, cozy rooms, this hotel is top notch with respect to its staff. Everyone was courteous, competent and very pleasant to deal with. Veronica and Romeo gave outstanding service at the front desk, and the waitstaff at the pool, could not have be nicer. I highly recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Poor wifi and outside noise marred what would have been a lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: JamesJames1014
Reviews.Content: On first impression, a very nice hotel, well situated and with welcoming staff and a great foyer. However, interior rooms (the cheaper ones) have little to no natural light, and the roar from the outside air-conditioning units that keep the place cool is deafening at all times of the day and night. The windows did not seem to shut properly. Also the wifi throughout the hotel is patchy at best and non-existent at worst. Could not cope with what must be an overloaded system. Outdoor rooftop pool is little bigger than a bathtub and dirty, but the view is great. 2 out of 4 lifts not working for most of the week, causing huge queues. Finally, their website says "all rooms have a great view of New York" but this is a blatant lie. All the interior rooms have no view at all. I tried to find the exact words on their website but it is actually not working itself at the moment. So, if you can book an outward-facing room at a good price or special deal, and you don't mind being without wifi, it's not a bad place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: Viktor B
Reviews.Content: Great location, pathetic operation. Two out of four elevators out of service for a week! Wait for 15 minutes and a crowded lift or climb 11 stairs. Charges 20* more than advertised for phone calls. Nice pool on photo is more like a bath tub in reality. Highly unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff at check-in. Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMA47
Reviews.Content: Helpful check-in. For us, a good location - only one block from Central Park. Clean, well appointed room but without a view. Most of the staff we encountered were very helpful. We booked and paid on Priceline but found hotel charged our credit card as well. Check-out person said he would take care of removing it from our credit card and would send an email. This did not happen. After making several phone calls, we eventually received an email, saying the charge would be removed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but housekeeping stole my shoes!”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: The hotel decor was nice and the bed was very comfortable. Our room had no view but we didn't spend much time in it for that to really matter. Overall, I was pleased with how nice everything was and the rooftop bar was fun. However, housekeeping stole my favorite pair of black high heels! WTF! Enjoy your stay here but I advise to check your things daily for any missing items.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: JFurphy
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to new york and I was so happy when I arrived at the Empire Hotel. When we arrived it was beofre 3pm and our room was ready, even better we got up graded after the manager had said I had emailed with a few queries beofre my arrival. We were on the 5th Floor and our room was gorgeous. I have stayed in many hotels in Ireland and England and after people saying new york hotel rooms were small ours was great, loads of room to move around. We walked everywhere and it took about 15 mins to times square. We had a great view of the Lincon centre fountain. It was so close to an entrance to central park and the staff were great at getting us a cab. My stay was amazing and the toiletries were really nice, L'octainne. After reading some of the reviews on trip advisor I was really weary about my choice of hotel. But do not listen to the negatives, the staff were great really friendly and the concierge was fantastic got us a reservation for a lovely steakhouse 'The Porter house' in Time warner building..now it was very fancy..and I felt slightly uncomfortable but the food was unbelievable and service was 100% except the two girls that looked me and my partner up and down on arrival. Tickets for the broadway shows are quite expensive and it was too warm to que for them in times sqaure, plus the que was massive. We never got to the pool as you are on the go constantly. We never heard any noise like some of the reviews said. Yes, there is a que at the weekends from locals getting into the roof top bar, it seems really popular. We ate in Ed's chowder house, lovely service and great food. PJ clarkes is right beside and under the hotel..definately go, the food and service is great (BBQ ribs are to die for). The hotel organised a car for are return to the airport, A/C sedan which was lovely. The only improvements I would make would be the drinks are quite expensive, $14 for a glass of wine plus 20% gratuity..but it is expected as the hotel is top class. The airconditioning in the room works but could do with an up grade as it got warm at night. Overall great stay and I will be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Reborn”
Reviews.Author: jmcneur
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Empire Hotel in the 1960's and was delightfully suprised by its transformation into a 5-star luxury hotel. Very comfortable and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Champski_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on business a few months ago and cannot find anything remotely negative to say. The Hotel itself is easily 4 star+ and the customer service was exceptional from start to finish. Sometimes I find that hotels treat business travellers a little different to those on vacation however everyone appeared to be treated the same and with the utmost courtesy. I was so impressed that I have booked this hotel for my wife's 50th birthday celebration and her first trip to New York at the end of November this year. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Returning”
Reviews.Author: SonarBoy
Reviews.Content: The nicest thing I can say about the Empire is that it is conveniently located across the street from Lincoln Center. Perhaps the owners and management will recognize that form over function isn't a good thing when trying to give the illusion of precious space in Manhattan. The piles of attractive decorative pillows with the Empire Hotel logo have to compete with luggage space when one wants to sleep in the beds. The small half-closet with no door with the mini-bar tucked inside left little room for a single carry-on. I can deal with a miniscule Manhattan hotel room, but making it more challenging for guests is mystifying to me. I might have appreciated the lovely Frette linens on the beds had the ancient air conditioner been working. When one is simply lying on top of these linens and sweating into them, the high thread count doesn't make much difference. The hotel did move us after we pointed out that we had to return to the lobby to cool off. Perhaps this was a stroke of good luck as our original room had a dark view of the other buildings on the block and the AC compressors and bags of garbage. While our 2nd room had a lovely view of Broadway, it too featured an incredibly tiny bathroom. Both rooms had shower stalls with a half-panel of glass and no door or curtain, so it was impossible to take a shower without soaking the floor. The square sink was attractive, but turn the faucet over anything more than a trickle and we got splashed. (Aha! Perhaps the piles of decorative pillows were, in fact, large Empire Hotel logo sponges to deal with the overflow problems!) I was surprised to see smoking allowed smoking in the outside bar near the pool. We planned to enjoyed the great view of the UWS on a beatufiul summer evening, but we stayed for one drink and went elsewhere so we could breathe. We won't be returning and encourage other travelers to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel located right by central park”
Reviews.Author: LBrans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and thought the hotel was lovely although the rooms were very small. The swimming pool is nowhere near as big as it looks on the website, it's more of a plunge pool, which was a bit disappointing as that was one of the plus sides for picking the hotel, but saying that, the roof terrace and bar was a great place to chill out late afternoon/ early evening after having done the sightseeing/shopping all day. There's also a nightclub which was very popular all through the week and weekend. Location was good for getting around though as it's just a few minutes to walk to central park or the nearest metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: pete827
Reviews.Content: Just off Broadway and steps from Lincoln Center, this hotel is in a perfect location for restaurants, culture and quick access by subway or bus to uptown and downtown destinations. A small park across the street from the hotel entrance means that there is not as much traffic outside the door. Hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful and we found Ed's Chowder House on the mezzanine level to be the perfect spot for a late afternoon snack and drink at the bar. I stayed here for the weekend with my 2 daughters for an exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, which was just a short cab ride away. We also took the subway down to Soho for shopping and the bus to the Times Square Area. The decor is snazzy, with dark walls and animal print accessories on the lounges in the lobby. The room was commodious for NYC, and the linens and pillows were upscale. We had 2 queen beds in our room, but there was still a little extra floor space. Upscale toiletries and mini-bar options were nice, if very pricey. A small refrigerator and safe in the closet, and an umbrella (for sale) in the closet were available. The only criticism I can offer is that the shower screen doesn't protect the floor from getting sprayed, but there were plenty of towels and a floor mat to soak up the water. All in all a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great 30th trip”
Reviews.Author: The_ShutleBus
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise 30th birthday for my girlfriend. We were both really I pressed with it. The location was great a short walk to times square or close to the metro for further journeys. We headed to the opera house a few times and caught some of their free outdoor shows which is just a couple of minutes away. The rooftop bar was amazing, not much atmosphere but really chilled and great to have a chat. Our room was small but perfectly formed, square ft in NYC is a premium so we didn't expect itto be huge, we had plenty of space to unpack all of our stuff, to be honest we only slept in the - there's so much to see and do why waste tome in the room?! Only one negative was the air con unit was a bit noisy but we had to keep in on as it was real hot. We ate at the 2 of the attached restaurants as recommended by staff but found them overpriced and not that great quality - we found much better places ourselves. Staff were friendly but to be honest other than check in and out we didn't need to contact them. Bar staff were attentive but drinks were overpriced (like most hotels). All in all a great place

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in good Manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: thebear59
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here on business. Although our vendor put us up in this hotel we were pleased with the location. There are two adjacent restaurants, one a pub and the other seafood restaurant. Across the street four outdoor patio restaurants so a great location for lunch! There is a Starbucks two doors away which is perfect for that java fix that we always have in the morning. Just beside this is a Duane Pharmacy open 24 hours which also offers cold beer for sale. So this hotel is in a location that has almost anything you need. We arrived at check in at noon therefore our room wasn't ready till 3p.m.. For the inconvenience she offered without me asking an upgrade to a superior room which was very nice of her. This room is considerable bigger than the standard room we stayed in last year and would be worth it for us to stay in next time. The shower area is much larger to comfortably accomodate the two of us, there was a seating area as well. This was an old building reonovated many years ago and sometimes you have to accept that you will find small rooms. There was no iron in the room so you have to call front desk for someone to bring you one. We had an opportunity to use the rooftop pool area for a couple of hours and were fortunate that it was an extremely sunny hot day to enjoy. Such a nice touch in small hotel as this. Bar lounge serves good cocktails however the price of a wine bottle is quite expensive. It's about 30 blocks from TImes Square which you can take the subway which is just around the corner, it's called One Way train, cost 2.50. Columbus Circle is just 2 to 3 blocks away and I found a unique wine store that has the wines organized by country. A store that prides itself on product knowledge, ask them what type of wine you like and your budget and they present you with the best options. This was such a good find that I will always remember this store next time in New York. Charming hotel great location good service and worth a threepeat.

Reviews.Title: “My 30th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: wanttotravelmore99
Reviews.Content: I was treated to an overnight stay by some friends, and had the BEST TIME. The hotel was beautiful and in the best location. When I checked in I was treated so nicely and my room was upgraded for my Birthday by Zulik at the front desk. I also was sent Champagne compliments of her and the hotel to help celebrate my birthday. The room was exceptional, roof deck pool was great. I and my friends had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Missbotess
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel receives some negative reviews but I've stayed here about four times in the last 18 months and obviously, I think it's worth coming back to. It's centrally located....across from Lincoln Center, 1 block from Central Park, and walking distance to the theater district (if necessary). The rooms are smallish, If there are only two of us, I book the double-double but when there are three, I book the Jr. Suite which is much roomier with a pull-out sofa bed and a larger bathroom. I can't recommend the restaurant in the hotel, the Chowder House but the place next door, PJ CLarke's is surprisingly good for drinks, burgers, desserts, and having a Starbucks just a few steps out the hotel door is fantastic! The concierge service is very helpful and the front desk staff, usually terrific! I will continue to return to this NYC classic on a regular basis!

Reviews.Title: “Good but rather loud location”
Reviews.Author: mademmi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Empire hotel 7 nights during my business trip to NY. In general, I think it is a good hotel, centrally located, offering average quality for the price. It was much better, cleaner and fancy than other hotels that I stayed in NY. The hotel is very well located, close to the Columbus Circle and Central Park, and just in front of the Lincoln Center. It was easy to reach metro and commute through entire Manhattan. The hotel is very busy, and there are lots of people coming and going. In the evenings lots of guests are coming to the top floor bar which sometimes makes it difficult to use the elevators or ask receptionist for help. As for the rooms - mine was rather comfortable, with two large beds. It was clean, bathroom small but functional. Beds were comfortable which was important for me after lots of walking. The room was situated on 9th floor but the constant noise from the street still reached me. Windows and blinds are not really keeping the noise out. My colleagues' rooms were much smaller and more loud so just make sure that you check the room before signing for it. The staff was extremely helpfull and kind. They managed to change my room after the first night (it was located on 1st floor and I felt like I am in the middle of the street), they also helped to arrange theatre tickets, taxis and we could even take shower in the gym room after morning check out just before the travel. Swimming pool that is on the roof of the hotel offers nice views over the street and the Lincoln Center. However, the pool is so small and shallow that it is rather difficult to swim in, especially if there are kids jumping around. One last but very important information for the shopping maniacs - Century 21 outlet is going to open its new store just in front of the hotel. So one more plus for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: someplace_new277
Reviews.Content: I found out the Empire Hotel was 4 stars after my stay. To say I was shocked is an understatement. The rooms are dated, tacky, and dingy. I.e. stains on the curtains, paint peeling on the walls. Whoever selected the finishes didn’t think about functionality. For example, the shower is a hand held, modern, sleek cylinder. It looks great but the shower spray shoots straight out and not at an angle so you have to hold the shower spray in one hand and bathe with the other. Very annoying. The air conditioning unit is the old floor model type. It is VERY loud so it’s not good for light sleepers, not to mention it pumps cold air very intermittently so it is constantly kicking on and off and your room is rarely a consistent temperture. When I left for a bit, the maid came in and turned the AC off which meant I came back to a hot stuffy room since NY was going through a 7 day heat wave during my stay. The rooms are small and the bathrooms (shower only) are tiny but this didn’t really bother me too much since I’m used to NY standards of real estate. The “view” I had was to an enclosed courtyard and looked right into more rooms. I never even had a top-sheet on the bed. I hope they wash the duvet covers with every guest. I thought the pool deck would at least live up to the photos. Wrong again. The pool is tiny too. It’s approximately 8 feet wide by maybe 30 feet long. The photos make it look much larger. When I went up to the deck the first night, it was closing early (at 5pm) for a private party. When I went up the second night, there were no towels to be had and the water was running right below the jets so water was sputtering the entire time I was there. That also meant water was not being filtered properly and there was a huge slick of sun block floating around. Ga-ross. I didn’t even dip more than my calves in the pool. Another bust considering it was nearly 100 degrees in the city. And finally, the service. Yet again, disappointing. I was checked-in very quickly but when I asked about receiving any frequent flyer miles for my stay I was told she didn’t know if I could get miles and to call an agent. When I went to my room, on almost the very first page of the “World Hotels” magazine, it says you can get miles with any of their airline partners. How did an employee of the hotel not know this? When I returned for the evening, my key didn’t work. Only one gal was working the desk so there was of course a line. It took almost 20 minutes to speak to her to get a replacement key. Not how I want to spend my time. I go upstairs to my room and later call for a wake-up call. No answer…after 3 tries. I finally just set my own alarm. It always felt that they were under-staffed, or newly staffed. All around, the Empire fell short in my book. What a bummer. I thought I was going to discover a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: adamks
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location across the street from Lincoln Center...smallish rooms and bathrooms (shower only), but that seems to be the NYC norm...very comfortable bed, friendly and accommodating staff (we arrived very late after flights canceled from Boston), reasonable prices. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tessbroz
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small, the hotel is beautiful. The location is the best part, right across from Lincoln Center with a small grassy (park) at the entrance and a Starbucks at the corner. Once you get a handle of the bathroom sink and tap, you've got it made. The lines outside waiting for the "hotspot" nightclub on the rooftop can be a nuisance but you grow used to it. Very pricey, but what isn't in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible beds, noisy pool.”
Reviews.Author: pearlw531
Reviews.Content: We took our bride to be for a weekend in NYC. The hotel itself was absolutely beautiful, our room overlooked Broadway and was also clean. The hotel staff was friendly and prompt to our room needs. However, the elevators of the hotel has no AC, the room's AC temp was always too warm, never below 75. The beds are very uncomfortable, you may as well have slept on the floor. We had wanted a relaxing time here at Empire, that was NOT the case if you ever stay on the Pool Deck Lounge. It was filled with young obnoxious 20yr olds, that were NOT hotel guests, they were all there mooching off the pool. There are signs that states the pool deck lounge areas are reserved for hotel guests. When we had called upon the issue to the front desk, it had taken 5 calls in 2 hours for hotel security to come. Very disappointing that the hotel would allow any "schmoe" off the street to use their facility!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraLEK
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, the room was great it had air conditioning which was needed in 103/39 degree weather, it also had a safe. The pool deck was lovely especially the booths which had curtains- you could even watch TV up there! The housekeeping staff always made the room look nice. All the staff at the hotel were friendly and welcoming. I would love to stay there again. Well worth the 7 and a half hour flight to get there - so was New York in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great air-conditioning during the heat wave!”
Reviews.Author: JimtownGal
Reviews.Content: The air-conditioning was great during the record-breaking heat wave and our room was quiet, cool and clean...perfect for recovering after a long day in the city. We didn't spend much time there, but the housekeeping and doormen were efficient and thorough. Right across the street from the Lincoln Center and Central Park. No in-room coffee service.

Reviews.Title: “I live in Manhattan and took a stay-cation for 2 days. What a great choice of hotels"”
Reviews.Author: jillny2000
Reviews.Content: I live in the neighborhood and needed to have some work done on my apt, so figured i would stay nearby ..It was really a great chice. Room was super cool and new and current. It was 100 degrees out and the pool was perfect. The rooftop bar was too hot at night, so the lobby bar was my choice. It was fun, active, not crazy but a great scene. The service was as good as a hotel that charges 3 x as much! The only complaint is poor service at breakfast restauarant. They need to get that together. Alot of people standing around and running around, but no one could seem to get any one a cup of coffe til the 3rd request...

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service after a rocky start to my stay!”
Reviews.Author: CottonTop0625
Reviews.Content: I checked in on June 26, 2011 and was not satisfied with my room. I was promised a different room the next day. However, the staff was not made aware of the requested change. Therefore, I spent yet another night in a room that was not to my satisfaction as I would be there for 14 days. I spoke with the assistant manager on the following day, she promised me a new room. Upon my return to the hotel from school, not only did she honor her commitment but the bell staff had already moved all of my items and left them in the same way in my new room as they found them in my vacated room. Needless to say, my stay turned out to be the best ever in New York City. I would like to extend my sincere appreciation to the manager whose name escapes me now, the staff and especially my favorite bartender whom I secured a glass of ice from every evening, he talked with me and handed over my glasses and/or bucket with a smile every single day of my stay; Miriam and Veronica especially for their hospitality, smiles, consideration of my needs and warmth. Their attempts to make my stay wonderful were successful. As for the bell staff, they were awesome as well (always willing to help and provide a bit of cheer and conversation for one such as I who loves to talk. Zuli checked me in the first night and listened to my concerns about my room. She offered me yet another room. Romeo, met me with a smile each time I passed the counter and stopped to ask him a question, request a key and/or directions. I absolutely loved my stay at The Empire Hotel in New York City from June 26 through July 10, 2011. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Several of my staff members (teachers) were residents as well. From all indications, they were pleased as well. We will be back next June, July and/or August.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; very inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: Member000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Empire at least 30 nights over the past 2-1/2 years, primarily on business. And I'll stay there again. PROS: --location, location, location (perfect for Upper West Side/Midtown West--across from Lincoln Center) --many great restaurants within a few minute walk --bigger rooms can be very comfy --price relative to other nearby hotels is (usually) very affordable CONS: --not really a business-oriented hotel; caters more to the tourist (i.e., non-repeater) crowd --check-in experience can be extraordinarily frustrating (read: takes too long, even for repeat visitors) --staff isn't generally the warmest I've ever received--particularly the front door --can be a little overwhelming when there's an event or Fri/Sat nights when the club upstairs is crowded--it's annoying to have to weave through lines of scantily-clad 20-somethings (or wannabes) just to get into the hotel you're paying $300/night for --I have experienced the problems others have mentioned (a/c not working or too loud; missing towels and bathroom amenities; rooms not completely cleaned)--what's annoying is how consistent they aren't. I'll likely stay at this hotel again because of the location, and the price vs. other nearby hotels. (And no matter how small the rooms are, they're still bigger and more functional than the ones at the nearby Hudson!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos1931
Reviews.Content: Aside from a great hotel, kudos to your customer service team. Mariana M.was fantastic. She greeted us when we checked in and made sure that we had a great stay. The hotel needs a team of Marianas!

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you don't like or need space and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Brewer524
Reviews.Content: Was there for 2 nights for a small conference. I can only speak about the room I stayed in, but it was tiny. No closet, no iron or ironing board, no tub, just a shower. Lobby area was modern and had several people milling around. Some staff spoke poor english. Chowder House Restaurant was good for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “I want my money back!”
Reviews.Author: jgibson409
Reviews.Content: I booked the Empire for my girlfriends birthday weekend and was very disappointed; there is no way this place deserves 4 stars. First off, customer service is not high on their priority list: our air-conditioner barely worked and their answer was to bring us (2 hrs later) a small fan; we didn't get an ice bucket (once again took 2 hrs to get) and they would only bring us two towels no matter how many times we asked for more. Secondly, at night the hotel seems more interested in the club being opperated on the upper floor than the guests of the hotel. In addition, having the club there brings around a lot of people you wouldn't normally want in the lobby of a "4 star" hotel. Other issues that bugged us: We didn't get a turn down service either night, didn't have the morning paper either morning and didn't even get a top sheet the last night of our stay. I spent 20 minutes trying to call someone to get a sheet before I finally just gave up. Not only would I never stay in this place again, I actually want some of my money back. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Zuli treated us like royalty”
Reviews.Author: wringho
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a great experience at Hotel Empire for over a week while in town for business. Rooms were fine, and customer service is obviously emphasized by the staff there. One asst. manager in particular, Zuli, went above and beyond to help with a computer and printer problem. She had a smile on her face the entire time and we finally resolved the issue. Great hotel, great staff, great location. Good food at PJ Clarke's and Ed's Chowder House too.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Content: What a joy it is to stay at the Empire Hotel! The staff makes you feel right at home. From the Bellman Daniel to the front desk where Mariana and Romeo welcome you. Although the bathrooms are small, and some rooms can be tight, Monica and the housekeeping staff keep the rooms immaculate. The lobby can be a bit noisy, but the location is wonderful for business and/or holidays in NYC. A Big Apple gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Disappointed - Worst Service”
Reviews.Author: Boozool
Reviews.Content: Went to New York to celebrate my birthday. We booked a room for our 11 night stay, 6 months in advance, but when we arrived we were told the booking had been cancelled. Ms Kim who was working that evening did nothing to accomodate us, and insisted we send her our confirmation to prove we had made the booking and that it was still current. Worst hotel staff - they didn't appear interested, they were not friendly, and were all less than helpful. They would have personal conversations whilst you waited to be served. Room rate - was incorrect, we had to speak to various hotel staff members daily for 7 days before it was sorted out, and upon checking out the changes had not been saved, so we had to go through the whole invoice from scratch. Not a relaxing experience at all, and I could not believe the staff did nothing without us following them up. We were given a room on the top floor, which meant we were up all night from the loud music from the rooftop bar which is a seperate entity to the hotel itself. Zero views. Housekeeping woke us up on two occasions even though we had our do not disturb sign on the door. Overall the hotel lobby presents well, but the rooms are small, bathroom is beyond tiny and floods, and the staff make the experience sux.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the most awesome city on earth!!”
Reviews.Author: Gully1981
Reviews.Content: The best holiday iv ever had new york is incredible and ten days was not enough, Coupled with the empire, clean rooms big bed bigger shower tv, but to be honest you only want to be there to sleep n clean up, your in new York right????!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and will be back in sept”
Reviews.Author: irinadejesus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 10 year wedding anniversary just for one night. We got a great view of the city. We could see Lincoln center. It was in a great spot the room was spotless. The bed and pillows were the best I have every had at a hotel so far. The staff was great and house keeping was supper fast in bringing an ironing board and ice bucket to the room. The hotel uses L'OCCITANE en Provence bath products which i have never seen in a hotel. The only things people should know is there is a night club/bar on the roof that gets very loud after 10pm. We were on the 9th floor and you could hear the words. If you want a quite room on a sat night, make sure your below the 9th floor. We had the TV on and it was not that bad. We want to come back for my husbands b-day in Sept and I asked if we can get the same room. I was told to contact the front desk after booking and ask for rep that i spoke to this am and if the room is available, its ours. I really can't wait to go back. Thanks for making out 10 year a night to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Completely overrated. Empire in name only.”
Reviews.Author: jamesandsim
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms (for 8 people) for 7 nights, specifically requesting non-smoking and Superior Rooms and somehow ended up with 3 tiny rooms (obviously Standard Rooms) on the smoking floor on our first night with unsightly views of the buildings directly opposite, and only 1 Superior Room on a non-smoking floor. Like others before me have mentioned, there was no room for suitcases, let alone ourselves in these rooms. The lingering stench of stale cigarette smoke greeted us the moment the lift doors opened. Incredibly disappointing after 24hrs of flying from Australia. After complaining the following morning, the 3 tiny rooms were "upgraded" to the 11th floor. Admittedly these rooms were much larger, however, they were directly underneath the nightclub. We were lucky to get a few hours sleep each night. The thumping and droning sounds from above woke us up constantly and were especially bad on Friday and Saturday nights. When we complained about this to the hotel manager, we were told that he had not previously had any complaints from these particular rooms, which we find very difficult to believe, but has had complaints from other rooms on the 11th Floor. We also found one of the staff members at reception, Helena, to be particularly rude, unsmiling and unhelpful. As it is, I am writing this at 3am on our final morning in the hotel, as we have been rudely awoken by someone tripping the hotel's fire alarm system, not once or twice, but on last count six times! That, combined with the drone from above will ensure that we will not be getting any further sleep tonight. On a positive note, the hotel's location is brilliant and the rooftop pool deck is fantastic for those travelling in summer. Concierge was very helpful but understaffed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: craigmacca
Reviews.Content: My partner and i booked 2 nights at this hotel £586.00 2 nights. No porters to carry bags so i had to drag a rucksack and 2 cases through a reception full of unhelpful people after a 8 hr flight an transfer. We booked a junior suite as it was a birthday treat - we was checked in by Romeo who assured us the view we would have from our 2nd floor room was amazing. Natural instinct to check the view the second you get in the room. I wish i left the curtains closed the view was of 2 tower blocks of office opposite the hotel no views of central park as this hotel claims. The size of the room was totally underrated. Im 6ft 4 i couldn't fit in the bath and the shower head did not adjust high enough. I had to hold the shower attachment to have a shower. The finishes are dated and tacky, there was no shower screen or enclosure so the floor gets soaked even if you put towels down and is dangerous. Prices of food $12 for french fries - HELLO - REALLY? not 1 member of staff spoke to us in 2 days other than check out when asked how was your stay - my reply was upsetting. The hotel check in didn't even ask why. Overrated hotel, over priced = AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: Kettle1977
Reviews.Content: This was a 5 night trip for my Mother's birthday and the hotel did give us a great view, as requested. However, the room was a lot smaller than we expected, more like a small double than triple. We only had 1 mirror in the bathroom, which was tiny and with 3 girls this made getting ready a struggle! Far worse though was the noise in the early hours from music on the 10th floor (we were on the 11th). This is a nightclub run separately to the hotel and music goes on until 4am most nights! We ended up moving rooms to 6th floor, which was much quieter at night. On booking, the hotel had a spa on website but in fact, this had apparently gone months ago so we were disappointed, plus the pool is really just a plunge - the web photos make it look a lot more impressive and a lot of guests said the same thing. That said, the hotel staff were accommodating when we asked to move and in particular, concierge were great in helping us to book theatre and trips. Hotel is well situated, close to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: TandomRaveler
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it had anything to do with it, but we booked the hotel via Bookit.com, specifically requesting non-smoking and the highest floor available. Check-in was smooth, but the room was on the fourth floor and also had a distinct cigarette odor. The room itself was a handicap-accessible room, so it had a large bathroom with an open shower. Unfortunately, the air conditioning unit was not functioning, and it was definitely needed this weekend. A call down to the desk said they'd send someone up or we could switch rooms. Waited for half an hour, no one came, called back down and requested the room switch. Unfortunately, didn't get the same person, and this time I was told they were full. Finally, they found a room but only with two doubles. Took it anyway. Bumped to 11th floor, no cigarette odor, bathroom smaller and the two doubles. But the A/C worked! Shower had a wood slat floor which was a bit corny. After all that, the lobby bar was decent and the plunge pool on the rooftop is sufficient for a quick cool down. The rooftop club bar was busy and Friday and Saturday evenings, there's a line waiting for access -- it has separate elevators. The in-building restaurant, Ed's Chowderhouse, was quite good, and the restaurant next door had great home-made tater tots. We easily walked to Central Park and throughout the surrounding neighborhood, with shops, bars and restaurants easily accessible. I'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: elifcachi
Reviews.Content: We spend a hole week in this Hotel with our family and we we're totaly satisfied. All people are very friendly and helpfull, because of that our vacation in New York (best city ever) and the USA (greatest country!) was very good! We thank you for your help and I hope to come back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Greeted by a COCKROACH trapped under a wine glass on top of an Empire Hotel Folder on the floor of my Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: njbenevento
Reviews.Content: My relaxing night away was completely ruined by the Empire Hotel and staff. I arrived slightly after the check-in of 3 PM and as I entered the lobby I saw an extremely long line with very minimal staff at the front-desk attending to guests. The Concierge stood along side the front desk looking extremely stressed out and doing nothing to assist with the growing line in the lobby. Eventually I was somewhat coldly greeted by Romeo who offered no pleasant conversation, asked how many keys I needed and sent me on my way to my first floor room, room 114. Although I was concerned about the noise I would experience being on the first floor I had a more disturbing issue to deal with awaiting me. I entered my room, dropped my bags glanced around quickly to notice the worn and chipped furniture pieces and general age of the room. I then decided to use the restroom..However, before I could turn on the room light a flash of light against glass caught my eye on the floor of the bathroom...I turned on the light and I simply could not BELIEVE my eyes. In front of the bathtub, trapped by a wine glass on top of an Empire Hotel folder sat a LIVE COCKROACH (I have a photo of exactly how I found this in my room). I promptly dialed the front desk and explained the situation, the person told me to come down to the front desk to get my new keys. I arrived at the lobby, which was now in a complete frenzy, and walked straight back to Romeo who had checked me in originally. He blankly stared at me as I stood there waiting to speak to him (at this point I realized no one from the back office who picked up my call had communicated my issue to the front desk), I proceeded to explain the situation to Romeo in a calm and demure manner so as to not disturb the other quests. Romeo then repeated word for word what I had just said back to me as if he did not hear me properly the first time. He then made new keys and sent me on my way (with barely an apology) to the next "ROOM of HORROR", room 721. I entered the sweltering hot room and dropped my bags and then immediately went to tend to the air conditioning unit in the wall that seemed to be quite aged. It was set at max level for coolness, so I waited a bit to see how the temperature in the room would settle. A few hours later while trying to take a nap I decided I had enough of the balmy, humid and uncomfortable temperature in the room as well as the EXTREMELY LOUD noise that was coming from the unit. I called the front desk to express how uncomfortable I was and was told she would send a technician and she could not switch my rooms since the hotel is at capacity. The technician comes in, looks at the unit and says "oh this is one of the older units, its just going to be the way it sounds when the compressor goes on and off, I will tell the front desk about whats going on up here." After he did nothing but offer justification as to why the room was hot and noisy the technician left my room. I called the front desk again and said I would like to leave the hotel as I am no longer comfortable staying here considering all that I have gone through. I would also like a full refund due to the horrific experience and the level with which I was treated. However, Miss Justyna Grochowska (ASSISTANT guest services manager) told me over the phone that the technician told her of the problem with the Air Conditioning and they believe it was functioning normally and she also believes they had provided me with a "sufficient" room and would only be able to refund me 50% of the total. Miss Justyna Grochowska never once offered to come to the room to experience what her guest was complaining of nor offered any alternatives to rectify the situation, she remained hidden behind the walls of the front desk. I quickly gathered by belongings and went down to the front desk to check out and take the credit (although insufficient) that was being offered. Again, it seems no one communicated to the front desk team that an unhappy guest would be coming down to check out. While I waited to be taken care of, another guest was complaining to the front desk of the air conditioning in their room...she offered a technician and planned to have two "Fans" brought up "just in case" Finally Justyna who was no where to be found appeared in front of me to provide her card and said "OK you're all set" to which I replied "I'd like documentation of my refund" which seemed to thoroughly confuse her. She had someone else at the front desk print it for me and I literally ran out of there as fast as I possibly could. I highly recommend that the Staff at the Empire be trained on how to provide a decent level of customer service to all guests. I also recommend that the credentials of Miss Justyna Grochowska be reviewed in detail, as she does not appear to have the necessary skill-set needed to interact with guests. Perhaps she can assist with the extermination efforts that should be started to limit any future hotel guest-cockroach interactions in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Empire - rooftop bar & pool deck made it!”
Reviews.Author: CHC27
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for a trip to New York - modern, clean & a great location for getting about. Rooftop club (weekends) & pool deck made it perfect for a summer girls NYC trip. Only downside was that the hotel charged $1200 to my credit card as a security deposit on check in & didn't advise me - subsequently mu card got blocked by the bank. An apology from the hotel but no more - I would have expected at least a bottle of wine from the bar as a token gesture. Would stay again in the summer but will definately by asking at check in for clarification on security deposits!

Reviews.Title: “"your fault for booking through an agent"”
Reviews.Author: kev'n'JJ
Reviews.Content: This was the curt reply we got from a member of the front desk staff when we informed them we had booked a Queen room through our travel agent in the UK as part of our package. the luggage did not fit in the room if we went in there as well, no dress hanging space at all. We ended up piling up unopened cases on top of each other. Room dark, view not what we expected, looking straight into rooms across the alley: undesirable. We kept the curtains and windows shut, but the outdated air-conditioning kept waking us up. We were given a hanging rail for our clothes, but the only place to put it was to lift it over the bed and then down the other side - leaving only one side to climb into bed. Dingy bathroom (wooden shower tray was mouldy at the edges, and no door so we used one of our towels to stop water entering the bedroom). When we asked if we could have a queen room as booked, we were told the hotel was full, but we could upgrade for a supplement (??), plus the above comment. The best thing was the location: there is so much to do in NY but there are many cheaper and (in our opinion from previous NY experience) better quality hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great for night life”
Reviews.Author: TommyG100
Reviews.Content: but not enough staff on during the day for the star rating, but looks great. the roof bar is good, but a bit of a pick up joint after work. pool closed when I went, but had not said so on the website even on the days I was there

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Here, but the First Time was Better!”
Reviews.Author: eurican
Reviews.Content: All, We booked a Standard Queen last April for 2 days, and they kindly upgraded us to the Superior King. Let me tell you, this was a great time! The room (#223) was spacious, clean and had a nice view. This year we booked again for a Standard Queen, and we were not so lucky in getting an upgrade (probably because of peak season). We arrived at 3 PM, and guess what? The room was not available. They had a smoking room, but that is just disgusting! So they told us to "check in our bags, and come back in about 45 minutes, and we would get a much better room." So we did just that. About 45 minutes later, we received a phone call that our room was ready. We arrived back to obtain our room cards, and I had asked about the log in credentials for the wireless. She told me that "there is a charge of $12.95 for it, "and I told her that there was no charge last year. She kindly went ahead and waived this for us. The room they gave us, #809 was a lot smaller than the room we had last year. It also needed some TLC, and had a view of an alley (not my idea of a "much better room"). However, the housekeeping staff did a great job in this room. Last thing, we wanted to Check Out at 2 PM instead of the 12 PM since we had to wait for our room to be ready during our Check In. I politely asked the front desk, and they kindly went ahead and gave us this complimentary. However, when we came back to our room after 12 PM, our room keys did not work. We had to go back down to the front desk, and they told us that "there policy is to have the rooms locked after 12 PM." Well if I request a Check Out after 12, shouldn't you 1. tell me I have to come to the front desk to obtain a working key, or 2. reprogram your locks to let us in after 12?? Overall, it was not as good as our first stay. Thanks for Reading!

Reviews.Title: ““If you do not spend any time in your room, then the hotel is perfect!””
Reviews.Author: AZGina
Reviews.Content: If you are going to NYC with the intentions of never being in your room, then this is the place for you. The location is fabulous. 2 steps from Lincoln Center, and also a subway stop, 2 minutes to Central Park and a 10 minute walk to Time Square. This hotel is very conveniently located. Of course, in NYC, everything is about location. The hotel lobby is great, the bar/lobby is fantastic and the rooftop bar and pool are amazing! The views are awesome and the drinks are great. The rooms are a bit of a disappointment. Make sure you know which room you are booking ahead of time. The firstroom we were given was the size of a closet. You can not walk in to the room with your luggage in your hand at the same time because there is no room for both you and the luggage. There is no room to even shut the door without climbing on the bed to shut it. We talked to the front desk because we had booked a 'standard' queen and they gave us the smaller version. They then gave us the room we booked and the view of all the standard rooms is of duct work, garbage and the heating/cooling system. The room is small with no place to store any luggage, but you can at least shut the door. The air was not working in the room and it was 90 degrees outside with 100% humidity. Being from Arizona, I can stand heat...mixed with the humidity and no working A/C, it was a bit hot. Just beware of what room you are booking before you arrive! We were never in the room. The location made up for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great location, Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: cyntremb
Reviews.Content: I had read some Trip Advisor reviews prior to my trip, and was concerned by some of the negative reviews. We touched base with the Hotel Manager and I have to say, the response from hotel management was outstanding. We were warmly welcomed upon arrival, there were no issues with our room upon checking in. Once we got to our room, we received a call within minutes from the hotel to ensure everything in the room was in order. The room was clean, a great size for a NYC hotel, and the location is outstanding - right across the street from the Lincoln Center, 2 blocks from Central Park, and just south of a great little neighborhood full of boutiques and restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definately return; however, HIGHLY recommend booking a Junior Suite to make the most of your visit - these rooms are very nicely appointed with a great sized bathroom and a very comfortable king sized bed. We were on our first wedding anniversary and management really made this stay memorable for us - thank you to Jennifer, David and staff. Note: This is a trendy boutique hotel, with lots of "comings and goings" of young people, and line-ups to get into the hotel's roof top bar. If this is your 'scene", this is the perfect hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: dplnj
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was clean and a very comfortable bed. It was a small room with a very small bathroom. The closet was a joke. The view was an ally. I loved the the whole atmosphere of the hotel. In front there is a little park with tables directly across the street from Lincoln Center. Whole foods a few blocks away at Columbus Circle. I felt very safe. I would stay again but with a larger room and one with an actual view.

Reviews.Title: “Slept on the floor!”
Reviews.Author: Esther11237280
Reviews.Content: My daugher and I were on a last returning trip to NYC as she was 4 and a half months pregnant. I called the day before ahead to notify we would be arriving after 10:pm, and to ensure again there would be separate beds in our room. When we arrived at 11:30pm we were informed our room was not available. They gave us " all that was left" which was a single room with a VERY VERY BAD pull out sofa, only in the room. When we went down to ask how they expect us to sleep on this broken down sofabed they said that is all they had. My daughter slept on the floor, after they gave one extra blanket and pillow. It was very cold and uncomfortable. Also they have a very popular roof top pool and when you try to get into your hotel in the evening the doorway is completely blocked. They have bouncers that just stand there and look at you, instead of directing traffic so you can get in. I have been to NYC many time and would NEVER go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and bar, good room”
Reviews.Author: terrberr78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on business in May 2011. The first night I arrived late and jet lagged so just had dinner in the rooftop bar. The food was a bit overdone on the design and not amazing while the cost was too high for what you get. Same story with the cocktails. But the design and atmosphere of the rooftop bar were cool. The downstairs lounge/bar was beautifully designed and the drinks were good that time (this time I chose a good wine rather than a cocktail). There were many people coming and going to the bar which gave the hotel a very "happening" vibe. The rooms were good, but simple and small. I had everything I needed but the temperature was a bit hard to manage. The bed was wonderful though. All in all it was a good hotel and I would be happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific. I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: PJinNJ
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous room, very, very comfortable bed and lovely view (my room looked out to Lincoln Center, I could see the Metropolitan Opera House from my window!). I have stayed in plenty of hotels in NYC and the Empire is by far one of the nicest I have experienced. The restaurant is not bad either. Friendly staff at both the front desk and the restaurant. Only 4 stars for the rest. review because they didn't have many vegetarian options. FYI, if you like Starbuck's, there is one right next to the hotel. Just two little things: the bathroom was a tad small (not a big deal, it is NYC after all) and had that single paned glass shower door which can make for a mess in the bathroom, 2) the internet connection in the business center was so slow that I could not access my email at all. You also have to pay for the internet use at the Business Center (a Kinko's-like set-up). These two points are really nothing in the grand scheme of things though. One last thing: I booked and paid for my room through Priceline.com. When I went to check out the front desk had mistakenly charged me for the room. It took them no time at all to fix the problem and credit my room back to my Visa.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book a standard room.”
Reviews.Author: my2cats75
Reviews.Content: We booked a STD room. Smallest room I ever saw in a 4 star hotel. Front desk was not knowledgeable. It took forever for them to find a upgrade room at 6pm. Rooms were still not cleaned. We finally got an upgrade. It was much better. However we had only bath towels and could not get towels until until the next morning. No one answered at housekeeping and the front desk was no help. Really bad front desk help. If you are staying there for the pool, it not opened the hrs. Listed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic night scene”
Reviews.Author: Nox104
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for solitude, this is not the place! However, if you are young and looking for a hot night spot, you couldn't have picked a better hotel in the city. The rooftop club / lounge gets packed during the weekends. And the best part of staying here is you don't need to stand in line with the rest of the crowd to get in! Lots of nice places to eat around as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud at night due to rooftop club”
Reviews.Author: DL0279
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here recently, I was in town for a combination of work and pleasure. My main (and only) complaint about this hotel is the level of noise from the rooftop club. We stayed on the 9th floor and the music from the club was clearly audible in our room at night. Perhaps we were directly under the speakers - the bass thumped loudly through the ceiling and walls all night. On Thursday night, it ended shortly after 1am, so not a major issue for us. On Friday night, however, the rooftop club (like many NYC clubs) is open until 4am. We called the front desk twice to see if they could do anything about it - they said they'd call the club manager but nothing happened. Not really surprised by that, I'm certain the club brings in a ton of revenue and that management is disinclined to ruin the party on behalf of a handful of sleepless guests on the top few floors. But it is really irresponsible to place guests in rooms where the level of noise is this high. I'm fairly well-traveled, and at any hotel you expect a certain level of noise from the hallway, others guests, street noise, sirens, etc (especially in NYC) - but this was way beyond acceptable. Saturday morning we requested to be moved to a different room and the staff kindly took care of that for us. They moved us down a couple floors and the noise problem was completely gone. Aside from the noise issue, the hotel was very nice. Rooms were good size for NYC, comfortable bed, very nice shower, beautiful lobby, nice bar, etc. Daytime staff at the front desk (Romeo) was extremely polite and very helpful. But at the end of the day, the main purpose of a hotel is a place to sleep. Since I couldn't do this at the Empire (prior to the room change), I can't give this property a good rating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and plan to return”
Reviews.Author: Apodictic
Reviews.Content: The Empire Hotel is a refurbished classic with 11 floors, just across the street from Lincoln Center and very close to Central Park. It is timelessly stylish. The front desk is on one side of an oblong waiting room and flanked at each end by a large container full of fresh red apples. The cocktail lounge opens onto the same waiting room. The concierge was always staffed by courteous and informed, multilingual people, one of whom got me to a florist for an orchid corsage, provided a map, got me a complimentary New York Times, recommended a restaurant with outstanding lox and bagels, made a reservation at a jazz club, and deftly pocketed the tip I gave her for her invaluable assistance. Its proficient and courteous staff pressed my suits and shirts promptly, kept the room immaculate, and were unflappable when i was not ready for housekeeping before 9 a.m. The rooms tend toward exotic decor, with animal stripes on pillows and chairs, and white, tan and brown colors. They have high ceilings, commendably comfortable beds, and a flat-screen 32" television, wireless internet service, a comprehensively stocked honor bar (sensuous oils, scented candles, imported wines, an umbrella, and so on) and access to a free fitness center. The bathroom was the most unusual feature. There was a kind of funky feng shui shower with smooth wooden boards on the bottom, separated to let the water run down between them. There was only a partial glass - no shower curtain. I found my card had a lower out of town limit and they accommodated me promptly as I arranged for a higher one. I was unaccountably charged for parking (since I had not brought a car) but they removed the charge without question only to have it recur when I got back, as a separate charge against the card. I called the accounting office and the charge was removed, this time for good. This was the only problem I encountered in a stay of four nights. Everyone we dealt with was courteous and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay- rooms could use a fresh coat of paint”
Reviews.Author: MaloneV
Reviews.Content: It was fine. Glossy lobby and pool deck areas. Rooms probably were great when they were built, but they have definitely seen better days. Bathroom door swipes the toilet...the bathroom is that small.

Reviews.Title: “City Style”
Reviews.Author: Leighdee30
Reviews.Content: We had a room just 3 rooms away from the supposed bed bug room up on the 10th floor. Had NO problems with bugs at all. The room had a huge view of Lincoln Center. The hotel room was not large (a King Superior) but plenty of room to move around, a comfortable chair and small desk. Bathroom was a bit on the small side, but had L'Occitane shampoos, conditioners, etc.. Shower stayed hot through 2 showers each day (I had read otherwise on a review). The price was a little high, even with a discount for attending a wedding, but the location at the bottom west corner of Central Park, with Lincoln Center right there and P.J. Clarke's attached can't be beat. Be prepared to spend $30/day parking (valet is so easy and didn't cost more than parking garages) and about $50/day in taxes on the room. It was restful and comfortable and you can access the park right there. We did not get up to the roof, where there is a lounge, but heard it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: katiepep
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with six friends on a hen do. I've been to NY a few times before but my friends hadn't, and I have to say this is up there with my favourite hotel there. The rooms are teeny, as they are everywhere in manhattan, but nicely decorated with really comfortable beds. The bar is cool, and the location excellent. Personally I prefer to stay slightly further downtown, but being right next to central park you can't fault the location. Would definitely stay here again if I came back to NY...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: TahneeR
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel- it was a very posh looking hotel, the interior was decorated lovely, and the lobby was lit by candles- such a relaxing atmosphere. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Our room was very nice, but abit too small, and the air conditioning unit did not seem to work, therefore it was very stuffy and hot. The view from our room was the view of a vent outside, not the best view of New York, but we're not fussy and compain alot so we were fine. However we did complain aout the air conditioning as it was too unbeaurbly hot, however the receptionists were very nice and handled this issue. The rooftop pool looks big on the internet, but in real life was rather small. The roof top waiter/barman was very rude, demanding a tip, but we did not have any small bills so he just said 'come back tomorrow and tip me' which we found very rude, so we did not go back. Also the prices were very over priced- $40 for a sandwich, go to the shop below and get a nice one for $5. The location was so good and practical- right near 2 subway stations, centeral park, lincoln center and about a 20 min walk to Times square or a 5 min subway for $2.50 each. The subway was very cheap, you could travel downtown to the statue of liberty, soho, and south street sea poort ( a must!) for $2.50. Overall had a lovely time in NYC and want to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In NYC”
Reviews.Author: ggmaine
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at The Empire Hotel in NYC this June. The hotel was located in a prime location in NYC. Central Park was only a block away and my view of Lincoln Center was inspiring. Mariana M. at the front desk was very accommodating. You don't come across that many people in NYC with such impeccable customer service. I would recommend this hotel for anyone coming to NYC for a weekend or a week. Dont forget to check out the roof top deck. One word AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed with the service and mistakes the hotel made”
Reviews.Author: supersky1
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed from check-in to check-out. Also, I received my credit card statement today and realized they charged me twice for the mistake they made. I booked with a wedding block for the day of the wedding (with the bloc) and when i checked in they said i was a "no show" from 2 days before. They made me wait 10 minutes before I finally was able to check in. Now the manager said I have to wait until monday and call back for the reservations dep.t can then "look into it". Meantime I am charges another 330 dollars. The new reservations they made for me at time of check-in was priced higher and I had to dispute the different price upon check-out, further disrupting my day. I never dealt with such incompatencies and would never go back to the Empire Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room I ever seen for a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DMG777
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in great location .Room was ok for the size for one person . My only complaint was the front desk people was rude and not all there .

Reviews.Title: “hmmm...on second thought”
Reviews.Author: Canuckian_10
Reviews.Content: I walked in and immediately LOVED the place for it's decor. But shame on me, she who has on more than one occasion chosen wine because of it's cute label! Not only was the service at the front desk lackluster, but when I had issues with my bill, it took FOREVER to have it straightened out. And when it was resolved, they essentially tried to make ME feel bad for the mistake even though it was their error. The room was lovely, the bed was comfy.. and I'll even forgive the TINY bathroom. I swear the toilet might as well been IN the shower, the place was so small. The air conditioning didn't work and the room was hot as hell. It was actually comfortable cool outside yet my room HOT AS HELL. I asked for it to be taken care of - politely of course - to no avail. Got in late - around half past midnite, the front desk clerked assured me I could order room service as soon as I got up stairs. I called room service and was told that room service ended at 11 pm. REALLY!?!? No iron in the room, no outlets to be found to charge phones, no where to hang a garment bag. The list goes on. I actually don't complain about hotels... but this one REALLY got under my skin. Really folks?

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Empire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miktremb
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the comments on tripadvisor we gave this one a try and were extremely happy. The staff were fantastic in every way, from the front counter to the maid service, and went above and beyond our requests. It is a very cool hotel and the rooms were unique, we had the junior suite which was huge and very well appointed, especially considering the excellent price compared to other NYC hotels. The bed was amazingly comfy, down duvet on top, down mattress pad underneath. Located in Upper West Side NYC, lots of interesting neighborhood to roam and discover; a block from the train and a block from Central Park. We will definitely make this our home whenever we go to New York. Thank you Empire Staff, you made our 1st anniversary very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff and a Great location”
Reviews.Author: JenCasselli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my top faves in the city. The staff was so pleasant and accommodating during our stay there. The rooms were amazing and loved the rooftop bar. You also cannot beat the location......AMAZING! Will be returning very soon! :)

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking - You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: heidib13
Reviews.Content: This hotel does have a few nice features - great location, nice lobby/2nd floor lounge area, and lovely L'Occitane bath products. Unfortunately, the negatives outweighed the positives during my stay. The very narrow hallways with dark wallpaper were off-putting from the start. I was not expecting a large room, but was suprised to find such a small room with such minimal space surrounding the bed. Although the TV was nice, I would've preferred a desk upon which I could do my work. A leisure traveler might not have any problems with this, but between the lamp, TV, and tray of items for purchase on the small desk, I had no room to work on my small laptop. The brick wall view only emphasized the small, dark, cramped feeling of the room. In addition, the bathroom was not well cleaned upon my arrival and towels and bath products were not replenished. I am not a light sleeper, but the loud, outdated A/C woke me up every time it kicked on. I found the front desk and conceirge staff to be quite rude on my first night. I had spoke with the staff on another night, and found these ladies to be very warm and friendly. It seems the service is inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Isa_0908
Reviews.Content: First of all: We've been a bit concerned because of some negative reviews here, but all we can say now: We cannot confirm them at all. We've been in New York City from 05/28 until 04/06 to celebrate our 10th anniversary and we are so happy to chose Empire Hotel for our stay. The location is perfect - Central Park almost in front of the door, two subway stations nearby and not to forget Lincoln Center directly aside. The staff is very kind and helpful. Our room was available immediately and clean & definitely big enough (we've also got a "real" closet !?). The view was'nt stunning (backyard :-)) but HELLO? You're in New York!! Who needs a perfect view from the room with so many things to see & do outside? You also won't hear the sound of the air conditioner in the backyard after the second day. Summarized: We'll come back damn sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience - Treated like a criminal for using Priceline”
Reviews.Author: rmessing
Reviews.Content: Summary: A few things about this hotel were acceptable, but most of our stay was nightmarish. Tiny room, dirty, broken bathroom, treated like a criminal at check-in for using Priceline. I've never received service this bad, even from the DMV or homeland security. If they promise you something (like a room) over the phone, make sure you keep a recording. Background ( Summary: we got the hotel room for a few hours on a Saturday morning. The booking was for the night before. I called them to ensure that this would be acceptable. I should have recorded the call.) We had a rough red-eye coming into JFK at 6AM on a Saturday (the weekend before memorial day weekend), and I wanted to give my in-laws a chance to take a nap. Our hotel didn't have check-in until 4pm, so I went on priceline to get a hotel room for a couple of hours. I got the Empire Hotel, with a reservation for the day before (which would, of course, include that Saturday morning, until checkout). I called upon receiving the reservation to confirm that we could check-in 12 hours late, on Saturday morning, and was told that of course I could, though the person I spoke to seemed to think my couple-of-hour stay was a little weird. I also confirmed that we would have non-smoking rooms (I have an allergy). I thought I was all set, and had assured a few hours of rest... We arrived, totally exhausted, around 9 AM that Saturday (flight delay + traffic). Upon arrival, we were informed that our rooms were no longer available, since we hadn't checked in the day before. When I told them that I had called and made arrangements, the front desk worker asked who I spoke to. I told her that I didn't have the person's name, and from that point forward, was treated like I was trying to pull one over on them, although they had our reservation in their systems. After being told that the worker would have to check with her manager, I asked to speak with that manager. The manager was even less respectful than the clerk, demanding that I produce my priceline confirmation email (again, they had our original reservation still in their system), and proceeding to read through the 3-page terms and conditions on my phone, as though looking for a way out of their committment. Failing that, they put us in a converted broom closet whose floor plan had no more than half a foot between the wall and the bed at any point, save a desk and the bathroom (for reference, the JFK Airport LaQuinta inn's cheapest room was easily double the space). This was after an hour (or 1/3 of our stay, by the time we got there) spend arguing at the front desk. It's acceptable for them to use Priceline to assure occupancy. It's also acceptable for them to treat Priceline customers as second-class citizens. It's totally unacceptable for them to do both at the same time. As for the room itself: I've already mentioned the size. The furnishing were about what you'd expect at this price point, and had clearly been updated within the last decade. My room didn't have a dresser / drawers, but yours probably will. My room had a comibnation half-closet and mini-bar, hopefully yours would have a full closet. The bathroom was pretty dirty (tip to the maids: Sometimes you have to actually scrub the toilet to remove excrement - it didn't take us very long (though it was pretty gross)). The shower was done up to look like a sauna, which was a little weird. The shower apparatus itself was basically broken (It had a lot of sliding parts designed to allow you to adjust it, but it had been broken to the point where it only worked if you turned it away from the person being showered, and held it up in one hand. Combined with low water pressure, this was a tricky manuever (watch out for sharp edges on broken shower parts, too!). The poor bathroom, wooden floor, and sleep deprivation reminded me of the morning after the last night of summer camp, although the bed was nicer (and we didn't have a minibar at camp). We used their valet service, and kept our car there until the next morning. It was pretty efficient and convenient, although if you've got the time, you can some money by just going to a parking garage. Our next hotel had a 30-person check-in line when we arrived, and it still took less than half the time to check in, and no one even implied that I was scamming them.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lenann
Reviews.Content: We discovered The Empire Hotel online, accidentally ... it's wonderful! I was so impressed that this beautiful building is right at Lincoln Center (great location) and beautifully maintained. The sleeping rooms were a model of "everything thought out -- and well" -- it's not a lot of space (this is NYC, after all), but EVERYTHING is there, and it's comfortable and pretty. We loved the fresh flowers, the beautiful design of the lobby, the great food in The Chowder House restaurant. But the strongest thing about this hotel is the people who work there. They are, in our experience, to a person, kind, thoughtful, friendly and helpful. I travel for a living, so I experience a lot of hotels all over the world. This one is truly impressive. And the price we paid was MUCH less than I would have expected to pay for all this. Here's hoping The Empire is able to stay just the way it is!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: WaveyDavey1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my brothers wedding in April 2010. Travelling with a small baby we did have our reservations but nothing could prepare us for the nightmare that would follow. Arriving at the hotel at 7pm we were keen to get to our room and get our baby to sleep. We had emailed a request for a cot to be present in the room and also rang ahead to confirm this was the case. We were told that there was no record of this on the booking. However a cot would arrive straight away. 2 hours later following 10 visits to an empty front desk and having been repeatedly been told "it's in the lift" or even better "they are in the corridor" (whilst I walked around the corridor unable to spot the invisible cot). Eventually it arrived with a now hysterical child beyond comfort. We had booked a king size room - no such booking available and no room available. As other reviews the room was so small that it we were barely able to unpack our suitcases. We had stayed in NY the previous year and had no so such problems. No offer of compensation until we complained for the 10th time to the manager - free breakfast! Brilliant. We then got moved to a new room on the 11th floor - the whole floor was like a sauna and the room even hotter! Window wide open / closed -air con on full blast - no difference and no support from the hotel. All in all a dreadful stay and one which ruined our time in NY. This place is great if are happy to sleep in a box room and have as poor service as you imagine. Returning? You must be joking!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, definitely will go back”
Reviews.Author: danroel1
Reviews.Content: When we entered into the hotel, the lobby gave the impression of being a classy and sophisticated hotel as well as it being modern. We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful front desk who quickly got us settled into our room. The room that we stayed in was extremely clean, decorated nicely, and the beds were large and had remarkably soft linens. The showers were amazingly comfortable and had a rainfall style to them. I was treated with respect and had a great experience and would definitely recommend staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Below Par”
Reviews.Author: NZShearer
