Reviews.Content: Took a world tour in April / May 2011. During the trip we stayed at maybe 12 hotels. The Empire Hotel was the most expensive in the whole trip. We stayed at 4-star hotels and some 3-star. The Empire Hotel was also the worst from the point of view of the following: cramped standard room, fixtures and fittings not working or in poor repair, queues at front desk, concierge service poor. The only real saving graces were the bell staff who were friendly and helpful, and the lady on the front desk, Vanna, who worked tirelessly - against the odds. The other saving grace was the location, which was very central and convenient. I complained, was upgraded, and then it was better, but still poor value for money, and not a great experience. My experience is that there are a lot better hotels for the money than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful stay”
Reviews.Author: Greg55500
Reviews.Content: My first time ever writing a review on Trip Advisor. This is one of the worst hotels I've stayed at in NYC. It is quite outdated. I got a good deal for my 3 night stay however through Travel Zoo at $189/night. The outdated A/C was very loud. You can hear it turn on and off during the day and night. You could not adjust the temperature, just max, min, or off. The walls were paper thin. I could hear all my neighbors down the hall close or open their doors. You could hear people walking down the hallway and talking. The humidity level in the hallways and the room was out of control, which makes the summer stay even more unbearable. The bathroom was puny. The edge of the door to the bathroom almost reached the toilet. You could not sit there and close the door. This is one of the smallest bathrooms that I've been in in NYC. The other smallest bathrooms I've been in was at the Hudson Hotel, a few blocks away in Columbus Circle. The shower was missing a glass door. I think they attempted a Euro style shower style that FAILED. Every time I took shower, half the bathroom floor would be drenched in water. When the maid service cleaned the room, they did not even give me more towels. Wifi -- Paying $12.95 is a ripoff. It is completely unreliable. I stayed here 2yrs ago and expected them to improve it. It was unreliable back then, too. Wifi in this day and age should be complementary. Location is great if you want to be in the Upper Westside and close to Columbus Circle and next to the Lincoln Center. It has heavy tourist traffic though. Expect to pay at least $20 in cabfare if you head down to the MPD or Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Too many other great hotels in NYC to go back to the Empire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovenyc6000
Reviews.Content: I thought for awhile before writing this review because I am not the type of person 'who likes to complain for the sake of complaining' but rather a person who uses this site for what it is intended to 'advise' other travelers. If I had booked through a discounted website then indeed I would not be as apt to write but I paid full price for a very disappointing stay. I canceled a reservation at a different hotel and booked the Empire when my son and wife said they could could join me on my stay. Friends had taken us to dinner at Ed's on our last visit and I fell in love with the beautiful lobby and thought the kids would love it. Looking over the reviews I knew the hotel had small rooms so booked the the Deluxe Room King for myself and the Junior Suite King for my son. I was amazed how small the room was and I could not get my suitcase past the bed so left it by the door. The room only had a shower and no tub and yes the shower let water all over the floor. The hotel not have a coffee maker in the room and the hotel forbids one to be brought in. When my son checked in Friday their room was not ready at 3:00 pm so they used my room to get ready. When we came back later that night their room was so hot you had to open windows to tolerate it and surprisingly their room only had a tub but no shower. There was a letter in the room explaining that the lobby and lounge would be closed all day on Saturday for a private event with a list of nearby establishments for quests to use. The reason for booking the hotel was meet to relax and unwind between outings in the lounge area. When I asked about it at the desk the staff sounded surprised and said they must be shooting again leaving me to think that this was not unusual for the hotel to block off the entire lobby except for the check in area and elevators. When I asked why I was not told about this when booking the hotel just a few days ago they said they didn't know why. As a small boutique hotel it is too small to book out the lobby and lounge without impacting the guests. The private party was still going on at 1:30 am. That night the hotel had no hot water so we were unable to take baths or shower. When I called about the problem they said there were working on it but it was not fixed by the time we checked out on Sunday. When I complained at the desk about how disappointed I was with the stay the desk person offered to take 1/2 off of the rooms for Saturday. The problem was when I arrived home the discount did not come through on my credit card and I had to call and have the Director of the Front Office correct the problem. I told her I was also upset that as many times as I spoke to the staff at the front desk that my son was not to receive the bill he had one placed under his door anyway. Kind of giving a gift with the price tag still on. The Front office person was very apologetic and extended an offer to return to the hotel with a discounted rate.off of a future visit. After following the subsequent reviews since my stay I can only say stay at your own risk. It definitely is a hit or miss sort of place and life is too short and money too tight to take a gamble that the hotel will provide what it advertises. We will not be returning even with a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Aardvaark52
Reviews.Content: Efficient staff and helpful concierge but bar staff unbelievably arrogant and aloof. Good rooms, comfortable beds and we had a good view of Broadway. Noisy traffic but hey this is NYC. convenient for Central Park and Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “I think I got the worst room they had.”
Reviews.Author: largeFamily101
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great. It was right next to Lincoln Center and close to Central Park. The decor of the room and lobby was interesting. Unfortunately, my room was small (not much bigger than the queen sized be in it. It was on floor one, inside, with a loud roof top air conditioner that roared all night. Also, 1/2 of my shower door was missing, so the bathroom got drenched when I took a shower.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelBermuda
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Empire and it was GREAT. Apart from a miscommunication at the front desk regarding my initial arrival the stay was perfect. The room was a good size on the 5th floor. It was a double/double room with plenty of space for the two of us to spread out. The lobby was great to hang out in while I waited for my friend to finish their business dinner. Lots of comings and goings of regular people and also a celebrity or two!! Funky music being played and what I think was the coldest glass of Prosecco in New York was served to me. Well done Hotel Empire. I ended up spending time in the Lobby a couple more times in the late evenings. Staff was friendly and courteous especially the bellmen and the bouncers to the rooftop lounge and the housekeepers were accommodating with my requests for extra amenities. If you want a great location for dining and shoppiong and a funky atmosphere, then the hotel Empire is your place. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “small room, nice room amenities, excellent linen”
Reviews.Author: Dmk05
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small, and the service average. Room amenities are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Won't waste my time looking here for my next NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: phantom6e
Reviews.Content: I reserved a standard queen room on Expedia for $190/night. The website notes that these are queen beds, but our room wasn't even large enough to fit a queen bed. Instead we had a full size bed and a bathroom where you could barely open the door. I've stayed in NYC plenty of times and have never paid so much for such a small space with a view of the interior building furnace. The good news is the location is good and staff was friendly. However, this room should have been further discounted because it is about half the size of their normal queen rooms and didn't include a queen bed. Maybe this hotel simply stiffs Expedia travelers. That would be pretty terrible if that is the case. I will not stay at this hotel again. There are plenty other places with friendly staff, nice locations and rooms bigger than a closet. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: jen2286
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spent 4 nights at the Empire Hotel and i would highly recommend. The rooms were very well decorated, clean and had everything you need. The room was pretty small but that is New York for you but it was big enough for what you needed.The location was perfect. 2 min walk to Central Park, 10 min walk to Times Square and a row of great restaurants accross the road. The reception staff were really helpfull and so were the porter staff who helped with your bags and getting you a taxi whenever you needed one. The hotel has a great gym, we didnt go there to use the gym but as we checked out alot earlier than our flight the hotel gave us a key to the gym so we could go up and shower and change before we left for the airport. I would definutly recommend this hotel and although it was slightly more pricey than the others it was well worth it for the quality and location. I would however not recommend the hotel bar if you are on a reasonable budget! Any questions please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: metwrt
Reviews.Content: Great location. That must be what we paid for . The room was small, but this is New York, after all. For more than $400, I foolishly hope for a bit more luxury. It was clean, the couple of small pieces of trash left under the desk notwithstanding. Maybe the maid was in hurry. Who could blame her? Bed was comfortable, but the noise from the rooftop AC units made me glad I travel with earplugs. There was no bath mat; not a major crisis but still... All in all, it was comfortable, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back but....”
Reviews.Author: redkerr15
Reviews.Content: I really did like the hotel, it was hip and very nicely decorated. Loved the location. Felt the bath room was a bit small but the room was a fine size for an NY hotel. Ed's Chowder House was fab for a snack and cocktail at the bar. And like another reviewer I loved the "S" cocktail. BUT...service was pretty bad. We had the weirdest phone in our room, would ring once and stop...ALL NIGHT. Complained 3 times and nothing was done. On checkout I was told I could negotiate a better rate next time because of this! We ordered a breakfast and the tea and toast were cold. At least this was deducted. All in all, stay for the hip atmosphere and location. Don't expect great service.

Reviews.Title: “Order an "S" at the bar”
Reviews.Author: IwannagoSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the empire hotel. It is what we expected - a hip atmosphere with a great bar and rooftop bar. The cocktails were delicious - named for the gossip girl characters - I loved the "S" a mixture of vodka, champagne, and lemon juice - yum! While the decor is hip, it is very dark and on closer look it is very apparent that this is an old hotel that has been updated superficially. The rooms are very small, but nice. The robes are Frete. The bathroom was so tiny - I'm 5'2 and it still felt cramped. No room for my toiletries bag - or a trashcan. Great location - right next to Lincoln Center. All in all, just fine for our one night stay and I was happy with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience, Romantic Location”
Reviews.Author: revpar35
Reviews.Content: I was planning to propose to my girlfriend in Central Park and needed a hotel nearby for the occasion. The Empire Hotel is right across the street from Lincoln Center and just off Central Park West, the perfect location. I called the manager ahead of time and mentioned my plans for the proposal. Upon arrival I was upgraded to a junior suite with a fabulous view of the city. I was so impressed with this gesture as well as the excellent, friendly service at the front desk. After my proposal in CP and dinner at the Boathouse Restaurant we returned to our room and found a complementary bottel of chamgagne waiting for us! How surprised and delighted we were. It is service like that that ensures I would recommend the Empire to all my friends and will certainly stay there again on my next trip to NYC. I should also mention the beautiful lobby and rooftop lounge were also equally impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Woody2001
Reviews.Content: One block away from central park and walking distance to many attractions this hotel has a great location in a nice part of town. The rooms were clean and spacious. All the staff really put themselves out to help. Manana in particular was extreamly helpful and always friendy. If you have a sweet tooth check out the Bouchon Bakery in the Lincon Centre it's amazing. Next time I am in New York I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE LET DOWN!! RUDE STAFF, TINY ROOMS!! NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zoe1999
Reviews.Content: First of all, i have never wrote a review for a hotel before but after returning from this hotel i felt that i need to vent my frustration!!!!! I was really looking forward to this trip for my parters 30th. I originaly booked another hotel, then decided to upgrade to the Empire- I needed not bother! the welcoming reception staff was rude to say the least. Extremely unhelpful. got the keys to a tiny room, a 'single' which apparently i ordered!! you couldnt even walk around the bed. the window faced a brick wall not 1.5 metres away!! I went to reception to complain and she told me that they would give me a 'courtesy upgrade' - UPGRADE MY EYE!! The next room we got was on the 9th floor and facing yet another brick wall still tiny exactly the same as the last room! The hotel was dark and unwelcoming, the rooftop bar was closed- the pool was closed even though it was really hot all the time we were there. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone. stop somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Phony place”
Reviews.Author: jpvdp75
Reviews.Content: Besides the location this place is everything but a bargain. For 330 $ a night without taxes you get either a room on the minuscule courtyard with a direct access to charming noise the condenser fans of he air-conditioning system with windows resembling toilets opening. There is nothing to see anyway or a room with regular windows but so small there is absolutely no place to put your personal belonging except in your suitcase so try not to stay there more than a night. The first day when we came back there was no towel , the second day when we came back @ 1h30 the room was not clean,room service promised to send someone right away and @ 3pm when we came back the room was still not cleaned. I f you are on your own avoid this place by all means JP Vanderpol

Reviews.Title: “Baby Moon was unreal at the Empire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MauiMeesh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Maui, Hawaii and expecting our first child. We wanted to go on a vacation that was completely different from our life style back home and well, NYC, couldn't fit the bill any better. The number of hotels to choose from in NYC is daunting and I went with my gut and chose The Empire Hotel. Great Decision! I love the room, the location and especially the kindness and Aloha of Don Chatham the Guest Services Manager. It was boutiquey and hip without the attitude. A wonderful experience at The Empire Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love love loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests I absolutely loved and thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Empire Hotel! I stayed here with my sister for my 30th birthday for 4 nights. It has a great location opposite the Lincoln Centre and a very short walk to Columbus Circle at the southside of Central Park! So perfect location! All the staff at the hotel made our stay very special and they really looked after us! Their service is first class! They were all so helpful and friendly always willing to help and advise on fabulous places to go and how to get there. Sean- Thank you for all the advice on which clubs to visit! And for upgrading us to our fab double room certainly made our stay much more comfortable! And for waiving the fee it was very kind of you! You're the best! Uri- thank you so much for making our reservations at Daniel we had a lovely meal! Romeo- thank you for being so friendly and helpful and just being fabulous! Mirium- thank you for your advise on where to party too! Will definitely visit those places next time! In closing the hotel is amazing, comfortable, beautiful love the art deco style, and all the staff are so friendly and helpful and can't do enough to make your stay special! Also check out the roof top bar it's got a really cool vibe we met some really cool people there too! So thank you to all at the Empire and we will definitely be back as soon as we can and we will be staying with you! Take care and see you all soon! Love Bobbie & Kerry Peck

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Olive1989
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the empire hotel with my mum. It was a lovely hotel, very well decorated and very glamorous. The only problem we had was the service we only found a few members of staff that were kind and helpful the rest just were not interested which is quite off putting. Other than that hotel was gorgeous and the perfect place to feel glamorous. We had a lovely stay and would still love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 4875derricm
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York City and I couldn't have been happier with the Empire Hotel. My friend and I were here for 4 nights. The room was cozy, but we didn't spend much time there except for sleeping. Great view overlooking Broadway and Lincoln Center. Comfortable beds and great maid service. The concierge and doormen were friendly and helpful. The rooftop nightclub was a hit with great service there as well. Overall an awesome experience and a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Candymota
Reviews.Content: Where do we even begin? The hotel in and of itself is beautiful. HOWEVER, the service is exactly the OPPOSITE. We reach the rooftop to hang out with friends and enjoy ourselves, only to have by far the slowest and most unprofessional service ever. I get it, its New York, people will be tough, but as a native New Yorker I am disgusted and quite frankly deeply disappointed by the level of treatment provided to us at the rooftop and the failure of any appropriate follow up or accomodations. The location is ideal, however if you can shop around for a better hotel PLEASE do so. Absolutely a true waste of money. Website is highly misleading, there is no spa available and the pool was "under renovation." Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “ADVISE DO NOT STOP AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: scottgregg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked into the EMPIRE HOTEL for three nights commencing 23rd, April 2011. This hotel was booked on our behalf by a cruise company as part of a 14 day trip covering Las Vegas, New York and returning on the QM2. When we arrived at the hotel we had trouble getting into the reception due to lots of people outside presumably waiting to get into the hotel for partying. We finally got to reception and to be honest the attitude of the staff left alot to be desired. We got our room key for a room on the first floor and struggled with our two cases into the dirty lift, no one offered any help at all. When we entered our room we couldn't beleive how small the room was, there were no wardrobes the floor was dirty and when we opened the blinds we looked out into another walled area. There realy was not enough room for us to unpack our suitcases. My wife was in tears so we went down to reception to say we were cancelling our booking and going to find a more suitable hotel. The assistant guest manager was quite blase' about our concerns and really didn't seem bothered that we were leaving. We then got into a taxi and stayed at a real 4* hotel in Lexington Avenue and made sure we enjoyed our time in fantastic New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but better hotels out there”
Reviews.Author: wendavey
Reviews.Content: The Empire was perfectly adequate but by no means the best hotel we've stayed at in New York. Both the On the Avenue and the Alex were better. although the Empire's location near Columbus Circle and Central Park gave it the edge in that regard. We had persistent problems with the room key cards - trivial perhaps but a PITA when trekking up and down several floors every day laden with shopping and bags after finding you can't get into your room. The hotels' decor wasn't too our taste. It could easily have been based on Bet Lynch's bedroom. The decor was so dark - a mix of browns, and the room lights so dim that it quickly became annoying. Drinks at the bar were very expensive - but then most hotels are of course. On the plus side there is a Starbucks right next door that opens as early as 5.30am, a PJ Clarkes (limited and expensive menu) right next door, but around the corner a fine diner called the Flame.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations and an amazing room with a view over the Lincoln Centre”
Reviews.Author: Footloose1066
Reviews.Content: We specifically asked for a quiet room with a view and were prepared to upgrade and pay extra. The staff at the hotel were very helpful (but I was persistent!) and the room we were given on the 9th floor was very big with 2 double beds and a superb view of the Lioncoln Centre. The bedding and towels were superb, the beds extremely comfortable, the staff very friendly and the lobby bar candle lit and very welcoming. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will certainly be going back there. It helped to make our stay in New York very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “You've got to be kidding!!”
Reviews.Author: lulupearl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend and the online photos looked great. The location certainly is wonderful. However, the room is smaller than a closet...nowhere to put anything!! Seriously, my husband and I came with two rather small suitcases and there was nowhere to put things. The bathroom is so small; there is no room to put any toiletries. And, I HATE when hotels gouge their guest with extra fees for the internet (double if you each have a computer). "Free" internet in the lobby, but it's so loud there that there is no place to sit peacefully if you have to work. Why not just add a few dollars to the room fee and include the damn internet? We thought this would be a good alternative to the Hilton, but don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, wonderful room!”
Reviews.Author: JulieSpring
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at hotels across the city, I was excited to spend a night at the Empire, which is located next to one of the best places on Earth -- The Met Opera. My sister, mother, and I were not disappointed! Courtney at the desk was accommodating to my specific needs for a room (nowhere near the rooftop bar, view of Lincoln Center). While at reception, we watched as a group of four people got increasingly irritated with the desk staff over a room reservation, which apparently had not been reserved correctly by the guests. I was impressed (and somewhat relieved) that the staffers diffused the situation by inviting them elsewhere to sit down and talk. The staff remained professional throughout. The hotel is a little pricey if you can't find a deal, but with the view, easy access to the Met, sparkling room, and turn-down service with a down-feather mattress top and comforter, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but you need to be very specific with your requests.”
Reviews.Author: Markkk014
Reviews.Content: In this review I’ll try to address all the major critics people have made about the hotel, from my own experience. My partner and I stayed in the hotel for a week during the Easter week. Since I have read all the reviews on noisy inner rooms due to the venting system, flooding showers, scandalous lobby, rude staff and noise form the rooftop, I wrote an e-mail two weeks before arriving in the hotel specifically requesting a room away from the noise sources listed above and which wouldn’t flood (since I’d read some people’s reviews which said they managed to get reassigned to such better kinds of rooms). They replied a few minutes later saying they would add this special request to my reservation. We arrived very early on Sunday morning so we left our luggage and went out to enjoy the city. We came back at around 3 PM and they assigned us to one of the inner rooms, close to the venting system and with the flooding showers! I couldn’t believe it... We went back to the front desk and the girl was really nice and she reassigned us immediately to another room, but the room happened to be in the exact same area, only three floors below. Consequently, we had to go back with our entire luggage to the front desk, and the lady said there was no special request in our reservation. Since I had the e-mail on my phone, I showed it to her and she called the manager. The manager was polite but not offering much help. He even said all the rooms within the category we’d booked face the venting system to what I replied that if they had told me so when I sent the e-mail, then I would have had the choice to decide whether keeping my reservation or cancelling it. It was not until we approached him again and told him: “Ok, we’re very tired, we’ve been waiting for a room for 10 hours, after a 16-hours flight (with connections) give us whatever you have” that he reacted and placed us in a new room. I must admit it was very nice of him to upgrade us to a better room located in the 10th floor. The room was still a little noisy because of the venting system and my partner noticed the reason was the apparatus was missing; there was a hole in the wall. The following morning they must have come and put the machine because when we arrived the noise was gone. Regarding the other most-read complains, (i) the music in the lobby was cool, not loud at all. There was a great atmosphere in the lobby, as if you were in cool club. The lobby is amazingly beautiful and the bartenders are really good doing cocktails. (ii) Despite we were in the 10th room we didn’t hear any noise from the rooftop. (iii) All the staff was very polite and nice, the room was great and clean (despite some of the deco was really avant-garde, some was kind of over the top), the bed was extra comfortable and the shower was lovable. L’Occitane products are a plus, and I loved to see they had Argentine Malbec in the minibar (despite I didn’t have any). There’s a great view at the rooftop and it’s worth going for a drink. The location of the hotel is great, just across Lincoln Center with access to the subway. One experience you should not miss while in NY is renting a bike to ride around Central Park, you can do so in Columbus Circle, just 3 blocks away from the hotel. So, despite the little misunderstanding at the beginning, our overall experience at the Empire Hotel was great, I would totally recommend it. If you reserve in advance, you can get a pretty good deal ;-).

Reviews.Title: “Great night’s sleep!”
Reviews.Author: JBSNYC
Reviews.Content: I would personally recommend the Empire Hotel to family, friends and business colleagues who are traveling to the Big Apple. The staff at the hotel is professional and beyond friendly to make your visit a relaxing one. Had one of the best night’s sleeps I can remember in their clean comfortable rooms with soft sheets on the beds. Again, If you are coming to NYC I would highly recommend the Empire Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nanook02
Reviews.Content: The junior sweet that my brother and I shared was clean stylish and spacious. The view was not the best but you can't have everything the location was great. short walk to the metro Drank at the bar in the hotel on Sunday night great service from the guy working that night I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Ok - yet very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Benodon
Reviews.Content: I stayed four days in the hotel. The location is good and the rooms are Ok, the noise level can be incredibly high though. I also stayed in other hotels in NY and some rooms in the Empire are way noisier than the NY average, especially the ones that overlook the back of the hotel (and are above the AC unit). If you get rooms overlooking the street the hotel is quite Ok I find. The Fitness Centre is a real joke though and doesn't deserve its name. It should be rebranded as "Two normal rooms containing some fitness machines".

Reviews.Title: “Day enhancing smiles”
Reviews.Author: inglea
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfort and service. Zuli and Helena at the front desk are supremely competent, and their smiles will make your day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, could do better”
Reviews.Author: TheRockette
Reviews.Content: When we checked in there was a problem with the reservation. We had booked four nights, and they only had two in their system! Only after talking with them for a while, they changed our stay to what we had booked. I thought the receptionist was kind of difficult. At a certain point we thought we had to find another hotel for the other two nights... It's not professional to blame someone else (booking.com) for problems and to tell your guest it's not your fault. Professionally you should just have a look at the confirmation and solve the problem instead of waisting time on blaming another. Another guest checking in at the same time booked a special room through his travel agent and not being able to give him that room, it was the fault of the travel agent. Very unprofessional. We asked for quiet rooms and rooms together, but as we checked this during check in, the rooms still needed to be assigned ('oh, i can do that for you') so we were on the same floor. This having booked in Octobre i thought was not professional. They clearly do not keep any comments on the reservation in mind. All standard rooms have a buzzing sound coming from the airconditioning due to the location (inner courtyard) . It's a really present sound, quite loud. If you book, you should book a superior room (but there are some that overlook this inner courtyard as well). If you take these improfessional issues away, and you don't have problems to sleep with noise, you will be ok in this hotel. The room facilities are good: a small but nice bathroom, very good beds, beautiful design. The rooftop terrace is excellent when weather allowes, very nice view and friendly and efficient service. Next to this, the location of the hotel is very good, only a 15 minute walk from Times Square, with a lot of shops and restaurants on the way. The Starbucks on the corner is a plus to have breakfast or coffee. There are always taxis outside and the Columbus Circle subway is only a 3 minute walk. My conclusion would be that if they would try harder to provide not only 4 star facilities, but also a 4 star service, this hotel would be one of the best in New York.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels than the empire!!”
Reviews.Author: Perrymar
Reviews.Content: Mold on the shower heads, maids walking into the room when we are asleep, key cards stop working, insisting you pay for wireless connection when it was stated that it was included......................the fact that most of our visit was spent away from the hotel doing the sites, eating etc. Means our stay wasn't spoilt..........we will go back to New York, we won't go back to the empire

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel the most comfortable bed and a lovely shower!”
Reviews.Author: lucy_worsfold
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel as expected. Staff very friendly and a helpful concierge. Comfortable room with the best bed and pillows I have ever had on a holiday. Always very clean and tidy. Not far from central park or the shops! Excellent transfer in hotel car to airport on departure. Nothing negative to say!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: MaryNH
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews because we were traveling with our two children (5 yr old and teenager) and didn't want to deal with late night party noise inside the hotel or feel out of place. We needn't have worried! First, we were made to feel extremely welcomed by Romeo at the front desk. He was friendly and professional and our room was ready right away. Romeo gave us a beautiful corner suite with fabulous views of Lincoln center (right across the street) and the city. We were so happy! The location of the hotel is fabulous. The room was huge by NY standards and well decorated and the bed was very comfortable. Although there is a 20-something vibe in the lobby and presumably the top floor bar, we didn't feel out of place thanks to Romeo and the door men who were super friendly to us (and helpful storing our luggage for several hours after checkout) and didn't roll their eyes at our 5 year old as she climbed on the nice lobby furniture. Plus, there were plenty of other families staying there as well. We had a great sleep with only the typical NYC street noise, no noise from inside the hotel. We felt like we were treated very well and would be happy to stay here again. Romeo set the tone for the whole stay and we want to say thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: proudrepublican
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel. If you plan on doing anything at Lincoln Center, this is the hotel to stay in. It is right across the street from Lincoln Center. The rooms are smallish..but that is NYC. However, the rooms are clean and modern. The bed is luxurious with tons of big pillows and a thick down comforter. The decor is updated and stylish. The bathrooms are done in an Asian-inspired decor and very luxurious. My favorite thing...this sounds crazy...but I love the L'Occitaine toiletries! The bar is really lovely and a cozy place to grab a glass of wine or cocktail before heading out. Lots of comfy, but not frumpy, couches with little tables and candles everywhere. A romantic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Renovation”
Reviews.Author: JackWG
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay since it was renovated. Hte rooms are compact and the bathrooms are tiny. However it was well appointed, trendy in design, welcoming and well located for the Met. The staff was welcoming and helpful. The hotel was clean and well run. Would return for its location, price and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jheart16
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable. It could have been a little cleaner. Great Location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but that's where it stops”
Reviews.Author: MMP54
Reviews.Content: It's a shame that the Empire Hotel is so poorly run. It is an ideal location for a visitor - very convenient to shopping and restaurants and easy access to transportation. However, the hotel is not well managed and is challenged to offer even the basic accomodations. It has been removated with a hip look but the upgrade is all superficial. The lobby is dark, cramped, and uncomfortable. The staff at the front desk seem disorganized and distracted. The night my son and I arrived at the hotel at 5:30pm the small lobby was overwhelmed with guests and luggage. The line was long to check in. I could hear the angry tone from many other guests so I wasn't surprised that I was told that my room was not ready. I was told that it would be another 30 minutes to an hour before the maids could get a room cleaned for us. I was offered a larger room for an upgrade fee of $50 but it was a smoking room so that was not an option for me. Instead we stored our luggage and went for a walk even though we had been up since 5 am and we were exhausted. About an hour later I tried to check in again and was told that no rooms were available - same song second verse. I was unhappy but decided there wasn't much I could do about it . So we went to dinner without being able to freshen up. By 9 pm when I finally got to the front of the line for the third time, I threw a fit when I was told that the cleaning staff was still working on a room. Because I was so irate, they finally put us in a room. The room was supposed to be two queen beds. There is no way those beds were queen. More like a twin and a half or very small doubles. The linens were nice and the tv was fine - the decor was updated. Room extremely small but that doesn't bother me so that wasn't an issue. The issue ws that the room is just not comfortable at all. There was no ac to speak of. The room was extremely hot and there was no temperature control. I called housekeeping who told me that I had to lift up a grate on the unitl and there would be some buttons to turn the fan to high or low. I managed to get some air circulating but it was far from satisfactory and I centainly would have expected that to have been updated during the renovation. The bathroom is modern and stylish but so small that it is not luxiorous at all. To top it off, we had absolutely no hot water. When I called to complain they had obviously heard that complaint before and there was nothing they could do. I was on the third floor and it was extremely loud all night. The noise from the street is not that bad - it's the city after all so that is to be expected. But since they were still celaning rooms late into the night the housekeeping noises were unbearable - carts clashing - loud voices in the hall. A maid unlocked our door and attempted to come in our room twice. I was glad to be checking out after one very disappointing night in this hotel. By the way, scrutinize your bill. The chaos at the reception desk means that you may have erroneous charges that will need to be removed. In my case it was parking but there were others that were charged the wrong rate etc.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey,High Traffic area”
Reviews.Author: ottawa198
Reviews.Content: 1st impression after settling into room was the noise level of the traffic below our 5th floor corner suite. Windows are not triple glazed and could hear every taxi beeping their horn and every bus screeching their wheels into the very wee hours. Although the bed was very comfortable, it did not make up for the noise level. The lighting in the room is very poor (too low lighted to even read a book). Chairs in the room were cheap and were creaking apart, lamps in room were also cheap and missing switches to manually turn them on. Bathroom lighting was minimal and off centered from the mirrow ... couldn't put on makeup in there and had to use hand mirror by the window to see what I was doing. As well there was very little space for one's own toiletries. For a sutie, there wasn't even a hall closet to hang our coats or our guest's coats when they arrived. If you want to stay here (near Lincoln Center) bring minimal clothing as storage is poor, ear plugs, and some high wattage bulbs to see your way around. Even lobby was dim and tacky. No free wi fi in room for over $550 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: WithaDoggieinSeattle
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Empire Hotel. The bed was very comfortable and we were able to get quality sleep. Rooms were about average for NYC, but we did not feel claustrophobic. Being able to get on the subway within two blocks was a major plus for this hotel. Plus, with all of the wonderful restaurants (and two blocks to Central Park) we really could not have chosen a better location for a hotel. We read that the front desk had a "running map" available and were hoping for a map of Central Park since it was nearby. What we were given was a map of the entire city - and told that the green hashes were the running routes - but there were no distances, nothing specific, it was just a basic concierge map. Not sure if we would stay there again, but the location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: beto_san
Reviews.Content: The place have been recently renewed, including the rooms. By the way, the room is really small. The bath doesn't have door or curtain, wich is weird, but the repcionist told me that was the "european design". I din't know European people liked to wash the bathroom everytime they take a shower. The hi-speed internet access is only complementary on the lobby, as in the rooms they charge $13 for 24 hours. And the speed isn't that high... the location is great, although if you want to stay closer to Times Square, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Exeperience at the Empire”
Reviews.Author: mordkramer
Reviews.Content: I have recently started tostay at the Empire Hotel when I am in NYC. In spite of its reputation as a luxury hotel and its great location, the pricing is always attractive and the service is impeccable. I was surprised to receive an upgrade this week. It was a real treat to stay in such an amazing room. Thanks to MAriana and the entire staff for another great experience at the Empire!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hip hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: khonkaen
Reviews.Content: In town for 20 hours on busines and this place was great. Good value, clean sleek rooms and best of all a super comfortable bed to sleep in. Staff was helpful especially the bell/doormen. Romeo at the front desk was also very pleasurable. Only complaints would be not enough outlets to charge gear the bar closed very early and other than that great place I'll be back in three weeks

Reviews.Title: “Great place.....”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboylufc
Reviews.Content: After a long journey we arrived at the hotel and the first impression was impressive. A swift check in and we got to our room. It was on the first floor, small and very warm.Opened the window and the view was of the opposite wall and the air con fans were loud. Straight back to reception and we were given another room on the 6th floor - same scenario, no view and too noisy. Another trip to reception, very unhappy at this stage. We were given a new room on the 8 th floor, much bigger, no noise and the air con was on! Brilliant, very pleased with it, a great view up toward the Lincoln Centre. After this the only blip we had was a toilet blockage which was dealt with quickly and without fuss. The bed was a king size, mega comfy. The only gripe would be that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and the mini bar prices were steep ( but when are they not?). The hotel is well placed for all the nearby sights and close to the Subway to go downtown for the ferries etc. We had a great time and would definitely stay here again although if we had to stay in one of the first two rooms the review would have been totally different!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean hotel near the Lincoln Centre and Central Park.”
Reviews.Author: Oggy100
Reviews.Content: Overall the empire hotel was very good. We had a standard room which, although a little on the small side, was very clean and well decorated. The hotel is well located opposite the Lincoln centre and is near to the subway and central park. The staff were very helpful and the hotel has a great cocktail bar on the 12th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Empire Strikes Back -- Shower Heads w/deadly aim”
Reviews.Author: 1896traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Hotel for business. Terrific location & a hop-skip to the subway. Very key. The Empire Hotel was a bit of a flea bag the last time I was there. But that was over 10 years ago. The NEW Empire has had a makeover. The lobby is a little too dark for me. It felt more like the lobby of a nightclub -- not a hotel. But the staff was friendly & efficient. The room was a good size. The mattress & the decor was above average. Overall, the room was solid. But beware of the bathroom. Besides being tiny (not a surprise), the sink isn't very deep & the faucet is just a few inches away. Not big deal right? Well, turn on the water & there's a good chance you'll create a little mess. But hey, it's just a lilttle water right? Well, how about if you're getting ready for an early morning shower...you turn on the water & the european shower head is strategically aimed at you! And you get blasted w/ice cold water! Not fun. The carpet in the room was soaked & I let out a pretty good scream until I finally turned off the water. The shower had a glass partition that reached half-way. So of course the water hit me. Ice Water at 7:00am. Rude awakening. Is it the hotel's fault? Of course not. But the bathroom design gets a minus from me. The hotel's hallways are very dark with real ugly wallpaper. Sure I'm nitpicking. But that's why I review my hotel stays. Overall, the Empire has improved by leaps & bounds. You can't beat the location. But there are plenty of good hotels in NYC. Explore what's out there!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and location we have had in the past five years visiting NYC.”
Reviews.Author: Newt0n31
Reviews.Content: We visit NYC at least once a year, every year after moving from the city to Atlanta. We are quite familiar with the NYC/NJ area and always look for a prime hotel/location for our stay. We have found it! The Empire Hotel is now at the top of our list. Special thanks to Sean, Mariana, Maggie and Ash for making the stay more memorable. We look forward to seeing them on our next trip [and will tell friends to book lodgings at The Empire Hotel and to say 'hello!'.]

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern, chic”
Reviews.Author: TheWs18
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas for our honeymoon. We travelled from the UK and I was very nervous about staying due to the previous reviews from other customers. However I was pleasantly surprised. The door staff are fabulous and very friendly, especially on our final day when we were trying to get to the airport via a shuttle bus, it never arrived due to snow and the door men went out of their way to organise a town car for us. Our room was upgraded due to it being our honeymoon with a bottle of champagne which was unexpected. The snow over Christmas was was the most NYC has seen in a long time so we were confined to our room for an evening, and it was fine. As the room size was great. The bathroom toiletries were beautiful. Yes the shower does leak a little bit but if you put a towel down its fine.. The Christmas cocktails were brilliant and I will be trying to recreate them this Christmas, I would definitely recommend the Ho Ho Hot Toddy. We stayed for 7 nights and had no problem with the wifi access. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Super experience, super staff, super location.”
Reviews.Author: gogogone33
Reviews.Content: We bought the hotel room through Priceline. After many Priceline stays at hotels over the years, we know to expect minimal service and a room next to the elevator. We therefore were delighted to find ourselves in a comfortable room with an amazing view of the fountain at Lincoln Center. The second night of our stay we had to move because our current room was part of a pre-booked block of rooms. The manager, Vana, upgraded us to a corner suite and she made us feel like we were the most important guests in the hotel. Super experience, super staff, super location.

Reviews.Title: “claustrophobic room, terrible billing system make sure they release the hold on your credit card!”
Reviews.Author: separateaccount2
Reviews.Content: First, the location is fabulous. Second, all the things that went wrong-- the heat would not go off in the room and the window that looked out on an alley didn't open, they sent someone immediately. That was great. The hallways and rooms were so cramped it was like being on a ship. No bathtub, just this shower thing with no door so the water sprays all over the tiny bathroom. The check in staff was really nice, the check out, Oh my gosh, terrible! Didn't want to give me a receipt because her printer was broken, and she'd have to use the other one exactly 3 feet away!!! Then I discovered they kept a $400 dollar hold on my credit card, even though I paid cash, 4 days later when I went to try to pay for groceries and my card was denied. Fun. They were very very very rude handling this when I called. No apology, shifted to front desk, snippy-- and it cost me $56 in bank overdraft fees so far. oh and lines of Jersey shore-dressed kids outside trying to get into the hotel's roof-top bar for Saturday night partying. It was very clean despite the foot traffic. Room spotless. Just super uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that is slipping a little”
Reviews.Author: Vonkramer
Reviews.Content: This is my de facto hotel when I travel for business to NYC. Great lobby, great location. But I noticed that the room quality is slipping a bit. The user experience got to the point of, "not this too". Here is a sampling: 1) the button on the desk lamp came right off- cheap lamp 2) no bath mat for the shower 3) loud air unit in room 4) the hanging "do not disturb" sign falls off the outside handle, the magnet ones are better 5) the phone wasn't operational- I had spend 15 minutes plugging and unplugging until it turned on with power

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: karyny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights and loved this hotel. The rooms are compact but perfectly formed. The bed was the very comfortable with quality bed linen and great pillows9 and I very fussy).The staff are lovely and very helpful. I would reccomend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: Samaras74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our honeymoon and we have to say overall the hotel was a bit on the disappointing side. The good stuff first - The location is excellent with easy access to the subway and plenty of cabs. Central Park is only minutes away and Times Square etc a 15/20 minute walk. The staff were superb (special mention to the excellent bar tender who was friendly, good with guests and also very informative about where to go). The rooftop bar was absolutely amazing with brilliant views up Broadway, felt like we were in a movie! The decor throughout the hotel was modern and tasteful. Now the not so good stuff! The room was small with little room to put cases etc. The bathroom was also on the small side but I guess thats understandable for Manhattan. Our main gripe was the noise. I know that there are no quiet rooms in Manhattan but you at least expect there to be a noticeable reduction in noise when you close the window! Added to that was the fact that the walls were paper thin. We could clearly hear people talking normally in all surrounding rooms! It felt like we were in a dorm at times. Some sound proofing is definitely needed. Special noise note to the housekeeping staff as well. From about 7:30am we were woken by a constant banging of room doors as staff went in and out of rooms. The doors do not have overhead door closers which would stop them from banging. I've never been to prison but I'd expect lockdown sounds very similar to what you hear every morning at The Empire.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: nadeyness
Reviews.Content: My parents let me book a holiday for me and my best friend to New York for a week for my 21st birthday and after doing a bit of research I chose the Empire. The reviews I'd read were mixed but my opinion is definitely not! This hotel is amazing, and I would have no hesitation in staying there again. The inside is decadent and beautiful while also being trendy and young looking, the staff are very helpful and polite, and the rooftop terrace bar is beautiful. One of the doormen to the rooftop bar even wished me a happpy birthday when he saw my ID even though I was there a month after the date! If you have concerns about staying at The Empire then stop now, you'll have an amazing time and you're only minutes from everything you'll need to have an amazing stay! Thank you for making my birthday present the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting the city.”
Reviews.Author: Lenetra
Reviews.Content: When I first went to check in to this hotel I thought I was going to hate my stay thanks to a mix-up with my reservation and a rude staff member. I reserved a king suite but the reservations rep mistakenly put double at first but cancelled that reservation and sent me a confirmation for the corrected one. However when I went to check in the lady at the front desk said the reservation still had double and of course my phone was dead so I couldn't pull up the confirmation. Thank God for Maria who was working the desk and took over when she sawy frustration with her co-worker, who was insisting I had to take the double. Maria couldn't have been more helpful. She found me a king room, but unfortunately it was on a smoking floor, and the next day no other non smoking kings were available, but Eric, who was at the front desk at the time gave me a credit my bill. The rooms are small and the shower takes some getting used to, but it's in a great locale. I was able to walk to Central Park, MOMA, the Time Warner Building, Rockefeller Center, the MET, and the stores on 5th Ave. There is a Starbucks and a 24hr pharmacy next door to the hotel. All in all I will be staying here again when I come back to NYC this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: thompr12
Reviews.Content: Was quite nervous after booking and reading rather mixed reviews here but the Empire isn't bad at all. We were greeted by a very angry customer shouting at the reception staff as we checked-in which increased the nerves but once we got to the room all was well. Is the size you expect for NYC but decently turned out, and the bathroom was a corker too. The hotel is in a fantastic position for everything - subway down the road, Lincoln Centre opposite along with Central Park. You can walk just about everywhere and there's a real buzz about the place. You must try the Mexican which is round the other side of the hotel facing the Lincoln Centre - was pretty amazing. Oh, and we had Alec Baldwin filming an ad outside one evening so what more could you want? Major gripe for us was lack of wifi - wasn't free and was majorly expensive - so if the Empire could sort this out they'd be onto a winner.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Alphamel
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC many times, but this was my first trip to the city with 2 small children and without my husband or anyone else to help "manage" the trip , so I had a few concerns. I booked through BookIt.com for the first time and was asked how trusting I was. I thought it was a strange question but I answered the agent by telling him that I was pretty trusting. He proceeded to tell me that he had a great deal on a very nice hotel but that I would not find out the name of the hotel until after my booking was complete. I was fine with that in general as I have used HOTWIRE.COM in the past but never for a NYC stay, I prefer to know where I will be staying in New York.. I went with it and booked 4 nights at what turned out to be THE EMPIRE HOTEL for less that what I have paid for 1 night at the RItz Carlton Central Park. I had never heard of the hotel so I read many online reviews, some good, some not so good. Because I know that there are people who complain just for the sake of complaining, I read reviews but take them for what they are....just someone elses opinion. And on this one, I am sooooooo glad that I did not let the not so good reviews sway me. . Our stay here was fabulous from the time we arrived by taxi, to the time that we left by taxi. The staff was beyond accommodating. Upon arrival the Doorman removed all of our bags, baby stuff, stroller etc. from the trunk before we were even out of the taxi and escorted us into the hotel lobby which is quite chic, modern and classy . Check in was pleasant and very smooth and we were even upgraded thanks to Mr. Chatham who prior to our arrival helped to resolve an issue that arose through no fault of The Empire Hotel. The arrangement of apples at the front desk is quite welcoming, but even more importantly the apples are absolutely delicious. A very nice touch. When we walked into our room my 4 years old said " I love this new house!!!". And that is just what it was for the next 4 days, it was like our home, maybe even better because I did not have to do any cooking or laundry. We had a lovely view of Columbus which my 4 year old was fascinated by. He made it his job to open the curtains and raise the blinds each morning. Housekeeping did a fantastic job with our room every day. Our room was clean every evening when we returned. There were always fresh towels and soap. There were even nice fluffy bathrobes and slippers in our room. I am really not sure why reviewers have so much to say about the shower, it was not an issue at all. The toiletries, which I usually don't use because I have my own personal favorites, are now my new favorites!!! Love, love, love them. The beds and pillows are heavenly. We had no problem with noise as some of the reviews mentionsed, we were in room 515. The location of The Empire Hotel just can't be beat. It is in close proximity to everything either by train or on foot. Yet you almost feel like a resident when you walk down 63rd. I actually bought fresh fruit every day at a fruit cart down the street. 7 bananas for $1, 16 ounces of strawberries for $1.50. A pint of blueberries for $1.50. This made me very, very happy!!! There is also a WHOLE FOODS store very close by. Central Park is just a short walk away. There are so many things that made our stay here an awesome one. We really would have loved to stay much longer. When it was time for us to head home, check out was just as smooth as our check in. My 4 year old had to take just one more apple for the road. And again , a Doorman was right there to assist with all of our stuff. He even held my 1 year old baby girl while I folded my stroller. The Empire Hotel is now my favorite NYC hotel for all of the reasons mentioned and many many more. We will definitely be back....and hopefully very soon. Thank you and very well done Empire Hotel staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: ter1228
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire for three nights, and found the experience very pleasant. Every staff person we interacted with, from the doorman to the people at the front desk, and the cleaning staff , was very pleasant and helpful. We requested a room with a view on a quiet floor, which was accommodated. The room was on the small side, but very clean and quiet. We reserved our room on Priceline, and found it to be an excellent value for the money. The bathroom was small, but workable. The location was great---just across the street from Lincoln Center, and a couple of blocks from Central Park. The weather was mild, so we didn't have issues with the heating or air conditioner. Would definitely recommend the Empire Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend--Great Service”
Reviews.Author: soundman68
Reviews.Content: The staff was GREAT.The whole weekend was GREAT we couldn't have asked for a better stay..If you go to New York you should stay at The Empire Hotel..Sean and the whole staff made us feel at home

Reviews.Title: “Less than desireable”
Reviews.Author: Wardog22
Reviews.Content: Rooms weren't ready until 4:30 which was ok but they have no shower doors...water goes everywhere and makes a complete mess....you have to pay to print anything and you are paying 200-350 a night...over priced and barely mediocre at best...would not chose to stay here willingly again

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend but initial contact left bad taste in mouth”
Reviews.Author: jcush1
Reviews.Content: As they say first impressions are most important. After a long flight got to the Empire for check-in and ran into an arrogant desk clerk. Simple questions were answered with quick dismissive remarks. Now maybe in India(hint, hint) this is allowed but as I've travelled all over the world I've had better. The other complaint was the heater. Tried to turn it off, unplug it, turn on AC, nothing worked. So we opened the window over Broadway and the room cooled off. Of course when we returned to the room the next night, housekeeping had shut the window and the room once again was a sauna. Now for the positives. Overall excellent hotel in a great location. Rest of staff were pleasant and helpful. Never made it to the rooftop, but appears very popular so you never have to leave the hotel for a nightlife. Rooms were nice, and I have to disagree with the comments on the decor. Its not outstanding but they did an excellent job making it cozy and elegant enough for the space provided. I've seen much worse and much more garish. My only complaint was the comfort of some of the furniture in bar area. So again pleasantly surprised. And for the money excellent value. I'd actually highly recommend except for the first impression provided by that arrogant kid at the front desk. I see negative comments on the shower. Its a rain head with no door. The head of shower tilts slightly toward the front wall. If you getting water on the floor than you should use it as designed. Put your back to the front wall and face backward. The water will hit perfectly and no water on floor. I had no trouble either way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience in every way at the Empire!”
Reviews.Author: houseofleaves
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire for a week in February with my parents, who were both first-time visitors to New York. I love the city myself -- I go twice a year on business -- and I've been trying to get mum and dad to go with me for years, so of course I wanted their first visit to be memorable and positive. I generally stay at the Waldorf or the Essex House when in NY, but the Essex was full, and all the bedbug talk surrounding the Waldorf in recent months had me spooked. I initially booked The Empire through Jetsetter, a trusted hotel source, but was alarmed when I started reading some of the negative reviews on TripAdvisor regarding the noise level and service at the hotel. I emailed Don Chatham in Guest Relations and explained my concerns. He promptly emailed me back with the assurance that our stay would be comfortable and pleasant in every way. And it absolutely was! The location of the hotel is perfect -- right beside Lincoln Centre, and short walking distance to Columbus Circle, Central Park, and the Metro -- it was a cinch to get anywhere we needed to go in the city. (And the very personable doormen were always quick to hail a cab if needed.) The recent renovations at the hotel are well done; it has a chic and trendy vibe, but retains a feeling of comfort and warmth. I never noticed that the atmosphere was too "clubby", as some reviewers have mentioned, and at no point were we able to hear any noise from the nightclub in our room. And, speaking of the room, I have to say that it was one of the most spacious I've seen in New York, with comfy beds, Frette sheets, and L'Occitane toiletries. The housekeeping staff were exemplary, and our room was kept clean, tidy, and restocked the entire week. All in all, a very good value for the money. In the end, my parents loved every minute of their first New York experience (they're already talking about a second visit), and the hotel played a big part in making the trip such a success! I would definitely recommend a stay at the Empire.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely chic hotel but far too hot and very noisy air con”
Reviews.Author: WillyWOnka55000
Reviews.Content: Can't describe just how hot the hotel was during our stay - the rooms were even hotter! The air con is old and extremely noisy so very difficult to sleep. If staying on the 11th floor you will undoubtedly be woken up by the dragging of furniture at approx. 4.30am once everyone has cleared out of the rooftop lounge. For some unknown reason the staff felt that they had to rearrange furniture at this time of the morning, every morning, and we were there for 4 nights. My friend and I were so sleep deprived during our trip, we were dizzy walking around during the day. The rooms are nicely decorated and have a great powerful shower, but they are very small - you can just about walk around the double bed and no more! The staff in general were friendly and courteous, although we found a couple of the reception desk female staff to be very false and couldn't care less. I asked at the desk for wine glasses as there is a mini bar and bottles of wine in room but no glasses (just tiny ones in bathroom for rinsing), and the girl said that she'd send them up while we were out but didn't even ask for our room no. We enjoyed the roof top lounge one evening for cocktails and had great views. There was a good buzz about the hotel lobby which is gorgeous for drinks and chilling out. Have to say that the hotel is in a great location and really lovely but the temperature really needs to be sorted out, and noise problem on the 11th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: BosRS
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! We were there on a Saturday night. When we arrived, it had to have been over 80 degrees in the room and were told that the heat wasn't even on! Therefore, we were in for a very uncomfortable night of sleep - that was only the beginning... The noise coming from the club/rooftop bar above us (we were on the 11th floor) from about 11pm-4am was unbearable. While I though the noise was bad, the pounding on our ceiling from the people above us dancing was even worse! We called the front desk around 2am and they told us they would bring ear plugs...those arrived at 4am once the club closed. Therefore we got 3 hours of sleep and had to host an event the next day half asleep. The next morning, all I wanted was a nice shower to wake me up but the water pressure was only a trickle and I'm surprised that the shampoo even rinsed out of my hair. Why pay for a hotel in which it isn't possible to sleep? If Empire cares more about its nightlife operation than its residents, they don't deserve a clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in very good location with small but clean and very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: wsvklaus
Reviews.Content: Service was understated, but good when needed. (f.E. late checkout 82 p.m.) was no problem. Leda Popoviq from the front desk was very friendly and helpful (printing out a voucher). We had the only a problem to leave the hotel :-), because the lock of the "keycard" room door was out of order. But help and assitance to solve problem was perfect and fast. So we had no problem to get our shuttle (Thanks for it)

Reviews.Title: “How does a hotel run out of sheets...?”
Reviews.Author: travel_joy_11
Reviews.Content: We were only in the city for a single night. I was very excited to stay in this hotel, it looked great and got good reviews. I got a decent rate that included parking (a obvious bonus in Manhattan). We checked in at 3pm and were informed that our room was clean and ready, but that the linens were not on the beds yet and would be there shortly. We went to put our bags in the room. The hotel had described itself as "recently renovated" but it was obvious this was not exactly true. Aside from the missing linens, the room seemed fine. I did a beg bug inspection and didn't see any signs of an infestation. We out to a museum - came back a few hours later ~5pm...NO SHEETS. Beds still unmade! I went down to the desk to tell them politely. I was shrugged off, and assured they would be there "soon"...the person at the desk didn't even write down my room number. Went out to dinner - came back ~9pm...STILL NO SHEETS. I went to talk to the front desk again. AGAIN I was brushed off, and assured they would be there "soon"...the person AGAIN at the desk didn't even write down my room number. We went out to see some live music - came back at 11PM and no sheet. I went down to complain again. This time the staff told to go back to my room and the sheet would be there right away. I asked them for some kind of compensation and they offered me 2 breakfast vouchers. At this point I was annoyed, but still being patient. We went back up to the room...30 minutes later someone knocked on the door with 2 pillow cases. It is now close to midnight. We are exhausted, had been traveling all day and wanted to got to bed. Went back down to the front desk to talk to a manager. We were informed that there were NO sheets...REALLY? A hotel with over 400 hundred rooms doesn't have a single set of extra sheets? I had to beg a hotel all day since check-in for sheets? He offered us a room with a single bed. My partner has restless leg syndrome and we can't share a beg - so the answer was no. I booked a room with 2 beds. I paid for a room with 2 beds. I want a room with 2 beds. When we finally got this resolved it was well after 12:30 AM. The sheets were mismatched - and I am guessing the stripped down beds from other rooms and cobbled together 2 incomplete sets of sheets for us. Although the night manager seemed genuinely sorry and willing fix the problem, I was appalled by the fact that no one from 3pm - 11:30 seemed to take me seriously. I would not stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Reservation Experience”
Reviews.Author: Liz-9999
Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient if you are attending a peformance at Lincoln Center (Met Opera). I give the 15 out of 10 for the reservation process. The staff were great. Nice clean, recently remodeled hotel in central location.

Reviews.Title: “Get-Away Southern Style”
Reviews.Author: getaway_v
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay - This hotel is in a perfect location. Each staff member set the tone for an enjoyable trip. Daniel, Jose, and Mike greeted us with “Welcome to the Empire Hotel”, “Good Morning”, “Is there any thing I can do for you” as we left each day and as we returned, “Welcome back - Did you have a good day?” Arrived early and room was not ready got upgraded to the Broadway side and the view was great. Room was comfortable for NYC. The room was a little stuffy at first, but maintenance quickly resolved the problem. The front desk staff Mariana, Gabriel and Sean (Manager) offered excellent services with directions and all our needs during the stay. Indeed it was a great NYC get-away - would stay there again! Of course, a little partial I love CHOCOLATE!

Reviews.Title: “MOLD IN ROOMS!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: discountaz
Reviews.Content: The Empire Hotel NY is a very hip and trendy location, but they tried a little too hard with the design of their showers! We stayed on the 5th floor for a weekend and with the first attempt to shower, we noticed that there was no shower door, so the bathroom floor gets water everywhere while people shower! I am in construction/real estate for a living and said there is no way that was supposed to be designed that way, but we were there for a fun trip, so I didn't think much of it. The second night, we came back to our room and while laying in bed noticed that part of the ceiling had been painted with primer to cover a water leak from the bathroom in the room above us! After discuss the issue with the front desk, they said they were AWARE of the water/mold problem and were doing their best to go floor to floor to resolve the issue. I said 'so I've been sleeping in a room with mold for 2 nights and breathing it in with your knowledge of it' and his response was 'we are doing our very best to fix the design flaw and hope that you'll come back soon!' NOT A CHANCE

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: DC_2011
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel offered the highest level in customer service recently experienced! Within 15 minutes of being in my room, I received a call to inquire as to whether the room met my expectations and standards. The price was really great and the location can't be beat...right across the street from the Lincoln theatres/centers and within walking distance of the best retails stores and restaurants. Although the weather did not permit, the hotel offers Indoor/Outdoor Rooftop Bar & Lounge but I did have the pleasure of dining at Ed’s Chowder House restaurant within the facility. Overall, the room was small as expected from the older hotels, but did not lack atmosphere, cleanliness and comfort. Again, for the price, service and location, it will be my hotel of choice again for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: dnymrc
Reviews.Content: we got a terrific deal on priceline, and stayed at the empire for three nights around christmas. the location is fantastic, the hotel is well appointed, the rooms are small but comfortable. highly recommended, especially if you can get a great rate (we paid about $130/night which i think is pretty good for nyc. i would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, bad management”
Reviews.Author: Megyxu
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is perfect just in front of the Lincoln Center and the room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom is small but with a good distribution. We arrived at the hotel for 2nd time at 15:30 and the room wasn't ready because it needed the house keeping verification (the same excuse at 14:30), after complained several times for the waiting time at last we're in our room at 16:05. The most listened word at the lobby was: "I apologize" , said to us and to the rest of the guests that were waiting for their room for a long time as us. They gave to us a complimentary breakfast for the check-in delay.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Monica42139
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in the building everyone was extremely accomodating. My flight came in early, so I was worried about checking into my room. As I entered the lobby/check in area, a very sweet blonde lady helped me with my reservation. She was fast, had a great attitude, and she upgraded my room. When I got to my room, everything was extremely clean, the shower was amazing. The bed was perfect. I had absolutley everything I needed. The mini bar was fully stocked. Room service was fast and food was wonderful. As I checked out the next morning, again I saw the same lady. Again, everything was great and I headed to the airport. My stay at the Empire Hotel, was wonderful. The surrounding area had some great restaraunts !!!. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at the Empire”
Reviews.Author: kelly91501
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely beautiful and really loved staying there. So looking forward to going back when the roof top pool is open in the spring. Definitely recommnend this hotel. Great location and wonderful staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel if you plan to sleep”
Reviews.Author: frqnttrvlr024
Reviews.Content: This nicely-located hotel looks very stylish and seemed like it would be a good spot for us to crash after being in NYC for a baby shower one weekend. However, our room on the 10th floor (which is 2 floors below the rooftop nightclub) was vibrating from the bass beat of the club until 4am. I got no sleep. Upon calling the front desk to see if we could get a room change the night manager Erik told me they were sold out but he would call the club to ask them to turn down the volume and send up a pair of earplugs. Really? of course the club did not adjust the volume at all, and the earplugs never arrived. Also, our bathroom was laughably small. It literally fit a walk-in shower, commode, and tiny sink that was facing a wall - you could not stand in front of the sink as there was only about 3 inches between the front of the sink and the wall. You have to stand in front of the toilet and lean over in order to see yourself in the mirror. Makes it difficult to do hair or makeup. Lastly, teh room was too hot. It is Feb and we had to turn the AC on high all night, which resulted in a tolerable temperature, but not even cool. We had relatives staying in a double room on the 8th floor, and while they couldn't hear the club from that floor, their room was also a toaster. Bottom line is this is not a hotel that worries about its guests returning by providing good customer service. If you do choose to stay here, I hope you are either planning on club-hopping until the wee hours or manage to snag a lower-floor room.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: jayClark_Nj
Reviews.Content: I needed a quick getaway with my wife, and booked a "4 star hotel in the central park area" on Hotwire, not knowing what I would get. The service was excellent; the room beautiful and very clean; the staff accomodating in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff along with excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: jburrows500
Reviews.Content: Would like to first thank the hotel for upgrading me to a double room. It was certainly appreciated traveling with my two children. The location, literally opposite the Lincoln Center, a 5 minute walk from Wolman's Rink, a 20 minute walk to Times Square was fantastic. Check in was easy. We arrived an hour before check in time however the bellmen gladly held onto our bags. Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room was of average size for a NYC, clean, bright and a view of Broadway. The bed and pillows (memory foam pillows) were probably the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel! In terms of the shower; yes, the door design (or lack thereof) is a little odd, but it presented no issues for us. My daughter loved it and thought it was, "cool". Without question, the Empire Hotel is one of my best Priceline experiences to date in NYC. A very friendly family hotel that I would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel with hip vibe and guests”
Reviews.Author: wendygo
Reviews.Content: Fun vibe, friendly staff. Great place to stay especially if you need or want to be by Lincoln Center.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Night Club above..."banged up" tiny room and W/C was 3x4ft”
Reviews.Author: GOTSPF
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past... small but ok... This last visit I discovered that that the rooms have not been maintained.... shotty showers, bar not refilled, A/C grills dented. This last time, I had a City view and the room was a challenge to move about in(by myself).... the bathroom was beyond tiny(I'm a 5'6 women/size 2), no vanity and I had to put a towel down in the sink in order to have a place to set my make-up etc...Called the spa and heard women yelling abt appts etc(joke and hung up) .Third and last time.... Pros... great lounge feel when you enter and location is central... Starbucks, Rosa Mexicana and PJClarks's around the corner... Don't stay here and you can leave your Xanax at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to experience a true spirit of NYC!!”
