Reviews.Author: jelena18
Reviews.Content: I came to NYC to work for fashion week, and found that Empire Hotel is the place to be at- to see and be seen!! As I arrived I was pleasantly surprised with an upgrade of my room to deluxe! Mariana Mero was at the front desk and I have nothing but the best comments about her- helpful, knowledgeable and efficient!! My stay in the hotel was amazing, loved every second of it and would highly recommend to all my friends + business partners!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay amazing service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia010
Reviews.Content: I came with to NYC to spend three days with my mother. I live in the U.S. and my mother arrived from abroad. We chose the Empire hotel due to its amazing location. The hotel is exceptionally pretty, and the room was large, clean, beautiful and with a great view. But by far, the best thing was the service in the reception desk. As I mentioned, I was there with my mother who can sometimes be pushy and impatient. And yet the treatment by the people from the reception was exceptionally kind and patient and I was very grateful for that. I would like to mention specifically the unbelievable service we received by Mariana M, who was kind, patient, efficient, even when my mother almost drove her crazy (for example, my mother asked to upgrade room, and asked to move to another room. Later, she forgot something in the previous room. In all this the service was so kind and non-critical). Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel especially for younger people”
Reviews.Author: nanarach123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire Hotel with a friend for 4 nights a few days before Christmas and was really impressed. I would say this hotel is more suited for younger people.When you first enter it seems more like a night club rather than a hotel and there is an actual night club at the very top. We didn't spend much time in our hotel but the time that we did we really enjoyed ourselves. Had the nicest cocktails I've ever had, however they are quite pricey but nevertheless worth it :) The staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. On our arrival are room got upgraded too.with out us asking. I wouldn't be put off by the night club at the top of the hotel, it did not effect us getting a good nights sleep and we were 6 floors up. Can't comment on the food as we did not eat anything there, but the hotel was very clean and the maid service excellent. I would stay at this hotel again if going back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Lame!”
Reviews.Author: deanandtracie
Reviews.Content: We checked with out 2 teen kids. We were a Mom, Dad, Teen 1 and Teen 2. There were 3 towels in the room. No wash clothes, no hand towels, just three bath towels. No BATH MAT. NO WASH CLOTHES, NOTHING, but 3 bath towels, for 4 people. When the kids got ready for bed, they found a note from the last occupants of the room tucked in between the headboard and mattress of one of the beds. Finally, there was NO SHOWER DOOR. NO BATH MAT. The whole TINY bathroom was soaked. Yet we still had NO towels. This hotel was not nice, and not worth the price. Many others are better.

Reviews.Title: “great help during fashion week”
Reviews.Author: boatman054
Reviews.Content: One of the girls helping in the lobby during Fashion Week went out of her way to answer questions and welcome me as I worked on the mezzanine. She gave me a card with the name Lauren on it. Just want to thank you for a nice experience. Although I was not a guest that day, I will definitely like to stay at the hotel if the staff is that friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: princesspeach_25
Reviews.Content: My partner and i recently stayed at the Empire hotel for 7 nights. This was a surprise trip for my partners 30th birthday. Months before we arrived at the hotel i emailed them to ask if there was anything they offered on arrival as a special touch as it was a special holiday, a few weeks later i had no reply from them so forwarded the email again saying i would appreciate if someone could acknowledge my email and return an answer- still no reply! When we arrived at the hotel nothing was mentioned about my emails and we were allocated our room which was a bit on the small side but nice enough and clean. The only problem was when you had a shower there wasn't a full door on it just a glass covering where the shower head was so each time you had a shower the bathroom floor would flood! I should of reported this but as i'm quite laid back i didn't want to make an issue of it. The absolutely worst thing about the hotel are the rude front desk staff. We were only staying with the Empire on room only basis so didn't have much to do with them, but the few occassions we needed them they were awful. On one occassion we needed to speak with concierge, she wasn't at her desk so i asked another guy behind the desk where she was. He snapped shes on a break, i asked if he knew when she would be back, and he screamed i don't know maybe 15 - 20mins then just shouted can i help the next in line! Not can i help with anything or take a message so she can get back to you. Another horrible experience was when i needed to change some travellers cheques, the lady behind the desk said sure thats fine you need to sign them and show me your passport. I did this then she disappeared and came back with the manager who told me i needed to re sign, i questioned this as i had already signed and she said, yes you've actually sign in the wrong place, if you don't re sign you don't get your money so signature please! I think some serious lessons in customer service is badly needed here. The only positive thing about this hotel is the location. I've come away bitterly disappointed with the service i received. Apart from that New York is an incredible place and i will go back, just not at the Empire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Don005
Reviews.Content: Reserved a junior suite and was simply told not available when I arrived. I was given a deluxe room instead. Later the hotel agreed to upgrade to a suite after a long conversation with the front desk. The suite did not have a robe and slippers, the newspaper was not delivered in the morning, there was no order form for in room breakfast, and the bathrooms in the suite were small and cramped.

Reviews.Title: “A Happening Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: operagirl21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met at the Empire Hotel 25 years ago, and just spent the night-February 13th-going to a concert at Lincoln Center, with dinner afterwards at Bar Boulud. We had a great time-check-in was fast and efficient, the room was small but comfortable,lovely toiletries,soft & comfy bed. The front-desk staff called us twice to see if we were happy with the room, and we so appreciated this courtesy. Check out was equally fast and courteous-and we also enjoyed watching the well-dressed young people obviously attending Fashion Week!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...Room and Service”
Reviews.Author: Cara21Westport_Ct
Reviews.Content: Was a bit reluctant when I went on-line as the price was so low for NYC, but was very pleased, as was my husband, to find such a lovley, well cared for room and imminities at Lincoln Center location! We were quite shoked. The linens were wonderful, very plush and upscale as were the bathroom toiletries. The room was quite spacious if you know NY or Paris accommodations with down pillows, pillow-top down comforter underneath Egyptian sheets and soft, fluffy duvet cover. Very well appointed and wonderful staff. Can't say more about it. Just Amazing in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes.”
Reviews.Author: prancy
Reviews.Content: After pushing our way through the crowd of 20-somethings that splled out the front door- complete with thumping, 'trendy' music- we checked in with a woman at the front desk who, when asked what the line of people was all about, became defensive and quite rude. (Apparently there's a club called The Rooftop on the rooftop-- open till 4am-- but thankfully we couldn't hear anything from our room.) Our Room: We were alloted one hand towel each for the duration of our 4 day stay- old handtowels were removed but never restocked. I don't blame housekeeping, they seem to be working with what they have. Washcloths, too, were a rare commodity; but perhaps the most frustrating, and even dangerous part-- ZERO bath mats. Not even one to sop up the water that sprayed all over the floor/wall/belongings while showering in the doorless shower stall. A "chic" design gone very wrong. Everything gets soaked and there aren't enough towels to wipe up mess. And It's a handheld shower, you must contort yourself into extremely awkward positions so water doesn't spay out. I can't imagine a less fulfilling shower experience--except possibly in prison? Bed was comfy, though there was NO top sheet-- just a comforter-- which rather creeped me out, as i hoped desperately that they change it with each new guest. We tried to call the front desk at one point (I'm sure for towels) and were put on hold and eventually forgotten about. We are far from nit-picky, but this experience was one for the books... STAFF: with the exception of one friendly doorman, the rest came across as rude and defensive, condescending even. But I imagine they must get inundated with complaints and this must wear on a person. What a shame since this is such a wonderful location...

Reviews.Title: “If location is important stay here, otherwise reconsider”
Reviews.Author: mustang beau
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice, not because it is particularly good, but because it is across the street from Lincoln Center, so if you are an opera/ballet/symphony buff, it's very convenient. The rooms are quirky and although some things are great, like the beds and linens, other things are so badly designed that they almost don't function-like the bathroom. We had a Junior suite and the bathroom was quite small and had no hooks or bars to hang a towel/robe except those inside the shower. The shower had no door, just a half wall, so whenever either of us took a shower, the bathroom floor inevitably got water on it, no matter how careful we were. The shelves in the bathroom were nice but a sink more than 4 inches deep would have been useful. Also, the sink and fixtures were so trendy that you couldn't fit your hands under the faucet to wash them! It was ridiculous-clearly whoever designed the bathroom had never actually used one! Our room also did not have a closet, more of a recess in the wall. In addition, the floor and walls of the bathroom showed that the materials used in the revamp were cheap and falling apart. There is some sort of club on the top floor, so there is a lot of noise in the hallways at night-another drawback. The decor of the rooms and lobby is supposed to be cool and trendy, I think, but it just comes off as a bit tacky, lots of animal prints. In summary, it's an old hotel that someone has tried to redo on a shoestring, so although there are some good things, on balance, I don't think I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty, but as special as I hoped for the price.”
Reviews.Author: theparma
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very posh and the rooms are neat. Valet and front desk staff were very nice and helpful, but bar staff were kind of icy. GREAT location next to Lincoln Center. Didn't care for the design of the bathroom, very tight and an odd shower design. Overall a great second or third choice in the city for me and I will keep it in mind, but not where I'd go first.

Reviews.Title: “A nice facade hiding rotten service”
Reviews.Author: jdepinho
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empire for a weekend, and while I was initially happy with the exotic decor and small-but-comfortable enough rooms.... but that was before I needed anything from there front desk. One particularly striking incident was when Eugene, the lobby's bag handler, slammed the baggage-room's door in my face while chatting away on his cell phone. (I had a few bags I needed to store). When I spoke with the manager on duty at the front desk... his response was one of "sorry that happened to you, we will be doing exactly nothing about it". They care more about the money they're taking and when, than the service and hospitality they offer their guests. RUDE, RUDE, RUDE.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, but small room with strange shower”
Reviews.Author: davink
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Empire Hotel for New Years 2010/11 and had a good experience. In general, the hotel is well located, clean and good value, but with a few strange particularities: Room - as stated by others, my room was so small that you could barely walk in it. There was barely any closet space, and the 1 door shower, also referred by other reviewers, is ridiculous to say the least. The had to give me double towels every day so I could mop up the floor! Otherwise, the rooms are beautifully furnished, with a great bed and tv. One last point is that we were unable to control the heating, which resulted in a room so warm we had to open the window (it was freezing outside) so we could sleep Service - service was always very courtious, especially the concierge (I'm sorry but I cannot remember her name) who on various occasions assisted us with tickets and dinner reservations. The housekeeping was somewhat erratic however, always forgetting to leave someting, either towel, or toiletries, or bath robe. Furthermore, we lost one night stay due to the Christmas snow storm and hope to be someway comped. But as it was an advanced purchase, this was understandibly, albeit disappointingly refused. Others - there is a great/ trendy rooftop bar, however it is "not part" of the hotel and although you are a guest may be charged a cover charge. I was actually not, and had a nice drink (expensive but not different to any other bar). It is worth a go if you want a drink and do not want to go all the way to SoHo or the Meatpacking District. Value - this was one of the main thing that made us choose this hotel as we got 6 nights in a 4 star double at inder 200$ a night during New Years week. If you find and opportunity like that, don't hesitate to book it. If it's double that, there may be nicer options. the alternatives I found were 2 stars for the same price... Conclusion - I reccomend this hotel conditioned to the price. For what I paid, it was great value for money. If for more, maybe look further.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with a Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Op2myst
Reviews.Content: I'm in transition and have been staying at The Empire a few nights week for the past month and a half. The hotel is very clean and the service is prompt and courteous. The from desk is vey helpful and the staff goes out of their way for the comfort and well being of their guests. The hotel is right in the heart of the city and that being said, the rooms are quite quiet. A few times my room overlooked Lincoln Center and one time I had a back room with no view. The decor is a little on the trendy side with Satin Drapes and Italian bedding. All very tasteful. As far as NYC hotels go, the rooms were also fairly spacious. I have not checked out the restaurants at the hotel although they have a great reputation and I will check them out in the upcoming weeks.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad.....”
Reviews.Author: JustsayJulie
Reviews.Content: We (2 friends and I) stayed at the Empire Hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of February 2011. When we checked in our room (a superior double) was not ready (laundry service problem) so we were upgraded to room #715 which is the largest room at the end of the hall. It was still on the small side as far as hotel rooms go but it did have a sitting area w/ a couch and a small walk-in closet, and the view was awesome. When we got to the room we just wanted to quickly clean-up and go eat. We noticed there were no washcloths or hand towels so we called housekeeping. It took 25 minutes for them to bring up what we needed...not happy. After spending our first night there we noticed our internet connection was not good in this room due to it being at the end of the hall, farther away from the router, so I went downstairs to see what I could do. I alerted the front desk to my complaints about the towels, the internet, a slightly dirty shower and they graciously moved us up to the top floor #1105 which was a much bigger room w/ sitting area and larger beds. We were very happy with the extra room but we lost our beautiful view of the city. The room was great and we had to stay and extra night due to the snowstorm, once again the front desk staff graciously let us stay in that suite for the same rate as the smaller room we initially booked. I would like to give a shout-out to Sean Wallace at the front desk for being very kind and keeping us happy! My only complaint is about the hotel itself.....needs to be tweaked with small repairs to the rooms and hallways more often to keep it looking top-notch. Some of the outlet covers were falling off, the shower was loose and would not stay where you needed it too, we were missing a sink drain cap, the curtains were a little dirty and needed fixing, the chandelier near the elevator was missing a candle & the lightbulb in our lamp was falling out and didn't work. The hotel looks great at first glance but given time, you notice the small stuff. Oh yeah.....and the showers are not good, glass door doesn't block the water properly....leaks everywhere. So don't put anything you don't want wet in there with you....also it gets really hot because there is no vent. All in all....nice and friendly staff.....trendy decor ......smaller rooms. Would I stay there again....maybe but there may be better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “I would choose to go to another hotel the next time I visit”
Reviews.Author: gerard_french3
Reviews.Content: The architecture and design of the hotel is beautiful, however, the size of the rooms doesn't match the price. I first booked a queen size room but when we checked into the room there wasn't enough room to put our luggage and walk around the bed at the same time. The closet was just a space in the room blocked off by a curtain and you couldn't close the bathroom didn't have enough space for you to hardly turn around in a circle. The assistant manager and front desk clerk was helpful in showing us a larger king size bedroom. Nevertheless, the design of the bedroom is more on a boutique contemporary level with spa design bathrooms. The major flaw about the bathroom is that the shower only has one door. That's right, one door! Therefore when you take a shower water will spill out and wet the floor. I made a complaint about this issue to the front desk and they said that it was the vision of the desiger to have one door and since they are getting a lot of complaints from customers that they are in the process of changing the design. Next thing on the list is when my girlfriend was brushing her teeth, brown water started to come out of the faucet every 30-40 seconds. The front desk sent their maintenance guy to our room and he told me that it was perfectly normal due to the building having old pipes. This is an issue they need to resolve instead of just trying to move guess to a different room. Last issue on our list was housekeeping. For the most part they cleaned the room as any good hotel would but for some reason everynight they would either not replace our face towels, the large bath drying towels, or the rug for the shower. Each niight after coming back to our room I had to call the front desk to get a new set of towels because housekeeping would not replace the old ones they took. I must say the location is excellent but the experience was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jm20036
Reviews.Content: Had a great visit to the Empire. Super location if you need to be in the Lincoln Center area. Got caught in the winter storm that hit NY. Front desk staff was fantastic, especially Helena. Found a room for me early (which after 24 hours of travel was a blessing). Free internet with a strong connection, which was great to get work done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - AMAZING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Joshuast
Reviews.Content: The EMPIRE hotel is not only a sick hotspot at night but also an awesome hotel in terms of rooms, cleanliness, decor and especially service! I am a New Yorker and got a hotel here for one night to celebrate my surprise engagement. Leda at the front desk was one of the most kind and helpful people I have met. She helped me plan and coordinate everything and upgraded my room all while sending up a complimentary bottle of champagne up to celebrate! HIGHLY reccommended! Thanks again Leda for making it a special and memorable stay

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Modern, Chic”
Reviews.Author: bachitrafaelwr
Reviews.Content: We stayed year as part of our Honeymoon. Fantastic location, we walked everywhere (even all the way to the Liberty Island Ferry!!) Rooms are smaller than normal hotels BUT this is New York, and this is an original hotel from way back, so stay here if you want all the magic of old New York with a modern twist. Situated so your right next to the lincoln centre, we could actually hear the Opera & Orchestral performances that were on right from our own room. The pool is smaller than average, but again what would you expect from a roof top pool on one of New York oldest and most romantic hotels? I'd advise you take a look at the old pictures of the hotel and how it looks now, it's like stepping back in time to a classic movie. We loved it. Amazing bed, really comfy. The bathroom is the smallest i've ever had in a hotel, but what it lacked in size it made up for in design and chicness. This hotel is a boutique hotel, so you should expect a little difference between your standard hotel room, but who wants standard these days? I'll be staying here again that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The Empire is in a great location, it's well appointed, staff is friendly and professional.”
Reviews.Author: NewportBeachBrian
Reviews.Content: This was my third or fourth stay at the Hotel. Every stay has been enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to coming back next time with my wife for a get away weekend. The location is perfect with the park close by, Lincoln Center, the Plaza, and even Time Square within striking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: alj78
Reviews.Content: We selected this Hotel primarily for its upper West Side midtown location. It is directly across the street from Lincoln Center, which clearly adds to its appeal for those headed for the Metropolitan Opera, the New York City Ballet, and the NY Philharmonic. We were upgraded from a deluxe king to a junior suite, a very pleasant surprise. Our room was most comfortable, very clean. Be advised that the Empire is not new. The lobby has been beautifully redecorated, the halls are attractive, there is a small but good exercise facility. But our room did not have a fully usable closet, with a door and enough space so that a winter coat could hang down fully without encroaching into the hallway. But there was a safe and a refrigerator, filled with very expensive goodies and booze, and very excellent L"Occitane toiletries (free) and plush bath wraps in the bathroom. A pleasant surprise was Ed's Chowder House for breakfast and dinner (or happy hour) on the mezzanine. Not cheap, but the freshest oysters and clams and shrimp. We thoroughly enjoyed it. And the french pressed coffee in the morning was wonderful. Contrary to the opinions of some of our fellow contributors, the staff was uniformly helpful and gracious. For the price, particularly in New York, we thought that the Empire was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: SheShopsTooMuch
Reviews.Content: The Empire is a gem. The location is fabulous - near Central Park (and away from the Times Square madness) plus great shopping nearby. Very friendly and professional staff from the front desk to the bartender - everyone was terrific. It's extremely clean and quiet. Comfortable bed, great linens, good workout room, LOVED the free Wi-fi. The Empire is a great value for the price especially in New York. The only negatives were the teeny tiny bathroom with the teak shower floor and the fact that my room was quite warm. I would give it a 5 for cleanliness, but that shower floor :(. I think it's supposed to be chic, but I'm not a fan. That said, I'd definitely visit again. For a more detailed review & photos please check my blog at www.tripscout.blogspot.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulMind504
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with some friends when visitng the city in April 2010. When we arrived, we were greeted by the bell men and helped with our luggage. We tried upgrading our room at the desk, but were told that no other rooms were available. The decor in the lobby was nice and everything was clean. Our room was small (the norm in NYC I'm told) but clean and nicely decorated. The beds were comfortable. We were able to open the window, feel the breeze of the city, and see the taxi traffic on the street below. The bathroom was extremely small but clean. We had to ask for more towels and received them without a problem. The location of the hotel is excellent. It's within walking distance of the subway stations, and Central Park. There's a bus stop on the corner of the hotel which can be taken to Times Square, just a short distance away. Starbucks is on the corner, a pharmacy and deli is around the corner. It was also easy to get a Taxi outside the hotel. It wasn't until we took the bus that we realized how close we were to everything. There's a nightclub on the roof of the hotel and the crowd to get inside the hotel at night could be a bit stressful for some, but the hotel staff did a good job controlling that. There's a line for the club goers. Hotel guest can just go in. You may be asked to present your room key, but after the first night most of the staff recognized us. To say the club is there, I didn't hear any noise in my room. I would recommend this hotel, but I probably won't stay there again because of the size of the rooms. It's just my personal preference to want more space.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, fabulous location, overly hip for me”
Reviews.Author: lizberry
Reviews.Content: Small room and bathroom size fine for Manhattan; fabulous location! Right across the street from Lincoln Center (my reason for being at this hotel). The lobby is meant to be sexy -- dark lighting, singles-bar-style soundtrack, animal-skin pillows, etc. -- and so are the rooms I guess; mine had a "lovers' intimacy kit" in the room along with other pay-if-you-use-it items like an umbrella, snacks, booze. Hee hee! I can't say the place isn't family-friendly though; there was a couple with new baby in the room next to mine I'm showing my age (fifty-something) when I point out that the bathroom sink reminded me of a darkroom developing tray. And that I wasn't excited by the filming of a "Gossip Girls" scene in the lobby (which meant I couldn't go into the lobby for 2 days of my stay). But I loved the Occitan products in the bathroom. Wonderful. Good selection of eateries nearby (including economical diners and carryout places), post office nearby; I'd say it's walkable to Broadway theaters. There's a Starbucks next door. My room was dark (on an airshaft, and decorated in darkish colors, with no overhead lighting). I didn't pay top dollar (used Expedia), so I expected the no-view. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trying very hard to be cool........”
Reviews.Author: Irish1978
Reviews.Content: Staff - mixed bunch, some pleasant some not. First person who checked us in was quite rude and checked us into a interconnected room with a family with children in the other room, the second and third people we dealt with while changing rooms were pleasant while the fourth was not. None of the staff wear name badges which I found unusual nor did they wear a uniform. The door men were very helpful but again wear not in uniform and at times it was hard to identify them. Rooms - we went through three rooms during our 4 day stay, the first room was a standard room with a door connecting it to the room beside it, this room was very small - we requested to be moved as we did not want a room with a interconnecting door. The second room was slightly larger but during the night we found a cockroach in the shower and asked to be moved. The third room was a suite and was large and well appointed. All the rooms are very dark with no central room light (if you drop something dark on the dark brown carpet forget about it because its lost!), instead there is a series of lamps which was annoying as they were not sufficent. The heating in the room was also tempremental with two heaters - one blowing hot air and the other cold, the room ended up being extremely warm and we had to unplug both heaters and open a window overnight. Bathrooms - well appointed but sink is not very functional. The frosted glass in the bathroom door is ridicolous however. The bathroom door in the suite did not close correctly either. Overall - tries a bit too hard to be cool and some of the functional aspects of the rooms etc suffer as a result. Cost of drinks etc is ridicolous as are some of the ther charges ($95 if you want the robe, $35 for the umbrella, $50 to have the drinks removed from your room fridge etc).

Reviews.Title: “Based on all of the mixed reviews I called and spoke to Mark in Reservations”
Reviews.Author: foosballNY
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Empire on Jan. 28th. I was a bit concerned about booking the reservation considering the mixed reviews. So I called the hotel to dicuss the issues, and spok to a nice gentlemen named Mark. The reason for some bad reviews abou noise i that they do have some partying and music going on there is that there is a roof top bar. Mark assured me they would be able to locate my family in a quiet area in the hotel. I am reserving judgment for after our stay, and I hope to be coming back here with sme positive comments.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible service and responsiveness.”
Reviews.Author: jcdc12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire for one night in December. The hotel was fine, room was typically sized for New York, and amenities were fine. The only complaint I have about the room was that the shower is poorly designed and there is water -- and water damage -- all around the floor, and as a result the bathroom looks a little dirty and bare. However, the service was disappointing. On check-in, there was a clear line of folks waiting and the staff let others walk in and cut in line, despite complaints from the rest of us. After our stay we checked out and were told that there would be no charges for the room. Imagine my surprise when I got my credit card bill at $8 had been charged to my card! I called the Empire immediately and the phone rang for several minutes without being answered. I called again, and after a few minutes the phone was answered. I explained that I had been charged for something and I did not know what it was. The gentleman at the front desk told me that he could not access my account and needed to help other customers, but that I could hang up and call back, and the operator would transfer me to accounting. I did, and the operator told me that because it was a weekend, accounting was out, and would not transfer me. I called the following monday, and was transferred to a voicemail box where I was told that inquiries would receive a response within 24 hours. I called twice over the next week and never received a response. Now it is a month later and I am very disappointed that no one would call me back to explain this charge. I am planning to contest it with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel... fantastic room, very comfortable beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: empireadvisor
Reviews.Content: The night I arrived at the Empire Hotel, the front desk upgraded my room because it was Christmas!. What a nice gesture! My upgraded room was fantastic, especially the extremely comfortable beds. The room was wonderful and my only wish was that the glass in the shower door covered the entire shower instead of just half of it. No big deal, though. Management at the front desk was very kind, considerate and helpful, especially due to the fact that I stayed 4 days during the blizzard when NYC had 1 1/2 feet of snow! The hotel was somewhat short handed due to the severe storm in Dec. 2010, so the staff more than compensated me by giving me 4 complimentary breakfasts, a bathrobe that I really liked, and even offered me a round of free drinks at the bar. They were awesome!!! I would definitely tell all my friends to stay at the Empire Hotel when visiting Manhattan. Starbucks, a diner, and Lincoln center are just a few steps away from the front door. My favorite mall with Whole foods and beautiful shops called Columbus Circle is only a few blocks away. The walk was beautiful. You can't beat it! The neighborhood rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but uncomfortably HOT”
Reviews.Author: mac1226
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would say this is a nice hotel. We checked in easily and were given a free upgrade to a king superior instead of a standard queen. The room was nice - it was small, but had everything we needed. We were on the 11th floor, but our windows faced out to more buildings, so there was no view. Because we were both tired, we immediately got into the bed. Unfortunately, as soon as we pulled the covers back, we noticed a very unappealing stain on the duvet cover (not the type of stain you want to see in a bed you're about to sleep in). We also noticed that it was very hot in the room, although the heat was off. Before we left for dinner, we stopped by the front desk to ask them to change our sheets and to fix the heating problem in the room. When we arrived later that night, it was still hot, but we were so tired we just opened the windows. Even with both windows open in 20 degree weather, neither of us could sleep because IT WAS SO HOT. I'm not sure if it's because we were on the 11th floor and heat rises, but it was really, really unbearable. Other than the heat, the room and bed were quite comfortable. When we checked out the next morning, we told the front desk person and all he said was that's weird. The hotel was nice, but I wouldn't stay here again unless they fix their heating issues.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE SERVICE, VERY RUDE PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: c-ray77
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I stayed here with my boyfriend over the weekend and it was AWFUL!! The hotel itself was decent, but it is not worth it for the people you have to deal with. The only problem I had with the room was that the heater didn't work the whole time and it was freezing. Also, the shower has no door and soaks the floor. The front desk is a joke. When checking in you get charged $100 per night for a security deposit and they don't tell you that upfront. They credited it back, but should still tell you upfront what they are doing with your card. Me and my boyfriend were underage when we checked in and they locked up the mini bar so we could not use it. After we checked out they didn't give us a receipt and the lady at the front desk told me there were no charges on my card. When I got home that night I had a charge of $321 and three charges of $14.69. I called the hotel and they said it was charges from the mini bar. I explained we were underage and they told me they had to "investigate." Almost a week later the charges are still on my account and they added another of $344. I just got off the phone with the front desk manager. I was very surprised at how rude he was. He said "this is the third phone call I have gotten about this situation." He acted as if I was an inconvenience, when they are the ones who have charges on my account that are incorrect of almost $700. I am not a rude person and remained calm and that is why I am so surprised at how I was treated. For a four star hotel, I can't believe they don't have someone who can remain calm and helpful. I am very upset and it is not worth everything that we have gone through. These are some of the most rude people I have EVER met in my life. This was the worst experience at a hotel I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Got a room that smelled like an ash tray. Wireless internet down.”
Reviews.Author: ffflea
Reviews.Content: I booked a three night stay using hotels.com while in NYC for a conference. I checked in late around 11.30pm because my flight was delayed to find out that they only had smoking rooms left (ie they gave away my non smoking room despite the fact that I didn't cancel my reservation). First room I was given didn't even have enough space for my large luggage (9 days of travel), so I went back to the front desk to request something more accommodating. Second room was so smokey that air coming out of the heater smelled like an old ash tray. utterly disgusting. got very little sleep that night and checked out the next day and got a room at Park Central---non smoking hotel and much more space! Also, apparently as of two weeks ago the wireless internet in the hotel has been "spotty" because 30% of the routers aren't working according to the front desk. I couldn't get a connection at all. beware that if you need internet for work, you have to use the lobby computers and they charge by the minute.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotel_lover42424
Reviews.Content: I travel all the time, mostly on business. This was a 4-day leisure trip; I chose this hotel (without checking Tripadvisor first, unfortunately) because my partner loves the UWS. This is, without a doubt, THE WORSE "4 STAR" HOTEL I have ever encountered. While the rooms were reasonably large for New York, and the Frette linens wonderful, the staff was incredibly rude, completely uninterested in my enjoyment of my stay, and clearly much more concerned with turning the place into a dance club than providing the services one would expect from a *hotel*. Apparently, the property figures in a popular television show called "Gossip Girl," and so it is now full of loud 20 and 30-somethings aspiring to become debauched teenagers. In any case, don't expect to sleep. In addition to the loud music and raucous crowds, the cleaning staff spent the mornings knocking (or just walking in) every half hour beginning promptly at 9am, while slamming the service room door on my floor every five minutes. I have never encountered hotel industry staff so inconsiderate of the environment they are creating for their guests. The furniture (everywhere) is worn. The leopard chairs in the lounge are visibly filthy. In the early evening, it takes room service 30 MINUTES to deliver ice to guest rooms (there's no other way to get it)! After 11, room service is not available, and as the front desk explained, "we do not provide ice either after 11pm; why not come down to the lobby for a drink?" Those drinks? I waited 10 minutes for a waitress who was MIA the entire night, ordered from the bartender who instantly transfered me to said MIA waitress. She did nothing but slap on an automatic gratuity of 20% (for non-service, apparently). The bill: $56 for two coffees, a bourbon, and a champagne cocktail; the champagne was flat but couldn't be sent back because the waitress couldn't be bothered to check in. I had to ask the bartender to track her down to settle the tab. In a word, it was humiliating to bring someone I care about to this hotel. The experience could hardly have been worse.

Reviews.Title: “Location is it's only positive - it is a hotel or a dance club?”
Reviews.Author: p8travels
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel near Lincoln Center for a night at the opera. Requested a quiet room (not counting traffic noise). When we checked in, asked if our room on the 11th floor was quiet. She said yes. Arriving home after the opera, there was not only loud music blasting in the lobby, we could, puzzlingly, hear it on the 11th floor. I called to ask what time the music would stop - was then told there was a 12th floor deck and the music there would go until 4 a.m. I guess there are no quiet rooms on the 11th floor. They did relocate us, a little after midnight (we had to get up at 5:45 a.m. for a flight) but we paid for a king bed and ended up sleeping in a double. I found the entire staff, except for a bellman and a doorman, to be dismissive, cold and rude. The king room was tiny and the bathroom so small there wasn't room to stand in front of the sink. No face towels in the second room - definitely not a four star hotel - I've stayed in much better 3 stars. Be warned - there is loud music in both the lobby area and the 12th floor "deck" every weekend until 4 a.m. - reminiscent of a 70's disco. I wish I had known that, so hopefully this review will help others. I had a couple of hotel employees tell us that they must have "forgotten" to tell us that upon check-in. We are in NYC several times a year - never, never again at this hotel - I'd rather find a taxi after the opera.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, overpriced and bad service”
Reviews.Author: Olymbios
Reviews.Content: I booked through priceline. Was told upon arrival that a twin was an extra $50 a night. Was put on a smoking floor due to lack of availability. Found a cigarette butt under the A/C. Made a 15 minute phone call to London and was charged $119. Was told that it was unreasonable of me to demand that these excessive charges be displayed in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room and Excellent Location but....not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: gparch
Reviews.Content: I can see why the reviews of others on this site vary from 5 stars to much lower ratings. Let's start with the good news - the location is right next to Lincoln Center and a block from Central Park and Columbus Circle so it is in a great spot. The room and bathroom werer very clean and modern. While the room was small, I thought it was laid out well. The cons for this site - the shower had a half door so the water went all over the bathroom; there were no face cloths in the bathroom. The price is very high given the size of the room. We went with it, because it was a mystery 4-star hotel listing on an Internet site. Although we paid much less than the retail rate for the room, it was not worth the price in comparison to other "4 star" hotels in NYC that we have stayed at as a result of booking from the same Internet site. By the way, this hotel does not rate a 4-start designation; maybe it's 3 1/2 stars at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: ECB2010
Reviews.Content: The Empire is the perfect gateway to enjoying midtown Manhattan. Located right beside the Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle and Central Park it really makes you feel like the entertainment district is right at your feet. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were comfortable and nicely decorated. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring, service leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Sean W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in December 2010 with my mother who has always wanted to visit New York. On arrival we were checked-in by a frosty Hispanic woman. Pretention immediately struck me as a prominant feature of this hotel and some of its guests/staff. The room was very small, not much larger than a Travelodge that you'd find in the UK. Despite this, all amenties were in place. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was very powerful to wake you up in the morning. Being located on the upper west side, getting around the city was no problem. Walking uptown from 63rd West takes you to a plethora of trendy shops, cafes, bars and restaurants where as walking downtown to about 52nd street is where Times Square begins. There is a Starbucks literally around the corner for a wake-up coffee but saying that there is a Starbucks around every corner in the city. Overall, it was a good trip. I dealt with the staff in the hotel as little as I could and was only in the room to sleep and shower. I will definitely visit New York again and will probably stay more in the heart of the action near Times Square. Regrettably, I cannot reccomend this hotel; you will find cheaper and friendlier all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Mystery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slovakianchic
Reviews.Content: I decided to try out the Empire Hotel in the upper westside of New York city. Actually it was offered on an online travel site as a 4 star mystery hotel in Manhatten. Silly me tried it and unfortunately it is misrepresented. I want everyone to know this incase they have an offer to choose it. The room is so tiny that my husband and I have to take turns walking around. They advertiese every room has a view - the only view I have is a brick wall. No fan in the bathroom, heat is not controllable - only HOT. Stay away from the specials. Unless you pay full price and choose your room as not standard - absolutely NO.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, but wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: cthoops
Reviews.Content: We received this hotel after a Priceline bid. The location was great - close to the subway and Central Park - and the bed was comfortable. That's where the positives end. The doorless shower looks hip but is impractical. We had to lay towels on the floor to keep the water from running everywhere. The hotel allows dogs, and there was a person staying next door with a yippy dog who barked incessantly whenever housekeeping or room service came around. Most importantly, however, was when we received our itemized bill on the day of checkout. There was a charge on it for $45 for the lobby bar, which we had never used. We disputed the charge and they took it off, and gave me a new bill with the charge removed. They then proceeded to run the charge on my credit card anyway. I called their accounting department to discuss, but no one has called me back. I am now disputing the charge with our credit card. Bottom line, we would not stay here again and will be sure to stay away from the zone when using Priceline in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: ejo246
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. When we first arrived we were upgraded free of charge which was an added bonus. The hotel was very modern and trendy. Never ate at the hotel, But had drinks at the bar, The cocktails were pricey but were very yummy, I enjoyed working my way down the cocktail lists. This hotel is perfect if you wanna explore the city and have a nice safe place to sleep. The room was great, large bed. Room was cleaned every day along with fresh towels. The staff were helpful. Just had an amazing experiance and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “UNACCEPTABLE: items go missing from guest rooms”
Reviews.Author: kmhyul
Reviews.Content: There's few worse things that can happen during a hotel stay than coming back and finding out that items that were left in your room are now not there. Rather than telling a long and drawn out story, I'll get to the point: The item was never found, and I'm very obviously very disappointed. It's quite unacceptable for things to go missing from guest rooms, and for them to not be recovered. There are only 3 possibilities of how the item left the room: (1) item was accidentally sent in the laundry. [oops, mistakes happen] (2) item was thrown out [negligence] (3) item was stolen [criminal] If it were #1, which I was hoping for for everyone's sake, it would have turned up in the hotel's "efforts" to recover the item. So it must be #2 or #3 which are both infuriating and a really big problem if that happens in this hotel. I stay in hotels 3-4 nights a week for work (about 200 nights a year) and have never had this happen before. Remarkable. If anyone if curious what the hotel offered as a "sorry"? A complimentary upgrade the next time I paid to stay there. Since no one ever called me back or replied to my email since [2 weeks+], as they promised they would, I'll give you my answer to your offer on TripAdvisor: That's insulting, no thanks. Advice to everyone else: if you do stay here, try to fit your entire suitcase, valuables, and any possession you have into the room safe. Otherwise, you may find that they were lost or stolen by housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! Stay there!”
Reviews.Author: drumasca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect! Beautiful, nice and clean. The shampoos and conditioners inside the room are L'Occitane! It's close to Lincoln and Columbus Circle subway station. It's located in a nice and quiet neighborhood. There is a Starbucks and a PJ Clark's by the corner. It's close to a Bed, bath and beyond, Best buy and Apple store. The rooms are not big, but rooms aren't big in NYC. The size is ok. I chose a room with a king size bed. Staff is really polite. The internet is free inside the rooms! A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully surprised”
Reviews.Author: savebythesea
Reviews.Content: Wow, I was really worried after reading some remarks here, so I am writing to say that the rooms were great, staff professional, and location convenient. Really nice rooms, although a bit small, but very calming colors and very very very clean. I would recommend this hotel. Great bar on the top floor full of people our kids' ages, but guests may bypass the line. The restaurant for breakfast is awful -- it takes ten to twenty minutes to get coffee and it is not plentiful -- the eggs are gummy and crayola yellow. But the hotel facilities are excellent. The lobby is alive with people and so is the lobby bar. There is energy everywhere, which we enjoyed. Very efficient and friendly staff. The spa was excellent as well where I got a man/ped, wax, and blowdry.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JudithChalmers09
Reviews.Content: This place is ok but there is better out there. It is unnecessarily over priced and the bars lack atmosphere. The staff are pleasant enough however the rooms are small and the WIFI is a joke..

Reviews.Title: “Empire Hotel - the perfect hotel for fun, business, and the New York Marathon”
Reviews.Author: katsonlondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Empire Hotel this past November, as I was running my first NY Marathon. I liked the fact that the Empire was close to Central Park, so I could walk back to the hotel after the race, plus the hotel itself looked stylish, modern, hip, yet comfortable. I was concerned that the room might be loud, so before arriving, I contacted the Guest Relations Manager, Don Chatham, to ask if I could put in a request for a quiet room so I could get sufficient shut-eye both before and after the race. He not only gave us a quiet room, but he also upgraded us to a plush and spacious corner suite with lots of natural light. I was thrilled! The hotel itself is beautiful and the location is ideal. The attached Chowder House restaurant became a favorite stop for me, as I loved their clam chowder, sandwiches, and breakfast (huge pancakes, perfect for carbo loading). I was so impressed with Don and his open communication. Funny enough, I never got to meet him in person while I was there (I was holed up in my cozy room after the race as I was just a bit tired after those 26.2 miles), but I felt like I knew him due to his responsiveness via email. If you go, please say hi to Don for me. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting place with rude that don't care”
Reviews.Author: TrishK_10
Reviews.Content: the first night of my stay there was a huge cockroach in the bathroom and when I called the front desk to complain the response was "well this is New York" I am from New York and lived in Manhattan for 13 years and NEVER had roaches in any place I ever lived. Also, don't expect your in room dining orders to be ontime (even if you call the night before to hav breakfast arrive at 8 am) or even correct. Most orders come up missing items or completely wrong. the rooms are tiny and noisy and what they call a closet is an area with a curtain over the hanging bar and on the floor there is a mini bar so if you plan to bring any shoes no place to actually put them. if you checkout the kayak.com site someone wrote a review and said they had bedbugs. I called before I booked my trip and spoke to someone here and asked if they ever had any problems regarding the bed bug issue and they said no. I guess they think people won't find out. Terrible place to stay...Try trump Soho. Beautiful place excellent service and well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDeano
Reviews.Content: I have been to new york a few times but by far this hotel has everything.Outdoor pool and bar for when you wake up.Next to lincoln center bars and restaurants all close by.Trains close by ,tons of shops to blow your money.Freindly staff super nice rooms only use the best of everything.Its not cheap but spoil yourself .. go for it ..

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Vincenze
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empire for 4 nights and were given a free upgrade to a superior room which was quite nice. The bathroom is a bit small but that didn't matter. The bed was huge and very comfortable. My only complaints would be that there is no kettle in the room and the windows were terrible, you have to be pretty strong to open or close them and even when closed the noise from outside doesn't abate, they really need to be replaced. The nearest tube station is at 59th street which is a few blocks away. To walk to Times Square couldn't be easier, turn right out of the hotel then right again and keep going for just over a mile. Central Park is a very short walk away and at the other side on the south east corner you will find 5th Avenue, turn right and keep walking to find Tiffany's, Saks, Rockerfella Centre and Empire State building.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: bill_page
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to the city for over 30 years, mostly for business but occasionally for pleasure. During this time, I've stayed at about every place imaginable. I was pleasantly surprised during my recent trip to the city when my wife and I stayed at the Empire Hotel. It was, by far, the best experience I've ever had when in Manhattan. The hotel was immaculate, comfortable and cozy-the service was top notch. The employees at the Empire went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. Mike, one of the bellmen, met us at the front door every morning with a big smile and a comment to make us laugh. My wife said it was the perfect way to start each day. Mike seems to know everything about the city and was able to answer any questions we had. Helena, the person who checked us in, made us feel as comfortable as we would have been at home. Lou was the perfect host in The Chowder House, (our waiter, whose name escapes me, was the best!) Sean was incredibly professional at the front desk and the concierge, Megan, was able to get us great seats for a play and reservations at the restaurants we wanted to visit. After our experience last October, the Empire is the only place I'll stay from now on when in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Empire”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelGirl6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend trip and spent very little time in the room. The rooms are small, but it is New York, and they are lovely, small rooms. Centrally located with a fabulous bar and even more fabulous rooftop, I enjoyed my stay at the Empire. The GG inspired drinks were also a cute touch. The bathroom needs to be redone totally. It is tiny, which I don't mind at all. There is no ventilation, which makes it somewhat gross after a long, hot shower in a small space. Other than that, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family!”
Reviews.Author: marti13
Reviews.Content: I had pretty average expectations for this hotel (based on online reviews), most of which were exceeded by far. The staff, particularly the doormen/bellmen, were wonderful to our family (including 3 young kids and my mother-in-law.. none of whom fit the "hipster" profile). We were welcomed warmly and checked in quickly after a late night arrival with tired kids. The room (we had a King Suite) was well laid out, clean and fairly spacious for NYC. The linens were lovely, and housekeeping was super responsive when we needed extra bedding for the pullout. The bathroom design leaves a bit to be desired, and the heating/cooling was not perfect, but otherwise a wonderful stay, fantastic location, great service and I would DEFINITELY recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't seem to get any better.”
Reviews.Author: westwilshire
Reviews.Content: The Empire is in a fantastic location. That is about all that is good about it. Even though it was remodeled just a few years ago, it is tired and drab and kind of depressing. I stayed a full week for business, and as with all my past stays, there were problems from the start. When I arrived, it was 40 degrees and my heater was broken. It would have been hard for the housekeeping staff to NOT notice that when they prepared the room, but they didn't. In the morning, there was no hot water, and the TV was broken. Just noise, no picture. For 3 days, the housekeepers left no clean washcloths, and when the tissues were gone, they didn't replace them. My window was broken, and made the room very noisy. I was paying well over $300 per night, and at that price, you expect much better service. Even though the location is great, I think I'm going to avoid it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: la8780
Reviews.Content: I know there are a lot of unfavorable reviews about this hotel, but we really enjoyed our stay. The location is wonderful - we could walk everywhere. I thought the price was very reasonable considering the location. The staff was friendly, especially Ash at the Concierge desk. On Saturday night, the line outside to get into the upstairs night club was around the block, but the bell men recognized us immediately and welcomed us back to the hotel. The rooms were small, but typical for NY, and were very comfortable. (We had a standard queen room on the 7th floor.) The A/C noise outside our window actually served as a white noise machine for us, which is much better to hear than the sounds of sirens all night. A lot of reviewers have complained about the bathrooms. I thought ours was fine, and typical of many of the other boutique-style hotels we have visited. I would definitely stay at the Empire again - we had a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Count On Hot a.m. Shower”
Reviews.Author: gkinnj
Reviews.Content: When we stayed at the Empire Hotel, we had luke warm showers. There was no door on the shower, so the bathroom got flooded. We called both housekeeping and management staff about this. Their response: "Huh?! That never happens." We will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegal99
Reviews.Content: We had to move our room twice and not one was better than the other. We paid over $400.00 for a Superior King and our room on the 1st floor overlooked an alley that had the heating and A/C units. When they kicked in morning noon and middle of the night it was not great. The Breakfast buffet at @$23.00 / per was terrible and the lack of service did not help. However if you plan to attend the Lincoln Centre it's across the street. The Concierge did provide great service

Reviews.Title: “Most terrible hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Yannick021
Reviews.Content: I was here for NYC marathon. The room is as quiet as a Jumbo JET. The staff is terrible. the TV was broken, the toilets too. I just spent 1 night here. the worst night in NYC for my whole life Stay away from that crapy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: hartford2010
Reviews.Content: It was a very stylish hotel but comfort and practicality were not its strengths. The beds had ample pillows and nice bedding but the mattresses were hard. The lighting was poor. the strangest part of the room was the bathroom. Like other reviewers, I found the lack of a shower door very bizarre -- puddled on the floor outside. There is no counter space so there is no where to place toiletries. There are no convenient towel racks. The room was very warm and stuffy and there was no individual unit to moderate the temperature. Overall, the room felt worn. It did have a lot of personality. The front desk was polite, the bell men were helpful and welcoming. The location was great -- a few blocks from Columbus Circle and very walkable to Times Square. The lobby has a cool sitting area which is off the bar and is just a neat place to "hang out." Lincoln Center is across the street and Central Park is a block over. They held my luggage after I checked out so I could poke around the city before leaving town. The regular rate is $700 or so. Really? Not worth it. You can do better at Times Square. A lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: guidovino
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write reviews on places I've stayed at, having flown all over the world as an Airline Pilot. My wife and I honestly can't say we enjoyed our stay there at all, and I'm sure if you were to collect all the patrons during our stay, they would all concur. 2 Star at best at a 5 star price! Understaffed, overworked front desk and housekeeping made the place frantic. People were changing rooms constantly, poor heating and airconditioning, had to request an extra pillow, ice bucket, towels, face- cloths, the list is endless. The restaurants close to the hotel are all great and that is all I would say about this, is the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “NLCR - Nice Lobby, Crappy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sosations1964
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say, my GF wanted to stay there, it looks nice from the lobby but the rooms are about the size of a wlk in closet. Mine was musty, with a queensized bed that was about the size of a double. The staff was must be decendents from the staff at Studio54 circa 1979. And the price, close to $600 with everything. For that kinda money stay at the London New York, or the Gansavoort. Very dissapointed

Reviews.Title: “3 STARS AT A 5 STAR PRICE”
Reviews.Author: StAlbansPadre
Reviews.Content: Well located at the foot of Central Park in Manhattan, not far from the Subway, this Hotel charges accordingly. No problem with that in principle but value for money is very poor as the standard rooms and bathrooms are small and only just passable. We got "upgraded" to a room 50% larger but it was still small. Very noisy location so double glazing and aircon essential all year round, and only just adequate. No meals of any sort available and hugely overpriced snacks etc left in room with a significant charge for their removal if you didn`t want them to remain! All in all impersonal, not particularly friendly and very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Come by for a drink. Stay someplace else.”
Reviews.Author: RPRMarina
Reviews.Content: First the positives: Good location, nice lobby and great rooftop deck. Of course, you don't need to stay at the Empire-- and pay its inflated rates- to enjoy the second and third items on the list. The rooms are tiny, not atypical in Manhattan-- but the prices are high. The maid staff starts banging on doors at 8am, asking to come in, and the racket doesn't stop until the afternoon. My biggest gripe is the snotty staff. A couple of them are just downright rude. I usually stay at 'On the Avenue' and decided to mix things up a little bit. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing! More a nightclub than a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chuckle1981
Reviews.Content: Well where do I start? The location can't be faulted, it really is an excellent base for your adventures in NYC.. But that is all I have to say that has a positive for this particular hotel. On arrival we were shown our room, and as soon as we opened the door, the room had an incredible rotting damp stench, the sitcom unit has flooded the room but I have to ask the room looked like it hadn't been used for quite a while as how could the stench build up for so long.. We then went to complain and ask for another room.. In every other city I've stayed in this isn't a problem... We had to argue with the very rude receptionist for 10 minutes! Also from overhearing the other concierge we knew that space in the hotel was not a problem... My other complaint I that we had ordered drinks at the roof bar, and tipped the waitress (who to be honest can't mix a cocktail, but we thought we would be kind) but on our departure the hotel charged us 20% tip for these drinks.. We even showed them the receipt showing that we had already tipped their collegue in the pool bar but they wasn't having any of it.... Paying £10 on absolutely nothing is highly annoying!.... Now on to my biggest upset. The Hotel Rooftop bar.. If you plan to use it between 9am and 6 fine.. To be honest we thought we would try and see what it wa like in the evening, no! You are not allowed in even though you have paid for the privilege to stay here.. You have to leave the hotel lobby, and join the back of the queue full of people who do not stay at the hotel!?!?!? We couldn't be bothered laughed and decided to go see the Big Apples nightlife instead.. We spoke to other British people who tried to get in to the rooftop bar and they were turned around as they didn't fit the image of the place??? (They were a couple from Notting Hill an obviously had money and class) To my partner and I we found this disgusting treatment.. Would I stay aagain?? Not until the establishment gets some decent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised after reading all the negative reviews on here”
Reviews.Author: ginmi1976
Reviews.Content: We were very wary after reading all the bad reviews on this site but based on our personal experience, this hotel is great. The location is amazing, the bed is great and the only issue we would mention is the way the shower is setup. They should really put a shower screen there to stop the bathroom floor from getting all wet whenever someone takes a shower. Their Wifi service was a bit touch and go though which is disappointing for a hotel of this class. We had to go to the Starbucks next door to get online. Overall, this place was really good value as we got it for a really cheap price through a 'Mystery Hotel' promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable holiday”
Reviews.Author: happytripper41
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from The Empire Hotel and have had a lovely time. Reading the previous reports we had our doubts and when we were given a room that overlooked, what appeared to be the surrounding buildings air conditioners and generators, we worried even more. We had checked in without any problems or delays and when we asked if there was any other available rooms as we hadn't slept due to the noise, there was no question and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were upgraded to a lovely room on the 6th floor overlooking the Broadway. The room was clean and a good size with a very comfortable bed , the bathroom was also a fair size. I did flood the bathroom but that was because I had the spray on wrong ! We didn't use any of the hotel facilities, bars, pool etc but that was because we were out and about all day every day. The hotel is close to bus stops, subway or in walking distance to where ever you want to go to. We would definitely use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: KellyinHR
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia so got a great rate. Started to get worried after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor but after speaking to one of the hotel managers I decided to give it a try for myself and am thrilled that I did! The hotel was great - the decor is lovely, the staff friendly and the room was spotless and no smaller than other NYC hotel rooms. The only point that I can agree with is that if you are not careful when showering the floor can get wet but that is a design flaw and no fault of anyone actually working there! Overall I had a great stay and plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly flawless stay!”
Reviews.Author: krystynlo
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the On the Ave hotel, but when I saw on Hotwire that I could save about $100 on a "Central Park Area" hotel, I went that route for my Halloween weekend stay. I was crushed when I saw it was the Empire and read all the negative reviews on TripAdvisor! But honestly, our stay was flawless. The staff is friendly and helpful, the room clean and as quiet as you can hope for in New York, the lobby is gorgeous, the bar is relaxing, and of course you cannot beat the location. The linens -- a big issue with me -- were soft, clean and not cheap. Oh, and the Internet is free, and fast (for a change). I would absolutely stay here again, and honestly perplexed why the reviews here are so bad. I guess either we lucked out, or they ... unlucked out. K

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Content: From the moment my husband and I arrived, we were treated like royalty. A bellman met us at the door, unloaded our car, took the keys and made us feel welcome right from the start. All of the people at the front desk went out of their way to make us comfortable (the manager, Sean, was especially helpful), the concierge, Megan, gave us the most amazing tips on restaurants and shopping - the entire weekend was an absolute dream. The meals we ate in the hotel's Chowder House restaurant were fantastic. Again, the staff in the restaurant made us more than just comfortable. We were greeted by one of the restaurant's managers, Lou, who stopped by our table to make sure we were enjoying the food, which was delicious. I would absolutely recommend The Empire to anyone thinking of spending time in the city. Seriously, I can't wait to come back. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when in town.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better.”
Reviews.Author: Lulu255100
Reviews.Content: This hotel hotel could not possibly be 4 star. The rooms are tiny, the lift racketty, the paint chipped. My bedsheets were actually wet when I arrived.! Someone had made the bed with ironed but wet sheets! The rooms have noisy airconditioner/heaters. The bathroom is tiny, with chipped tiles. In the morning the room was filled with cooking smells. Four star? I asked if I could get a coffee in the bar or anywhere in the hotel in the morning and was told that I could get one at Starbucks around the corner! The hotel is in a great position and is clean. The front desk staff is friendly and efficient. But it is overpriced. Get a good deal somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “If you are planning on staying here to go to the Rooftop bar... DONT!!!”
Reviews.Author: JF76
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a large group with the thought we would go to the Rooftop Bar.... Well that did not work out. Not only was it NOT free to go up (as stated on there web page) but they would not let us up because we were not with girls. After seeing many couples go up to the bar and much back and forth they would only let us up if we paid for bottle service. I dont know about you but after all that I was not willing to shell out 350.00 for bottle service.

Reviews.Title: “A+ location, C- accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMan09
Reviews.Content: Great location and the rooms are clean and nicely decorated, if you like a trendy boutique hotel look, that is. The lobby and bar are nice enough, too. But if you look at anything closely (or, in some cases, not even that closely) you can see that the proprietors pretty much did the bare minimum to make the hotel acceptable. The carpets in many areas are threadbare, room service is left uncollected outside people's doors for up to 2 days, the doormen apparently don't know that part of being a doorman is to open doors for guests as they're schlepping luggage, and the bathrooms (miniscule) are in bad shape (see picture of the tub in our bathroom), among other things. If location is your primary criteria for choosing a hotel, you cannot go wrong with the Empire. But it's not a very pleasant place to be.

Reviews.Title: “super hip, awesome location, but...”
Reviews.Author: love4jetsetting
Reviews.Content: the staff there could take a tip from the w hotels on "being hip doesn't mean snobby"! we usually stay w hotels when we go places, but since we were traveling with our friends we wanted to try something different this time. read some great reviews on this hotel, and i am a gossip girl fan, so thought we try it out. all i have to say is hmmm...not so impressed. front desk team isn't super rude, nor super nice...just there to check you in. maybe they were robots? i should have reached out to touch and see for myself?! the lobby and rooms were just amazing...totally up my alley as far as the design aesthetic goes. superb! room & bathroom size was quite good for ny standards. loved that! location? oh forget about it...we loved being central to everything we needed. it was awesome! the only problem i have with this hotel, is that service was seriously lacking here!! we went up at the rooftop pool area to relax and enjoy our last day with some snacks & drinks. only to sit around waiting and waiting...no one there to take our order or even greet us? i went to the bartender to ask if there was a service person for the pool area, or were we supposed to order up at the bar? he said "oh well we are short staffed and running about an hour for food service up here, sorry"! um...ok....we will just sit here and enjoy the view, drinking our bottled water then...thanks for nothing mr. probably the MAIN thing that really bummed us out was that we were planning to head up to the rooftop lounge for some drinks saturday night before heading out to the village for some live music. not only were we told that as guests we still had to wait in the club line (what?) but then as we were standing in line, the bouncers came up to my husband and our friend and said they were dressed inappropriately and couldn't get in. 1st of all WHAT? we are staying here, and can't go up and get a few drinks without being treated like we are at a LA nightclub? 2nd of all, please tell me what is inappropriate about the guys wearing dark jeans, cool shirt, and jacket? they weren't dressed like thugs, it was an upscale trendy look...perfect for this type of venue...not a suit! when we told them that we were guests at the hotel, they basically let us know that if we wanna get in, the guys needed to change. hmm, okay that's cool...okay that's fine we won't argue it, we'll just spend our drinking $$ elsewhere. sad sad! i have stayed at multiple w hotels, and we are always able to show our room key, and head straight into the lounge...never an issue, never waiting in lines. the next day as we were checking out i told one of the guys that worked the front, and he said that shouldn't have happened, and that the staff was basically being "a'holes". he said i am sorry that you didn't get to hang...maybe next time. but, no thanks, next time we will just stick to what we know!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: TonyO_StPaul
Reviews.Content: The Empire made a great home base for our stay in NYC. The location worked really well for us, as it was within easy walking distance of a lot of attractions including Central Park, and was within a block of the subway. Our room was small - really small. But everything was really clean, the decor was nice, and the bed was really, really comfortable. We slept well! We had an issue with out A/C immediately upon checking in and mentioned it to the front desk as we headed out for dinner. When we returned, it was fixed. Actually, all of the staff that we encountered were really pleasant and more than willing to offer any help they could. We booked the hotel via Priceline bidding, and got a pretty decent rate. For what we paid, it was perfect, and we would be satisfied staying at The Empire again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but little else to commend it”
Reviews.Author: Leedstraveller24
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Empire Hotel just after 3pm, having been told checkin was 3pm. However the room wasn't ready and we were left waiting in the lobby for nearly an hour, as were several other people. After lots of complaining we got to our room. It wasn't good. It was cramped, no view, no bath - just a tiny shower room, and had a musty smell. The aircon sounded like a jumbo jet taking off. There is supposed to be a hotel roof terrace but most of the time this was locked off. The hotel staff said that was because it was raining, or due to rain, even when it wasn't. The truth seemed to be that the hotel used this as a kind of club. When it came to printing off boarding cards, there was a facility but it was hard to understand and operate, and there was little support from hotel staff who always seemed to be too busy. The supposed free wi-fi didn't work most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth it even at a discounted rate...”
Reviews.Author: magsbme
Reviews.Content: We were excited to try this hotel especially since it's website stated that rooms were priced over $360/night and that it was a four star hotel...we got it really cheap on an alternate sight. Front desk staff was beyond rude! Our room was horrible. It overlooked a roof top ventilation system, was so tiny that my husband and I had to take turns walking around the bed in order to get to another part of the room. There was NO where for us to open our bags, the very small closet that we had was half a shelf that would not allow you to hang a pair of pants let a lone a gown. The amenities that the hotel states are in your room were non-existent. The wall paper was not only peeling in the bathroom, but was peeling over our bed and on another wall near the TV. The shower was filthy, and the steam from the shower made the entire room muggy and wet because there was no ventilation. We asked the front desk staff to move us to another room after they had verified that there were many rooms available. They stated that they would only move us to another room if we agreed to pay more money/night. Even for the same sized room...It is obvious that if you reserve a room through a third party for a cheaper rate that you are treated as a second class citizen and more money will be demanded should you want a room that isn't mildewy and nasty. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Other than that...DON'T spend the money, even if it's cheap...unless you enjoy being treated poorly and staying in a less than acceptable room

Reviews.Title: “Great Decor & Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Chanel1102
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York City & my travel agent got me a pretty good deal on this hotel. I was a bit nervous after reading some bad reviews online but was pleasantly surprised.
