We checked in early (9:30am) & was told that although our room was not ready that we should check back in about 45 minutes just to see if a room opened up (They didn't guarantee but we were told to try anyway) We arrived an hour & a half later for a different & VERY rude woman on the front desk to look at me like I was crazy & tell us that "No, nothing would be ready before 3pm" I kindly asked her if there was any chance of us getting in sooner as we had been up & traveling this 3:30am, again she looked at me like I had 5 heads & promptly told me no again. Feeling a little irritated with her attitude I went off to enjoy some more of the city to return back at 3:30pm to find out that the room the original (& very nice) lady had booked for us still wasn't ready but that they were going to give us an upgrade. This was much appreciated! However, I think we may have been put on a smoking floor after requesting a non-smoking floor. Our room was very clean & neat. The room & bathroom were quite small but were more or less what I had expected being an older (but renovated) hotel. We also had a working A/C which was a relief after reading some horror stories of very hot/humid rooms online. We didn't have any view (just another building) but we didn't experience any noise outside & were able to sleep without any noise issues. The doorman at this hotel went above & beyond what I expected. They always seemed happy & eager to greet you & more then happy to flag down a cab for you if necessary. The lobby of this hotel was stunning & felt very modern. I was also excited to find out it was also featured in the second Sex & the City movie! The upper west side location was perfect & was very close to Central Park & Columbus Circle, & all the taxi drivers we encountered knew of its location since it has been around for so long. All in all, the hotel was what I expected, I was pleased with the service & would stay again (if I got another deal!)

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and very disappointing --- You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: M-Deutsch
Reviews.Content: This is a very expensive "high end" hotel that definitely doesn't deliver. The service was wretched (it took them several hours to respond to an urgent request) and they are unfriendly and unresponsive. It is noisy and the rooms are cramped and not set up well. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; small rooms”
Reviews.Author: keroppi348
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel for us was the location. The hotel lobby area/lobby was nice to have a few drinks and chat with friends. The furnishings and fixtures appear to be clean and well maintained. Being guest of the hotel, we did not have to stand in line to get to the roof top bar. The not so good things: - the room we were in was very small and had a view of a (very close) buidling wall. - the bathroom was very very small. - reservation was for a non-smoking room, but was given a smoking room upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Nightclub! Don't Stay if you want a relaxing holiday.”
Reviews.Author: Books77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because my husband was raving about it as he had been 2 years before but by the time he left he definitely was not going back. Location is great, hotel is nice and trendy but service was ridiculous especially the front office. I think they are believing all the hype about the hotel too much and its getting to their heads! House keeping staff were the only ones always willing to help. The Bell boys were really good and helpful too. The hotel was noisy and felt more like a bar/club than a hotel......we are a young couple but still didn't feel right. We went to the bar a few times however, it seems they care more about being a young , hip trendy place than actually making their hotel guests comfortable. I felt like a stranger in the hotel I was staying because it was always packed full . Rooms were small so we had to upgrade, they are also very noisy so didn't get much sleep either Overall, not recommended and I am not returning.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: parxheavner
Reviews.Content: I have never had such poor service at a hotel in my life. The front desk staff was rude at check-in and only got worse. While checking out we had a discrepancy on our bill. I waited 30 minutes while the clerk tried to resolve the issue in the back with no communication only to have him come out and say he would do nothing. Shortly after, my husband got involved and waited for over an hour, same situation, staff hiding in the back with no resolution to the discrepancy on our bill. We ended up calling our credit card company and refuting the charge because the staff refused to help us. Housekeeping did not observe the do not disturb sign and knocked on our door every 30 minutes every morning until we left the room. The mini-bar people were just as bad aslo stopping by at regular intervals. I've stayed in NYC at a lot of different hotels so I know the rooms are small. However, this room was a shoe box. They bathroom as tiny and the shower curtain did not contain the water from the shower so the bathroom was constantly flooded. The hotel boasts flat screen TV's in all the rooms, which would e great if the TV worked. Even basic channels (ABC, NBC, Fox) were snowy. What's the point of having a nice TV if your connection is so bad that you can't see the picture? They also claimed to have free WiFi, but we could never get it to connect. Overall I felt like the hotel couldn't care less whether we were there or not. They did nothing to make our stay comfortable. No one was polite. No one was friendly. And then when we needed something, they simply ignored us. It was truly the most horrible hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - dodgy rooms”
Reviews.Author: IB1London
Reviews.Content: We were there for the first few nights of our honeymoon. The room we had booked was unavailable so we were downgraded to a single. It was tiny and the AC machine was very loud. We got free breakfasts for the duration of our trip as compensation but to be honest the receptionist was pretty uninterested. The next day they moved our bags to a queen room, which was better. It was still small but it had a good view of the Lincoln Centre. The hotel is in a great location, near the park, the Lincoln Centre, shops and a cinema. However, even in this room the AC machine was very loud and often woke us up during the night. The concierge was always very friendly. The roof garden pool/bar was ok but not what it looks like on the website. Obviously the night bar is very trendy but I don't think guests have priority access to that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: shescoopsdotcom
Reviews.Content: I would love to stay here again the next time I visit NYC; without hesitation. I did what I have never done before and booked through Priceline so got a really terrific price. We were visiting NYC for my birthday celebration so I had contacted the Guest Relations Manager (Don Chatham) ahead of time because I was a little worried that because we were paying a good deal less than the rack rate; we might not get the nicest of rooms. How wrong I was! Don was so kind in both his communications and in his actions. Upon arrival, we learned we had been upgraded to a Junior Suite which was above and beyond. Great views out the windows and a gorgeous bathroom. Add to that the complimentary surprise bottle of champagne (to help us celebrate) and the massive NYC-style cookie that we found in our room each night - we were smitten. Allison, the concierge, and the check-in staff made us laugh from the word go - which made our trip start out brilliantly. The ambiance of the place is rather on the posh/trendy/cool side of things. I did not experience sleepless nights due to loud music. Being on the 5th floor; the only sounds were the classic NYC sirens, etc. out the window. We did not eat in the restaurant nor order room service so I can't comment on those - though the Irish Oatmeal for breakfast sounded amazing (if rather pricey). There is also FREE wi-fi which came in very handy. In terms of location - it is very close to the Subway; a Whole Foods (3 blocks) and across the street from the Lincoln Center with the NYC Ballet, Opera, and Philharmonic. Thanks to the team at the Empire - it really added a lovely dimension to our NYC trip! Polly from shescoops.com

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: NJOYNC2CA
Reviews.Content: Ask for the handicapped room. It is huge! The walk in shower is amazing. The location is perfect for exploring NYC on foot, subway, bus, it doesn't matter. It was great. Perfect place to come home to after long days of exploring. The rooftop is a cool place to have a drink and watch the sunset. The pool is small but just fine. Apples every morning at the front desk were a nice touch. I missed them the last day we were there when they weren't delivered. By the way, the mini bar is FULLY Stocked! WOW! The only issue I had was the hotel must be older. The last night I heard a loud slam, but couldn't figure out what happened. I turned out one of my windows had fallen down. I tried to raise it but it would not go back up. Luckily, I was checking out because it was HOT and the air conditioning was going right out the window. Overall, cool hotel. The staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out - too loud to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: hollyloch
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, DO NOT stay on the upper floors. The hotel rooftop bar plays crazy-loud music all night long. We stayed for 2 nights and couldn't sleep either night due to the music. Things in our room were shaking. Ridiculous. And the manager wouldn't answer the phone or return my calls. Easiest thing is to find another place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not At All Impressed; 4 Star Rating is Off The Mark”
Reviews.Author: tempertraveller
Reviews.Content: If you can't say anything nice, don't say anything at all. Truthfully, it is not all that bad; it just did not meet our expectations, ought not have a 4 star rating as it does and is over priced for what is on offer. I will however say that the staff were all very capable, polite and professional. The best thing about this property is its staff. We booked for 4 nights in September. Friends had stayed here and recommended it and the pictures were very impressive. I knew people who stayed there in years past and they said it was completely renovated and a great place to stay. It would be if not for the price. After the first night we checked out and into another property in mid town. The property we moved to was far less expensive and far more comfortable. We were put in three different rooms before we bedded down for the night. The first (630) was tiny, loud and the wrong bed type. The second (Room 626) was acceptable but for the fact that you had to sleep on top of the aircon and it was growing mould spores. The third room (1106) was better but I chopped up to the point that I could not see my travelling companion when we were both in our beds. The room looked out to an air shaft that was dark and dank throughout the day. Without exception, there was not room enought for a trash can in any washroom we had and in 2 out of 3 the door to the washroom collided with the toilet. Apart from the staff, the next best thing about this property is the location. You can throw a rock through the windows of Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center without ever having to leave the Empire. It is attractively reno'd; especially the lobby but not at all worth the rating or the price in my opinion. P.S. Decent spa in the basement (Jeunesse Spa) that is well priced, though not affiliated with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in upmarket location”
Reviews.Author: LittleMs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after falling in love with the photos we saw of the trendy interior and the unusual bonus of a roof top pool. Having been to New York many times we were keen to avoid the Broadway / Times Square location and knowing that the west side of Central Park is a very plush location opted for the Empire. What a fantastic location - a stones throw from Central Park and just a quick stroll and your on 5th Avenue. Unlike other comments we found the staff, reception, maids and security really friendly and polite. The pool area was gorgeous and we enjoyed several evenings up on the rooftop having drinks (yes it is expensive). Our room was no smaller than the usual hotel room in Manhatten just much better decorated and the bathroom was gorgeous - who cares that its not practical if you're only there a few days?! We were there for the 1st part of our honeymoon and were relieved after reading a very concerning review that a surprise hamper our friends had arranged was in fact waiting for us in our room and because of this reception were aware it was our honeymoon and congratulated us - so hopefully the hotel have taken note of the poor reviews from others and things have improved greatly. Loved it - would definitely go there again and recommend it to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Awesome lobby, small but nice rooms, ridiculously small swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Caro37
Reviews.Content: The photos for this hotel were done by a brilliant photographer who must have been something of a gymnast to get his angles for the swimming pool! Having said that, the lobby is a thing of beauty - really cool. The rooms were very small with very little storage space and the shower was a ridiculous affair - it looked swanky - a wooden deck with a rainhead and no door - but it poured water all over the floor. I felt so bad for the housemaids that I would spend a good ten minutes every day cleaning up the deluge on the floors after our family of 4 had showered! This is however, a great hotel for location if you can get the price reduction we did through Priceline - it was an absolute bargain. It is dead opposite the Lincoln Center complex, near Colombus Circle and two blocks from Central Park. The bus which takes you all the way down to where the Statten Island Ferry (a good 40 minute ride for only $2) can be picked up, leaves from right outside the hotel, stopping at every good destination along the way (Get your Metrocard which gives you 4 journeys for $8!). Staff were ok, but a little too aware of their Hotel's trendy status (the US Open was about to start and the hotel's nightclub was the venue for it!). The major complaint was that we were put in a room on the 11th floor initially and when we returned from having a meal out, it sounded like we had a nightclub in our room - obviously no good for us as parents with young kids in tow! Having said that, I went downstairs to ask to be moved and the young lady who sorted it out did it with much aplomb and was super efficient - within 30 minutes we had unpacked and were settled into a room on the 8th floor - where there was no noise except that from the streets as you would expect in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend!”
Reviews.Author: traveler24NewYork
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel until we checked out... the hotel was on the top of their game. We were upgraded from an express queen to a king room. I had noted that it was our anniversary and D or mgement sent a bottle of champagne to the room- very nice touch-thank you! In NYC the rooms are not huge, but very nicely setup and the bed was comfortable. Flat screen TV's and bathrooms had all that you needed. Visited the rooftop lounge at night and hotel guest do not have to wait on the outside line only the elevator line. The lobby is very well decorated. The location is perfect away from Times Square. Everything you need in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HapyIrishLad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Empire Hotel for eigth nights, I checked in on 23rd August 2010. The reason for my trip was my 40th birthday which was identified at the time of my booking. The hotel itself is in a great location just across the road from the Lincoln Centre and a few minutes from Central Park, The hotel itself is very nice and has a very nice foyer with a bar also. The check in staff are professional but not very friendly i suppose thats because its a boutique hotel. I did not eat for drink in the hotel as the prices were a complete rip off. The hotel rooms themselves were very comfortable, nicely furnished and had flat hd tvs with all the channels that worked its a plus.. The bed was extremely comfortable and as for the bathroom it was small I admit plenty of clean towels and very nice Loccitance range of toiletries. The rooms were spotlessly cleaned and my room was cleaned in the morning and before I returned back in the evenings. Access to the subway is a few minutes away and its about 25 minutes by foot to Times Square. The rooms were quiet at night but housekeeping did wake me in the mornings so use your do not disturb sign. I was slightly disappointed that my birthday was completely ignored especially as I was travelling on my own but I made up for it. I would stay here again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel...pity about the staff”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel140
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Sept 9th with husband and 5 month old baby. Loved thr hotel,very trendy! Small rooms though.Didn't realise fashion week was starting across the road in Lincon Centre.We felt the staff were only intrested in the "fashion crowd" We stayed here for our last night of holidays. Arrived with 3 cases and a stroller.Nobody offered to help us to our room, and not once did the many staff hanging around the lobby open the door to help us out(even when I was on my own with the baby) I would go back but it's not a hotel geared towards families. PITY!

Reviews.Title: “I might stay again if the price was right”
Reviews.Author: normalfolks
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Empire.I'm not sure if it deserves 4 stars, The room was small but pretty comfy and seemed pretty clean. Noise can be pretty bad from the street and the doors on the other rooms. I guess this place is supposed to be kinda chic. Its decor is really kinda dark. The restaurant is way,way overpriced. The food might be real good, I didn't try it. The surrounding restaurants seemed kinda high priced too. It is convenient to Times Square, and the subway is a short walk away. The little fridge is stocked full but also way overpriced as were the snacks in the room. The small vending machine size cookies that cost me 75 cents at work in the machine are $6.00 in the room. Seems a little excessive , even for New York. No coffee pot, no alarm clock , no ice bucket.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: charlotteamy1984
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Having read negative reviews we were quite aprehensive about staying here, but have absolutely no complaints. Our room, athough small, was clean and stylish, and was actually really cosy. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The pool area was lovely, but unfortunately we didn't get to use it as it poured with rain the entire time we were there! The bar and lobby area was also great, I loved the art deco style decor. The location was also good - right opposite the Lincoln Centre and just a stones throw from Columbus Circle and Central Park. We would reccommend this hotel and would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, awful. Do not stay here. False advertising at its best.”
Reviews.Author: hego83
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed there in the last few weeks. We arrived into a very small, cramped room. The carpet was not vacuumed, there was a toenail clipping lying on the carpet beside my locker. The instance we walked into the room we both got a terrible smell, athough we were unable to identify what it was. At the time of check out our credit card was charged for a meal we never had - we explained this to the front desk and were assured everything would be fine. At home a few days later the meal had indeed been charged to us. We phoned the hotel to query this and were met with the rudest, most unhelpful girl on the desk I have every come across who would not stay on the line to help us and transferred us immediately to a voicemail in the accounts section. We phoned back again and asked to speak with the manager to be told he can't make international calls!!!! No I ask you.... the manager not allowed to make international calls!? I wonder is this a party trick of the Empire to make money? Charge meals to random rooms. The cleanliness was............. awful. To be met with someone else's toenails upon our arrival on the carpet was awful. Long story short, the hotel is clearly using its roof top bar as its selling point. Everything else...................... awful. A word of caution. Do NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, no light, little, tacky, dark, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: capecod16
Reviews.Content: This was the worst room I have stayed in in NYC and it was rated 4 stars. I would not give it 2. The decor is terrible, I had an interior room, the air conditioner is noisy, I had roaches in the bathroom. I left after one night even though I had paid for a second. It was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, overall good value and great stay.”
Reviews.Author: xraydoc04
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Aug 30 to Sep 3, for a total of 4 nights. We got the rooms from a price-bidding site, and was surprised to get a 4-star hotel at USD150 per night. However, we become apprehensively when we read some of the reviews. Hence, we were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the room that we got. My party is a group of 5 adults and 2 young boys, and the single queen bedroom allocated to us was not big enough. So, we paid USD30 more per nite per room for a 2-queen bed suite. The rooms are big for a NYC hotel, and much better than what we had when we were in San Francisco. There's free wi-fi, free use of a mini-fridge, and a safe. No coffee making machine, but that's OK. I'm not sure why some people are unhappy about the room size, as I've had worse in DC, for a much higher priced room in a branded chain hotel. The rooms are very nicely done, and comfortable. The bathroom is small, but honestly, it's sufficient. The hotel sacrificed functionality of the basin for aesthetics, but that's fine. The air-con is old and noisy. No insulation from street noise, so it was difficult to sleep in late with all the noise. Parking is very expensive, at USD60/day with no in/out facility. After the 1st day, I parked my car just 2 streets south, at 61st street using Icon parking, for USD35/day. Made no sense to drive around NYC, as parking is expensive. Metro is at 58th st-Columbus circle. There's a Whole Foods supermarket near the Metro, and we got milk, juice, bread and snacks as breakfast was not included. Central Park is 2 streets away, and Natural History Museum is just 1 mile walk away, which was a nice walk in the morning. Lots of cheap eating places within half mile south of the hotel. Try the Mee Noodle Soup shop along 7th Ave, as well as Shake Shack along Columbus ave west of the Natural History Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in New York”
Reviews.Author: MacFamily35
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the Empire Hotel in August with family. It was a trip to see the sights of New YOrk and do some shopping. The location of the hotel is good, near Central Park and about a 20 minute walk to Times Square. The rooms were well appointed and clean. The bathrooms were a bit small and not pratical for travellers as there was not much counter space, as well there was one door missing on the shower. The shower head faces down so water did not get out of the shower, but still not pratical. The hotel as a small pool with deck chairs. This was nice to add some relaxation to our trip.Overall the Empire Hotel is a good hotel to stay at if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hip but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: sushiboy21
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline at a surprisingly good price for four-star in Manhattan. Contrary to other reviews, the staff were mostly friendly. We paid extra, above our Priceline payment, to ensure we'd get a room with two beds, as we were travelling with kids. Some people checking in at the same time who asked for two beds were put on a waiting list. Rooms were tiny but with cool furnishing and comfortable beds and bedding. Bathroom was also small but elegant and modern. Couldn't get the WiFi to work on our iPod touches but someone with a laptop might have better luck. Reception on the television was awful on local channels. Air conditioning, as noted by others, was a bit geriatric but it worked. The rooftop terrace is really nice. Yeah, the pool is tiny but big enough for the kids to splash around in and cool down. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, acceptable price, clean rooms, ok service”
Reviews.Author: NeoMaximus
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline as a "feeling lucky"- "pick my own price" deal. I wanted a great location to Broadway and Central Park and a price below $300. All hotels around this area with a 4 star rating were above my price range. Empire Hotel accepted. When I saw the location, I was very excited, but after seeing a few of the reviews I was wondering if I did the right thing by shooting the dart with my eyes closed. Having stayed here a couple nights I feel this place is great. The rooms are clean, the location is fantastic, don't expect the front desk to kiss your feet (they are very good at checking people in and out of the hotel, but beyond that, they are always busy") I didn't use the concierge and don't plan on it. The fridge had a few drinks, which were opened, so I wanted to make sure I don't get charged for it - had to stay on hold on the phone with front desk for 5 minutes and hung up... came home in the evening to find out another drink half finished... The bedrooms are clean, bathrooms are nice. Though some folks don't like the one door shower stand style (with a towel placed on the floor the water doesn't spill that much) - also beware of a small switch under the shower lever, which switches between the rainforest showerhead in the ceiling and the handheld shower. The other thing - there is no hot water in the room (so if you like to make your own tea - you are out of luck), but they gave me a cup of hot water in the bar downstairs free of charge! The swimming pool on the roof is rather small, but having a nice sun deck with a pool in the middle of 90F weather in New York is fantastic! I am happy with the hotel overall and if visiting here again would stay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let them give you Room 111!”
Reviews.Author: Noergler
Reviews.Content: I'll say this: the bed was comfortable. And the location is great. But the room was like being in the bottom of a mine shaft. So depressing. I asked to change it - it was still early in the afternoon - but got a big, fake smile and a "So sorry." The a/c unit is medieval, and I had to sleep with a pillow over my ear to muffle the noise. The free wi-fi is hopeless. When I asked they said that some guests say it works better in the lobby or the mezzanine than in the room, but that was just as bad. Loud, crass music blaring in the lobby. There are little touches of what they hope to pass off as modern and swanky, but the place is tawdry. You can't say you haven't been warned.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind the hotel being used as a film set and want a 'no frills' central location then Empire is great!”
Reviews.Author: Feefifofum40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We chose the hotel for its central location and swiming pool. However the hotel was being used for filming 'Gossip Girl' which our children found very exciting until we realised this meant we couldn't use the pool deck after all! We were recompensed with free breakfasts which weren't anything to write home about and the service was fairly curt. The rooms were small and in need of redecorating - a bit frayed at the edges. However we were so central to Broadway, Central Park and most of the sights we wanted to visit. New York more than made up for the accommodation at Empire.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and glamorous with a nice Gossip Girl surprise!”
Reviews.Author: MD77
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after seeing it on Gossip Girl. What a wonderful surprise to see filiming in the lobby bar. Fantastic location and amazing service. The concierge moved mountains to get us great tickets to the American Idiot musical which did not disappoint. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was compact but well set out with funky furnishings - love that tiger print chair!! The huge couches near the bar provided a relaxed setting to sip on a cocktail or 5! We loved it and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Empire Hotel is worth a stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzoh!
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on Saturday and by that night we had called over 5 times to advise management the air conditioner was on the fritz. It's an old building so the circuit kept tripping. In any case, the night manager, Eric, came through with stellar customer service. He moved us into a larger room, where the A.C. worked fine. The rooftop deck is amazing and the hotel bar is a hotbed for television filming. The hotel is very clean, the staff is terrific, and Eric is a keeper! -Angel and Tara Russell

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected fees - not happy”
Reviews.Author: corygerdts
Reviews.Content: They nailed us with $100 in extra fees that were not indicated upon booking. Left feeling extremely taken advantage of. 6 more words: Elevator ding heard 'round the world... Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Location...Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dustyn
Reviews.Content: The room was small but well appointed; however, the room was VERY dingy, dark, and seemed thrown together. The bathroom door jam looked like someone tried to get into it with a crowbar and the wallpaper was peeling near the ceiling in multiple locations. Our duvet cover had a hole in it and my wife kept catching her foot in it...funny after awhile. There was no sheet between the duvet either which was very weird, just a duvet, that's it. As for the location, we were two blocks away from Central Park which makes this hotel worth the booking. If you want the Plaza, then you will not be happy here...it's cheap, better than a hostel, and a perfect location. The staff was good getting us checked in fast, but they did nothing exceptional. I'm not going to rate them high just because they did their job as directed. Rooms again were picked up, but seemed very dirty still, stains on the curtain, etc. Our air conditioner was OLD and EXTREMELY noisy. On top of the noisy A/C, the windows were old so we heard car horns, sirens, and people yelling ALL night and we were on the 5th floor! I can't imagine being at a lower level. Overall, 3 star hotel, 5+ star location, decent nights sleep, cheap for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “pro s and con's”
Reviews.Author: edkbs
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the empire for 8 nights. We booked two rooms with two beds each. stayed at the 5 th floor at the street side. (some street noise ) rooms are small but beds are great. hotel is clean , good room service airco is a disastre ( eather on or off) , you can't get the temperature right I can't understand why a decent hotel as such an airco. pool is super small , bar very expensive ( 19 dollar for a glass of wine) pool is open each day form 10 to 10 , but only ok for little children when we asked hotel staff to book us a basketgame ticket , they would charge us 69 dollars for a ticket of 10 Dollars !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! on are bill they charged us two phonecalls we didn t make location is great Due to front desk staff and the totally outdated airco , i wouldn't recommand this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Central Park is highlight of the Empire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rocksario
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were moved to this hotel after booking at another hotel that was deceitfully FAR from Central Park. We were happy that the Empire is only one short block away from the Park and very conveniently close to the subway. We were there for a busy birthday weekend and therefore didn't spend much time at the hotel. From the time we did spend.. these were our remarks.. 1) The room is small but nicely decorated and the bed is TO DIE FOR. 2) Very nice plasma tv and desk area with an ipod radio which we thoroughly enjoyed while getting ready for a night out. 3) The bathroom is very nice-looking but not functional AT ALL. Both my boyfriend and I have college degrees (his in mechanical engineering) and it took us well over 5 minutes to figure out how to use the shower and to figure out there was no door to close the shower resulting in a watery pool on our bathroom floor. 4) The hotel is very chic.. definitely catering to the party crowd in NYC.. the hotel staff while nice and pleasant was young and not very experienced. When checking in they asked me if their hotel was better than the hotel we were moving from. I thought this was rather childish. 5) We could not check in earlier than 3pm so we had to leave our bags there to go to our event in Central Park. 6) Very nice views from our room and seemed quiet despite all the party people showing up to attend the pool party on the roof. Returning from our event around 2am there were many intoxicated twenty-somethings exiting the hotel some were being literally pushed out by the hotel staff. Since we are also in that age group we thought for sure we would be mistaken for the party crowd and kicked out ourselves. Fortunately this did not happen. Overall a nice stay but definitely the highlight is the location!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ACW80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near central park so not next to the main shopping areas etc but there is a subway stop just near by. The hotel is really funky and has a couple of amazing bars. While we were there they were filming gossip girl! Which was very exciting! The only very slight down side was the size of the rooms but they were still clean, maybe my suitcase was just too big :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Hotel - Shame about the service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: sut78
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult hotel to review and I can see why it has been given varying comments. Pros: 1) It is in a good location, within walking distance from Times Square and Central Park. Also on the tour bus route. 2) Rooms were fairly small but nicely decorated. Beds were comfortable. Nice bathroom. Large TV and iPod radio. Could do with a Tea / Coffee machine though. 3) The starbucks downstairs is useful, especially as there is no coffee / tea in the room. Also a pharmacy. 4) Some nice restaurants nearby. Cons: 1) They were filming an episode of Gossip Girl whilst we were staying there. This meant that the pool was closed for the whole duration of our trip (3-4 days), and also the bar was closed for one day. There was no warning of this and no compensation for these facilities not being available (although they offered to pay to use the public swimming pool down the road, this is not really the same). Also, as part of the filming, we were questioned as to 'what we were doing' or told to be quiet or hurry up, when we were trying to get to our room or move around the hotel! 2) The staff varied greatly. Although some were polite, others were dismissive and even rude (including one of the managers). They seemed to have an attitude of 'there is nothing we can do', 'its not our problem', or 'the hotel is not responsible'. These were the answers given to the filming, and also when the internet stole our money and didnt work. 3) The bars and room service are quite expensive. $10 a drink in the bar. $20 for breakfast. 4) The bar can be quite noisy. We stayed on the 11th floor, and you could hear music and footsteps from the bar above. Other comments: The rooftop bar was quite nice and trendy. There did not seem to be too many queues whilst we were there, but we didnt stay on a saturday. Cannot comment on the rooftop pool as we didnt see it. Free wireless internet. On another trip, this hotel could have been quite nice, but it was ruined really by the filming and some of the staff. I think that more consideration should be made to the guests if the hotel decides to use its facities for filming. It is primarily a hotel after all!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but new pool is horrible and service is even worse....”
Reviews.Author: alirtraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and had a good experience and decided to stay again, this time to enjoy the new pool deck. Well, you can't even call it a pool, its a lap pool that is lined with blue plastic! Water is dirty too. The lounge chairs and deck are nice, but does it really matter if the pool is such a joke? Also, the front desk service couldn't be worse. The girl who helped us didn't smile and looked like she couldn't bother to be there. If you're that miserable you shouldn't be in customer service. Plus our room wasn't even ready at check in time! And to finish it off, we got into our room and the maids cleaning cart was left in there!

Reviews.Title: “Empire Hotel - Central to Park, Shops and Broadway WOW”
Reviews.Author: princesscaroline91
Reviews.Content: We travelled to New York from Barbados with American Airlines business class. It was fantastic. The crew could not do enough for you. We stayed at The Empire Hotel in New York City. It was beautifully done out in zebra prints and chocolate browns and orange colourways. Our room wasnt large but we only ever slept there anyway. However it did overlook broadway. It had a lovely dining area on the roof (We only ever went up for breakfast and a late night drink). We were recommended the hotel by the british airways staff who we booked our tickets through. It just so happened that this lady had been to new york and had stayed there herself. Recomendation is everything. Because of its location, so close to central park and fifth avenue it was great for sight seeing. On the corner of central park (3-5 minutes walk) you can get on a tour bus. I dont know what they charge this year but it was around $10 to $12 per person a ticket. This will take you either end of manhatten island, you just choose which way you want to go, north or south. The best thing about this is that you can get off and back on again at any of the bus stops so you can get to sight see and not have to buy another ticket as it lasts all day. We did not realise this until the last day when we decided to do a tour, so if you want to see the island, go hopping on and off of the buses, its great. The weather in september was around 23 - 25 so just right. We had a fantastic time and I would certainly recomend this hotel as I would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for Central Park area”
Reviews.Author: NantwichMark
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel are pretty mixed, and I can understand why, but we thought this was pretty good overall. We travelled as a party of five - myself and my partner, her two sons (21 and 10) and the elder son's girlfriend. We had a double double on the top floor and elder son plus girlfriend were three floors below. Bearing in mind that it's New York, and rooms are pricey and small, we were happy with what we got. Everything was modern and spotlessly clean, and we got a nice view towards the Lincoln Center. First the drawbacks - the pool isn't as nice as the photos would suggest. they have worked miracles on the angles, because it's small. We were keen to have a pool to keep the 10 year-old happy, but in hindsight this is a small rooftop plunge pool for the trendy crowd to gather around, rather than a pool suitable for kids (or even for swimming, really). Our only other grumble would be that the lounge and bar were so achingly chic that we felt out of place, and the food prices were so astronomical that we didn't even contemplate eating in - about 20USD per person for breakfast, and snacks were 15USD. On the positive side, we found the door and reception staff courteous, the room cleaning excellent, and all the communal areas well maintained. The location, just a block from Central Park, was excellent especially given the 100-degree heat. We found a pretty good deal online which gave us five nights for five of us for about 400USD each - so all in all, we were pretty happy with The Empire.

Reviews.Title: “Catastrophe”
Reviews.Author: KbbOc
Reviews.Content: We looked all over the web for a good review and deal and decided on the empire. Regular double bed room. We arrived at 8 pm and had to wait at the front desk for about 20 minutes to get checked in. Once there, we were told the room was not ready yet, here are some breakfast coupons, please come back later. We went to dinner, came back and checked into a very warm, very small double bed room. We could not get the air conditioner to work so maintenance said go have dome fun and I'll fix it. We arrived back about an hour later to no air. Our safe, our room phone & air did not work. At 2 am with no sleep in a hot room, maintenance brought up a box fan & said your circuit breaker for your room is broken. Hotel is full. Sorry.although the manager comped the room, we got almost no sleep. The next morning we were moved to a bigger room with ac. Pool is SUPER small, like a lap pool. There were no towels of course. Sat night the roof bar is packed so the hotel has a huge line of people out front.and in lobby all night. So many other hotels yo choose from. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Most of the posts here are pretty accurate”
Reviews.Author: DallasWorldTraveler1
Reviews.Content: I thought this Hotel was "Ok". I knew it had a reputation for having a sweet pool scene on the roof as well as a hip Hotel Bar. I thought the rooms were of decent size, the 70s theme had me taken back a little, but i think they are going for that. Felt a little uncomfortable when I had to go to the lounge bar to get some ice after 10pm... Let's just say I was getting ready for bed and my evening attire didn't quite fit in with the rest of the bar scene.. All in, I think it was neat NYC Hotel and I would recommend it for younger couples looking to be in a sweet NY area with lots to do. Probably not the best for families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.. angry staff.”
Reviews.Author: cleggles
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in the Empire when we got married in New York on the 30th June in Central Park. The desk staff were down-right surly, telling us that we had only booked one room instead of two despite being shown evidence to the contrary. The following day we tried to find the spa so my wife to be could book a hair appointment for our wedding day, unable to find it, we had to ask the desk staff - unfortunately the same person as the day before - who sent us down the elevator into a basement which when the lift door closed behind us was pitch-black and we spent 5 minutes trying to find the wandering around in the dark until we ended up in the laundry room and then feeling the wall to find the lift button. (when we did find the spa it was ridiculously overpriced). On trying to enter the rooftoop bar we walked up all the stairs to the top of the building and opened the door to get into the bar only to be confronted by a bouncer who shouted "what the hell are you doing?" We said "getting a drink". To which we were informed that we were not allowed into the bar unless we went back down to the front of the hotel and queued up for the bar (even though the bar was not full) I explained that we were guests in the hotel and showed him my key card and he replied "and?" so I called him a very rude word (under my breath.. he was a big chap.. and black eyes would have spoilt the wedding pictures somewhat) and went back down to find a queue of massively obnoxious drunk people which I didn't fancy standing in so we went elsewhere. On a positive note though, the consierge (a chap whose name i unfortunately did not get) was amazingly knowledgable, and found us a hair salon that was brilliant and about a quarter of the price of their own salon. On the day of the wedding we were waiting for our transport outside the hotel to take us to the bataux for a dinner cruise (which you should definately do whilst in NYC as it was amazing) and a member of staff came to talk to us and on returning we had champagne and strawberrys and rose petals on our bed, which was very nice. So they redeemed themselves a little (although it seems that the way to get good service in this hotel is to walk around in a big wedding dress.. just pop one in your suitcase just in case).

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: PedroMacG
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon. Our bedroom was a bit small & we requested a street view 10 weeks prior to our arrival which we never got. The Hotel Wifi only worked for 1 night of our stay. The Hotel has a great location, Adjacent to Central Park & walking distance to Times Square. As we returned to our hotel each day, our electronic room key wouldn’t work. So each day we had to go back down to reception to reactivate our room key. There were always a few people at reception with the same issue. Very frustrating after being outside in the heat all day. The rooftop bar is very stylish but very expensive. $22 for two drinks! Also we asked a local patron where the smoking area was. he just laughed, you can't fault the Hotel for its clients, it was just one of many rude New Yorkers we met. On leaving the hotel, we were greeted with a phone bill of $90. The hotel room information book didn’t have their rates on it & the hotel couldn't explain how they arrived at that fee so we refused to pay. Overall we a good stay, the hotel was clean, the staff were pleasant & the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Aesthetically pleasing but not a great place to stay especially if you're easy going and do sports or bringing family”
Reviews.Author: Artemis88
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to NYC for a Triathlon. We had used priceline for this hotel and got the room on the second floor for $120/night which is an amazing deal when their rooms usually go for about $299/night. When we arrived there the bellhop was very courteous and helpful and took all our stuff to our rooms. The room was big enough to put two bike bags and two bigger pieces of luggage (with a bit of room to move around them) which was perfectly fine. The room was beautiful and the bed was a little big higher than average for comfort. There was a shower only and no way to close it so even if we put towels on the floor it still got soaked. The prices for our little fridge bar and anything else was very expensive (but expected from a hotel like this). Also nice though becuase you could take everything out and use the fridge. The service is probably the worse part of this hotel esp if you have sports event to wake up to at 330am. The night before triathlon we did not put up our don't disturb signs but we also didn't have a sign that says service please (which is part our fault for this part of our stay). So while we were lying there we keep on hearing "tap tap tap"...made it very hard to go to sleep (we also found out it was the turn down service...which knocked on our door at 11pm the night before the triathlon...I wasn't happy but I forgot the sign so I couldn't complain too much). Either way though it is hard to sleep because of the "tap tap tap" that you hear every night for "turn down service". The maids that clean your room are very prompt and replace everything from towels to your shampoo, etc (which unless you're a person who is environmentaly friendly and don't like to waste things...that service should be perfect). I would almost have to say that the only nice person and helpful person that worked there was the bellhop. The hotel is overcrowded on most nights esp Friday and Saturday because they have a rooftop bar which is not exclusive to hotel guests (there is a dress code of dress shirt and nice shoes so don't accidentally go there (thinking it's the pool and thinking you'll relax from the heat of NYC) in your runners and a nice pair of shorts because you'll get a look of distain from the "security gaurds" that makes you feel very very small and insignificant. The pool was harder to find and on the way up to it you think you're going the wrong way due to going up stairs that look like it was part of a custodians closet in a dingy hotel. When you find the pool you'll find it very laughable when you realize that the photos from online are very misleading as it has not cut off any part of the pool....the pool (I refer to as a tub) is maybe about 6 feet wide (that would be pushing it) and not that long (the pool in my condo is almost four times bigger). The location, however, is amazing. You are close to two subway entrances and walking distance to almost everything (the subway entrances connect to the trains that go straight to most of the popular sights without having to transfer too much or at all in some cases). Two blocks away from Central Park, there are really good deli's around too and if you or anyone else on your trip feels sick the pharmacy is right around the corner (literally). Liked Best: -location -aesthetically pleasing -free internet Liked Least: -service and at what hour "turn down service comes" -"pool"..or tub as I refer to it as -crowded with non hotel guests going to the rooftop bar upstairs on weekends -unfriendly atmosphere (exception of very helpful bellhop) Side Note: Would upload photos I took of this hotel but I didn't take any I was that unimpressed with service (I liked the hotel that Delta Airlines put us up in better in Minneapolis and that was a $49/night hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: greenturtle53
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with good customer service. The rooms are nicely appointed, and the bathrooms have been updated. It has a great location. From our window, we could see the streets converge with Lincoln Center on the left- amazing view. Getting around is easy with subway stops only a half of a block away. The stay was great Friday through Tuesday, but on Wednesday night, the rooftop bar was opened. There was a line around the corner waiting to get in. The line was not a problem, but the place does not have adequate soundproofing. The walls shook and thumped all night. I'm not sure how many floors the hotel has - maybe 14? But we were on the 4th floor, and the earplugs did not help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel pity about the service”
Reviews.Author: patc56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 27 June to 1 July as our daughter was getting married 30 June. I booked and paid for 2 rooms, but on our arrival the receptionist insisted that there was only one room booked despite being shown the booking confirmation. Eventually it was sorted out but she was most unfriendly and the matter could have been dealt with better. After a long flight the last thing that you need is aggrevation on checking in to your hotel. The public rooms were beautifully furnished and impressive as was our small but spotlessly clean and well presented room. The airconditioning was noisy -constantly switching on and off throughout the night. I have advised the hotel when booking and on checking in that we were part of a wedding party but it was not until after the wedding, when 13 of us we were waiting for a limo to take us to The Bateau that a Manager asked if we were staying there. When we arrived back, champagne, roses and strawberries were waiting for the newly weds. A nice touch but a friendly word at reception on arrival would also have ben nice. The hotel is well placed for the subway and there are lots of reseaonably priced eating places within 10 mins walk. I had enquired about booking a table for our 13 guests for dinks and nibbles around 3-4.30 around the roof top pool area on the day of the wedding. I must have sent 5 emails and had no reply so phoned and was told that it was a public area and it was not possible to reserve a couple of tables. I accepted this but was surprised that notices were put under the door informing us that the pool area was to be shut the following day for a private party. This happened twice out of the four days. I can only say that if you book this hotel expecting to spend a little time around the tiny plunge pool after a hard day in NY think again. On our return I have found that a small amount has debited my credit card. I made 2 local calls and paid for them in cash on departure. The mini bar was untouched and we did not use the bar or any other service. I have emailed the hotel twice to ask what this amount is for and have had no response. Not really surprised they are not big and answereing emails.

Reviews.Title: “great location / average service”
Reviews.Author: aggie28
Reviews.Content: great location, right to the Lincoln center and subways. Classic room clean as well as the bathroom. Small space for clothing. Loud AC. Negative points : service (managers give you attitude whereas the staff is very nice) The roof top. It is closed at 10PM, but they do not tell you that part of the roof top is "converted" at night as a lounge (not loud at all) oponed to the public. It is really weird to get back to the hotel at night and to meet with people lining up to get into the hotel to the roof top. I know the city well and it can drag "cheap" crowd around and for the hotel price.... however, it is a good deal if you can book your trip early.

Reviews.Title: “What a come back!”
Reviews.Author: LuluTrist
Reviews.Content: I am a native New Yorker, and have known the Empire Hotel since I was a little kid. It was old and tired. This hotel has been completely revamped, and the value for its location is unbelievable. The staff was fabulous too. Definitely going to be using this hotel whenever we need to escape the kids! :) Jeunesse Spa underneath...not so much!

Reviews.Title: “how can this be rated 4-stars?”
Reviews.Author: cityshepherd
Reviews.Content: Okay I understand space is at a premium in NYC hotels, and puny size of a double room here was tolerable - but decor seemed calculated to make it seem smaller, and depressing. But while reasonable minds might differ about the room, the broom closet sized bathroom was unique in my experience. Toilet crammed into a space suitable for midget and I've never seen a shower without a shower door, and so small that there's no way the flow could stay into what looked like a decorator's never-been-to-Japan idea of oriental chic. incredibly, to reach the "pool deck" you have to enter a stairwell and climb three flights of stairs. Fitness center? The size of a single room with a handful of machines. This is luxury? Give me a break.

Reviews.Title: “Just two complaints prevent this hotel getting full marks”
Reviews.Author: twinings
Reviews.Content: The one major fault of this hotel is breakfast . The service is poor with lazy waiters wandering around bringing you your order piecemeal: coffee pot, then cup, then cream .Butter is brought but you have to remind them about the toast..the buffet option is incomplete ie bread and bagels but no toaster.Cereals but no milk. One morning the bread had not been delivered. Secondly the music in the bar/lounge once it is over to the dj is totally incompatible with conversation. If they addressed these two points it would be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nakis
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to NYC and we researched a lot before choosing this hotel. What drew us to the Empire Hotel was the fantastic location across the street from the Lincoln Center and one block away from Central Park, the great transport connections and the elegance/trendiness of the rooms. We stayed there for 6 nights and we were lucky to have a room facing the front of the hotel (as some rooms are internal) with great views in three directions (see photo). The standard double room is somewhat small for international standards but this is NY and large rooms cost a fortune! We had two large suitcases and we didn't have any problems moving around. Other people are right, the beds are extremely comfortable!! Bed linen was changed daily, rooms were spotless, L'Occitane toiletries in the bathroom, free wifi in rooms, friendly and polite staff. Location is excellent too, there are great shops and restaurants in all directions and a multiplex cinema a 5 min walk away. There are some weaknesses though in the service that a hotel of this standard and fame should (and could easily) address. We only had one bathrobe in the room when we checked in and we had to ask twice for a second one to be delivered, we had no fresh towels one day because there was no laundry delivery that day, and the beautiful rooftop bar and swimming pool were out of bounds for guests on most evenings because of parties/events. None of these spoiled the experience, but a hotel that seems to seek perfection and charges $700 a night off-the-street price (we paid a lot less off the internet) should try this extra bit more to achieve that! Overall we loved it and we would be more than happy to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Service leaves much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster15
Reviews.Content: I live in NYC but booked a room at the Empire Hotel for a celebration with friends. The interior of the hotel is quite nice, but that is pretty much the only good thing about it. The staff at the front desk is rude and the employee that checked us in barely said two words to us. We realized that our room was a bit to small to accommodate us (booked on Priceline so could not choose room category) and called to inquire about upgrading to another room. The hotel was not willing to accommodate us so we stuck with the same small room (one full sized bed) as I know that NYC hotel rooms are typically small in size. Our room had no guest directory or information on the rooftop pool, spa amenities or partner restaurant. The bathroom had mold all over the back of the door and a sink that did not drain properly. The rooftop is nice for lounging, however the pool was murky and didn't seem to be well taken care of. All in all, the hotel was fine for a one-night stay, however the lack of proper service would discourage me from recommending this hotel to out of town guests.

Reviews.Title: “Change the front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Adrismom
Reviews.Content: Great location, Columbus Circle right across from Lincoln Center. Also stayed in January and liked it enough to book again. Excellent restaurant, Ed's Chowder House, right in Hotel. Last stay, hotel was less crowded. This time, stayed on July 4th weekend, and usually the city is empty, but this was a disaster. Check in was deadly slow lines. Hotel has a rooftop pool lounge, but apparently, it is not run by the hotel (although hotel guest allowed free admission as long as you DONT BRING YOUR CHILDREN - which they neglect to tell you when you book the hotel on July 4th for the espress purpose of viewing the fireworks! Front desk staff completely ignored our complaints (we had called in advance to make sure it was ok!) as well as other people who were told they had to get on line with non-hotel guests to get to the rool (line was hundreds of people long, wrapping around the NYC block by 8 PM!) Also, AC wasnt working very well (multiple complaints) and only one or two elevators were working, requiring about 15 minute wait to leave on checkout day. Won't be going back - especially not in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, spacious room -maybe a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: I stayed more than a week at the Empire hotel during a business trip to New York. I got my room for a 165 usd corporate fare, but I think that the standard fare is over 400 usd. The point is that for 165 usd it´s a great hotel, but for 400 usd or more there might be better options in the area. I really loved the location. The hotel is just across the street from the Lincoln Center, steps away from amazing Central Park and a 15-minute walk from Times Square. I went to work by subway to my company´s office in Chelsea and it was just a 15-minute commute. The area is great, with lots of things to do. The hotel is very old but was renovated about 5 years ago. The décor is very trendy, but some features -i.e., the carpets- start to look dated. I think that it would take some money to bring its glory back. Anyway, the lobby is really luxurious. My room was huge by New York standards, with a comfortable desk and a great king-size bed. The bathroom wasn´t that big but it was reasonable. There´s free Internet access as well, which was really useful during my business trip. Service is as good as you would expect in a 4-star hotel. There´s also a terrace with places to relax and a pool on the roof top. Overall, it is a nice property which would really use some updating. Anyway, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “If you're traveling with kids and having a pool is important to you, then a quick heads up is in order.”
Reviews.Author: seattletraveler505
Reviews.Content: There are a number of reasons why we chose the Empire, but chief among them was the availability of a rooftop pool. Like many families, we enjoy having a pool available when traveling with our kids. Please be advised that the pool at the Empire is quite small, and should be considered more of a plunge pool than a swimming pool (i.e., shallow and much too small for swimming; useful only for wading in and cooling off). Also, the pool area was booked for a private event on two of the four days of our stay thereby making the pool off limits -- and this occurred after we received assurances from the hotel prior to arrival that the pool would be available to us during the entirety of our stay. A reasonable adjustement was made to our bill (after we complained) but we would never have booked at the Empire if we knew the pool was so small and that it would be closed to us for half of our trip. Otherwise, rooms are reasonably sized and the location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “A major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MrGelhs204
Reviews.Content: PROS: Location, Location, Location; Complimentary wireless internet. CONS: The common element of all my worst experiences as a business traveler lately is the same: an in-room IPOD docking station. My room was incredibly small AND uncomfortable. Don’t need much, but when the bathroom door doesn’t fully open because it hits the toilet, and there is barely any room to move, you know you are in serious trouble. Perhaps there are larger rooms; I certainly did not get one of them. The shower sliding door in room 1102 was missing a half (or was that on purpose?) so water spilled into floor while you are showering. Outlets were a tough find and work desk space was minimal. There was very little room in bathroom to place toiletries, etc. Noisy old school air conditioner never fully cooled the small room, but it was never unbearable. Needless to say I did not have a good night sleep either night I was there even though the bed, linens, and pillows were comfortable. The fitness room is not properly labeled, so one must know that it is rooms 124 and 125; it is below average at best. Worst, forget about receiving any kind of service; the staff seemed aloof and detached from the operation. First, the lobby music is loud preventing the understanding of any normal front desk interaction. My check-in experience on 6/30 lacked any sort of normal human behavior and I even found the woman to have a bit of an attitude; no one cared to asked me at checkout how everything was. It doesn’t seem anyone cares about the guests at this place and I rarely say this. My post arrival midnight phone calls to housekeeping at midnight and 5 AM to request an iron and ironing board (they don’t have them in the rooms but info flyer says to call via housekeeping) went unanswered and my phone transfer to a live person as the recording suggested did not occur till my third request at 6 AM. The very roof top bar was not accessible because it was closed for some sort of filming during the day and at night you have to compete with the long line of locals who want to be seen with the beautiful people. I guess I could have tipped the security staff. No special roof top bar privileges of any sort for hotel guests – VERY annoying. Could not even get to the pool when I had time because the pool was closed for filming. Why stay here for the rooftop bar and pool when you can get it to it is beyond me. I got the impression these folks make money renting the rooftop are to everyone and anyone (special events, film crews, etc.) so the hotel guests are always screwed. You want to hear more service attitude at this place; here is directly from their room guide. “Late checkouts are granted on an availability basis and may be subject to an additional charge. A half day room and tax charge will be posted to your folio after 2 PM and a full day charge after 6 PM.” I missed last Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn Express experience. Avoid this overpriced hotel at all costs especially if you are a business traveler. I have no incentive to return and will lobby the company I consult for, whose main office is just around the corner from this place, to place employees and guest elsewhere even if we all have to walk extra blocks.

Reviews.Title: “If read only one review, read this one.”
Reviews.Author: jsantora
Reviews.Content: Just got back home form a stay at the Empire Hotel Yesterday. I travel constantly for work so the bad reviews really put me off but most of the complaints seemed to come from people with extraordinary or unrealistic expectations so we gave it a shot anyway and I was happy we did...First off it's NYC, rooms are gonna be smaller regardless although we had a king and I thought it as great. The room is clean, the bed comfortable, the bathroom is small. Rooftop pool is pretty much a gimmick, the dimensions are approx. 10'x20' and it is COLD!!! The location IS great, close to the 59th street subway, central park, theatre district, times square and a short $10 cab ride into the meatpacking district. The staff seemed ok, but again it's NYC not omaha..LOL The roof top bar always seems to have a line but if you are a hotel guest you go to the front of the line. This is a great hotel if you just want a clean trendy room in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - worst staff I have ever encountered.”
Reviews.Author: lisa0810
Reviews.Content: Booked 2rooms with suite-2nd rm wasn't ready until next day! "manager" Shaun was uneducated, rude. Bellman never said hello to any guests--walked in with baby in arms sleeping, pushing stroller, not one person opened door. Stay in hotels every week...would've rather stayed at Holiday Inn, at least they say hello. NEVER NEVER again

Reviews.Title: “good location, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: area41
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel was excellent, right beside the lincoln center and central park. However, myself and five other adults we were travelling with arrived at around 11am on a thursday and were told our rooms would not be ready till three. We returned at three and were told five by an unhelpful concierge. We also were told that our bags would be put somewhere safe but after returning we saw them sitting beside the main entrance to the lobby, laptops and all, which was extrememly upsetting. Our rooms were eventually ready around 7pm, all at different times. room was extremely small and if you were in the bathroom you could not open the door fully to get out without climbing over the toilet. Our other travellers got their room about 8pm and their air conditioning wouldn't work. The staff were unhelpful, however after three days of complaining (on the last day of the trip) they were moved to a different room and refunded their payment for the room, which was good. However myself and the other guests that had to wait nearly 8 hours for our room were offered nothing, not even a drink. The rooftop pool is closed for most of the year and at night the lobby is crowded and noisy as there is a nightclub of some sorts upstairs. the wifi also did not work. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hospitable, enjoyable stay, however the location is fantastic if you are there for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, NOT family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Bloomie4
Reviews.Content: The staff was cold and the rooftop pool is about as big as two jacuzzis --and you have to walk up two flights after taking the elevator to get to it. The hotel makes NO accommodation for children, nor are the staff particularly friendly. Mostly cold, business-like and slightly exasperated by having to deal with the public. Best thing (only thing?) is the great location, between Central Park and Lincoln Center. But I'm sure next time I can find something in the same neighborhood that's happier to have us!

Reviews.Title: “Empire Strikes Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: nina1492
Reviews.Content: The Empire was a terrible hotel! It took me over 15 minutes to wait in line to check-in (which was about the same time it took waiting for the elevator! The bathroom felt smaller than a tin can and the bed was extremely uncomfortable. Additionally, the air conditioning hardly blew cold air and the "complimentary" breakfast included stale bagels and flavorless pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Popular hotel across the street from Lincoln Center”
Reviews.Author: Traveller20203
Reviews.Content: On a trip to NYC to visit friends & family, I stayed at the Empire hotel for the first 2 nights. The hotel is directly across the street from Lincoln Center, and near Central Park. It is walking distance to the Time Warner Center where there are a number of great restaurants. It is a safe and convenient location in NYC. There is also a popular rooftop bar & pool. Each night during my stay there was a line of people waiting to go up to the rooftop. Hotel guests returning to the hotel do not need to wait in line. The room was very tiny, I'm guessing around 200 square feet. The bathroom was nicely appointed and everything was clean. The bed was a good size and comfy. The hotel is trendy and popular. The elevators are slow, be patient. The normal rate starts from the mid 300's. I got the room for $165 via priceline name your own price.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: axelr58
Reviews.Content: rooms incredible small, even upgraded room. No space for luggage, no space for clothes. Loud and noisy facility. Despite recently renovated already dirty rooms, cockroaches etc. The free WIFI never worked. Service OK, only concierge was of little help and only suggested very expensive solutions (i.e.: car rental). Best was roof terrace, both public and pool terrace.

Reviews.Title: “We checked in early which was nice bc we...”
Reviews.Author: ballerinamom95
Reviews.Content: We checked in early which was nice bc we bad been on a long red eye flight. I was told that the room was small but it was available so we took it. The room is the size of a closet. There is no shower door. Water goes everywhere. The one window looks over an area filled w trash. Here's the best part...I'm being charged the same rAte for this closet as I was going to be chArged for the original much bigger room. Over$300 a night. I requested a lower rate twice and was completely blown off. Do not, under any circumstances, stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a chance!”
Reviews.Author: ChampagneSupernova1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last November with my mum and a friend and must say I was initially very put off by some of the bad reviews on here! We decided to take a chance on the Empire and were very pleased with every aspect of our stay. Firstly, the location is great - 10 minutes walk from Times Square and very close to Central Park. Also, contrary to a lot of the comments on here, the staff were all great. Every one we spoke to, from the desk staff to the bell boys were extremely polite and attentive throughout our stay. In terms of the bar being closed to guests, that wasn't the case when we were there so I can't really comment on that. Yes, the rooms are small but you're in New York - what do you expect!? Unless you have money to burn you will never get a spacious room in New York, the rooms were nicely decorated, very clean and the beds were very comfy. If I had to pick a fault I'd say that the corridors are in need of some attention and the shower leaked a little but apart from that I had a great time at the Empire. I am actually a travel agent myself and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to my customers! What I would say is that if you are looking for a bragain and want to spend a lot of time in a big luxury hotel room, New York is definately not the place to for you. However if you want a great sight seeing base with friendls staff and a good nights sleep, the Empire is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but with some cons...”
Reviews.Author: J123N123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for me and my two kids (12 & 16) for a quick weekend getaway to New York. I chose the hotel because of its fantastic location. I was close to booking at a hotel nearer the southern end of Manhattan as we wanted to visit the WTC site along with the whole Brooklyn Bridge and Pier area - (we still managed to get down there one of the days and it is definitely worth the twenty-five minute cab ride). The Empire Hotel has (I'm pretty sure) been recently renovated as the lobby/rooms are all extremely-well appointed. The Lobby is modern and although it's random, the lighting was very relaxing and there was a lot of places to sit at in the Lobby - very comfy seats. The staff I met were all eager to help and when we asked for directions or tips on how to get to places they were happy to offer there knowledge. There is a restaurant in the hotel itself - we never ate there. It looked nice... but dark and more of a bistro-styled restaurant - not my type. For breakfast, we ate at the perfectly situated Starbucks on the same corner of the hotel. It was a big Starbucks with lots of seating and the people were also very friendly. We ate the first night at a small Italian down on the Avenue of the America's (the name slips me...) and another night at a Asian restaurant called Tao - this was extremely good (expensive) but fantastic food. Our favourite restaurant by far though was one called Cafe Fiorello - literally across Broadway from the Empire Hotel. The hotel is situated pretty much in the middle of a lot of the interesting places of North Manhattan; Lincoln Centre, Shops and Columbus, Central Park, Fifth Avenue with the masses of designer stores. The Chrysler, Flatiron and Empire State buildings were all more of a taxi ride away - not really close enough to comfortably walk. We went up the Empire State building at night thinking the lines wouldn't be long... but they were. I don't think it really matters what time of day you plan to visit the Empire State because the lines will always be long! If you have time definitely visit Macy's - fantastic experience! Getting back to the hotel, the cons were: The rooms were very nicely furnished/appointed but small. We had a room with two queen beds in and it was a squeeze - hardly any 'walking' space around the beds. The bathroom was small - other reviews have mentioned the bathrooms being right and they are true - they are seriously small. You could be on the toilet, wash your hands and give your feet a shower at the same time... The "Business Centre" was uhm... more of a Business Closet. It had two (I must say very nice/modern) computers but it was like sitting in a broom closet. Our room got very hot but the air conditioner was noisy and rattly and was very annoying when you were trying to go to sleep. We ended up leaving ours on when we were out during the day and then turning it off right* before we went to sleep - that way it didn't disturb us. One of the things my 16 year old son (who's a swimmer), was looking forward to was the rooftop pool, bar and terrace. Yeah ok... it would have been nice if we had got to get in the pool but it was closed for 'maintenance' every day yet nobody was ever working on it... Not to mention it was literally less than 2m wide and probably 10m long... not much of a pool. Also the rooftop terrace is fantastic - a great place to have a drink before going out to dinner or after getting back from your trips out... but it is very very* expensive and it was nearly always closed (parties or do's) but the one time we were able to go we had a great time. Overall, the Empire Hotel is a modern, nicely appointed hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms were small - especially the bathrooms - and there was not much of a business centre but on the whole it worked for what we booked it for. I'm not sure I would go back - just because of the room sizes - but if they were a little bigger the no doubt I would be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: yllas1492
Reviews.Content: The Empire has really upped their game. The rooms, the bars, the hallways and elevators have all been designed with great care. The service was first class. I highly reccomend the Empire when doing business in New York.

Reviews.Title: “forget about the rooftop bar/pool”
Reviews.Author: reallynicegal
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed rooms and lobby, but staff on desk quite aloof though all other service staff friendly, helpful and welcoming. My air con had to be noisiest ever but the most wonderful thing when returning after hours sightseeing! Beds very comfy and spacious enough room if just used for nocturnal activities, no room to sit and relax but i didn't mind that. As for roof bar/pool i never got to see it as always closed for private parties or events, such a pity as its used as unique selling point at point of selecting hotel. Overall cleanliness good, tiny bathroom though and badly designed fittings, toilet awkward to sit on, sink shallow, and shower controls difficult to master. It is still a hotel i'd recommend because of its location and proximity to park and walking distance to lots of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “too many private events...”
Reviews.Author: Dagsy81
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is located in a lovely area near central park, lincoln center and columbus circle. The pool looked great online - i wish i could have seen it but there was one private event after another, and maintenance, that i never had the chance to actually use it. The rooms are small, but if you're not in NY to stay in your room you dont need anything bigger. Would have been nice to have a coffee/tea maker in the room..

Reviews.Title: “Four star with many quirks”
Reviews.Author: pmirchan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just finished a stay of 5 days. The location is outstanding. $7.00 cab ride to most attractions and of course being just opposite the Lincoln Centre and walking to Central Park is great. That said, the Junior Suite we upgraded to is the minimum anyone should stay at if you want room to move and a couch and a chair to sit on. We did not regret our decision to upgrade one bit.
