Staff were friendly and very helpful. Room Service was prompt and the room kept clean and neat. A few drawbacks which puzzled us immenesely. No tea/coffee making facilities whatsoever which makes for a not so good start to the day. No wine glasses in the room even though the mini bar has wine bottles. No proper hotel directory. The air-conditioning cannot be adjusted and so you may swetler a bit in summer. Downstairs bar in the evening is noisy and not recommended for a quiet drink. And so to the infamous showers. Yes, the design is a train-wreck. To use them: the big handle is for adjusting the water temperature - you have to turn nearly 360 degrees to get hot water. AFTER that look for a cunningly disguised sliding lever BELOW the main handle. This controls both selector switch for hand-held/top shower as well as the water pressure. No matter what you do, the floor will become sopping wet. however the hotel staff know that this is a dud design (as is the shallow sink) and are prompt at changing towels. Having said all that, the room was a sheer delight to be in - the plasma tv was huge and the proximity to stunning restaurants and quiet neighbourhood made the experience on the whole very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, try to get room off street side”
Reviews.Author: halrlaph
Reviews.Content: Great staff, kept our bags and laptop before we checked in, nice clean room, small but adequate, free wifi, well appointed room. Very noisy on street side, but everything else very good.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Champion”
Reviews.Author: mhatahet
Reviews.Content: A really charming boutique hotel equipped with modern furniture, comfortable beds, clean bathrooms, etc... The staff were extremely friendly at check in and check out. A very proffessional Concierge was helping us in getting reservations for tours. The price to quality ratio is totally acceptable for New York I would defenitly make it my standard hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Hold on to your wallet and your jewelry”
Reviews.Author: RobbedATtheEmpire
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively and I have travelled with my wife and teenage kids on a number of occasions. Not once have I ever been concerned about leaving items of any value in my hotel room. Not the case any more with the Empire Hotel. My daughter had her jewelry case stolen from our room. While we did not loose the crown jewels, she did loose items that held value. The hotel treated us like we were trying to pull a fast one on them. We informed the hotel, they sent up security which promotely dismissed us. We did not even ask for any money, we wanted to make sure that they knew that we had this happen to us. The security guy seemed unconcerned. They told us that only hotel staff and my family had used the electronic key to get in - so, i had to infer that they did not believe our claim. So ladies hold your gems near and dear to your heart. Unless it is tied down, too heavy to carry or too big to get out of the door - your stuff is not safe at the Empire Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: kec80
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Empire, so I just wanted to write a review sticking up for the place! Our standard queen room was fairly compact but there was enough room for all our things and for us both to get ready at the same time. The bed was wonderfully comfortable, the shower was lovely (none of the problems with flooding that other reviewers have had and I loved the Occitane toiletries), and the room was absolutely silent and dark thanks to the heavy curtains (great for helping us get over our jet-lag!). As for the communal areas, we enjoyed the rooftop bar and the swimming pool looked lovely and inviting for summer days (shame we didn't really have time to use it!). The lobby was nice enough, although the music was very loud in the evenings. My only real complaint was that prior to our stay, I emailed the hotel twice for some info - once through their website, and once to their email address - but both of my messages were ignored. This didn't inspire much confidence. However when we got the hotel the staff were reasonably efficient. So, in summary I would say if you can get a good rate (the off the peg prices seem astronomical, but lots of websites do discounts, esp. if you book early) then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: gda141
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Empire for the holiday weekend. The hotel is in a great location, directly across from Lincoln Center, near Central Park, Columbus Circle, and many nearby restaurants and shops. The hotel itself and rooms are nicely decorated. We decided to upgrade to a suite for the extra room, and are glad we did since the regular rooms are small. The only negative experience we had was at check in, as we did not get in our room until after 5:00, and check in time is 3:00, but they were nice enough to comp us 2 breakfast buffets. We enjoyed the pool deck, service there was great. The breakfast buffet at Ed's Chowder House was very limited and overpriced for what you get(once again ours was free), they only had 3 hot items, would not recommend it, you are better off ordering from the menu. I felt the rooftop club/patio bar (not the pool deck) was overrated, although many come from all over to go there. I would rather have a drink at the lobby bar instead. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If I could have stole the bed and made it past the doorman, I would have!”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelQueen
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I do live about in a NYC borough and one would say, why would you spend a few hundred to stay in a hotel when you have an apartment that’s a 20 minute subway ride away? Well, I needed a little R&R, or something like that, and had the company of a “friend” for the night so off to the Empire Hotel. What can I say? The place screamed sexy chic. Animal printed décor, mixed with sleek and modern fixings. Zen-like spa type bathrooms with wood planked floors in the shower, a shower- head the size of a volleyball that delectably pours water over your head from above, and did I mention L’Occitane bath products? My most favorite part of the room had to be the bed. And no, not because I spent the majority of my stay in it, but because it was so soft and fluffy that it felt like I was sleeping on millions of cotton balls. No joke. Crisp and buttery Frette linens with a pillow top mattress and yes, I had to peek, a featherbead on top of the mattress for even more fluff. Ahhhhhh. I’m still dreaming of that bed. I think I may have had the best hotel sleep ever in that bed. If I could have stole it, I would. Simply delightful. The queen size room was small…but cozy and enough space for two people. There were only two cons which made me rate this hotel 4 stars versus 5. The queen rooms all face an air shaft, where at the bottom is air conditioner unit which I presume cools the entire hotel. It is loud. I could not keep my window open for too long without getting irritated by the noise and opted for the in-room ventilation instead. But, you didn’t hear a peep of street noise which was kind of nice. No cars honking, no people screaming. I almost forgot for a second that I was in NYC! Also, the room doors really have to be shoved to close properly which makes unnecessary noise. I could hear the people in the other room coming and going, and I kept thinking someone was breaking into my room! But when the air conditioner was on in the room, it really muffled the hallway noise. Thank goodness. I didn’t make it to the rooftop bar which apparently bumps, as the handsome doorman told me. Nor did I make it to outdoor pool because it was too cloudy and cool. Next time. Empire Hotel you were good to me. I’ll be back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended (with caveats)”
Reviews.Author: saulon
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for the Empire on Priceline and stayed for three nights in May. Overall, it is a beautiful hotel which pays attention to design from the fixtures and fittings down to the big bowl of red apples on the check in desk. Pros The bell boys who happily stow luggage and retrieve it, flag a cab etc. The decor and quality of the linen Pool deck..the perfect place to sip an overpriced martini while gazing out on new York Efficient Check out service Free Internet..a great luxury and not every hotel offers it , even the more expensive ones Cons Grumpy check in staff who made us wait until 3:45 to check in (inspite of requesting an early check in) with not as much as an apology The lift (elevator) that pings at every floor through the night

Reviews.Title: “Feeling eh about the Empire - it has real possibility but management should step up its game”
Reviews.Author: CockleCove
Reviews.Content: I was able to book a junior suite -- king bed + sleep sofa -- at a ridiculously low price for an evening at Lincoln Center (right across the street from the Empire), so I definitely got my money's worth. Those who are paying the usual rates and/or booked into one of the compact standard rooms are likely to feel much more let down. PLUSES: Our suite was the same type depicted in the photos accompanying Pricilia's "Magnifique" review dated January 22, 2010. It was clean and roomy enough by NYC standards; narrow desk but long, so offered good work space; excellent black-out shades under the draperies; comfortable seating. The sleep sofa mattress was better than many of this type & my son reported the bed was fine, although we both thought it seemed shorter than the usual king mattress. Plush LaFrette terrycloth robes. Electronic safe and iPod dock-clock radio, a welcome touch. The bathroom -- supplied with L'Occitane bath products -- was comfortably sized, notably larger than the notoriously compact ones in the standard rooms. I liked the wood sauna-style floor "mat" in the walk-in shower & the lack of a shower door (a shower curtain ran the length of the shower) ended up not being a problem for us. Last but not least, free WiFi that was excellent (you need to ask the front desk for a user name and password). And big kudo, warm thanks to the doormen/bellmen who were personable and professional. MINUSES: There are some design & furnishing quirks I found irksome. The bathroom sink is one of those trendy, shallow ones where the water from the faucet splashes out over you; there is no counter space in the bathroom, just a small open-faced cabinet hanging on the wall next to the sink; and I'm not a fan of a ceiling-inset shower head, although the Empire's showers are at least supplemented by a spray wand. Climate control could be better and the windows don't do a great job of insulating you from the street noise outside. Drawer space is too skimpy for 2 or more people who don't like to live out of their suitcase. There is no closet, but rather a narrow alcove with a curtain drapery (which always seems cheesy to me) and a hanging rod suspended inordinately high, too high for vertically-challenged me to use. The management-service failings, however, are what stood out. The fact that we didn't get turn-down service is no biggie, but if you can't consistently offer it, then don't advertise it, or make it "upon request." There was absolutely no information about the hotel to be found in the room -- not even a little card by the phone with a directory of in-house numbers to call. So when I needed an iron and ironing board (not supplied in the rooms), I had to go down to the front desk to make my request. The woman, who was not otherwise engaged, did not offer to make the call to Housekeeping but rather gave me (without comment) the extension to ring once I returned to my room. Pool hours, room service, concierge services, the spa hours and services, the location and hours of the gym, on-premises bar and restaurant(s), etc.? I'm clueless: this info was also not to be found on the hotel's "home page" when you access the WiFi nor was it on an in-house TV channel as is sometimes the case. Why management keeps the guests in the dark about such matters -- which could boost their revenue stream -- is a mystery to me. My other dealings with front desk personnel were the most lifeless I have ever encountered. No surprise there was a fairly long line when we arrived at 3 PM, the official start time for check-in, and I understand that not all rooms will be available at that early an hour. But I cooled my heels at the counter for 10+ minutes as the clerk, who offered no welcoming greeting, "worked" the computer -- in complete silence --before telling me she had a room for me, but that we would need to come back in 30-45 minutes to get the keys. She did not volunteer info as to what we could do with our luggage in the interim; I had to ask. Upon my return, she simply asked my name and whether I wanted 1 or 2 keys and handed them over, saying the room number aloud (which is a poor policy imo, even if you don't see Jack the Ripper standing within earshot) and nothing else, not even a perfunctory "Enjoy your stay". Similarly, check-out was uber business-like, devoid of token niceties such as "Was everything to your liking?" or "We hope to see you again". I presented the bill that had been slipped under my door and advised her that I owed an additional $12 for 2 candy bars from the mini-bar; she questioned me 3 times as to which particular candy we'd helped ourselves to. After asking if I wanted to leave all the charges on the credit card I'd registered with, she printed off a new bill and handed it to me, saying "I need you to sign at the X". And that was it. The grizzled guys at the news stands at Penn Station seem happier to have me as a customer than the Empire. BOTTOM LINE: This hotel is in a great location, offers some very nice amenities, and the physical plant should be attractive to many, even if the decor doesn't hold tremendous appeal to me. Based upon what I've read here on TA, the Empire is a frequent Priceline and Hotwire win. That leads me to believe that they are struggling to keep their room occupancy rates up. I don't know how much it would cost them to provide more info about the hotel, its services and amenities, the neighborhood to guests. But better training & evaluation of their front desk staff (and axing those who are poor performers) should be a management priority, wouldn't add much to their expenses and would doubtlessly be worth their while. Unless and until that happens, I'll be returning to the Beacon or On The Ave when I want an Upper West Side hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: chrismeredith
Reviews.Content: The Empire looks great on paper, but they were consistently bad on the details. My collection from the aiport (arranged via the hotel) never showed up. I complained at recepton on check in and they said it wasn't thier department. Also, the shower in my room was broken. The bar was closed due to refurbishment and when I wanted to use the rooftop pool, it was closed due to a private function.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing find for the price”
Reviews.Author: evamelb
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Empire hotel on a recent trip to New York. For the price (just over $200 a night) it was a real find. Yes, the rooms are small, but this is New York, and all we did was sleep there. The beds were comfortable and they use really good quality linen.There was plenty of room to unpack all our stuff and put away our suitcases and still move around without falling over each other. The room we had faced into a central space where all the airconditioning units were kept so it was noisy - but nothing a pair of earplugs or a closed window couldn't fix. The bathroom was quite newly renovated and the shower was fabulous. L'Occitaine toiletries with decent sized cakes of soap were a nice touch. The location of this hotel is great - one block from the park, opposite the Lincoln Center and next door to a subway station. We also found a great deli across the road that does pretty good coffee and nice breakfast. There's a Starbucks in the building if you are into that. Unlike some other reviewers, we found the staff pleasant, efficient and accommodating. We had a blocked toilet and 5 minutes after a call to the front desk it was fixed. There's a nightclub in the building and although we aren't into the club scene, it seemed pretty popluar and I got the impression that residents don't have to line up to get in. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ARWEL_ANGLESEY
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit on the small side even for NY. The air-conditioning unit was VERY NOISY - must have been a very old system - kept me awake. Shower was fine, worked well, a bit small but not a problem. No view whatsoever from the window. W hen we booked we asked for a 2 beds - we got the one, when we queried at reception we were offered 2 beds for an extra charge. The room and corridors reeked of tobacco - a shame as the hotel was very stylish and loved the art deco style. Will try another hotel next time...

Reviews.Title: “Was not able to utilize hotel amenities”
Reviews.Author: SOCALCecilia
Reviews.Content: The gals at the front all looked grumpy, they could smile..... I booked this hotel thinking what an awsome idea with roof top bar and have a drink in the evening after a long day out and dinner.. or what have you.. but it was closed off for private events every night I was there.. the pool was closed too! I would of like to have known that and I would of booked my room somewhere else. The rooms are decent, what more do you expect for a NYC hotel? No shower door, which was a little odd, but doable.. water splashes.. whatever they must of known what they were doing when they designed the room. No door, and the water splashes everywhere not my fault, they should of put a door in. Clean rooms and great location.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: cathyandcolleen
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week in New York. The Empire Hotel, overlooking Lincoln Center, was a pleasure. It was entirely renovated and was definately somewhere to go back to stay. Prices were great too. Rooms are beautifully appointed, beds are terric and services top notch. Note: don't stay on the 11th floor Thurs-Sat as there is loud music on the rooftop patio (where there is also a pool). During the day, bar service is available up there. This hotel is within walking distance to: Central Park, MoMa, Times Square and is in Manhattan. Great restaurants and shopping nearby. We're going back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: FitGirl19
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried about our stay after reading previous reviews about rooms being tiny (my husband is 6' 6") and shower leaking onto floor but thankfully my fears were unfounded! Room was a good size and even though there's no shower door the floor didnt get soaked as other reviewers stated. Receptio staff could do with smiling a bit more though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: TravelMad1983
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique type hotel. It's in a good location just a few blocks from Columbus Circle and only a couple of steps to the subway. Walking distance to Central Park is five minutes, Times Square 20 minutes, 5th Avenue 15 minutes. Watch out for the rooms ending 41 on each floor, we stayed in room 541 and it is incredibly small, however there is plenty of storage. The bathrooms are tiny, barely room to open the door but they are clean and the shower is excellent. The lobby bar is a great place to sit and have a drink, the rooftop bar attracts a young crowd and is really busy at weekends. As a hotel guest you can jump the queues. The bar itself is a bit grotty and there was a slight smell of sick when we were there early on a very warm April evening. The rooftop pool is tiny but there are sunbeds for the summer. We didn't eat in the hotel's restaurant, Ed's Chowder House. The concierge is very helpful and will happily book restaurants etc.. All in all, a good hotel in a good location right opposite the NY Ballet and far enough away from Midtown to escape the crowds. There is a Starbucks and a Duane Reed on the same block which are very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ronSi
Reviews.Content: The Empire Hotel ist besides the MET in the Upper West Side. Bus and Metro stations are very close to hotel and at Columbus Circle nearly all important subways are accessible. The check in was very easy and the voucher of FTI worked perfectly. The room was little, but very nice furnished. Bathroom also little, but with high end accessories. I liked the L'Occitane shower gel and body milk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Expensive, Small Rooms and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Johnny059
Reviews.Content: stayed here between 22nd & 27th April, Positives - Hotel was modern, staff pleasant, room spotless, great location Drawbacks - Prices of Mini Bar over the top $76 for bottle of wine, $6 for a 4 finger Kit-Kat, room was exceptionally small, shower was good but did leak all over the floor, air conditioning was noisy (despite unplugging it from socket it stil banged and clanged) and blew out hot air despite being set at cool which made the room excessively and unbearably hot, this was reported twice but nothing done about it, as a result had hardly any sleep, although the bed was really comfortable. Wouldn't use again simply because of the lack of sleep due to noisy A/C and exhuberant price of the mini bar

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: jc1218
Reviews.Content: To level set, this hotel is PRICEY but I got it for about 1/3 the advertised prices on one of those websites where you tell them what you are willing to pay for a 4 star hotel and Empire accepted our bid. For $300-$400 per night, stay in a real lux like the Jumiah Essex House... But if you get a good price, it's ok. The rooms are tiny; I lived in NYC most of my life, and many years in a studio in NYC so I am used to tiny, NYC spaces but these rooms are quite small. We only stayed one night but if you have suitcases for 2 people for a week or so, it'd be uncomfortably tight. The bathroom door, for example, doesn't open all the way because the toilet blocks it. The "closet" is a cubby with a curtain and a mini fridge and safe on the floor. It is overall fsirly clean and nice. The only thing that kept me from giving the room a higher cleanliness rating was that there was no top sheet; they give you a sheet to cover the mattress and a down comforter that has like a sheet as one side. Eww. How well can they clean that? It is located quite conveniently, literally across the street from Lincoln Center. There is some trendy rooftop pool that we didn't use but there was a line to get up there at night so it must be "cool". So, if you get a good deal, it's not bad but it is pretty tiny and the comforter thing really bothered me but overall it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Chelli1449
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night. I shared a standard double room with my boyfriend and another couple. Our friends were in two other rooms on a different floor. Check in time at this hotel is 3 pm. We were not able to get into our rooms until just after 4:30. We barely got an apology for this. Once we were in the room, we turned on the AC which was very noisy. It made awful noises all night. The beds were like sleeping on a soft floor. Not comfortable at all. The shower was very pretty looking. However, the half door led to the bathroom being SOAKED and the rain fall shower head was very difficult to shower under. My friends had to call at least 3 times to get an iron. We were all awakened by the loud traffic, horn honking, and people with megaphones in the park the next morning. It was like we were outside standing on the sidewalk. There is no soundproofing at all. All in all, the entire hotel had a dirty, grimey feeling to it. As we left to check out, my boyfriend informed me that he had seen a cockroach in the bathroom the night before. He chose not to tell me since he knew I would have freaked out. He's right about that. The next time I head to NYC, I will not be staying at the Empire Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_Girl82
Reviews.Content: OK...so I booked The Empire Hotel through Priceline and was a little worried about a hotel in New York for $200 a night. Was worried it would be a dump. I was completely shocked by how nice the hotel was. We had a great (albeit very small) room on the 9th floor. It was clean, the bed was comfy and the little extras were so appreciated. L'Occitaine bath products to boot. The location was incredible - we walked everywhere and walked two blocks to Whole Foods every day for breakfast. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: simplynyc
Reviews.Content: Great location! Walking distance to the park and even Chinatown (if you're not lazy)... But, that's about the only thing that I liked about this hotel!!! For the money that we paid $$$$ we expected a lot more! The room was TINY!!!!! Think dorm room style, go it? Now cut that dorm room in half! The in room air conditioning sucked! It was either too hot or too cold... I literally had to put a book over the vent and blankets around it at night time, ughhh. My brother is tall 6'3, average size (ex college athlete), and he was the only one that could fit on the bed... Meaning that I had to sleep on the floor, SUCKED! The tiny bathroom was horrific. The shower had no door, nothing to keep the water from getting outside. The toilet was right next to the sink, barf! Closet space? forget about it... more like a babies closet... Tip: If you do stay here (or at another hotel) buy water, snacks, etc at the nearby Rite Aid (its right around the corner) instead of getting ripped off by eating something that Empire Hotel is selling (peanuts, chips, other snacks...) As for the baggage men, they were okay, but they do live on tips....

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - first class service and in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: coxy21
Reviews.Content: My boyfreind whisked me off on a surprise break to New York for a week in April 2010. Luck or what?! We had a great stay at the Empire Hotel, the service was great and we couldn't fault the Empire team in any way at all, from the doormen and barmen to the hotel Management. The hotel is situated in a really great location, easy walking distance from Central Park, 5th Avenue, lots of great resturants and all the City hotspots. If i were to be picky, the hotel is a little expensive and the bathroom was a little on the small side, but neither effected our stay. If you decide to book a room, i suggest that you request to stay in one of the lower level rooms, as at weekends the music from the rooftop bar can get loud and some nights we could hear the music from our room on the 9th floor. What really inspired me to write this review was the Empire Hotel's service when our flight home to Scotland was cancelled due to the Vocanic ash in iceland. We telephoned the hotel from the airport, explained our situation and the hotel did it's up most to get us a room and even offered it to us at a discounted rate of 25%. We couldn't resist! Take advantage of the hotels free wi-fi, straight from your room. There is a very handy Starbucks next door too, which is open till midnight and the barista's are very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room. great Location”
Reviews.Author: charlottex
Reviews.Content: Me and my new husband stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in April 2010. We found the hotel to be slighty dissapointing compared to the online photographs. the rooms were extremely small. This would never normally bother us, but it was sometimes a bit of a struggle to actually move around the room (Even though We're both average size). The rooms were nicely decorated and clean but just a little bit shabby. Eg the shower had no door on it and every morning we soaked the floor or just tried to huddle into the corner of the shower. The hotel shows pictures of a swimming pool which we found to be completely unused, drained and dirty. It was also the size of a large bath. (Honestly). The hotel does however have a beautiful restaurant which was well worth a vist and was decorated to a much higher specification than the hotel. The location of the hotel was amazing and was only 2 metro stops from time square and a 5 min walk to central park. Despite being a little basic, I would recomend this hotel as being basic, clean and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous and Irresponsible”
Reviews.Author: Travelerwithkids65
Reviews.Content: The hotel overbooked (they said they had some damage to a floor which caused them to cancel rooms but as we travelled by the hotel, all floors looked booked.) We were informed that a wedding and two conventions had to take priority over our visit and we were unceremoniously relocated to another hotel all the way across town. My parents arrived first and were simply told it was not their problem and that we should contact Orbitz. Orbitz said no, it's the hotel's problem and there was nothing they could do. We needed to be close to Lincoln Center which is the only reason we booked this hotel in the first place. Until we called the hotel to discuss what they could do they were prepared to simply tell my parents to go to another hotel nearly 20 minutes away. The best they did was put us up in a queen room at the Hudson...Smallest room ever. Although the front desk manager was helpful, while we waited for a new hotel room which took nearly 4 hours, many people arrived at the hotel and checked into their room. As they told me, they simply took priority over booking with Orbitz. I will never recommend, stay or every even suggest any hotel associated with the Empire, the chain or frankly will never use Orbitz again for my travels. Orbitz did not help in any way resolve my problem. The most they did was contact the hotel and request a full refund. How does that help me when we are already in New York? What's even more disturbing is that when I called Orbitz to get me a refund, the agent contacted the hotel and when she came back on the phone said, since it was I that was cancelling, I would be charged the full amount and no refund was available. In fact, after having been on the phone nearly 12 times and for four hours with the hotel, the Ortbiz rep told me "your reservation is confirmed and your room is waiting for you when you arrive." An utter joke of customer service and a joke of a travel agency. Not until I escalated within Orbitz, did someone actually take some ownership and try and resolve the problem and even then it took anoth 30 minutes on the phone. THe reservation had been prepaid and it had cost us nearly $1,000. We had confirmed with the hotel earlier in the week. The hotel claimed they contacted Orbitz and Orbitz didn't have my contact info which is simply not true. SO either the Hotel lied or Orbitz did....either way, be wary of booking with Orbitz or the Empire hotel; it bordered on theft.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelingNYfamily
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was because we used priceline and got the smallest room in the place, but our room was small even by NYC standards. Still at the price we paid it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Not What It Used to Be”
Reviews.Author: AggieCanada
Reviews.Content: Two years ago I stayed at this hotel and gave it an excellent review. I have recently returned home from a stay at the same hotel and it is difficult to believe it is the same place. Here are some of the reasons why: The restoration of a few years ago has not been maintained. One of the elevators malfunctioned in that the outer door separated from the inner door and the door would not open - somewhat disconcerting, to say the least. The doorman never once opened the door for the people coming and going to/from the hotel. The staff at the desk was unfriendly and one of them flipped maps at us when we checked in without even a smile. There were no black and white cookies this time. The bathroom needed its paint touched up, as water from the shower was turning the white paint to brown. Hypo-allergenic bedding had been requested but never materialized. Instead, a pillow case was left for us to use on one of the decorative pillows. A bottom sheet never did materialize on one of the beds. In short, a very disappointing experience and one I would not repeat. I am returning to NY in May and have already made reservations at another hotel. The Empire needs to shape up. Just because it is in a prime location doesn't mean it can shirk on its physical plant or its service. Eventually this bad attitude will catch up to them, if it hasn't already.

Reviews.Title: “Odd mix of comfort and disappointment”
Reviews.Author: gabry_ll
Reviews.Content: First, let me start off by saying that the room itself is pretty nice. The bed is comfortable and everything is clean. I imagine that some people have a good experience here based on those things -- to me they are the most important. But all of the little negative things this trip have added up, leaving me to write this review. First, I am traveling with a colleague and we reserved a room with 2 beds. We even called 2 days before arriving to confirm this was the case. When we got here, they said they couldn't give us a room with 2 beds and they didn't care about our "reservation" because we had made it over the phone and had nothing in writing. The manager was completely unwilling to compensate us in any way. My colleague arrived in the room to a stopped up sink, and a shower that started hot but went cold during her shower. When I arrived, I had trouble getting a key (the girl first insisted that my name wasn't on the room, before finally finding it after a lot of arguing). I was also a little surprised that the hotel didn't have an iron or blow-dryer, because I have grown accustom to hotels having these things. That night, I wanted to get a little bit of work done after my colleague went to sleep. I went downstairs to find a place to sit, but the entire lobby of the hotel had blaring club music. All of the seating belongs to the bar, and there isn't even a quiet corner to go sit on the floor. I asked at the desk where I could work and was told I could work in the business center. The business center is a small closet with 2 computers which is right off the lobby -- you can still hear the blaring music. Finally, on Sunday morning I slept in a bit (until 9) and there was no hot water for a shower -- none at all. After the frigid shower, I decided to sit down and write the review. Like I said in the beginning, the bed and room are nice. If you are willing to deal with the issues that pop up, it might be worth it. The location is wonderful, and I suppose if they had all the details worked out they would be charging much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, EXCELLENT Location”
Reviews.Author: trip304
Reviews.Content: Went to the Met for an anniversary trip, found this hotel on Trip Advisor, excellent location, directly across the street form the Met, couldn't be closer. Hotel was re-decorated, excellent room, great shower (towels caught the water on the floor), bed was very comfortable. Never heard anyone else for the other rooms nor any street noise. Had a 40' HD TV on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Next to Central Park”
Reviews.Author: Lapinroyal
Reviews.Content: We stay 4 nights in the King superior room and we found it very roomy with a nice design bathroom, but a little small with shower only. Occitane’s amenities are a plus with Frette so soft towels. The king bed is huge and very comfortable. The bed is almost as comfortable as the heavenly bed from the Westin hotels. I like the room design very much, but a little worn. The pool is still close. The staff is super nice. At night, there is a DJ in the hip-lobby, mixing music for us… Cool! There is a busy club/bar on top of the hotel, but we didn’t manage to go. The location of this hotel is perfect for us as we came here for the opera at the MET at the Lincoln Center and the Central Park is just across. The Columbus circle subway is in the Time Warner Center where all the major line connected and the Lincoln center Subway is just a cross the street. We have breakfast at the organic Whole Foods Market in the Time Warner Center where they sell food by weight, so you only pay what you want to eat. You can have excellent meal here (hot/cold) when you are in rush before the opera. The Starbuck is next door to the hotel for caffeine addicted. On the down side, the room is a little bit noisy from the street side (normal for NYC), but we stay in the room in the back of the hotel where the ventilator is quite noisy. But this should not stop you from reserve at this hotel, unless you are a very light sleeper (we are exhausted so no problem to sleep for us despite the constance noise). For 170$, it is OK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenjenwoodall
Reviews.Content: Our trip to New York was for our honeymoon, we booked the The Empire Hotel as a package. After booking i looked at some of the reviews on here and was a little worried about some of the comments. When we arrived at the hotel, ok the reception staff we not th happiest of people, but they were by no means rude in any way, they were just busy and getting there job done. We had no problem checking in and once we got to our room, we were happy with what we had got, ok it wasnt the largest of rooms, but who goes to New York to spend all there time in the room. The room was vey clean, bed was very comfy and the housekeepers were very good, they made up the room every money and came to the room early evening to fold back the bed cover, which was a nic touch. Hotel perfect location, 10 minute walk from Tmes Square and Central Park. Starbucks right underneath the hotel and a small convienience shop 5 minute walk away. Overall im so glad we booked the hotel and do hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms and bathrooms, nicely decorated”
Reviews.Author: denisetraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this with Priceline (name your own price @$150.00 a night) so once it was purchased I came to Tripadvisor to see what everyone was saying. A lot of reviews were saying that the rooms were the size of a thimble and that there were issues with temperature control in the room (too hot). I called and spoke to the front desk and they were polite and helpful (spoke to Diana). I went ahead and paid an extra $40.00 a night to upgrade from the standard room (which is very tiny and it's what you get automatically on priceline) to a deluxe king, which is a larger room. I figured for $190 a night it was still a good deal for NYC and at least I'd be assured of a decent room. As it turned out we got delayed by 2 days getting to NY due to the storms and the closure of the airports. I called and spoke to Alex (also very nice and helpful) and he went ahead and checked me into my room by phone so that I'd be sure not to lose my reservation. (With priceline you pay in advance so unfortunately I had to pay for the 2 nights that I wasn't even there, but that wasn't the hotel's fault, just priceline rules.) When I finally arrived at the hotel on day 3 of my visit I asked if they could at least give me a break and not charge me the extra $40.00 a night upgrade fee for the 2 nights I missed and they said they'd have to check with the manager and get back to me. They explained that they kept that upgraded room for me so technically I used it even though I wasn't there (since they could have sold it to someone else). I never heard anything from them for the rest of my stay, and to be honest, I was having a good time and forgot about it myself. When I got the bill under my door on the last day I was pleased and surprised to see that they had taken off the upgrade charge for the 2 missed days after all. That was very nice since they really didn't have to do it. The lobby was very nicely appointed with a groovy animal print bar and lounge. We never made it up to the rooftop bar but people said it was nice. The pool was closed for the winter and hadn't reopened yet when we were there (mid-March). As for the deluxe king room, if you should decide to upgrade, it is still small by Hilton or Marriott standards but for a NY boutique hotel it is decent and much better than the standard room we would have gotten without the upgrade. There's a small desk and desk chair as well as an upholstered chair. We had a nice view of Lincoln Center. I found the kind bed extremely comfortable and I slept like a baby the whole time we were there. Also, not sure if it was just our specific location or good fortune but we never heard anyone in any adjacent rooms at all while in our room, which was nice. There's a decent size chest of drawers under the TV to unpack your stuff as well as a wardrobe to hang things. There's a minibar fridge and also a room safe. As for the bathroom, it's very small and not designed with practicality in mind. It's all about style, not about usefulness, unfortunately. There's a very attractive square sink which is nice to look at but it's so shallow that every time you turn on the faucet you get wet pants from the water bouncing off the too shallow sink bottom. Also, the design of the doorless shower is again groovy and mod to look at but there's going to be water all over the floor. On the bright side, there are plenty of nice towels to lay on the floor. The shower design is a rain head on the ceiling and also a handheld wall-mounted head. You need a manual to figure out how to use this thing but once you get it figured out it's fine. We didn't have any problems with getting enough hot water. Also....a nice little extra is you get free wireless high speed internet in your room which is really unusual for NY. They typically get you with around a $20 a day charge so I was pleased and surprised. It worked well every day as I used my laptop for business. Don't dial any 800-number calls from your room, however, as their generosity doesn't extend that far. You get charged $1.00 to dial a toll free number (and then some per minute charge if the call is over 10 minutes, I think) so beware if you use a toll free access for your calling card or pre-paid phone card. I just used skype on my laptop instead since the internet was free anyway. As for the complaints about controlling room temperature, we didn't have too much of a problem. The week we were there (mid-March) was rather unusually warm so we had the A/C on the whole time. It was not as nice and cool as it could have been but it was comfortable enough to not be bothersome. This is a very old building so you have to expect some of this sort of stuff. The housekeeping staff did a good job and our room was always cleaned when we came back each day with nice refills on the L'Occitane bathroom amenities (which were much appreciated). The front door guys and bellmen were also nice. I'm not sure about the reviews that say the staff was rude. We didn't encounter any of those sorts during our stay, but maybe we were just lucky. Also, you have to figure in the NY vibe that maybe some people take as rude but it's really not meant to be. Last but not least, we loved being on the upper west side. It's a great part of town. You can walk up a few blocks on Columbus Ave. and there are tons of small restaurants and shops, walk down a few blocks and you're at the Time Warner complex which is a big, multi-level indoor mall with shops and restaurants. There are two movie theatre multiplexes in walking distance (one is artsy films and the other is regular releases). You can walk a few blocks further to the theatre district, or a couple blocks over and you're at Central Park. There's so much in walking distance it's amazing and not nearly as touristy as staying in midtown. Bottom line for this hotel, in my opinion, is that you have to go into it expecting a small room no matter what so that you won't be bummed when you get there. If you have the money to upgrade to the king deluxe it's worth it for an extra $40 a night. Go with an an expectation that you're in NYC in a great neighborhood at a very stylish hotel but don't go expecting the RItz Carlton or Peninsula. Don't even go expecting the Hilton or Hyatt because it's a different experience. It's more of a trendy, boutique hotel experience. We had a great time but if I had expected a big spacious room and a big Hilton-esque lobby, I would have been disappointed. Go for the city experience in a great part of town!! I would definitely stay here again without hesitation (and would go for the upgrade again).

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Busy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MadridMadrid
Reviews.Content: On a 4 night stay on a superior room we found out ourselves (and quite a few other guests) overbooked (in spite of reconfirmation phone call 48 ahead) and so being diverted to a nearby hotel. Remaining 3 nights on a room with tiny bathroom and tiny closet. Good beds, quiet atmosphere in rooms. Expensive uninteresting breakfast. Hip evening bar. Cool lobby bar. Just by Lincoln Center and 1 block away from Central Park. The place is fine but at this level of price you may be expecting something better and some more personal service, but this is NYC...

Reviews.Title: “NY Best”
Reviews.Author: gogomn
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Empire Hotel. It is in a great location, it's nicely decorated, clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The lobby bar was always jumping and the roof top bar was a real treat! We were helped by great weather, but we had a great time and really enjoyed staying at the Empire Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend but be prepared for 'cool' service.”
Reviews.Author: Milly1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband at this hotel for five nights in December 2009 as part of our honeymoon. The room was quite small but very, very clean and had a great view. The shower was great too. Given we were there for five nights, we found the hotel very comfortable. It's in a great location next to Central Park and next to an amazing theatre. The only negative point for me was the service when we first arrived. The guy at reception was curt and not at all welcoming. This sticks in my mind as the rest of the service we received in the US was excellent. This was echoed when we checked out too (it was our honeymoon). The roof top bar was lovely for a quiet drink, it will probably be busier now it's better weather! We had breakfast once in the hotel, and, while it was good we preferred to eat out. Overall, I would certainly recommend this hotel - just be aware that the rooms are not huge if you don't go for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “I expected A LOT more...”
Reviews.Author: lizbeth8808
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff (as is noted from others) is very poor, they are rude, and have no customer service skills what-so-ever. Booked a room months ago, when we arrived at the Empire, they had "over booked" and didn't have the room we originally booked. The most ironic thing was, we weren't even told this they printed out a paper and handed it to us so we could read it! For our inconvenience they were "nice" enough to take $30 off the room price and put us in a room with only one bed instead of two. $30 compared to a $659 per night charge was a drop in the bucket, they could have just not taken anything off and I would have been just as upset. When asked to speak with a manager we were told she was "unavailable" and even if she was available and we spoke with her they would not have taken off the $30. Also were told check in was at 3 pm, only to find out it was at 4 pm, which was even more confusing that they weren't starting check in yet and our room had already been taken... I feel as though my friends and I were not treated the same as others that stayed there with thoughts that we were "too young" and we could easily be taken advantage of. I myself am 27 years old and was with a group of friends, half are married and one soon to be bride (hence the trip). As others have said, the bathroom is HORRIBLE, the shower leaks everywhere, no hot water (even on the first shower) and the sink is not practical. There was even a point in our night that we were going back up to our room to grab a few things and I was not allowed back in until I showed my room key to the person standing outside of the hotel. I told them what room I was staying in and they could have checked with the front desk, but still refused to let me through the doors without seeing the actual room key. Since I was with a group of friends (6) some of us had keys and some did not, (as they did not hand a key to everyone staying in the room) and we weren't always with everyone in the group. Just thought for the amount of money per night we payed it would have been a completely different experience. I've been treated better at hotels that were much less expensive. The couple things that weren't so bad were the bell boys were super friendly, and the staff at the restaurant were VERY friendly and helpful as they suggested a few places to have drinks after dinner. To say the least I was dissapointed, but would never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: bmzhen1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a great time staying at the Empire Hotel in NYC. The room was very clean, the staff was helpful, and the hotel atmosphere is really fun. There is a bar in the lobby and another one up on the roof. There is usually always 1 or 2 people at the entrence to help you with bags,transportations or directions. the free WIFI in the rooms is a nice touch as well, I had my laptop with me and was able to stay connected. Now for the very minor negative things. Our window faced a brick wall so there was not much of a view, or light coming in. This is really not a problem, since we did not spend much time in the room, and usually had the window closed, also it probably reduced noise as well, we were expecting to hear car horns and ambulance noises but our room was very quiet. If you want a room with a view, I am sure they have them. The other small complaint was that there was only 1 bathrobe in the room, even though we had 2 people there, which I am sure could have been remedied if we asked the staff for another one. Another thing is the bathroom sink faucet is too close to the sink and if you have big hands, its kind of hard to wash them. As you can see, these are really not worth even mentioning. I recommend ordering in advance and looking for a great deal, our room was $100 a night, which was amazing for this location and quality of hotel. I will definitely stay here again if I am able to get the same price.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR EXCELLENT ALL AROUND!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon016
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel I have stayed at in a long time. Very nice rooms, very nice staff and an atmosphere which is romantic and trendy. Boutique hotel with an amazing lounge on the roof. Showers are incredible, wood plank floors and rain head attached to the ceiling. Such a great location. Unless your staying at the Peninsula or Four Seasons, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: NorCalHereAndThere
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat. Subway is right there. Several bus lines stop right across the street. Zabar's is nearby. If I can always get the good price I got this time, I would always stay at the Empire Hotel. The place itself is good. My room was acceptable. I think it was one of the smaller rooms. The greatest disappointment was the fact that it did not have a closet. The room faced the air shaft, which had a fan noise all of the time, but that was no big deal. I certainly didn't have a problem with street noise. The bathroom was odd. The shower did not have a full door and I almost flooded the bathroom when I left the shower hose facing the wrong direction. The redwood platform in the shower gave it a spa look, but I think it hid a multitude of moldy sins. I hope they go through every once in a while to disinfect it. I would bring shower slippers next time just in case. The lobby bar is cool and lends to the hotel's airs of hip-ness. The first night I was there, the place was hosting a movie premiere. The biggest disappointment was the "club" on the roof. I took a friend up there and we could only tolerate 1 minute. It was filled with people that I would expect to see on an MTV reality show. And the fact that there were 20 year olds wandering around in the lobby made me wonder about the security of the hotel. But these things are minor relative to what's really important. It's clean, pleasantly decorated and ideally located. I hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lincoln Ctr location perfect for this trip; some odd "quirks"”
Reviews.Author: BabyBlueOwl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Empire for 3 nights; overall positive and location for Lincoln Ctr unbeatable. Staff very nice; breakfast in adjacent restaurant pleasant but some pricing dumb ($8 for a cup of hot tea?). FYI, I think rooms on Lincoln Ctr side are quieter; we were on Broadway side and even on 10th floor, reasonable amount of street noise. A few criticisms: upon check-in, we were told non-smoking king we had reserved months ahead was not available; we had to take smoking king or non-smoking double. (We chose to upgrade to a "junior suite" for $80/night more - weren't thrilled about that.) AND, okay I know this is crazy, but honestly no human being could reach the toilet paper holder from the commode (we had to take the roll off the holder!). Also, the square bathroom sinks do not drain well - very hip and all that, but poorly functional at best. The armoire-style closet in our pricey junior suite had a fridge at bottom, so the vertical hanging space was barely enough for a man's suit. These were relatively minor inconveniences but not what one expects to find in a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Empire”
Reviews.Author: sparkle123Uk
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after a 'mid life' crisis 6 week trip round the world and enjoyed a variety of countries from India to the USA. The only hotel I was concerned about staying in was the Empire in New York. It seemed to have such negative reviews that I really was not looking forward to staying there. When we got there, my fears escalated as a room was not available and we were checking in at 4pm. We went coffee and returned after an hour and still no room. The receptionist not really too helpful but one of her collegues came to assist and we were given an upgraded room, so problem sorted. But I am glad to say that that was the only hiccup. Loved the style of the hotel-very chique and New York, rooms very clean, lovely bedding, gorgeous bath products-although strange set up with the half glass panel shower door, great location, and the guys on the door were great. My only comment would be that maybe the staff on reception could benefit from seeing how the guys on the door interact with customers. I would stay again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Retro Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CindyD3
Reviews.Content: Loved the style of the hotel - Old New York. Classic Art Deco decor, small rooms and too short (11 stories) for a view , but right across from Central Park and 2 blocks off Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, small room”
Reviews.Author: kkalto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. Loved the location: Lincoln Center right outside the door, movie theatre across the street, Metro close by, Columbus Circle an easy walk. We had a queen inside room which means no view except across a light shaft at another room. The room had just enough space to walk around the bed. However, the bed was extremely comfortable, the pillows were great, the bedding was top notch, the shower great, towels deep and plush. No complaints other than the room was extremely hot when we arrived. It wasn't until the next afternoon that we discovered the thermostat in the unit under the window. We got breakfast every morning from the truck on the corner. A delicious muffin and small cup of coffee for about $2.50. We took it back to the hotel and ate up stairs in the mezzanine while watching all the comings and goings in the lobby. Desk staff were polite but didn't ask if we needed anything. If you can find a good deal here, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall but very small”
Reviews.Author: newyorkerCanada
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Empire having gone with our two pre-teen children to see some shows and do some shopping. Its well located and nicely re-done since we saw it last (we lived in NYC for several years right near there). We were in a "superior" room. However - it is very small - smaller than any hotel we've been in - in North America or Europe. The bathroom is extremely small - no tub, absolutely no counter space and no air vent so it steams up really quickly. There is no shower door - just a half pane of glass so the floor gets wet easily too. The ceilings are high and the closet (which is actually just a cut out space in the wall with a curtain) was very high - I had to have my husband hang up and retrieve everything as I couldn' t reach the hangers/rod (I'm 5'4") So overall it was not very family oriented. The staff were very friendly though and when we had trouble with our heat (two nights in a row) they were readily available to help. Great spot for a single person or couple - not for families.

Reviews.Title: “A New York Minute”
Reviews.Author: MyVacationToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a weekend escape to celebrate a rather seminal birthday. Our Empire weekend did not disappoint. The hotel is chic and in a chic location. The people staying there - urbane and cosmopolitan. I found the guests were varied and interesting: some older guy in the company of a much younger woman that he proudly claimed as his wife, a lovely gay couple, a gracious older woman from Vermont with a drop dead expensive floor length fur coat who liked to chat, a helpful front of desk who were quick to offer me the option of an upgrade, although I insisted at first I didn’t want one, and the doormen were polite and really tried to be helpful. Two breakfast places were recommended to us and both very different from one another. Both should be checked out if you’re in New York for 2 mornings. The first is The flame, “greasy spoon” (sans the “greasy”, and our server connected with us). The other is The West Side Diner. It’s old New York and close to all of those brownstones a block away from Central Park West that we all love. I booked through Expedia. This was a bad move on my part. I should have booked directly with the hotel. I usually do this. I think that I was suffering some kind of cognitive dysfunction while I was on line booking a hotel. For your edification, the room price offered by Expedia when I booked 2 weeks prior to our leaving in comparison to the room price offered the day before we left was a difference of approx $70.00 US ) . The other 4 on-line travel sites listed at EXACTLY the same price. So you’ve been warned. ”Caveat Emptor”. Once at the hotel, I did ask for an upgrade because of what I felt to be an unfair price in what I payed. We originally booked a Queen sized bed-room on the 6th floor. When I saw the view on the 6th floor I was mortified. I went back and asked them if I could have a look at their ‘upgrade’ on the 10th floor. It consisted of a king bed, with a lovely north fronting view, with the Lincoln Centre off to the side and partial view of at least one of the Chagal's that hangs in the foyer of the Lincoln Centre lobby. The club music- well, it depends on your attitude. I was worried about this after reading the other reviews, but as it turned out it was just what the doctor ordered. This is going to sound weird, but, for this quick trip I was wired for the sounds of a busy city that never sleeps. I loved the relentless beat of life emanating from the 12th floor. We were on the 10th. Saturday morning 12-2am, I did have to open my door twice to ask people to move their conversation to a more private place, and they moved on. The thing is, because of the view, the fun time I was having, my partner's attentiveness, the musicals, the food, the park, the shops, it being NYC, I went with the flow. And it was easy to do here. This place flows. The hotel has charm. The bathroom showers, not so much, but we tried to be careful and diligently sopped up the water from the shower with the plentiful amount of towels provided. The soaps, shampoo, conditioners are heavenly and in ample proportion. Actually, from a Feng Shui point of view, this hotel is being hit with a tsunami of energy coming from being right at the top of the crossroads of Broadway and Columbus, and all that energy is not being deflected in any way and, according to my theory, the hotel is getting whamed with too much chi force. In my estimation whoever designed and accepted the shower configuration for the rooms was not mindful of the energy hit this hotel receives from the flow of energy from these two streets and it is the reason for their serious water shower issues...but I digress. When I go to a certain place I kinda hope I know what my attitude will be while I am there. Once we switched floors, from the 6th to the 10th I was a bit wary because I knew that we would have to deal with the club sounds. I didn’t need to worry. We both got in the groove and while we didn’t find time to go to the club upstairs on the 12th floor - we were having our own party around town and in our hotel room. As I lay in our king sized bed, at 3am Sunday morning, my head cushioned on a might fine down pillow, with a just-as-comfortable white down comforter keeping me warm, listening to the muted buzz and purr of NYC city traffic coming from the closed 8 foot window beside me (which, surprisingly, you can actually open…..and believe me, after a shower the room heats up and you will have to) I fell asleep and I slept like a baby, both nights. It was all good! We had a great weekend. I would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Music Too Loud”
Reviews.Author: KoolAid14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel on Priceline and got a great deal of $130/night. As in other reviews I read we got "upgraded" to a room with two full size beds and a view. I was a bit annoyed that we would not be in a queen size bed and when I asked about it they didn't have any available for us. The room was particularly dark and there was not a lot of information on the hotel in the room. After returning from dinner later that evening we found out about the music from the bar/club upstairs. We were on the tenth floor and the music shook our room. The music was so loud I could clearly identify what songs were playing. I finally went down at 2:30am to complain and asked to be moved not only to get away from the music but to try to get a queen size bed. I was told the only thing available was on a smoking floor which as a non-smoker was not something I wanted. The staff at the desk also told me that they did not have any other complaints about the music that night and that there was even a floor above me and it was not bothering them. The clerk said that loud music is bad for business so why would they do that. After getting no where at 2:30 in the morning I asked for a later check out so we could catch up on our sleep and I had to call back after 8am to request that. When we checked out we let them know how disappointed we were and they apologized but nothing else was really done about it. They also mentioned that they don't have guests on the 11th floor due to the loud music which was interesting because the clerk the night before tried to bring his point home by saying no one on the floor above me had complained. No one complained because no one was staying on the 11th floor. In summary, the loud music and lack of help from the staff ruined our romantic weekend. This hotel is over rated and not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly as good as the Mandarin Oriental down the street”
Reviews.Author: roo15
Reviews.Content: What a find this hotel was! I have stayed at the Oriental, and checked rates at the time I booked the Empire. The Oriental was $700 and the Empire $140. When you walk into the foyer of the Empire, you know you're in a swanky boutique hotel (which I prefer over large corporate hotels). I must have got upgraded as I ended up with a spacious room (for NYC) with 2 queen size beds. The quality & decor of the bedroom was equal to that of the Oriental, however the bathroom was smaller and not quite as luxurious, although it was contemporary and better than the average "corporate" hotel bathroom. The only fault I could find was that the room overheated at night and couldn't figure out how to turn down the heat in the middle of the night and there were no notes in the hotel guide as to how to operate the heating, nor any indication of breakfast dining options outside of room service. Wireless was welcomely free.

Reviews.Title: “Form over function -- Not so great”
Reviews.Author: anguilladreamer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Perfect Escapes, which usually has good rates on nice properties. I booked what was billed as a superior queen with two queen beds for my husband, adult daughter & me. When we checked in, we were "upgraded" to a superior room with two double beds. I asked reception about two queen beds, but was told that the queen beds were only a bit larger, and that I'd have to pay more. Looking at their website now, I'm not sure that they even have rooms with two queen beds. The people at the front desk were always very nice & helpful, but our room was not great. The decorator obviously valued form over function -- very high tech & trendy looking, but not very comfortable. The dark colors made the room look dirty, too. I expect small rooms in NYC, but our room was missing a lot of basics -- no information on the hotel, no phone numbers for the hotel restaurant (and we were charged $1.50 when the operator connected me to the restaurant, after telling me that there'd be no charge -- I would have used my cell phone after getting the number). We (and other hotel guests) had to have our room keys re-keyed. The bathroom sink (although very pretty) was too shallow, the shower was hard to use, there were no washclothes, and we finally found the bathroom wastebasket on the morning that we were leaving. The heating system made a terrible noise (sounded like people trying to get in the room) that woke us up throughout the night. And worst of all, our room was at the end of an unlit hallway, so it was hard to see the room number. Not that big a problem until we had a drunk woman pounding on our door at 1:30 a.m. yelling "Let me in you idiot." She was apologetic when my husband told her that she had the wrong room, but I'm sure all of this commotion woke more than just us up. The location was wonderful, though -- right across the street from Lincoln Center, which was our main destination.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location: chic & trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyB_10
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights at the Empire hotel for my husbands 30th Birthday and we had an amazing time. We have never been to NYC before and this hotel could not have been in a better location to explore the city. It is only one block away from Central Park and 10 minute walk to 5th Avenue. The hotel looks fantastic, very chic and trendy. The rooms are tiny and the bathrooms are even smaller, but do not let this put you off. My husband is 6ft4 and had no problem! The plug in the bathroom was broken and when we told the staff at reception, they gave us an upgrade to the 10th floor with a city view and larger room! The staff moved all of our luggage while we were out so as not to disrupt our day. We were impressed. The hotel bar is gorgeous! Intimate areas with comfortable sofas lit by candle light, really lovely for pre or post dinner drinks. The cocktail list is great and the wine list extensive however the drink prices are high. $8 for a beer and $15 for a cocktail! The pool bar is great for music and dancing in the evenings and is open until 3am. Make sure you have ID on you as they check almost everyone on entry. The views of the city at night are fantastic and make for romatic moments. The check out time at the hotel is 12.30pm. Our flight home to the UK was not until 7.30pm so reception arranged to store our luggage until we had to leave. This allowed us to spend another day in the city without worrying about taking bags with us. This hotel is a definate must for those who want to explore New York with a bit of style!

Reviews.Title: “I agree: Staff....Terrible!....”
Reviews.Author: nycbabeLES
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe this review I read...see the quote, please. My exact sentiments...right up to the bartender! "The staff is snotty, argumentative, and not interested in helping you out (except for the bartender)." And, people...all I was trying to do was find my friend's Private Birthday Bash. The staff behind the check-in counter were unbelievably rude. Had it not been for...believe it or not....the bartender who was passing by....I would never have found them...and he couldn't have been nicer. I'm a New Yorker - did not stay at this hotel (although it's a great location) - but travel extensively for CBS...and would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. Consider the Four Seasons...they say: Welcome Home...whenever you come back to them. :)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: islanderbob
Reviews.Content: just spent 3 nites at the empire ,great location ,only 3 min walking distance to central park/columbus . very clean ,modern and friendly area. the employees were very friendly. you have some cheap breakfast/lunch place next to the hotel (europan bakery), and starbucks as well. enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Tough to call, lovely room but charges for EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: lsilver
Reviews.Content: Looks like a 4 star, service isnt. We had 10 times better service in the Heathrow sheriton! £17 for a toothbrush and mini tooth paste in the room!!!! Rooms lovely, but no coffee making facilities. Sean on reception very accomodating and friendly. Nice guy on concierge, very helpful (Leo I think) We had to carry our own bags from taxi into hotel and to the room (while bellboy watched). I understand the bad reviews as no ones goes above what they should do. Things are done but almost with a huff and a sulk. Visit the bar on the rooftop - absolutely kicking!! Full to the brim with people, we get to jump the queue as guests but $15 a drink!!!!! ooooh and they knew it was my partners 30th birthday and they didnt even give a free drink voucher!! In summer we stayed at The London in NY and they upgraded us, left a cake, chocolates and a bottle of wine in the room free of charge!!! My advice, if you get a cheap deal its a good location and compfy room. If you can spare the cash stay at The london NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Trendy Hotel with Killer Location”
Reviews.Author: guriamundial
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a mini break in my own city. I got an excellent price via travelzoo and was pleased to nevertheless have received a complimentary upgrade from a basic queen room to a "superior king". This is a smart move on the hotels part to upgrade when there's availability. I liked the little touches like the Frette bathrobe, the fresh rose on the bedside table and the umbrella for complimentary in stay use. I'd like to address a few of the more frequent complaints I've seen here. First off, the heating. It's hot. However in old NY buildings this is not unusual so it didn't bother me. Just don't bring flannel pajamas and you'll be fine. Second the shower design- the half open design of the showers is imperfect without a doubt. There will be some water splashed on the floor; however, it wasn't a flood and there were more than enough to towels to put down, so this didn't bother me in the least. The rain shower style shower head is really nice and the wooden nonslip mat an upscale touch. My room faced the alleyway. This was fine since it meant less traffic noise. That being said, the walls are thin- again not unusual in old NY buildings. I recommend earplugs. This is not a 5 star hotel but it is upscale enough to make you feel pampered and the location directly in front of Lincoln Center can not be beat. I think its a great option for tourists to get out of Times Square which is the cheesiest, ugliest, part of the whole city. Stay here and you're near almost all the same subway lines, and instead of overpriced chain restaurants that in no way reflect NY you're a hop away from the amazing restaurants of the UWS and the Time Warner Center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Rooms Very, Very Hot (temperature)”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: We got a $149 rate for the first weekend in January and we were attending the opera at Lincoln Center so this hotel was a great choice. The room was a very good size, for NYC, and it had two beds. The downside was that the temperature in the room had to have been 85 degrees. We were on the 11th floor and there were no working controls on the heat/ac units. We called the front desk as soon as we arrived and they sent up two people from Engineering, who told us that "we had hot walls". There didn't seem to be too much they could do about it. We spent most of our time with the windows open, not a crack for fresh air, but a foot and half open so that we could sleep and function (keep in mind it was in the teens the entire weekend). My wife stopped people on our floor and asked them if there rooms were as hot and they all agreed that their rooms were extremely warm. If you looked around the air shaft at the other rooms, most people had their windows open. There were a couple of downsides to keeping the windows open. One was the noise from the night club, although even with the window open, not that bad. The other was the smells from the kitchen, which wasn't the worse thing, but if the smell of bacon and other fried foods bothers you, this is not the hotel for you. I would have really liked this hotel if I was able to turn down the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PB2204
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Empire Hotel over the New Years, reception staff are friendly. I went with my husband and some friends, our room was really nice - we had a great view, the room wasn't too small. BUT our friends ended up in a much smaller room than us with a horrible view of just a wall!! Other than that the hotel was great, with a great location. Subway located a couple of minutes away. The best thing was Starbucks - just next door, they serve brilliant on the go breakfast. Also rooms are really hot - we went in December, outside was freezing but the rooms and hotel really hot - without the heating on in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Totally swish and Pimped out”
Reviews.Author: lib817
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a party, but we didn't participate in any of the shenanigans we were quite happy getting out for the day and exploring the Big Apple! The room was quite small but very comfortable and swish, the bathroom featured very fancy shampoo and conditioner... which might seem a trivial thing to choose a hotel on but it made my trip all the more special! We were sooo close to Central Park and there was a massive fresh grocery market just down the road. The pool was small and it felt like a bit of a bar but we would go there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: pbh73
Reviews.Content: Location is a short walk from Columbus, Central Park and a choice of subways. Emphasis for the property is style throughout. Very dark and broody. Rooftop pool with cabanas. Hudson one way, CP the other. Very nice. On the practical side, the room was small - even by NY standards, and the bathroom too. No biggie though, unless you need your space! For 2 nights we enjoyed it as our base location for exploring NY. It was nice to be somewhere different, not chainy in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: clraine
Reviews.Content: We purchased our room on priceline for a great rate. After reading the trip advisor reviews we were really bummed out because there were a lot of really bad reviews. We did not have a single problem with this hotel and really enjoyed our stay. Check-in was fast and the front desk folks were really nice. Yes, the rooms are small, but HELLO!!! this is NYC. You really shouldn't expect a huge room unless you are willing to pay a ridiculous amount of money for it. The location is great and about 1 block from a subway stop. The room was very clean and the common areas are very pretty. We had no noise issues. As far as the heat goes the controls are in the air unit itself and you can control them. When the heat was on we did get a little warm, but you can turn the heat off and be fine. We ask for a late check-out and again the front desk staff was very nice. We went on the roof to look around and apparently the deck was closed (there was not a sign that stated this). A security guard came up and even he was really really nice about it. Great hotel, great staff & great location. I guess if I had paid $400 a night I would have expected more, but honestly I don't really know what they could have done better. THey even have L'occitane bath products!!!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Lilliput”
Reviews.Author: TylerD23
Reviews.Content: I am amazed this hotel can put people up in those rooms and look them in the eye with a straight face. I have traveled the world over and have never stayed in a smaller hotel room - anywhere. To say that I've seen bigger walk-in closets than the room I stayed in would be an insult to walk-in closets. And speaking of closets, there isn't one; just a cut-out behind a curtain with a metal bar. I was hoping to spread out some materials to get ready for a business presentation but I literally couldn't take more than one step without hitting a bed, a table or a wall - what a joke. I was looking forward to staying here, having heard a little buzz, but don't believe the hype: this place is all faux-chic, with dimmed lights in the lobby and elswhere to hide disguise the cheap decor.

Reviews.Title: “avoid rooms on top floor- too hot without thermostat control”
Reviews.Author: DUKEwino
Reviews.Content: The Empire at Lincoln Center is certainly convenient for opera and concert proximity. However, the rooms are a real gab bag. I had to change rooms twice as the heating was so intense that the room stayed above 80 degrees even with the window open and the temperature outside at 20. The air conditioniing would not cool in two rooms. Finally, the third room was Ok with the AC at full blast. It was also on the 9th not the 11th floor. The rooms range from tiny with one bed to spacious with two beds. The restaruant "Chowder House" was quite good with a pleasant atmosphere. The bar was noisy and full of loud Russians. Service was obliging in finding a room with reasonable temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: sbass68
